title: NewSchools Fund Attracts More Capital
description: NewSchools Venture Fund, a nonprofit that started out channeling philanthropic donations to charter schools and that now invests in a range of education groups and businesses, is entering into a partnership with a new venture capital fund that could result in millions more in financing.

title: Years Later, Barnes Gets a Big Hit Off Pettitte
description: Shortly after he had been battered by the Houston Astros on Monday night, Andy Pettitte dissected his performance and was particularly upset about a fourth-inning, 0-2 pitch he threw to Brandon Barnes that Barnes turned into a two-run double.

title: Equipped to Weather Big Storms, a Jersey City Tower Draws Tenants
description: In the six months since Hurricane Sandy hit, office tenants have been flocking to a huge glass tower in Jersey City despite its being right along the waterfront. It may seem counterintuitive for companies to pointedly search for office space near the water, but the 500,000-square-foot building at 111 Town Square Place in Newport is a hybrid data center and office building that offers tenants backup generators, redundant power and an extensive fiber optic network.

title: Chris Matthews Signs Long-Term Extension With MSNBC
description: Chris Matthews, who has been one of the most prominent hosts on MSNBC for more than a decade, has signed a new long-term deal with the network to continue his Hardball program, a network executive confirmed on Tuesday.

title: Advocates Say Managed-Care Plans Shun the Most Disabled Medicaid Users
description: Managed-care companies in New York have come under fire for signing up vigorous older adults referred to them by social day care centers, customers whose health needs are relatively small.

title: In the World of Content, Web Follows a Trail Left by TV
description: IF in real estate, as the saying goes, the three most important things are location, location, location, when it comes to wooing viewers and advertisers to online video from television, the corresponding mantra seems to be content, content, content.

title: Miamis Condo Market Rebounds, Stoking a Building Boom
description: MIAMI  Of the 22,000 condos created in downtown Miami during the boom years, only about 600 remain unsold  thanks mainly to an influx of Latin American investors seeking a safe haven for their money.

title: In New Hampshire, Senator Finds Her Vote on Gun Bill Is Hot Topic
description: WARREN, N.H.  It was 45 minutes into Senator Kelly Ayottes town hall-style meeting here on Tuesday, and the local Republican official screening question topics had allowed just one query on gun control. A few in the crowd of about 150 started to get agitated.

title: Chinese Way of Doing Business: In Cash We Trust
description: SHANGHAI  Lin Lu remembers the day last December when a Chinese businessman showed up at the car dealership he works for in north China and paid for a new BMW 5 Series Gran Turismo  entirely in cash.

title: Massachusetts: Aid Promised for Victims Who Lost Limbs
description: The American Orthotic & Prosthetic Association, a national trade group, has promised to provide artificial limbs to any people who lost a leg in the Boston Marathon bombings if they are uninsured or their insurance fails to cover the cost. More than a dozen people lost limbs in the blasts; it is not yet known how many will need help paying for prostheses. The cost of an initial prosthesis could be $8,000 to $30,000, said Tom Fise, the groups executive director. Many insurance plans sharply limit coverage, he said.

title: Kerry Calls Arab League Plan to Revive Talks With Israel a Big Step
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State John Kerry on Tuesday embraced a proposal by the Arab League to revive peace talks between Israel and the Palestinians as a very big step forward, but initial reactions suggested that the new initiative might have difficulty penetrating the years-long impasse.

title: Deanna Durbin, Plucky Movie Star of the Depression Era, Is Dead at 91
description: Deanna Durbin, who as a plucky child movie star with a sweet soprano voice charmed American audiences during the Depression and saved Universal Pictures from bankruptcy before she vanished from public view 64 years ago, has died, a fan club announced on Tuesday. She was 91.

title: Leader of Hezbollah Warns It Is Ready to Come to Syrias Aid
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The leader of Hezbollah, the powerful Lebanese Shiite organization, edged closer on Tuesday to acknowledging that its fighters were battling rebels in neighboring Syria, an intervention that threatens to drag Lebanon deeper into that conflict.

title: Critics of Israels West Bank Occupation Say Calm Before New Violence Was an Illusion
description: As my colleagues Isabel Kershner and Fares Akram report, the tension of daily life in the occupied West Bank exploded into deadly violence on Tuesday, when a knife-wielding Palestinian man attacked and killed an Israeli settler at a bus stop. The attacker, identified as Salam Zaghal, a 24-year-old who recently spent three years in jail for throwing stones, then seized the dead mans pistol and engaged in a shootout with police officers.

title: The Frankfurter Diaries
description: I ate two hot dogs the other day. And now Im going to talk about my feelings about junk food.

title: No Penalty for Singh for Using a Hormone
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Vijay Singh, the 2005 champion of the Wells Fargo Championship, taking place here this week, was asked on the driving range Tuesday morning where his doping case with the PGA Tour stood. It had been 91 days since Singh admitted in a magazine article to taking deer antler spray, a substance included on the tours banned list because it contains IGF-1, an insulinlike growth hormone.

title: With a Friend Like Rudy ...
description: Former Mayor Rudolph Giuliani went to a fund-raiser on Staten Island on Monday for Joseph Lhota, his former deputy who is running for Mr. Giulianis old job. Thanks to a blogging reporter, Jacob Kornbluh, there is video of Mr. Giuliani reprising his role as the Mayor of 9/11.

title: Ghost Money, and Lots of It
description: The news that the Central Intelligence Agency has been spending lavishly in Afghanistan should come as no surprise. The agency went to work in the country right after Sept. 11, 2001, and has played a dominant covert role hunting down Al Qaeda and the Taliban ever since, while the Pentagon and other agencies have pursued more transparent military and development operations costing many billions of dollars.

title: Flooded Factory Is Brought Back by Its Workers
description: The day after Hurricane Sandy, Dal LaMagna drove to his factory in Building 12 at the Brooklyn Navy Yard. His company, IceStone, had been making hard surfaces, like countertops and tables, using recycled glass and cement. As he pulled into the yard, his first sight was of the factorys new garage door, which cost $21,000, peeled back like the lid of a sardine tin. Inside were six destroyed forklifts. The entire place was drowned.

title: Koch Brothers Plan More Political Involvement for Their Conservative Network
description: As the countrys leading conservative donors finished off plates of roast lamb and spaetzle in a Palm Springs, Calif., hotel ballroom on Monday, Charles G. Koch delivered a pep talk.

title: The President and the Hunger Strike
description: President Obama said a lot of important things on Tuesday about the prison in Guantnamo Bay, Cuba. It is a blight on the nations reputation. It mocks American standards of justice by keeping people imprisoned without charges. It has actually hindered the prosecution and imprisonment of dangerous terrorists. Even if Guantnamo seemed justified to some people in the immediate aftermath of the attacks on Sept. 11, 2001, those justifications are wearing thin. It is unsustainable and should be closed.

title: Its a 401(k) World
description: Its hard to have a conversation today with any worker, teacher, student or boss who doesnt tell you some version of this: More things seem to be changing in my world than ever before, but I cant quite put my finger on it, let alone know how to adapt. So let me try to put my finger on it: We now live in a 401(k) world  a world of defined contributions, not defined benefits  where everyone needs to pass the bar exam and no one can escape the most e-mailed list.

title: Banks Rally Against Strict Controls of Foreign Bets
description: WASHINGTON  Wall Street bankers and some of the worlds top finance ministers are waging a bitter international campaign to block Washington financial regulators from extending their policing powers far beyond the nations shores.

title: Bottoms Up, Lame Duck
description: WASHINGTON

title: Is Cursive Dead?
Domestic Abuse Aftermath
description: To the Editor:

title: Tobacco Use by Youths
description: To the Editor:

title: How to Respond to the Syria Conflict
description: To the Editor:

title: Working Out the Kinks in the Health Care Act
description: To the Editor:

title: As Bombing Inquiry Proceeds, Obama Offers Measured Praise for F.B.I.
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama offered measured support on Tuesday for the F.B.I.s handling of a tip from Russian intelligence about one of the suspects in the Boston Marathon bombings but said his administration would review every step that was taken to see if more could have been done to prevent the attack.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: April 30, 2013

title: The Anthony and Smith the Knicks Dont Want
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.

title: Attention-Deficit Drugs Face New Campus Rules
description: FRESNO, Calif.  Lisa Beach endured two months of testing and paperwork before the student health office at her college approved a diagnosis of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder. Then, to get a prescription for Vyvanse, a standard treatment for A.D.H.D., she had to sign a formal contract  promising to submit to drug testing, to see a mental health professional every month and to not share the pills.

title: Harvard Students Suicide as a Case Study
description: A lawsuit against Harvard provides rare detail on the issues involving a diagnosis of attention deficit hyperactivity disorder from a student-health department.

title: The Most Hated Bangladeshi, Toppled From a Shady Empire
description: SAVAR, Bangladesh  Barely 20 miles from the national capital, this gritty suburb is now a dusty, chaotic industrial center littered with factories that produce clothes for leading Western brands. Building codes are often unenforced, regulatory oversight is flimsy and the men wielding power often travel with armed guards.

title: Retailers Split on Contrition After Collapse of Factories
description: The building collapse in Bangladesh that caused at least 386 deaths has produced some jarringly different responses from Western apparel retailers and brands that obtained goods from factories inside the building.

title: For Torontos Kessel, Just Another Game Awaits in Boston
description: TORONTO  A day after causing a stir by not speaking to waiting reporters, Phil Kessel met the Toronto news media Tuesday.

title: Legislation Would Give Usada Authority Over Drugs in Racing
description: Two lawmakers who contend that the United States Anti-Doping Agency is the most effective agency to regulate horse racing plan to introduce a bill in Congress to give it the authority to enforce antidoping standards and to kick out violators.

title: With Democratic Mayoral Field in Flux, de Blasio Assails Quinn
description: Bill de Blasio has hammered Christine C. Quinn over her closeness to the mayor, mocked her as the best friend of the real estate industry, and accused her of being soft on the police commissioner, Raymond W. Kelly.

title: A Fun Holiday to Celebrate
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  ALOHA and happy LEI DAY, everyone! Paula Gamache is back, and her challenge to you is this lovely Wednesday puzzle. Her challenge to me is to figure out how to discuss this without getting fired.

title: Guatemala: Former Dictators Genocide Trial Resumes
description: The genocide trial of a former dictator of Guatemala, Gen. Efran Ros Montt, resumed Tuesday, 12 days after a judge ruled to annul the court proceedings. Guatemalas highest court has yet to issue a clear statement on the legality of that decision, but it made several rulings last week that sent the case back to the chief trial judge, Jasmn Barrios, to restart proceedings. Testimony is almost complete, but Guatemalas highest court must still consider several more motions related to the trial, and experts say more delays are possible.

title: Liu Is Prominent Figure in Closing Argument at Ex-Aides Trial
description: As closing arguments began on Tuesday in a widely watched political corruption trial in Manhattan, a federal prosecutor asked a jury to convict two former associates of John C. Liu, the New York City comptroller and a Democratic candidate for mayor, of conspiring to funnel money to his campaign through an illegal fund-raising scheme.

title: Jason Collins Took Personal Steps Before Coming Out Publicly
description: LOS ANGELES  When Jason Collins signed with Boston Celtics last year, he was a player in search of a number. His number for years  34  was taken, and 35, which he had with the Nets at the start of his career, had been retired by his new team.

title: Cuba: U.S. Allows Presidents Daughter to Travel
description: The State Department will allow President Ral Castros daughter to travel to Philadelphia to receive a gay civil rights award. Mariela Castro, director of Cubas National Center for Sex Education, was granted a diplomatic visa to attend United Nations meetings in April, but the State Department did not issue a second visa she requested to attend the Equality Forum 2013 Summit this weekend. Cuban diplomats cannot travel more than 25 miles without prior authorization. Ms. Castro is considered an international leader in the issue of rights for gay and transgender people. The Equality Forum received word on Monday that the State Department decided to lift the 25-mile restriction. Better judgment prevailed, said the groups director, Malcolm Lazin. The State Department did not explain the reversal.

title: Companys App Can Now Be Used to Hail Yellow Cabs in City
description: After a series of court hearings and false starts, New York Citys yellow taxi riders can now, for the first time, legally hail a cab with a smartphone app.

title: Push to Include Gay Couples in Immigration Bill
description: This has been a good year for gay rights advocates  with public opinion shifting in their favor and same-sex marriage advancing in the states  but not when it comes to immigration.

title: Zimmerman Forgoes Pretrial Hearing, Taking Issue of Immunity to a Jury
description: MIAMI  With a softly spoken, Yes, Your Honor, George Zimmerman officially waived his right to a pretrial Stand Your Ground immunity hearing on Tuesday, choosing instead to lay out his self-defense case before a jury.

title: Three Outs From Win, Mets Throw It Away
description: MIAMI  Caught in the baseball vortex that had vaporized their offense and drained their confidence, the Mets searched for an escape route before Tuesdays game at Marlins Park. Some of the players spent additional time analyzing video. Some took extra cuts in the batting cage. Others simply stuck to routine, hopeful that this would be the night they unearthed the ability to score a couple of runs, maybe more.

title: Looking Ahead to the Jets Quarterback Roulette
description: There were once three quarterbacks: the uninspiring veteran, the free-agent addition and the recent draft pick. They would all compete, team officials said, and compete they did until the winner was selected.

title: Celtics Rally Around Collins, a Valued Former Teammate
description: WALTHAM, Mass.  Doc Rivers said he received a phone call a few days ago. On the other line was Jason Collins, who had appeared in 32 games for the Boston Celtics this season before being traded in February.

title: Like His Team, a Wing Who Kept Plugging Away
description: Colin McDonald personifies the resolve of the resurgent Islanders as much as any player on their young roster.

title: Derby Limelight Doesnt Fall on Baffert
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  On Tuesday morning, Bob Baffert was in his usual spot on the backside of Churchill Downs, holding court with a group of owners and horsemen, telling stories and making jokes.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, May 1
description: The idea that we would still maintain forever a group of individuals who have not been tried, that is contrary to who we are, contrary to our interests, and it needs to stop.

title: Body Is Found Buried at Queens Apartment Building
description: The police dug up a body on Tuesday that had been buried in the backyard of an apartment building in Queens, the authorities said, several days after they had received a report of someone missing from that building.

title: Word of the Day | sidereal
description: sidereal \si-dir-e-l, s-\ adjective

title: Duke University Withdraws From Online Course Group
description: Duke University has pulled out of Semester Online, an education consortium that will offer online undergraduate courses for credit, after faculty members objected.

title: The Problem of Breast Pain in Women Who Exercise
description: In the days before the London Marathon last year, scientists from the Research Group in Breast Health at the University of Portsmouth in England approached female racers at the events registration center and asked them to complete an anonymous questionnaire about their exercise habits and breast health.

title: Yankees Find Ways to Win and Finish 16-10 in April
description: The Houston Astros arrived in the Bronx on Monday with the worst record in the American League, losers of four straight games and playing in a manner befitting a $26 million payroll.

title: Corrections: May 1, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Extinction Nears for Chinas River Pig, the Finless Porpoise
description: BEIJING  Its known in China as the river pig, the finless porpoise that has lived in the Yangtze River system for about 300,000 years but may become extinct within 10. Why?

title: Rough Track and Low Stakes in Kenya
description: When Steve Njugunas son told his father he wanted to follow in his footsteps as a jockey, Mr. Njuguna did all he could to dissuade him.

title: E-Books and Democracy
description: WRESTLING with my newspaper on the subway recently, I noticed the woman next to me reading a book on her smartphone. That has to hurt your eyes, I commented. Not missing a beat, she replied, in true New York style, My font is bigger than yours. She was right.

title: Tokyo Official Apologizes for Remarks About Olympics Rival
description: Naoki Inose, the governor of Tokyo, apologized for comments he made recently about Istanbul, a rival city hoping to host the Olympics in 2020. Inose, who is also the chairman of Tokyos bid committee, said in a recent interview with The New York Times that Istanbul may be less equipped than Tokyo to host the Games.

title: Whats On Wednesday
description: 11:30 P.M. (Sundance) NURSE BETTY (2000) Rene Zellweger, above, with Chris Rock, left, and Morgan Freeman, is Betty, a small-town waitress who suffers a nervous breakdown after she witnesses the murder of her husband (Aaron Eckhart) at the hands of two hit men (Mr. Freeman and Mr. Rock). Instead of facing reality, Betty escapes into the idealized fantasy of her favorite soap opera, A Reason to Love, which is set in a hospital. She travels to Los Angeles to become a nurse and tries to reunite with her imagined old flame, the fictional Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear). Unfortunately, the hit men are in hot pursuit. Writing in The New York Times, Stephen Holden said that this dark comedy takes the most hackneyed dramatic ploy of soap opera, a case of amnesia, and spins it into an irresistibly heady mixture of sadness and hilarity. He added, At its giddiest peaks the movie, directed by Neil LaBute, produces that shivery feeling when your heart melts, but at the same moment you want to burst out laughing.

title: News Quiz | May 1, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Lawyer to Contest Congress Leader Sajjan Kumars Acquittal in 1984 Riots Case
description: NEW DELHI  A Delhi court acquitted the Indian Congress Party leader Sajjan Kumar Tuesday for the murder of five men during the 1984 anti-Sikh riots, but the lawyer for one of the victims said he is already planning to appeal the decision to the Delhi High Court.

title: IHT Quick Read: May 1
description: The most reviled man in Bangladesh, Sohel Rana, 35, is under arrest. Mr. Rana owned the Rana Plaza, which collapsed last week, killing nearly 400 people. Many others are still missing. On Tuesday, a top Bangladeshi court seized his assets, as the public called for his execution, especially as it appears that the tragedy could have been averted if the frantic warnings of an engineer who examined the building the day before had been heeded. Jim Yardley reports from Savar, Bangladesh.

title: Roadside Bomb Kills 3 British Soldiers on Patrol in Afghanistan
description: Three British soldiers have been killed by a roadside bomb that detonated near them in Helmand Province in Afghanistan, British officials announced Wednesday, the deadliest attack on British soldiers there in a year.

title: Test Yourself | Math, May 1, 2013
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Scott Matthews at Math for America from the article Building a Better Tech School.

title: Online Courses and the Challenges of Higher Education
description: In Colleges Adapt Online Courses to Ease Burden, Tamar Lewin writes about the ways in which some public universities are harnessing the power of online courses.

title: Greeks Strike Against Austerity as World Observes Labor Day
description: ATHENS  As workers around the world observed the international Labor Day holiday with demonstrations and rallies, thousands of Greeks walked off their jobs on Wednesday in the second general strike against government austerity measures this year, shutting down tax offices, leaving state hospitals to operate with emergency employees and disrupting public transportation.

title: How Do You Feel About Rihanna and Chris Brown Getting Back Together?
description: Four years ago, the singer Chris Brown pleaded guilty to felony assault after brutally beating his girlfriend at the time, the pop star Rihanna. Now, the two seem to be back together  and though some people see it as a story of true love and forgiveness, many worry about the example Rihanna is setting in a case that, as one professor said, defined dating and domestic violence for the hip-hop generation.

title: Echoes of Saddams War in Dilemma Over Syrias Chemical Weapons
description: ERBIL, Iraq  A team of United Nations experts was still waiting in Cyprus on Wednesday to hear whether Syria will grant it unfettered access to investigate reports that chemical weapons have been used in the countrys civil war.

title: The Lions Share
description: NEW DELHI  Volunteers from an Indian nature club in the state of Gujarat are threatening suicide over a recent decision of the Indian Supreme Court to relocate some Asiatic Lions from Gir, in Gujarat, to Palpur Kuno, in the state of Madhya Pradesh. The endangered animals number about 400 in all.

title: How Did You Choose Your College?
description: Just a few weeks ago, many of you gathered around a virtual kitchen table on The Choice blog to share the admission decisions of the colleges to which you applied. Since then, youve had until May 1 to choose a college and submit an enrollment deposit.

title: The Early Word: Try Again
description: Todays Times

title: Powering Up the Cloud
description: A new product from one of Silicon Valleys legendary engineers also says a lot about where the industry is going.

title: Health Coverage Worthy of a Senator
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago. He is the author of The Redistribution Recession: How Labor Market Distortions Contracted the Economy.

title: A Conversation With: Psychiatrist Dinesh Bhugra, Expert on Deviant Sexual Behavior
description: Reports of rapes of very young girls continue to surface in India, appalling citizens and sparking protests. On Monday, a 4-year old girl died from injuries sustained after she was raped by a grown man and left near a crematorium in central India.

title: Obama and Guantnamo
description: The ties that bind Obama on closing Guantnamo.

title: Molten Cake, The Big Mac of Desserts
description: Mark Bittman shows how to make a warm soft chocolate cake with Jean-Georges Vongerichten, who says his restaurants make about a thousand a day.

title: Higher Cable Bills Help Comcast Increase Profit by 17%
description: Despite a slowdown in the number of customers paying for cable and high-speed Internet subscriptions, Comcast reported a 17.4 percent increase in net income, to $1.44 billion, in the three months that ended March 31.

title: Almost Half of Americans Say Budget Cuts Will Hurt Economy
description: Nearly half of Americans agree with the Obama administrations contention that the economy will be hurt by the spending cuts prompted by the sequestration, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.

title: One Entrepreneurs Favorite Start-Up Tools
description: I recently had a conversation with someone who is starting a social enterprise to connect corporate sponsors with the social networks of activists, athletes, musicians and others. He was asking me for advice on learning to code so that he could start to build his site.

title: Operation: Mothers Day
description: Attention, significant others of mothers: Breakfast in bed is a thoughtful, time-honored gesture for Mothers Day. There is, however, an alternative to a precariously balanced tray of eggs, orange juice and coffee, all of which she eats by herself while the kids hang around watching. That alternative is a simple but wonderful dinner, cooked by you and those same adorable children, eaten together at an actual table.

title: One Last Cringe for The Office Finale
description: LOS ANGELES  Sometime in Season 3 of The Office, its creator, Greg Daniels, conceived the premise for what would be the shows finale.

title: In Performance: Deborah Cox of Jekyll & Hyde
description: Frank Wildhorns 1997 musical Jekyll & Hyde, now being revived on Broadway, is a Gothic pop-opera version of the Victorian tale of Dr. Jekyll and his nefarious other half, Mr. Hyde. In this scene, Deborah Cox, who plays the prostitute Lucy, sings her characters signature song, the power ballad Someone Like You. The show runs through June 30 at the Marquis Theater.

title: Vyjack Has Learned to Behave, and to Win
description: Ive seen only one Kentucky Derby starter up close this year. The starter, Vyjack, came to Fair Hill for two weeks or so in April, and he struck me as a lively personality during several visits over a few days.

title: Wednesday Reading: Age Lowered for Next-Day Birth Control Access
Apples Debt Market Foray
description: It might not seem that Apple, with a $145 billion cash hoard, would need to raise money. But on Tuesday, the company issued $17 billion of bonds, a record amount, paying interest rates that hovered near those on the low-cost debt of the United States Treasury.

title: An Attempt at a Good Deed
description: Dear Diary:

title: Yoga Instructors, Tile Layers, Others Get New Outlet for Web Lessons
description: Online education is a sprawling category that encompasses everything from  open online courses on physics, history and other college subjects to intensive, multiday workshops on photography on sites like CreativeLive.

title: Daily Report: Hotels, Airports and Airlines Struggle With Demand for Wi-Fi
description: Travelers hitting the road with their mobile electronic devices have three questions about staying connected away from home: will there be Wi-Fi, how much will it cost and how well will it work? Increasingly, it is that last question that matters most, reports Susan Stellin on Wednesday in The New York Times.

title: Berkshire Hathaway to Acquire the Rest of IMC for $2 Billion
description: Berkshire Hathaway has agreed to buy the 20 percent of the IMC International Metalworking Companies that it does not already own for $2.05 billion, giving it full control of the company.

title: The Rope Wrangler, Ideas Unfurling
description: If I could put my body into my work, Orly Genger likes to say, that would be the ultimate.

title: Hong Kongs Culture Fix
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Obama Nominates Congressman to Lead Mortgage Agency
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Wednesday nominated Representative Melvin L. Watt, Democrat of North Carolina, to become the overseer of the government-backed mortgage financiers Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.

title: Downton Abbey Adds First Black Cast Member
description: 2:51 p.m. | Updated

title: Credit Suisse Is Said to Elevate 2 Investment Bankers
description: LONDON  Credit Suisse named co-heads for its investment banking operations in Europe, the Middle East and Africa, following the resignation of Jamie Welch after a year in the job, a person with knowledge of the appointments said on Wednesday.

title: In New Chinese Campaign, Concerns Over Morals and Corruption
description: BEIJING  An early glimpse of a political campaign expected to launch in China soon, the homely-sounding check the mirror, fix your clothes, take a bath, see the doctor, which aims to improve the morals of Communist Party members and combat corruption, came last December.

title: Built as an Operating Theater, Soon to Be a Private School
description: When Dr. Charles McBurney, an eminent 19th-century surgeon, was given the opportunity to create the ideal operating room, he insisted that there be lots of light and air. Thats not a bad arrangement for precocious schoolchildren, either.

title: I Wanted Twins
description: Taking Sides

title: I Didnt Want Twins
description: Taking Sides

title: Young Movers, With a Passion for Change
description: I intended to write this column next October, but why wait? As President Obama observed last week, weve been through a tough time. And as the Boston Marathon bombing continues to be headline news  and gut-wrenching images continue to circulate  we need to keep in mind what behavioral scientists call the availability heuristic  our tendency to mistakenly estimate the probability of events based on how readily examples come to mind. A story that leaves a painful and vivid impression like this one can distort our sense of reality for a long time.

title: Americas Most Reconsidered General
description: The reputation of Ulysses S. Grant has oscillated wildly through history, almost since the day of his birth, April 27, 1822. A West Point graduate with a middling military career and a series of failed business ventures. From a midlevel command at the start of the Civil War to the very top of the military leadership at its end, followed by a two-term presidency. But from almost the moment he took office, his reputation began to steadily decline. As late as the 1950s his military success was commonly attributed to superior numbers applied with brute force.

title: Big, Hot, Cheap and Right': Erica Grieder Talks About Texas
description: In her new book, Big, Hot, Cheap and Right: What America Can Learn From the Strange Genius of Texas, Erica Grieder, an editor at Texas Monthly magazine, writes about the forces that shaped the states attitudes as well as its current economic growth in the face of widespread troubles in the rest of the country. In a recent e-mail interview, Ms. Grieder discussed the states economic miracle, whether the future there bodes well for Democrats and more. Below are edited excerpts from the conversation:

title: Baltic Brouhaha
description: Martin Wolf has a very good piece on the attempts to put the Baltic states, Latvia especially, on a pedestal and claim that they prove that austerity works. Mainly he makes points I have made previously: first, that output is still well below the previous peak, and unemployment still very high despite drastic out-migration:

title: Telling Eyes in the Dark
description: Mary E. Blair is a postdoctoral researcher at the American Museum of Natural Historys Center for Biodiversity and Conservation, where she coordinates the Enhancing Diversity in Conservation Science Initiative.

title: Orbs Workout Impresses a Top Observer
description: Before the Kentucky Derby, horses are scrutinized with more intensity than before any other race. No one is more respected for studying these horses than Mike Welsch, who has been watching pre-Derby workouts for the Daily Racing Form since 2000.

title: What Were Reading
description: Vice: One tub of I Cant Believe Its Not Butter and chocolate chip cookies; Wonder bread and Dom Prignon. What do these delicacies have in common? They are what famous rockers want to eat backstage. (You can play match the meal to the rock star.)  Melissa Clark

title: Dying Long Distance
description: PARIS  The last conversation I had with my father was by Skype. He was in a sunny room in southeastern Pennsylvania; I was in Paris, where I live and work. He was surrounded by my siblings and their spouses; my mother had visited earlier that day.

title: Home Spending on Entertainment Rises
description: LOS ANGELES  Home entertainment spending on movies and television shows rose about 5 percent in the first quarter, to $4.69 billion, compared with the same period a year ago, as some strong titles including Skyfall and Argo hit the market, according to figures released Wednesday by the Digital Entertainment Group, an industry consortium.

title: Image of the Day: May 1
The Golden Age of Museum Renovation
description: As Queen Beatrix handed the title of monarch of the Netherlands to her son, Willem-Alexander, on Tuesday, art lovers in Amsterdam had another reason to celebrate. For the first time in a decade, the citys great museums are all open.

title: Highlights and Analysis: Champions League Semifinals, Bayern Munich 3, Barcelona 0
description: In the end, Barcelonas mission was indeed impossible.

title: Film Studios Say New York Gun Law May Ban Props
description: ALBANY  The sweeping gun control measure signed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and hailed by Democratic leaders has a surprising critic: Hollywood.

title: Failure of Gun Bill Casts Shadow on Immigration Reform
description: WASHINGTON  As a gun safety bill dissolved on the Senate floor last month, a group of eight senators  some who had supported the failed measure  had already moved on to a policy battle they found more promising: reinventing the nations troubled immigration system.

title: The Mean Screens of New York
description: Officials in the movie and television industry say the new gun control laws in New York could prevent them from using lifelike assault weapons and high-capacity firearms. The following are a few famous movies that have prominently featured gun violence in New York.

title: Extreme Weather in a Warming World, and the American Mind
description: To see the relationship between extreme weather and public attitudes on human-driven climate change, check out the latest report from the Yale Project on Climate Change Communication  Extreme Weather and Climate Change in the American Mind April 2013.

title: Transactions
description: Recent Sale

title: Q.& A.: Protecting Your Twitter Account
description: Q.

title: Re-Re-engineering the Corporation
description: Could we be on the verge of another workplace revolution?

title: Friendly, Maybe Lucky, Skies
description: The passenger in seat 34B has caught your eye? Now on Virgin America flights, you can catch his attention by sending him a drink, snack or meal along with a text via seat-back monitor declaring your intentions. Richard Branson, Virgins founder, right, introduced the service last month in a video billed as his guide to getting lucky at 35,000 feet. Try it, he said, and your chances of deplaning with a plus one are at least 50 percent.

title: What if You Are Audited by the I.R.S.
description: The April 15 tax deadline is now receding in our collective rear view mirror. Nothing to do now, but to start collecting records for next year. Right?

title: Questions About Yoga in Your Middle Years
description: This weeks Ask an Expert features Dr. Loren Fishman, who will answer questions about practicing yoga in your middle years. In 1972, before applying to medical school, he studied yoga with B.K.S. Iyengar for a year in Pune, India. Dr. Fishman, 72, has now been a practicing back-pain and rehabilitative medicine specialist for 33 years. From the start he incorporated yoga in patient care, and he teaches seminars in yoga nationally and internationally.

title: A Different Sort of Egg
description: Every year, springtime brings a flurry of books about birds and birth and babies and, inevitably, eggs. Of course, theres Easter. And the seasonal school curriculum. And every so often, something that feels quite new. This season, two new books from small presses offer interesting perspectives on the finding and keeping and eventual opening of eggs.

title: Yahoo Enhances Its Parental Leave Policy
description: Marissa Mayer is trying to repair Yahoos image by upgrading benefits for working parents.

title: Flashing Lights in an Ocean of Sound
description: Close your eyes and listen to the sound of my big black boots, Trent Reznor sang midway through the concert by How to Destroy Angels on Monday night at the Apollo Theater. It wasnt advice many people were taking.

title: The Gun Report: May 1, 2013
description: Tennessee senators Bob Corker and Lamar Alexander both voted against the failed Senate bill to expand background checks, a safety measure supported by 90 percent of Americans. So it should come as no surprise that a pro-gun group in that particularly gun-friendly state plans to raffle off an AR-15 semiautomatic riflethe same weapon used by Adam Lanza to mow down 20 children and six adults in Newtown, Conn.

title: Eric Cantors Dilemma
description: One further thought about the House Republicans and health care: In addition to being symptomatic of the Republican Partys larger policy problems, last weeks defeat of a very modest gesture at something resembling a conservative approach to health care reform was illustrative of the particular problem of trying to rebuild the partys agenda from within the House of Representatives.

title: The Options Quarterback
description: No one seems to be quite done with Tim Tebow.

title: No Remains of Humans in a Search Tied to 9/11
description: New York City officials said on Wednesday that no human remains had been found in the soil behind a building in Lower Manhattan where wreckage was discovered last week believed to be from one of the planes that crashed into the World Trade Center.

title: Besieged Syrian Leader Makes Rare Public Appearance
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, apparently seeking to counter the impression of a leader in hiding after consecutive days of suspected insurgent bombings in his power base, Damascus, made a rare public appearance on Wednesday, visiting workers at an electric station.

title: First Book Is Planned on the Tsarnaev Brothers
description: The first major book on the Tsarnaev brothers, the two suspects in the Boston Marathon bombings, has been acquired by Riverhead Books, the publisher said on Wednesday.

title: After Boston Attack, 3 Friends Covered It Up, Prosecutors Say
description: They were perhaps Dzhokhar Tsarnaevs closest friends during his two years at college, an American classmate from high school and two Russian-speaking students from Kazakhstan. The Kazakhs seemingly had money and drove expensive cars. They entertained Mr. Tsarnaev at their off-campus apartment, and he partied with them in New York. One of them lent Mr. Tsarnaev a black BMW after he smashed his Honda Civic in an accident.

title: In Brown-Vitter Bill, a Banking Overhaul With Possible Teeth
description: The biggest banks have done an excellent job of delaying and undermining the Dodd-Frank financial overhaul law and staving off criminal investigations into wrongdoing.

title: When the Doctor Is Overweight
description: Dr. George Fielding, a pioneer of weight loss surgery in Australia, remembers how patients treated him in the late 1990s, when his weight reached 330 pounds on his six-foot frame. He would meet new patients, dressed in Armani suits and feeling on top of the world, and then be abruptly upended.

title: Keeping Guns in Circulation
description: While Senator Joe Manchin decides whether to reintroduce his failed background checks bill, other lawmakers are busy passing new gun measures that decrease rather than increase regulation.

title: Berra Museum to Highlight Inclusion in Sports
description: The Yogi Berra Museum and Learning Center in Little Falls, N.J., is creating a new exhibit, Championing Respect, which will detail the evolution of attitudes from Jackie Robinson breaking the color barrier to the latest news of gay athletes openly competing.

title: Can Every Group Be Worse Than Average?  Yes.
description: My Off the Charts column last week noted that pay disparities had grown in the United States since 2000. The real income necessary to reach the 90th percentile  the top 10 percent of all wage owners  was 9 percent higher in the first quarter than it had been 13 years earlier. The income necessary to be in the 10th percentile was down 3 percent over the same period. The pay needed to be at the median was up 1 percent.

title: Shell Makes Big Bet on Boom in Natural Gas
description: LONDON  As Big Oil increasingly becomes Big Gas, no major petroleum player may have more at stake in the shift than Royal Dutch Shell.

title: Feeling For | Herms Equestrian Collection
description: Although it is perhaps better known for its iconic handbags, the French brand Herms originated as a harness and bridle maker in the 19th century for European nobility. Last month, the brand introduced its new Cavale saddle and Jumping Lady boot at Le Saut Herms competition at the Grand Palais in Paris. And starting May 4, these pieces become the focus of the Spanish artist Pamen Pereiras windows for the brands new boutique in Greenwich, Conn. Pereira, whose previous installations for Herms stores in Taiwan and Barcelona featured birds, elevated her usual flight concept with an avant-garde interpretation of the equestrian competition by way of winged saddles and motorized riding boots (as pictured above in Ts exclusive peek at the artists window plans).

title: HTML5 Dev Conf Videos
description: A few of the HTML5 Dev Conf talks we recently recommended are now available on the event video sessions page. Dont miss the two keynotes (Steve Souders and Christian Heillmann).

title: Observed Earth: A New View of the Sky
description: Theres not much to say about this extraordinary image created by Canadian photographer Matt Molloy:

title: More Releases of Ailing Prisoners Are Urged
description: WASHINGTON  The federal Bureau of Prisons could save taxpayer money and reduce overcrowding if it better managed a program for the compassionate release of inmates who are dying or facing other extraordinary circumstances, according to a new report by the Justice Departments independent inspector general.

title: Thieves Break Into a Personal Data Vault Company
description: A company that describes itself as a vault for personal data has suffered an embarrassing heist: intruders penetrated its computer system and looted its customers names, addresses and in some cases, dates of birth and login passwords.

title: Truck Sales Led a Strong April for U.S. Automakers
description: DETROIT  American automakers said on Wednesday that sales of pickup trucks rose sharply in April because of a revival in the housing market and increased demand from the oil and gas industry.

title: Sorry We Drifted Apart, Richie Havens
description: Mark Lutin is a legal-marketing executive and lifelong New Yorker who lives in Bayside, Queens.

title: Days of the Jackals
description: Gail Collins: David, I just got back from a vacation in Botswana. We were cut off from the outside world for quite a while, just looking at nature. One of our guides showed us a wild dog who had wandered into the area a few years before, apparently lost from her pack. So she stole some jackal pups and raised them. Now theyre a team  the dog does the hunting and the jackals keep a lookout for lions.

title: The Joyce Announces Its 2013-2014 Season
description: Arthur Pitas award-winning interpretation of Kafkas Metamorphosis, originally staged by the Royal Ballet in London, will open the fall dance season at the Joyce Theater on Sept. 17, with the Royal Ballet principal Edward Watson dancing the role of Gregor Samsa, and Frank Moon performing his own score live. The production, which runs through Sept. 29, is the first of 16 that the theater has scheduled through February 2014.

title: Leaving Cars Behind in L.A.
description: Los Angeless tourism agency is hoping to entice visitors to find new ways to explore the city. Its Car Free LA program offers seven itineraries for tourists up for biking, walking or taking the Metro transit system. Trips include the bike route from Venice to Santa Monica and a walking tour of Hollywood, though you may have to take a taxi to the starting point.

title: A Wholesaler Decides to Abandon His Most Profitable Sales Channel
description: Last week, we published a case study about an entrepreneur, new to the furniture business, who had expanded his business selling patio and deck furniture to $7 million in annual sales. Instead of selling through sales representatives, Gerald Shvartsman, founder and chief executive of Source Outdoor, which is based in Miami, employed a multichannel sales strategy.

title: Cancers Share Gene Patterns, Studies Affirm
description: Scientists have discovered that the most dangerous cancer of the uterine lining closely resembles the worst ovarian and breast cancers, providing the most telling evidence yet that cancer will increasingly be seen as a disease defined primarily by its genetic fingerprint rather than just by the organ where it originated.

title: Striking a Pose Above the Clouds
description: No wonder travelers are bent out of shape.

title: Gun Law Proponents Focus Ads on 2 Senators
description: WASHINGTON  With members of Congress back in their home states for recess this week, activists pushing for tougher gun laws are hitting two senators with new appeals on television, asking them to change their votes.

title: How to Weaken a President
description: Republicans came up with all kinds of convoluted and made-up explanations for voting against gun background checks, and some are starting to do the same for the immigration bill. A few are even using the Boston bombing as an excuse. But for many lawmakers, the real reason is depressingly familiar. They dont want to give President Obama anything he wants.

title: Gulp (Dont Gag): Modeling the Complexity of the Digestive System
description: The Timess Quentin Hardy talks with Mary Roach about her new book, Gulp: Adventures on the Alimentary Canal.

title: Time Warner Revenue Is Flat, Despite Cable Gains
description: Sluggishness at Time Warners magazine and movie divisions partly offset gains at its cable television networks, leading to virtually flat revenue and a 13 percent increase in operating income in the first three months of the year.

title: For Ramirez Hidalgo, Little Glamour but a Lot of Tennis
description: He is 35, a father and wears his cap backward on the court. He is also the oldest man in the Top 100 on the professional tour.

title: Showing Grass-Roots Support for Immigration Overhaul
description: Tens of thousands of immigrants, Latinos and other supporters of an overhaul of the immigration system turned out on Wednesday for marches, rallies and prayer vigils, hoping to show Congress that momentum is building for a path to citizenship for 11 million immigrants in the country illegally.

title: Like an Oozing Brownie
description: Were imagining sinking a fork into the warm, soft molten chocolate cake described by Mark Bittman in his Eat column this week. The column outlines a three-course menu for Mothers Day, simple for novice cooks to pull off. The dessert is a version of a recipe by Jean-Georges Vongerichten, who helps Mr. Bittman make these small cakes in fluted molds.

title: A No-Hitter So Rare It Took 6 Pitchers
description: On June 11, 2003, Roy Oswalt, the ace of the Houston Astros pitching staff, had to leave a game against the Yankees with a groin pull after the first inning. The Yankee Stadium crowd sat back and waited for the runs to pile up, figuring that the powerful Yankees lineup  Alfonso Soriano, Derek Jeter, Jason Giambi, Jorge Posada, Hideki Matsui  had the whole game to wear out the Astros bullpen.

title: Girls Bones Bear Signs of Cannibalism by Starving Virginia Colonists
description: Archaeologists excavating a trash pit at the Jamestown colony site in Virginia have found the first physical evidence of cannibalism among the desperate population, corroborating written accounts left behind by witnesses. Cut marks on the skull and skeleton of a 14-year-old girl show that her flesh and brain were removed, presumably to be eaten by the starving colonists during the harsh winter of 1609.

title: Survey Shows Strong Support for Fuel Efficiency Standards
description: A new survey has found that consumers want more fuel efficient cars and also support the new federal fuel economy standards that the federal government plans to reach by 2025.

title: Nicolas Ghesquires Balenciaga Legacy
description: Suddenly theres a deluge of Nicolas Ghesquire stories. Well, two, but they are meaty, reflective accounts on his departure last year from Balenciaga, his views on the state of fashion, and some hints about his future.

title: With Initiative, Attorney General Focuses on New Yorks Pets
description: ALBANY  Last year, the state attorney generals office sued an animal hospice center in Delaware County that had been accused of neglect for failing to file required financial reports.

title: In the Alps of Goethe and James Bond
description: We were hiking in fog and drizzle up the barren slopes of Mount Schilthorn, a 9,748-foot-high peak overlooking the Lauterbrunnen Valley in Switzerland. As I inched along a narrow trail, the mist cleared to reveal a long drop on either side into a boulder-strewn abyss. My legs wobbled; my feet slithered over the soggy ground. I reached out to grasp what seemed like a taut rope line, only to feel it sag beneath my trembling fist. Then the trail widened, I steadied myself, and continued my arduous climb toward the summit.

title: More Forceful Fed Stands by Stimulus
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve said Wednesday that its economic stimulus campaign would press forward at the same pace it has maintained since December, putting to rest for now any suggestion that it was leaning toward doing less.

title: French Efforts to Block Sale of Stake in Video Site to Yahoo Are Criticized
description: The government of President Franois Hollande has expressed its objections to plans by Yahoo to buy a controlling stake in the video-sharing site DailyMotion, which is owned by France Tlcom, in an effort to keep one of the countrys most successful technology start-ups out of foreign hands.

title: Yoga After 50
description: While many yoga classes across the country seem to cater to the youthful enthusiast who wants to sweat his or her way through an hour-and-a-half workout, a growing number of longtime yoga devotees are raising questions about the best way to safely continue a yoga practice into midlife and beyond.

title: Properties for $5.9 Million
description: Homes include a gated Spanish-style house in Pacific Palisades, Calif.; a midcentury modern outside Boulder, Colo.; and a brick traditional in Charlottesville, Va.

title: What You Get for ... $5.9 Million
description: PACIFIC PALISADES, CALIF.

title: Income Guarantee Swells Crop Insurance
description: WASHINGTON  The worst drought in 50 years led to record payouts from a taxpayer-subsidized insurance program created to protect farms from weather-related disasters. But the high costs were mostly a result of policies that guarantee farmers a portion of their projected revenue, rather than coverage that pays them for their damaged crops, according to a study released Wednesday.

title: Racing Industry Eager to See Bill Allowing Usada Oversight
description: Horse racing industry officials said Wednesday that they were eager to see proposed federal legislation that would give the United States Anti-Doping Agency the authority to create a regulatory plan with meaningful penalties to clean up the sport.

title: A Study in Chinoiserie Dating to the 18th Century
description: A princess was the first occupant of this five-bedroom brick home, called the Pagoda. Its owners are entertaining offers of at least $4.54 million.

title: House Hunting in ... London
description: A CHINESE-STYLE HISTORIC HOME IN SOUTHEAST LONDON

title: Fighting Corruption in China, One Special License Plate at a Time
description: HANGZHOU, China  A photograph in the official newspaper of the Peoples Liberation Army over the weekend showed a grinning military officer standing proudly in his green uniform, as if he had single-handedly repelled a foreign invasion.

title: Criminal Complaints Against Additional Suspects in the Boston Marathon Bombings
description: Court documents related to the additional suspects in the Boston Marathon bombings.

title: With Upgrade, Headphones Have New Sound, and New Parts
description: Sol Republic, maker of headphones with swappable parts, recently expanded its offerings with the release of its Master Tracks line, which incorporates over-ear headphones for the first time.

title: Wagonmasters Celebrates the Classic American Dream Through Station Wagons
description: Do you remember the last time you saw someone driving their family around in a gargantuan American station wagon as if they meant it? Im not talking about a college student driving a load of friends around in grannys hand-me-down or that weird neighbor whos all cold dead hands about his ultimate suburban driving machine. No, I mean run-of-the-mill families of 4.5 who drive to schools, jobs and doctor appointments with mom and dad up front, a surly teenager or two in the back seat and one to one-and-a-half children way in the back, bouncing around on the rear-facing fold down, making faces at people through the back glass.

title: Shorter Forms for Coverage Under New Health Law
description: Banks and mortgage lenders have made strides in simplifying their disclosure forms so consumers can more easily understand the types of fees and terms they are getting.

title: New Album From the Civil Wars
description: The Civil Wars will release a follow-up this summer to the duos Grammy-winning debut album Barton Hollow, but they provided no hint about whether they would reunite or go on tour.

title: Telecom Investor Named to Be F.C.C. Chairman
description: WASHINGTON  Tom Wheeler, President Obamas pick to be the next chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, knows all about the most advanced telecommunications systems  of the 19th century.

title: The Interior Performance Art
description: What is the sound of two heads reading?

title: N.H.L. Stadium Series Announces Date in Chicago
description: The Chicago Blackhawks and the Pittsburgh Penguins will face off in a regular-season matchup at Soldier Field on March 1, 2014, as part of an expanded set of N.H.L. outdoor games next season.

title: Online, Everyone Can Be a Makeup Critic
description: Matin Maulawizada, a makeup artist based in New York, used to spend hours prowling department stores beauty floors to find out what was new and noteworthy. Now, Mr. Maulawizada, the global artistry director for Laura Mercier, likes to log on to Pampadour.com, a sleek new beauty-focused social network, to see what products colleagues are using  or, in the companys parlance, pamping. It really saves me time, Mr. Maulawizada said.

title: Window Dressing | Tsumori Chisato
description: Attention, Tsumori Chisato devotees: The Paris-based Japanese designer, whos earned a dedicated following for her whimsical prints and graceful use of manga, is making a rare New York appearance tomorrow evening. Shell be hosting a cocktail party at Kisan, the SoHo boutique owned by the Icelandic-French couple Thorunn Anspach and Olivier Bremond. In honor of Tsumoris visit, the two have created a special window display that showcases her Arizona-themed spring collection, pictured above, which was inspired by a visit to Sedona and includes references to the work of the artist Georgia OKeefe. Tsumori, a tireless traveler who just returned from Italy, says that she is always on the lookout for fresh ideas for her designs. In New York, shell be walking the streets and feeling the very unique atmosphere, though shes mainly looking forward to meeting her fans. That makes my day! she says. Every time I meet a woman wearing my clothes I can tell she feels good in them.

title: New Home Planned for Los Angeles County Museum of Art
description: The Los Angeles County Museum of Art is planning to build a new home for itself on Wilshire Boulevard, designed by the Pritzker Prize-winning architect Peter Zumthor, The Los Angeles Times reported on Wednesday.

title: Building Blocks All in a Row
description: GREAT FASHION doesnt start from the bottom so much as from the outside  kids with ideas and dreams and no clear path to the center. The hungriest of them will study anything they can get their hands on, a bunch of eager would-bes trying to figure out how things work on the inside, faking it until they make it.

title: Canon Powershot N
description: This new 12-megapixel camera is designed to compete with cellphone cameras.

title: For Playoffs, Seven Isnt Necessarily the Best Number
description: It was a perfect snapshot of the drama, pressure and excitement of the N.B.A. playoffs, but it was ultimately meaningless.

title: The Testament of Toibin: A Tony Nod, and a Closing Notice
description: The Irish writer Colm Toibin was shaving in his bathroom on Tuesday morning, and savoring the news that his Testament of Mary had just been nominated for a best play Tony Award, when the telephone rang. The voice on the other end said, I have Scott Rudin on the line for you. And so began one of the more surreal phone conversations that Mr. Toibin ever had: He was a freshly minted Tony nominee, but his producer Mr. Rudin was telling him that the play would close on Sunday, after only 43 performances and far earlier than planned, due to poor ticket sales.

title: A Camera Takes On the Phones
description: Technologies come and go in waves. And lately, the waves are coming and going faster.

title: Uncertainty Still Clouds Health Care Law
description: Three years after President Obama signed the health care reform law, there are concerns that the process of implementing it will be rocky. Even some of the laws supporters are worried.

title: Ticketmaster Accuses 21 of Fraudulent Ticket Buying
description: Ticketmaster, trying to fight the computer tactics used by some of the most advanced ticket scalpers, has sued 21 people, accusing them of fraud and breach of copyright in circumventing the companys online security system to try to buy huge numbers of tickets.

title: Does Depression Contribute to Dementia?
description: A large body of research has linked late-life depression to social isolation, poorer health and an increased risk of death. Now, a new study finds that depression is associated with subsequent vascular dementia and Alzheimers disease, conditions poised to expand dramatically with the aging population.

title: HBO Orders Third Season of Veep
description: Who needs to wait another three years to choose Americas second-in-command? Not HBO, thats for sure: on Wednesday, that cable network announced it was ordering a third season of Veep, its comedy series starring Julia Louis-Dreyfus as the vice president of the United States. In its first season in 2012, Veep, created by Armando Iannucci (the author of the political satires The Thick of It and In the Loop) was an Emmy nominee for outstanding comedy; Ms. Louis-Dreyfus, an Emmy winner for her performances on Seinfeld and The New Adventures of Old Christine, earned her third such award for portraying the Veep title character, Selina Meyer. Veep was just three episodes into its second season (which started on April 14) when HBO announced its latest renewal. The network said a third season of 10 episodes will be shown next year.

title: The Players Meet Those Who Play Them
description: Every year, it seems, someone makes a big to-do over the White House Correspondents Association dinner and how it has been overrun with celebrities. (This year, Tom Brokaw and Barbara Walters criticized the events star turn.) Its safe to say they didnt make it to the annual after-party hosted by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and Vanity Fair magazine.

title: Up Close to Entice
description: Outtakes is a behind-the-scenes glimpse of images in the Dining section. Andrew Scrivani (@AndrewScrivani on Twitter and Instagram) is a freelance photographer and a regular contributor to The New York Times. He writes the blog making SundaySauce.

title: High Line Decides to Drop Planned Fee for Visits to Final Section
description: The High Line announced on Wednesday that it had begun taking online reservations, at thehighline.org, for visits to the last undeveloped section of the rail line, between West 30th and 34th Streets, where for the next year seven sculptures by the artist Carol Bove will be on view. The High Line originally planned to charge $6 for a visit but decided on Monday to make reservations free.

title: Goldman Names New Head of Special Situations Group
description: Goldman Sachs has named a new head of its global special situations group, the elite division that invests in and lends to companies.

title: Michael Bubl Hits No. 1 With To Be Loved
description: Michael Bubl stormed to the top of the Billboard 200 chart on Wednesday with his new album To Be Loved (Reprise), which sold 195,000 copies and gave the Canadian crooner his fourth No. 1 set.

title: At Least Five Protesters Arrested in May Day Demonstration
description: The police arrested at least five people on Wednesday afternoon as a group of protesters marched from Tompkins Square Park to Union Square in a May Day demonstration meant to criticize capitalism.

title: Emmy Nomination for Elmo Puppeteer Who Resigned
description: Kevin Clash, who resigned from Sesame Street last year amid allegations that he had sexual relationships with minors, found himself back in the news on Wednesday after receiving a daytime entertainment Emmy nomination for his role as the shows popular Elmo character.

title: China Is Seen Nearing U.S.s Military Power in Region
description: TOKYO  Chinas growing industrial might is likely to allow it to mount an increasingly formidable challenge to the military supremacy of the United States in the waters around China that include Japan and Taiwan, though it will probably seek to avoid an outright armed conflict, according to a detailed new report by a group of American researchers.

title: Valdespin Turns on a Pitch and Likes How It Feels
description: MIAMI  Jordany Valdespin had always been a full-time player. Whether it was as a young outfielder in the Dominican Republic or rising through the minor leagues, he was accustomed to taking the field for nine innings. Nobody, he said, wants to spend all game sitting on the bench.

title: Not Everything Is Political
description: Brad DeLong directs me to a screed by Clive Crook, who sort of admits that Ive been right about a lot of things but accuses me of being, well, shrill. Where have I heard that before?

title: Mobile Ads Help Propel Earnings at Facebook
description: SAN FRANCISCO  This time last year, just before Facebook made its public debut, the social network did not show a single advertisement on its mobile applications. And over time, the cries from investors about its mobile strategy grew louder and louder.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Facebook Beheadings and Privacy Champions
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. More Scuttlebot can be found here.

title: Scouting Report
description: Openings and Events

title: Pictures of the Day: Turkey and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Turkey, Indonesia, Chile and Nepal.

title: Would Anna Settle for a Safety Pin?
description: IT IS HARD ENOUGH for famous people to decide what to wear to the annual Costume Institute gala at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, fashions party of the year, even though Anna Wintour has been known to offer advice. But imagine the pressure facing guests at this years ball, on May 6, where the theme, as you might have heard, will be punk.

title: No Vote Needed on Abortion Bill, G.O.P. Leader Says
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is still hoping to pass the whole of his 10-point Womens Equality Act during the closing weeks of the 2013 legislative session, which ends in late June. But on Wednesday, the State Senate Republican leader suggested that his conference would not support any effort to bring a key part of the act  a state safeguard of federally recognized abortion rights  to a vote.

title: Beauty Spots
description: The beauty buzz is all about bees these days. Honey has long been a staple in cosmetics, with Perlier and Laura Mercier making well-loved bath items that contain it. But now other products of the hive, like pollen, venom and royal jelly, are being used as well, and increasingly in creams and serums for the face. Their salubrious properties supposedly include increasing blood circulation, as well as plumping and hydrating the skin. If all else fails, at least youll smell sweet.

title: Year After Resignation, Virginia Quarterly Review Names an Editor
description: More than a year after Ted Genoways resigned as the editor of the Virginia Quarterly Review, the literary journal has named a successor.

title: British Stars of Yesteryear Are Ensnared in Sexual Offenses Inquiry
description: LONDON  The suspects include a flamboyant pop star, a sharp-tongued comedian, a disc jockey known as the hairy cornflake and a quirky Australian-born entertainer who performed at the queens diamond jubilee concert. Most are in their 70s or 80s, and most are, or were, household names  celebrities from a bygone era.

title: A Google Duo and a Media Maven Explore a Hyper-Connected Planet
description: After a goofy introductory chat about the White House Correspondents Dinner, this Times Talks conversation involving media columnist David Carr and Eric Schmidt and Jared Cohen of Google, co-authors of The New Digital Age: Reshaping the Future of People, Nations and Business, becomes a fascinating walk through the emerging Knowosphere:

title: Medicaid Access Increases Use of Care, Study Finds
description: WASHINGTON  Come January, millions of low-income adults will gain health insurance coverage through Medicaid in one of the farthest-reaching provisions of the Obama health care law. How will that change their finances, spending habits, use of available medical services and  most important  their health?

title: Abroad as Her Father Lay Dying
description: Jan Benzel, an editor with The International Herald Tribune in Paris, had one of those impossibly painful decisions to make.

title: Bote
description: The modern fixation with speakeasy culture can be traced to Milk & Honey, a clandestine bar that Sasha Petraske opened in 2000, behind an unmarked door with an unlisted phone number on the Lower East Side. Among the novelties now considered the norm: Bars could take reservations. Bars could have rules (No. 1: No name dropping). And cocktails could cost $16.

title: Prom is Easy. The Ask Takes Planning.
description: It was almost midnight, and I was perched next to my teenage son at his computer. He was frantically searching the Internet for a Web site that could produce custom Chinese fortune cookies  in 48 hours. Finally he hit upon a company called Tankinz Inc., and his fingers flew over the keys, Lizzie, will you go to the prom with me?

title: Irish Proposal Would Allow Abortions in Emergencies
description: DUBLIN  The Irish government proposed legislation late Tuesday night that, if approved as expected, would allow abortions in cases where a threat existed to a womans life, including from suicide.

title: Doomed, but Still Dedicated to Verdi
description: Extreme deprivation, degradation and abuse are not easily evoked in a concert setting, with relatively comfortable musicians performing for well-fed and highly perfumed listeners. But the conductor Murry Sidlin made a remarkable attempt on Monday in his Defiant Requiem, a concert-drama presented at Avery Fisher Hall by the UJA-Federation of New York, with ticket sales and sponsorships to benefit Holocaust survivors.

title: Hes Back From the Dead, With So Much More to Do
description: In Stephen Petronios Like Lazarus Did, dance is preceded by the stillness of death. As you enter the Joyce Theater, where the hourlong work had its debut on Tuesday, the choreographer is already on stage, lying on his back in a dark suit, corpselike, his eyes closed, the soles of his bare feet gilded with gold paint.

title: Two Pleas for Sanity in Judging Saneness
description: This month a new edition of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, the so-called bible of psychiatry, will be released into the world. This revision, known as the D.S.M.-5, is hovering already on Amazon, its cover an appalling shade of purple, available for advance order at a hardcover price of $189.

title: On the Aesthetics of the Animated GIF
description: How many hours have I spent looking at loops of acrobatic cats, snowboard stunts, the human insanity recorded by Russian dashboard cameras? The answer, Im afraid, is many.

title: Photos Show Vast Destruction of Nigerian Homes in Raid, Group Says
description: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria  Satellite images corroborate the accounts of residents of a fishing village north of here who say that thousands of their homes were destroyed by fire during a recent storm of violence carried out by rampaging soldiers, according to Human Rights Watch.

title: Speaking of Getting It Wrong
description: My heart goes out to Brad DeLong, who debated Alan Reynolds and discovered that his opponent really doesnt understand at all how either fiscal or monetary policy work.

title: Emotional Tugs, Real and Fictional
description: Delicately balanced between fact and fiction, Song Fangs Memories Look at Me, contemplates dying by honoring the living.

title: G.M. and Mountain Dew Drop Ads After Criticism
description: Both General Motors and Mountain Dew withdrew advertisements on Wednesday after receiving criticism that the ads were racially offensive.

title: A Novella Emerges Tweet by Tweet
description: With the release of Side Effects earlier this year, Steven Soderberghs retirement from filmmaking (at least for the big screen), announced in 2011, finally took effect. Liberation might be a better word, since his recent activities seem to belong to a restless person newly freed from the constraints of his profession, rather than a used-up man at rest.

title: In Store | A Poolside Pop-Up Shop at the Standard Hollywood
description: After a long Canadian winter, the Montreal travel brand Want Les Essentials de la Vie headed south to design a warm-weather-themed temporary boutique in a white-box space next to the pool deck of the Standard Hollywood. The shop, called Poolside, features rattan rugs, beach balls galore and a vintage summer Olympics poster  a perfect setting for Wants new collection of unisex bags in sea- and sky-inspired colors and natural materials. Dexter and Byron Peart, the twin brothers behind the company, say they strive to design their products so that theyll fit any lifestyle. We have a gold and silver zipper on each bag, Dexter says. This represents the intersection between structured and relaxed, young and old, men and women.

title: The Newest Russia House
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  A few weeks ago, as Valery Gergiev and his Mariinsky Orchestra tested the acoustics of their new $700 million theater here, they played one of the most dramatic selections in the symphonic repertory: the rousing finale of Mahlers Fifth Symphony.

title: Yeh Brothers Cup in Yokohama, Japan
description: A few experts  very few  are willing to back their judgment at the table in making what seem on paper to be very much anti-percentage plays. But they are right far more often than not.

title: Favorites Draw Outside Posts for Derby
description: Orb, the Florida Derby winner trained by Shug McGaughey was made the morning line favorite at 7-2 odds and will start the Kentucky Derby on Saturday from the No. 16 post, the same position Animal Kingdom started from when he won in 2011.

title: A Score or More of Languages in Your Pocket
description: In Douglas Adamss The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy, the hero sticks a so-called Babel fish in his ear and can understand everything said to him in any language. Todays apps for language translation try to accomplish the same thing. While not as accurate or instantaneous, they are nevertheless useful and greatly improved from just a couple of years ago. And you dont have to put anything slimy in your ear.

title: Becoming a Williamsburg Hipster
description: A writer wanted to see what the demographic behind nanobatched chervil and the continually cited show Girls could teach him about life and craft cocktails.

title: Views of an Adopted Nation in Sharp, Colorful Focus
description: America is a large country, but it looked larger yet on Tuesday night on the stage at New York City Ballet. Its spring season is dedicated to American music, and its opening night presented successive visions of this country that were all enthralling and extraordinary. By turns charming, shamelessly exuberant, romantic, enigmatic, bright and dark: a spectrum of views emerged during the course of four ballets, all of which were choreographed by George Balanchine between 1954 and 1970. Few ballets made in subsequent years have proved so unusual and compelling.

title: The Digital Stage for Six-Second Zingers
description: Whats the point of a comedy festival on Twitter when every day is a comedy festival on Twitter?

title: In Vain Pursuit of That 15 Minutes
description: Everyone of a certain age sees life as a reality show, and maybe thats right: the urge toward documentation is greater than ever, and with Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, Vine, Snapchat and more, its easier than ever.

title: A Mariinsky Addition
description: The new $700-million, 2,000-seat theater formally opens on Thursday with a gala concert.

title: Rearranging the Furniture, Minus the Aching Back
description: If youve ever sat on your couch and wondered how it would look across the room, or whether the walls would look good in red, that was your inner interior designer speaking. Now apps offer a quick and powerful way to indulge your home design fantasies.

title: Fighting Global Poverty, One Mosh Pit at a Time
description: When the Global Poverty Project staged a benefit concert with Neil Young, the Black Keys and Foo Fighters in Central Park last fall, skeptics wondered if that nonprofits attempt to generate pressure on world leaders to help the poor would fade as soon as the amplifiers and guitars were put away.

title: How I Became a Hipster
description: You know youre in hipster Brooklyn when someone who looks like a 19th-century farmer tells you that his line of work is affinity marketing.

title: Come as You Were
description: The year was 1992; the scene, a fitting at Calvin Klein, where Nadja Auermann, the 6-foot fashion Valkyrie, was trying on the nude-tone slip dress she was to model on Mr. Kleins runway. She totally filled it out in this voluptuous way, recalled Nian Fish, whose job as creative director of the KCD public relations agency was to oversee the proceedings.

title: Tiling 102: The Bathroom Floor
description: Whats practical, durable and a pain in the knees?

title: Shopping for Espresso Cups
description: Giulio Cappellini, the art director of the Italian furniture company Cappellini, goes shopping for cups for serving his favorite hot drink.

title: The Home Workshop Gets an Upgrade
description: Inside hacker spaces, where inventors and electronic tinkerers share tools and knowledge.

title: Espresso Cups
description: Giulio Cappellini has a knack for identifying the design stars of tomorrow. As the art director of the Italian furniture company Cappellini, he was an early supporter of emerging talents like Jasper Morrison, Tom Dixon and Marc Newson in the 1980s, long before they became giants in the field.

title: One Big Workbench
description: Under different circumstances, or in some earlier America, Yair Silbermintz might have spent his weekday evenings tinkering with a soldering iron alone in the basement of a suburban ranch house.

title: Carrying a Torch
description: Scenes from a three-day design-build camp.

title: Lessons in How to Play With Fire
description: AUSTIN, TEX.  Jack Sanders discovered the Newbern Tigers, a century-old sandlot baseball club from the tiny town of Newbern, Ala., one spring weekend in 1998. He was in his second year at the Rural Studio, the breakaway design-build program at Auburn University run by Samuel Mockbee, which paired architecture students with the states poorest residents (mostly citizens of Newbern) to create houses and community projects as individual as the folks they were made for.

title: In a Creative Season, a New Design Fair
description: On May 8, 23 exhibitors will gather on Pier 57 in Hudson River Park for the first Collective design fair. The event, which coincides with the Frieze Art Fair and a gang of Impressionist and Modern art auctions, inaugurates a vigorous two weeks of art and design activity in New York that includes the International Contemporary Furniture Fair and satellite shows. Steven Learner, 52, the architect and designer who started Collective (known as Collective.1 in its first iteration), made a trip uptown to discuss it.

title: Bespoke Chandeliers Inspired by Bees
description: Last week, Guerlain, the French perfume company, opened a boutique and learning center in La Cour des Senteurs on the Rue de la Chancellerie in Versailles, a hundred yards from the main entrance of the royal chateau. Suspended from the shops 22-foot-high arched entrance is a frothy chandelier by Marie Christophe, a sculptor in Toulouse.
