description: invocation \in-v-ka-shn\ noun

title: No Easy Path to Slimness, Patients Say of Procedure
description: The standard knock on weight-loss surgery is that it amounts to taking the easy way out. But people interviewed on Tuesday who have had the same type of surgery as Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey say it is not so.

title: Decisive Surge Gets a Spark From Prigioni, of All People
description: The booming chants inside Madison Square Garden during the fourth quarter were for Pablo Prigioni, the 35-year-old Argentine rookie point guard who was implored to shoot whenever he was open.

title: Inquiry Adds 6 Officials Taped by Ex-Legislator
description: At least six elected officials who were secretly recorded by Shirley L. Huntley, a former state senator from Queens, are now the subjects of a criminal investigation, substantially broadening a case that has already led to allegations against Senator John L. Sampson, federal prosecutors in Brooklyn said on Tuesday.

title: Man Charged in Mothers Death Had Been Acting Strange
description: Sylvia Scott was a constant, calming force in her sons life. In times of trouble  whether emotional, criminal or financial  she was there for him.

title: Outsiders in Race for Mayor Are Irritating Their Better-Known Rivals
description: To many, they remain the afterthoughts of the New York City mayoral race: outsider candidates, polling in the single digits, whom the political establishment assumed would at some point quietly go away.

title: Brooklyn Club Owners Debt Agency Cheated Clients, U.S. Says
description: Michael Levitis is no stranger to notoriety. He was convicted in 2011 of lying to F.B.I. agents in the investigation of a former New York state senator, Carl Kruger. His wife and mother had roles on a reality television show, Russian Dolls. He controls Rasputin, a Russian-themed nightclub.

title: Yanks No-Name Lineup Gets No Runs Off Rockies
description: DENVER  Undermanned as they are from a long list of injuries, the Yankees have managed to survive the first few weeks of the season with relative success. But as more players go down, and the Yankees reach deeper to find replacements, that success may prove more elusive.

title: Designer Wont Hold Workshop at Parsons
description: A four-day workshop and discussion that the controversial fashion designer John Galliano was to lead at Parsons the New School for Design has been canceled, the Manhattan school announced on Tuesday evening.

title: Whats On Wednesday
description: 8 P.M. (TCM) DONT SAY NO UNTIL I FINISH TALKING: THE STORY OF RICHARD D. ZANUCK (2013) Laurent Bouzereau chronicles the life of Richard D. Zanuck (1934-2012), the Oscar-winning producer, through recollections of his childhood on the 20th Century Fox lot as the son of the studio head Darryl F. Zanuck and his wife, the actress Virginia Fox. When Richard had the chance to produce his first film, Compulsion, starring Orson Welles, he said his father told him: You know I had it a lot easier than you will have it. You have to overcome the circumstances of your birth. You carry baggage with you  I am the baggage you carry. When Darryl Zanuck was installed as chairman of the studio in the 1960s, he asked his son for a list of possible names to be appointed president of the company. Richard, above, submitted a piece of paper that read, simply, Me. Films like The Sound of Music (1965), Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid (1969), M*A*S*H (1970) and The French Connection (1971) followed. But films like Doctor Dolittle (1967) and Hello, Dolly (1969) resulted in debt, and just before Christmas 1970, Richard was fired by his father. Shortly afterward his father also lost his job. This documentary, with Steven Spielberg as an executive producer, is followed at 9:45 by Driving Miss Daisy (1989), the Oscar best picture winner starring Jessica Tandy as a Southern widow and Morgan Freeman as her driver; it was the first movie produced by the Zanuck Company, which Richard and his wife, Lili Fini Zanuck, founded in 1988. Cocoon (1985), about a group of elderly people rejuvenated by aliens, follows at 1:15 a.m., and Compulsion (1959), Richard Fleischers take on the Leopold-Loeb case, at 3:30.

title: A Cash Chokehold on North Korea Gets Tighter
description: HONG KONG  The noose is tightening on North Korea. And for the leaders in Pyongyang, two developments in recent days suggest that the countrys ravenous thirst for foreign currency, which fuels its military ambitions, may be much harder to satisfy.

description: Two articles Three Women, Missing for Years, Found in Cleveland and Before Escape, Fleeting Clues to Long Ordeal report on three women who were found after being kidnapped about a decade ago.
