description: LONDON  The sudden announcement on Wednesday that Alex Ferguson will retire in two weeks time after almost 27 years as manager of Manchester United has shaken its shares on the New York Stock Exchange, to say nothing of its effect around the sporting world.

title: A White Road and an Ambiguous Narrative
description: This project was born out of failure.

title: Would You Want a Pair of Googles Computer Glasses?
description: Are wearable computers the next big technological innovation? Do you see yourself walking around with computerized glasses a few years from now, snapping pictures, sending messages or getting directions? Or is the hype and controversy misplaced?

title: From Arunachal Pradesh, a Tribe Offers Lessons in Ecology
description: ZIRO VALLEY, Arunachal Pradesh  The end of April is planting time for the women of the Apa Tani tribe. Their 50-square-kilometer valley is a meticulously groomed jewel of green conservation, compared to the flood-beset Assam plains below or the slash-and-burn plots that neighboring tribes cultivate in the shrinking forests of the surrounding hills.

title: The Early Word: Spiraling Up
description: Todays Times

title: ACT Plans to Move to Computer-Based Exam
description: The ACT has announced that it wants to move to a computer-based exam by spring 2015, my colleague Tamar Lewin reported this week:

title: Sanford and the Electoral Effect of Sex Scandals
description: Tuesday nights special election in South Carolinas First Congressional District was won by a Republican, Mark Sanford, the former South Carolina governor whose political career was imperiled in 2009 after he disclosed an extramarital affair.

title: To Speak Yet Say Nothing
description: MEXICO CITY  Presidential visits are events designed for photo ops, controlled situations and speeches of little substance. They are the nice side of diplomatic relations; the real negotiations happen before and after, behind closed doors.

title: The Tarot Sees a Full Battery in Your Future
description: Backup batteries usually trumpet their capacity, but capacity results in size: they are sometimes as large as a paperback book. The Powerocks Tarot, though, trumpets its size, because its just about the same as a stack of credit cards.

title: Where Private School Is Not a Privilege
description: In the United States, private school is generally a privilege of the rich. But in poorer nations, particularly in Africa and South Asia, families of all social classes send their children to private school. The private schools within reach of the poor, however  usually a single classroom a woman runs in her house  are not a big improvement. But two school systems  Bridge International Academies in Kenya and BRAC in Bangladesh  are offering something different: they are making decent education accessible to the worlds poorest on a giant scale.

title: How We Keep Our Mentors and Investors on Board
description: When I came up with the idea for Fashioning Change, I had no idea what it meant to create a technology start-up. I just knew that I wanted to create something that would rival big fashion brands and e-commerce sites like Amazon, and I knew there was a lot I needed to learn. So I sought out resources to help me.

title: Who Would Kill a Monk Seal?
description: The Hawaiian monk seal has wiry whiskers and the deep, round eyes of an apologetic child. The animals will eat a variety of fish and shellfish, or turn over rocks for eel and octopus, then haul out on the beach and lie there most of the day, digesting. On the south side of Kauai one afternoon, I saw one sneeze in its sleep: its convex body shuddered, then spilled again over the sand the way a raw, boneless chicken breast will settle on a cutting board. The seals can grow to seven feet long and weigh 450 pounds. They are adorable, but also a little gross: the Zach Galifianakises of marine mammals.

title: If Practice Makes Perfect, Why Dont Companies Practice More?
description: In his terrific book Outliers, Malcolm Gladwell writes about the importance of practice and, specifically, the necessity of completing 10,000 hours of practice in a particular field to become proficient. This makes sense to me. Everything I did before starting in business taught me that practice was essential to achieving success. In school, I had two or three exams each semester, but I went to class every day. Moreover, I had voluminous amounts of homework each night to refine my skills in a particular subject. In football, there were 10 games in a season, but nearly 100 practices.

title: Q.& A.: Scanning Checks at the A.T.M.
description: Q.

title: Backup Power in the Palm of Your Hand
description: Demand for electronic devices seems to be growing faster than the number of outlets available to charge them. Hoping to provide power to those in need, Etn has introduced a series of portable backup batteries called BoostBloc.

title: Daily Report: Investment Firms Golden Touch With Technology Falters
description: During the dot-com boom, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, the venture capital investment firm, made prescient early investments in Netscape Communications, Amazon.com and Google and delivered astonishing returns to investors, Randall Smith reports in The New York Times.

title: British Government Moves to Toughen Rules on Immigrants
description: LONDON  Britain moved to toughen immigration rules on Wednesday as the government tried to regain the initiative after recent electoral gains by a populist party that wants the country to curb immigration and leave the European Union.

title: Wednesday Reading: Sites to Help Solve 5 Travel Problems
Blue Note to Partner With ArtistShare
description: Blue Note Records, a storied label in jazz, has plans to partner with ArtistShare, a pioneering crowd-financing platform, for a hybrid called Blue Note/ArtistShare. The joint venture suggests one tactical response to the pressures now facing the record business, especially in and around the jazz field.

title: Setting Their Sights on Wider Vistas
description: Are we symmetrical? asked Rostam Batmanglij. It was the kind of question  concise, mathematical, a little nerdy, a little tense  that might be expected from the keyboardist of Vampire Weekend, a band that packs complex ideas into twisted pop songs.

title: Congress Party Sweeps Karnataka Elections
description: BANGALORE  In a morale booster for the governing Congress Party in New Delhi, its regional unit stormed into power in the south Indian state of Karnataka on Wednesday, as trends show, relegating the rival Bharatiya Janata Party, which governed the state for the last five years, to a distant second place.

title: Deciding on Dimons Dual Role
description: A little-known firm in London could play a crucial role in determining the fate of Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase. The firm, Governance for Owners, has been tasked with voting the shares of BlackRock, the banks largest shareholder, on the question of whether to strip Mr. Dimon of his role as chairman, Susanne Craig and Jessica Silver-Greenberg report in DealBook.

title: A Corporals Taxi Ride
description: Dear Diary:

title: Objects | Towel Off With Designer Pieces for One Kings Lane
description: Continuing its series of philanthropic collaborations with fashion and interior designers, the online home marketplace One Kings Lane tapped eight talents to create limited-edition prints for its inaugural Designer Series Beach Towels sale. The prints range from kitschy silhouettes of beach gear and diamonds (by Robert Verdi) to floral motifs (by Tracy Reese and Nanette Lepore) to geometric patterns (by Rebecca Minkoff, Celerie Kemble, Steven Alan and Jenni Kayne). Because theyre produced in the same basic colors, they can be mixed and matched easily. Beginning Monday, each designer will take a turn having a sale on OneKingsLane.com, offering several prints each for a few days at a time, with the proceeds benefiting a charity of the makers choosing. The first is Tracy Reeses collection in support of AIDS Fund-New York Community Trust on May 13; the last is Jenni Kaynes set to benefit Baby 2 Baby on June 18.

title: Transforming Data
description: Someday youll tell your grandchildren you remember the old days when data just sat there, like some list of information for people to look at.

title: Lie to Me
description: BUENOS AIRES  How much inflation is there? Who can buy dollars legally? Who really runs the economy? All are simple questions, but in Argentina they can be major puzzles.

title: AOL Profit Rose in First Quarter; Shares Fall on Disappointing Ad Growth
description: AOL, the giant online portal-turned-media company, on Wednesday reported first-quarter revenue of $538 million, up 2 percent from the same quarter a year earlier. Net income grew 23 percent to $26 million.

title: What Were Reading
description: The American Prospect: This thorough article about how farm workers really get paid just won a James Beard award for journalism.  Julia Moskin

title: Cleveland Man Charged With Rape and Kidnapping
description: CLEVELAND  About the time that neighbors kicked in a front door to free three women abducted and long imprisoned, the man charged with their kidnapping was idling away a spring afternoon at his mothers home.

title: Theres Something About Maynard
description: After his Keynesianism-is-gay remarks got him in trouble, Niall Ferguson did the right thing and offered a straightforward, no excuses apology. Unfortunately, it seems that he has reverted to type; sigh.

title: Similacs Dubious No Judgment Marketing
description: Sometimes the messenger makes you question the message.

title: Sanford Takes South Carolina Seat
description: The Timess Kim Severson says the Republican Mark Sanford used well-honed campaign tactics and a solid fiscal record to win election to Congress.

title: The Mystery of the Monk-Seal Murders
description: In Hawaii, at least 4 endangered monk seals have been found violently murdered since the end of 2011.

title: California Modern
description: The Los Angeles architect A. Quincy Jones (1913-79) was equally at home designing middle-class housing developments as he was creating luxurious dwellings for celebrities like Gary Cooper and wealthy couples like Walter and Leonore Annenberg. This month, a retrospective examines his extraordinary body of work, which is as influential in its own way as that of better-known West Coast Modernists like Charles Eames and Richard Neutra. The show, at the Hammer Museum in Los Angeles, spotlights Joness innovations in indoor-outdoor design and includes photos and original blueprints of a number of his notable projects, like the colorful, airy Burbank headquarters of Warner Bros. Records (above)  an embodiment of the California dream if ever there was one.

title: Whos Next at Manchester United?
description: The lines are open, the speculation has begun  who will, who can, replace Alex Ferguson, 71, who announced his retirement Wednesday as the manager of Manchester United. As Capt. Louis Renault said in Casablanca, Round up the usual suspects.

title: Advice on Practicing Yoga in Middle Age, Part 1
description: More than 100 readers submitted questions about aging and yoga to Dr. Loren Fishman, a back-pain and rehabilitative medicine specialist who has long incorporated yoga into patient care. In 1972, before applying to medical school, he studied yoga with B.K.S. Iyengar for a year in Pune, India. Dr. Fishman is medical director of Manhattan Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation in New York City, an assistant clinical professor at Columbia Medical School and an associate editor of the journal Topics in Geriatric Rehabilitation. He is also an author of eight books, including Yoga for Osteoporosis: the Complete Guide.

title: Comeback Achieved, Sanford Takes Spotlight
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  After getting a few hours sleep, Mark Sanford made a victory lap Wednesday morning. He showed up on several national television news programs not only as the newly elected congressman from South Carolinas First District, but also as a symbol of a political comeback many here and across the country thought could never happen.

title: With Bleak Job Prospects, Parents and Their Children Buy Into Franchises
description: Late one night in January 2012, Paige Palmer called her mother at home, crying. She was entering her final semester as a communications major at St. Marys College of California in Moraga, and neither she nor her friends were finding work. The job market was terrifying.

title: One Perspective on the Best Places to Retire
description: When people dream of places where theyd like to retire, chances are that North Dakota is not at the top of the list. Or South Dakota, for that matter.

title: Manchester United Investors See Risk in Managers Exit
description: 5:37 p.m. | Updated LONDON  When a successful chief executive finally bows out, investors often fret that his replacement wont be able to replicate past glories.

title: A Love of History and Horses
description: As many racing fans look forward to the classics, some of us like to look back, preoccupied as much with racing heroes of the past like Harry Bassett and Colin as we are with who will win the big races in 2013. Annie Johnson is one of these people. She runs the Web site Antebellum Turf Times, which looks like a vintage racing broadsheet and contains features such as How To Catch A Wild Turkey, Circa 1831  and the 1845 Constitution of the Adams County, Mississippi, Jockey Club.

title: Who You Say You Are
description: Ever think twice about using Airbnb, the Web site for short-term home and apartment stays, for fear the traveler or host could be posing under a false name to run a Nigerian prince-style scheme on you? To put your mind at ease, Airbnb added identity verification last month to its site so you can be sure the person youre e-mailing is who he says he is. Users can upload a photo of their drivers license or passport and confirm personal historical data about themselves, and Airbnb will compare that information with their Facebook or LinkedIn profiles or Airbnb reviews to verify their backgrounds.

title: Former Aide to Putin Is Out at Kremlin
description: MOSCOW  The Kremlin on Wednesday announced the resignation of Vladislav Y. Surkov, in recent years a close aide to Prime Minister Dmitri A. Medvedev and one of the architects of Russias highly centralized political system, now under strain from protests and a slowing economy.

title: Calpers Calls JPMorgans Combined Top Roles a Fundamental Conflict
description: As shareholders consider whether to press for splitting JPMorgan Chases top two roles, one big investor has made it very clear where it stands.

title: Republicans, Reporters, Drug Addicts and an Orphaned Mural
description: Having a hard time imagining a palatial Republican Club in the middle of blue Manhattan  with a sumptuous main lounge, fireplaces at either end, that offers a panorama of Bryant Park through its great windows, and an oak-trimmed dining room where each of the pilasters is topped by an RC crest?

title: Commanders View of the Afghan Endgame
description: In an interview with The New York Times, Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr., the supreme military commander in Afghanistan, discussed the readiness of the Afghan security forces, his optimism that the Afghan Army will be a unifying force for the country, the Talibans tactics this summer and winning over the Afghan people. Following are extended excerpts from the interview.

title: The Gun Report: May 8, 2013
description: This just in: two and a half months after Californias state pension funds voted to sell off their gun stocks, New York has followed suit. This morning, Comptroller John Liu announced that the New York City Employees Retirement System has sold $16.3 million worth of gun stocks. In his press release, Liu noted that another New York retirement fund, the Teachers Retirement System, had also dumped its gun stocks.

title: South Carolina Voters Get It
description: So they just convincingly voted for Mark Sanford, a man who cheated on his wife, tried to cover his actions with an absurd story about hiking the Appalachian Trail, and trespassed on his ex-wifes property, over an exemplary Democratic candidate. And you know what? Given their preferences, this was the right thing to do.

title: Foes Suggest a Tradeoff if Pipeline Is Approved
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas first major environmental decision of his second term could be to approve the Keystone XL pipeline, profoundly disappointing environmental advocates who have made the project a symbolic test of the presidents seriousness on climate change.

title: Wheelies: The Supercar Cops Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: In California, Push for Diversity in College Starts Earlier
description: As the future of affirmative action in college admissions is being considered by the Supreme Court, my colleague Richard Prez-Pea describes how universities are working to diversify their student bodies in states like California, which has eliminated race-conscious admissions:

title: Can Technology and Tourism Sustain Mexicos Sea Turtles?
description: Sea turtles have roamed the oceans for close to 200 million years, surviving assaults that doomed the dinosaurs. Around the world different species now face threats ranging from coastal building to poaching and drowning in fish nets.

title: Fergie Time Runs Out at Manchester United
description: Some will remember the 13 league titles. Others the five F.A. Cups or the financial growth that turned a club from northern England into an international empire that trades on the New York Stock Exchange. But any list of Manchester United Manager Alex Fergusons contributions to the game must surely include the concept of Fergie Time, though it may not be an official part of global soccers vernacular.

title: Image of the Day: May 8
Genetics Reveal Europe Is One Big Family
description: LONDON  From Ireland to Turkey, Europeans are all related, sharing a link with ancestors who were alive just 1,000 years ago, according to a new genetic study.

title: A Mothers Day Gift
description: Adults with older parents or even grandparents will soon be searching for suitable Mothers Day and Fathers Day gifts. If these presents are not consumables  a box of chocolates or a bottle of spirits  then they will only enlarge the material convoy that accompanies Mom and Dad through their later years.

title: Romantic Triangle: Star, Director, City
description: An address on Vanderbilt Avenue in Brooklyn. An F train that never comes. Unfinished on-spec scripts for Saturday Night Live. The artistically inclined friend of yours who, incongruously, is dating a man who works at Goldman Sachs. That exorbitant $3 fee at the Bank of America A.T.M.  and the long unpalatable walk to the next deli, to find a cheaper option.

title: The Fix the Debt Fix Is Still In
description: So, Bill Clinton says that Im right in the short run while Simpson-Bowles are right in the long run; hes half right. But whats interesting is to see the Peterson juggernaut still rolling along despite the enormous intellectual hit the cause has received.

title: Beatles Concert Show Let It Be Coming to Broadway
description: For a group that split up more than four decades ago and never reunited, the Beatles are certainly finding plenty of opportunities to appear on Broadway. Let It Be, a popular British concert show based around the bands music, will make its mop-topped way from the West End to Broadway this summer, press representatives for the production said on Wednesday.

title: Decisive Moment That Ended a Kidnapping
description: The Timess Serge F. Kovaleski talks about the decisions made by bystanders like Angel Cordero to help the release of three women held against their will in Cleveland.

title: A Double Dose of Harry Potter Planned for Universal Theme Parks
description: LOS ANGELES -- Harry Potter transformed Universals Islands of Adventure theme park in Florida when he arrived in 2010. Now Universal hopes the boy wizard can shower its aging adjacent park with some of the same magic.

title: Touching Up the C.I.A.
description: The Central Intelligence Agency announced on Tuesday that it had replaced the acting head of the clandestine service. The day before, Gawker published a memo from the C.I.A. pinpointing all the ways it had managed to get Mark Boal to change scenes in his screenplay for Zero Dark Thirty that did not promote an appropriate portrayal of the Agency  in other words, things that made it look worse than it did in the final version of the movie, which depicts the hunt for Osama bin Laden.

title: A New Louvre North of Paris
description: On a Friday evening this winter, 250 paired-off revelers  from couples young and old to mothers with small children  were dressed in varying interpretations of Renaissance-style costume: many were in masks, some wore full-skirted, floor-skimming gowns. They filled a stripped-down auditorium and twirled energetically to instructions belted out in French by the renowned Parisian choreographer Christine Corday.

title: Eating Locally on the Road
description: Sarah Elton is a regular at the farmers market near her home in Toronto. She religiously checks labels and menus to make sure her food hasnt traveled far before arriving on her plate. Yet, while traveling to organic farms in India, China and even food-obsessed France to research her new book, Consumed: Food for a Finite Planet, she found that her locavore ways were not always sustainable.

title: House Holds Hearing on Benghazi Attack
description: Eight months after four Americans died in a terrorist attack on the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, a House committee held another hearing on Wednesday to examine whether the Obama administration mishandled the tragic events. What follows is an update on what is known about the Benghazi episode and why it has become such a political flash point:

title: The Joy of Toys
description: New picture books about children and their toys, including an age-old problem: Two children, one ball.

title: Properties for $870,000
description: A 1905 cottage in Louisiana, a Cape in Vermont and mountain views in Montana.

title: What You Get for ... $870,000
description: BOZEMAN, MONT.

title: Police Quell Protest in Beijing Over Womans Death
description: BEIJING  Hundreds of police officers in riot gear were deployed into the streets surrounding a shopping mall in southern Beijing on Wednesday to contain a large protest that was ignited by the death of a 22-year-old woman rumored to have been raped by security guards.

title: A Nearly Perfect Night
description: Who had the better New York night?

title: Israeli Police Question Muslim Cleric After Scuffle
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli police on Wednesday detained the Palestinians top Muslim cleric for questioning about disturbances a day earlier at a fiercely contested holy site in Jerusalem known to Jews as Temple Mount and to Muslims as the Noble Sanctuary.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: The Great Gatsby
description: Baz Luhrmann, the director of The Great Gatsby, narrates a scene from his film featuring Leonardo DiCaprio and Tobey Maguire.

title: The Joy of Toys
description: PEANUT AND FIFI HAVE A BALLBy Randall de Sve.Illustrated by Paul Schmid.40 pp. Dial. $15.99. (Picture book; ages 3 to 5)

title: Some Retailers Say More About Their Clothings Origins
description: The revolution that has swept the food industry is expanding to retail: origins matter.

title: An Ethnic Map
description: David Brooks: On Tuesday I was on a panel with Representative Xavier Becerra, the chairman of the House Democratic caucus, and Janet Murgua, who is the head of the National Council of La Raza.

title: Teamwork for a Channel
description: DoubleTree by Hilton has teamed up with Google to create a YouTube channel called DTour, which allows travelers to post their photos and videos from other social-networking sites like Facebook, GooglePlus and Instagram. The sites map displays locations of DoubleTree hotels, with the ability to book rooms and allows users to link photos, videos and written recommendations to those destinations.

title: As Candidates Vow to Hire Educator as Chancellor, Quinn Keeps Options Open
description: Several candidates for mayor on Tuesday pledged to hire an educator as the next schools chancellor, breaking with Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg, who three times tapped leaders from business and government for the post.

title: Metal Bands Frontman Charged With Attempting to Hire Hit Man
description: The frontman for the Christian metal band As I Lay Dying was arrested on Tuesday in Oceanside, Calif., and charged with attempting to hire a hit man to kill his estranged wife, the San Diego County Sheriffs Department said.

title: The Fire in the Rear
description: One of the Civil Wars most unusual surrenders took place on May 25, 1863. Accompanied by two Union officers, a former Ohio congressman named Clement L. Vallandigham approached a Confederate soldier on picket duty outside Murfreesboro, Tenn., and recited a short speech: I am a citizen of Ohio, and of the United States. I am here within your lines by force and against my will. I therefore surrender myself to you as a prisoner of war.

title: Anatomy of a Scene: The Great Gatsby
description: In this video, the director Baz Lurhmann narrates a scene from The Great Gatsby, featuring a conversation between Jay Gatsby (Leonardo DiCaprio) and Nick Carraway (Tobey Maguire). Mr. Lurhmann discusses the location of the shoot (an area of Sydney, Australia, made up to look like Long Island) and how a rainstorm almost prevented the scene from happening.

title: Go Daddy Lures an Executive From K.K.R.
description: When Scott Wagner stepped up as the Go Daddy Groups interim chief executive last summer, he viewed the move as temporary. He already had a day job, as a senior executive at an arm of Kohlberg Kravis Roberts.

title: Trouble in the Hive: Researching the Decimation of Honeybee Colonies
description: Overview | What is colony collapse disorder, and why is it a growing concern to farmers and beekeepers? In this lesson, students learn about the ongoing decimation of honeybee colonies across the country, discuss its possible causes and potential solutions, and participate in a citizen science project to census honeybees in their neighborhoods.Materials | Computers with Internet connections, a variety of fruits

title: In Immigration Bill, Deportees See Hope for Second Chance in U.S.
description: TIJUANA, Mexico  Erik Garca arrived at the metal gate of a migrant shelter here, deported from Los Angeles just hours earlier. After 23 years in the United States illegally, he suddenly found himself separated from the country where he had moved as a boy, and from his two teenage daughters, both American citizens.

title: The Man With the Golden Ear
description: The 75-year-old businessman Chris Blackwell has made a fortune betting on the charms of his beloved Jamaica. In 1959, Blackwell started Island Records, which brought reggae and Bob Marley to a worldwide audience. (He also signed U2, Cat Stevens, Grace Jones, Nick Drake and Roxy Music.) When Blackwell sold Island 30 years later, he turned his attention to hotels: both in Miamis South Beach, which he helped put on the map when he transformed blighted Art Deco properties into luxury destinations; and, more enduringly, at home, where his current holdings include GoldenEye, the former home of the James Bond author Ian Fleming (a longtime lover of Blackwells mother, Blanche), which attracts the likes of Kate Moss and Naomi Campbell. His latest venture? Jamaican rum, naturally.

title: Opening Up Networkings Black Box
description: The Open Compute Project, a Facebook-led effort to remake the computer servers and data storage of the biggest computing centers, is broadening its aims to include networking as well.

title: A Timeline of Events in Benghazi
description: The defense actions carried out on Sept. 11-12, 2012, as the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, was under attack.

title: Ex-Lawyer in State Department Criticizes Drone Secrecy
description: WASHINGTON  A former legal adviser to the State Department has sharply criticized the secrecy surrounding the Obama administrations use of drones for the targeted killing of terrorism suspects, saying it is unnecessary and has backfired.

title: Mayoral Hopefuls Divided on How to Punish Prostitutes Patrons
description: Yes, there were the usual questions focusing on term limits, pensions, education and temperament. But after dozens of forums over the last few months for mayoral candidates, Tuesday nights back-to-back debates earned the distinction of coming up with an apparent original: What would you do to punish men who patronize prostitutes?

title: Opponents Rally Against New York Public Library Plan
description: More than 100 people gathered in front of the New York Public Librarys Fifth Avenue flagship building on Wednesday afternoon to register opposition to the librarys renovation plan.

title: New Diplomatic Push to End Civil War in Syria
description: ROME  As new reports of violence flowed from Syria, Secretary of State John Kerry telephoned leaders in Europe and the Middle East on Wednesday to lay the groundwork for a conference between rebels and the Syrian government, sponsored by the United States and Russia, that he hoped would begin within a month.

title:
For Officials on
Tape, Legislators
Invitation Was Ruse
description: ALBANY  Over three months last year, Shirley L. Huntley, a longtime schools advocate then serving in the State Legislature, invited several of her fellow Senate Democrats, as well as a Democratic New York City councilman, to visit with her at her tomato-red Cape Cod-style house on a residential street in Jamaica, Queens.

title: Critic of Immigration Proposal Cited Lower I.Q. of Immigrants in Dissertation
description: A co-author of a new Heritage Foundation study highly critical of the Senates bipartisan immigration proposal also wrote a doctoral dissertation in which he argued that immigrants generally had an I.Q. that was substantially lower than that of the white native population.

title: Military Courts Are Called Outdated on Sex Crimes
description: WASHINGTON An aviation commander for the Navy was raped by a co-worker, but there was no prosecution and the female accuser was denied re-enlistment. A noncommissioned officer was assaulted by a captain, who was found guilty but then granted clemency without explanation.

title: Twitter Adds Tweets You Can Hear
description: Now you can hear the Twittering.

title: What Do Mothers Want?
description: LET HOLDEN CAULFIELD have his naked-bosomed squaw, Noah Baumbach his squid and whale. For me, the central attraction of the American Museum of Natural History has always been the hall of gems and minerals. Darkened, plush-carpeted  there is no greater serenity than staring into one of its giant amethyst geodes, split open like a mangosteen.

title: French Open Will Bar Tomics Father
description: John Tomic, the father and coach of Australian tennis star Bernard Tomic, will not be granted accreditation to this years French Open, according to the tournament director Gilbert Ysern.

title: Letter Disclosing Those Recorded by Shirley L. Huntley
description: Read the full letter listing those officials recorded by Shirley L. Huntley.

title: He Made Her Who She Is
description: First theres the enormous chest, which seems to enter the room a few seconds before the rest of her. Then theres the hand that curls into a claw as her anger rises. And finally the voice. A pinched staccato that carries menace and a barely contained hysteria.

title: The Foreign Bribery Law Comes to Wall Street
description: It was almost inevitable that the governments crackdown on bribery would hit a Wall Street firm.

title: Rangers Lundqvist Is Vezina Finalist Again
description: When Henrik Lundqvist talks about his craft as a goaltender, it is almost as if he is giving a seminar about how to succeed at any endeavor requiring work, devotion and concentration.

title: Older Workers Say Age Bias Is Common
description: About two-thirds of older workers say they have seen or experienced age discrimination in the workplace, and most of them say its common, a new survey from AARP finds.

title: The Politician as Telemarketer
description: Federal elected officials spend only a fraction of their time engaged in what might loosely be called the business of governing  even when they belong to the party that believes in government. Oh, sure, they write the occasional bill, and talk with their constituents, and go out to dinner with lobbyists, and yell at other politicians on Sunday talk shows. Mostly, though, they beg for cash.

title: Video: Intersection, Dumbos Style Mash-Up
description: In the latest Intersection video, we headed to Dumbo, Brooklyn, and met people who work in the area and draw style inspiration from music festivals and furniture design. Martin Medina, a visual designer, draws fashion inspiration from his youth in the Lower East Side and bright colors.

title: A Three-Bedroom Among Palms and Rice Paddies
description: A traditional Balinese house near the town of Ubud is on the market for $450,000.

title: House Hunting in ... Bali
description: A TRADITIONAL THREE-BEDROOM BALINESE VILLA NEAR UBUD

title: Apples Peter Oppenheimer Is Highest Paid Finance Chief
description: Being a tax ninja pays off at Apple. Its chief financial officer, Peter Oppenheimer, who has helped the company sidestep billions of dollars in taxes, was the highest paid chief financial officer of 2012, according to data compiled by Bloomberg News.

title: German Orchestra to Bring Symphony for Palestine to West Bank
description: A few years in the making, a Middle East tour of a work called Symphony for Palestine will come to Ramallah, East Jerusalem and Jenin from May 30 through June 2, a German orchestra announced this week.

title: Stock Markets Rise, but Half of Americans Dont Benefit
description: The stock market has been doing well, reaching new nominal highs in recent weeks. Economists have been arguing that such equity gains make people feel richer, which might encourage consumers to pick up their spending despite their stagnant wages and recent tax increases.

title: Powe Is Out for Rangers as Clowe Nears Return
description: It seemed likely that Ryane Clowe would take Darroll Powes place in the Rangers lineup for Game 4 against the Washington Capitals on Wednesday night. Powe left Game 3 with an undisclosed injury, though he appeared to sustain a concussion from a hit by Washingtons Joel Ward. Clowe left a game April 25 with what was also believed to be a concussion, but he has been practicing recently.

title: Enrons Skilling Strikes Deal for Shorter Sentence
description: 8:27 p.m. | Updated

title: Lhota Facing Anger After He Likens Port Authority Police to Mall Cops
description: It was a simple question about improving airport security, the kind that candidates for mayor field up to three times a day at campaign forums across New York City.

title: Food Stamp Program Faces Deeper Cuts Under House Farm Bill
description: A new farm bill being crafted by the House Agriculture Committee includes deeper cuts to the food stamp program than those included in last years version of the bill, setting up a potential fight with House and Senate Democrats who oppose additional cuts to the program.

title: Middle Ages Men
description: Portraits of some of the men who will represent the United States this week at the Battle of Nations in France, a full-contact armored fighting event.

title: Knicks Defense: Same Plan, Better Execution
description: The Knicks offense may rise and fall with their 3-point shooting, but their attack is a straightforward mix of efficient pick-and-rolls and wing isolations for Carmelo Anthony. As the team proved in the regular season, its personnel and style are suited for high scoring. With Anthony at power forward and relatively unathletic players on the perimeter, however, defending requires a bit of smoke and mirrors.

title: Diplomat Says Questions Over Benghazi Led to Demotion
description: WASHINGTON  A veteran diplomat gave a riveting minute-by-minute account on Wednesday of the lethal terrorist attack in Benghazi, Libya, last Sept. 11 and described its contentious aftermath at a charged Congressional hearing that reflected the weighty political stakes perceived by both parties.

title: Riding a Fast Sled to the Tonys
description: Benj Pasek and Justin Paul were brought in to write the music and lyrics for A Christmas Story after the original composer was replaced. This opportunity resulted a few years later in unexpected Tony Award nominations for the Broadway hit and for the duo, who have been touted as theater wonder boys since graduating from the University of Michigan in 2007. Theyve seen their song cycle Edges performed around the world, had songs featured on NBCs Smash and watched another of their musicals, Dogfight, get a high-gloss production at Second Stage Theater.

title: Depression May Raise Risk of Gut Infection
description: Two studies have found that depression and the use of certain antidepressants are both associated with increased risk for Clostridium difficile infection, an increasingly common cause of diarrhea that in the worst cases can be fatal.

title: Legal Memo Advised Postal Service Against Ending Saturday Delivery
description: An outside law firm hired by the Postal Service warned its nine-member board that they risked being removed from office if they proceeded with plans to end mail delivery on Saturdays, according to a memo the firm prepared for the agencys legal department.

title: The Holy Grail of Battle Re-enactments
description: ATLANTA  Inside Craig Iveys travel bag are objects reminiscent of the Middle Ages.

title: Beauty Spots
description: Pedal Pushers

title: Errors Afflict More Checks Issued to Aid Homeowners
description: 8:58 p.m. | Updated

title: By The Numbers
description: We chart the success of the 75-year-old businessman Chris Blackwell, who has made a fortune betting on the charms of his beloved Jamaica.

title: The Price of Fast Fashion
description: Even before the tragedy in Bangladesh, pressure was growing on retailers to balance Americans appetite for cheap clothes with the human costs of making them, the author Elizabeth Cline says.

title: Syria, and Pro-Government Hackers, Are Back on the Internet
description: Syrian Internet and cellphone access resumed Wednesday morning after an Internet failure pulled the company offline Tuesday.

title: Singh Sues PGA Over Handling of Doping Case
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla.  Vijay Singh filed a lawsuit against the PGA Tour on Wednesday  a day before the start of the tours flagship event, the Players Championship  saying the tours mishandling of his doping case had caused him severe emotional distress.

title: Hypertension in Youths Is Tied to School Success
description: High blood pressure in adolescents may have a bright side. A new study suggests that hypertensive teenagers have higher academic achievement and fewer emotional and behavioral problems than peers with normal blood pressure.

title: On to the Next Experiment
description: Most people think I go shopping all day long, Cecilia Dean said.

title: One Wet Dog
description: Workers installing Paul McCarthys Balloon Dog (2013) on the grounds of the Frieze Art Fair, which opens Friday on Randalls Island.

title: New Zoo Rarity: Hogs With Uncloven Hooves
description: Whats new at the Queens Zoo these days is three female mulefoot hogs.

title: How Normal Are Cruise Mishaps?
description: Its name is Triumph, yet this year has been anything but that for the 14-year-old ship owned by Carnival Corporation, the worlds largest cruise company.

title: Stephen Hawking Joins Boycott Against Israel
description: JERUSALEM  Stephen W. Hawking, the University of Cambridge physicist and cosmologist, has pulled out of a high-profile conference to be held here in June in order to support an academic boycott of Israel, conference organizers and the university said on Wednesday.

title: Next W.T.O. Head Wants a New Look at Bodys Role
description: PARIS  Roberto Carvalho de Azevdo, the next head of the World Trade Organization, said on Wednesday that the institution needed to adapt as the United States and other nations turn away from the multilateral forum to regional trade agreements.

title: Chinas Economy Unexpectedly Stumbles Again on Weak Export Results
description: HONG KONG  Brightly hued mens underwear in a rainbow of colors is no longer selling well in Europe for the Zhongtian Garments Company in Xiamen, China. Exports are down 30 percent in the last year.

title: Harvey Is Hard to Hit; Will No-Hitters Follow?
description: Pitching for a franchise that has had a complicated relationship with no-hitters, the Mets Matt Harvey has seemingly become a threat to throw one every time he pitches. It is as if the franchise that traded away Nolan Ryan before his record run of seven no-hitters is getting a second chance to have a player regularly flirt with the accomplishment that eluded it for 8,019 games before Johan Santana threw the teams first no-hitter last season.

title: The Buzz
description: A Preview of the Week Ahead

title: Amalfis Legacy of Lemons
description: Along Italy's Amalfi Coast, one family struggles to carry on its heritage of lemon cultivation.

title: Bowie Video Is Restored to YouTube
description: Even in 2013 David Bowie can shock people. The singers latest video, featuring women in stripper costumes cavorting in a bar with priests, was briefly pulled from YouTube on Wednesday, then returned with an adults-only label, according to Reuters and Mr. Bowies publicist.

title: The iPhone: Smart, but Sometimes Rude
description: The Apple iPhone sure is smart. You can talk to it through its fancy Siri interface, or take and organizegorgeousphotos based on location and time. But when youre making a phone call, the iPhone isnt that bright, and can be incredibly rude.

title: How We Designed the Monk Seal Murder Cover
Todays Scuttlebot: Inside Google Glass, and a Cyberattack Report
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. More Scuttlebot can be found here.

title: Seeing Mississippi Sight Unseen
description: From its opening pages, Southern Cross the Dog has all the markers of a novel written in the finest Southern gothic tradition. The Great Mississippi Flood of 1927 sweeps in, taking a few unlucky characters with it. There are references aplenty to race, poverty, the blues, voodoo and an ill-fated brothel.

title: This Business Is a Lemon, and a Family Wants to Keep It That Way
description: AMALFI, Italy  On a recent spring morning, Luigi Aceto, a hale 78, climbed a ladder in a terraced lemon grove that stretched up the hillside in one of Italys most picturesque towns and expertly began snipping lemons into a wicker basket. The sun was shining. The lemons were ripe and as big as fists. The scent of blossoms was intoxicating.

title: Mark Sanford and the Future of Marriage
description: While watching Mark Sanford win election to the House of Representatives last night, I thought back to a piece Megan McArdle wroteduring the Supreme Courts gay marriage deliberations earlier this year, in which she made the case that the battle over same-sex unions would ultimately strengthen the forces of staid, bourgeois sexual morality, and tip American society in a kind of neo-Victorian direction. Once gay couples are assimilated into the institution of marriage, she argued, it could become easier for upper-middle class liberals to preach what they already tend to practice, and promote stronger marital norms:

title: Labor Dispute Effectively Ends Minnesota Orchestras Season
description: The Minnesota Orchestra, where musicians have been locked out in a labor dispute since October, announced on Wednesday that it had canceled its concerts through June 2  effectively, the rest of its season. At the same time, Michael Henson, the orchestras president and chief executive, announced a series of concerts for late July and early August, with repertory drawn from this seasons unperformed programs, saying in a statement that the concerts were added because we are not willing to give up on our entire season.

title: On Piano, a Point of View
description: Admirers of the Italian pianist Maurizio Pollini are set in their lionization of this singular artist; his detractors, likewise, are steadfast. Were you not an aficionado of his methods before the recital he gave at Carnegie Hall on Sunday afternoon, nothing that he played during the all-Beethoven program was likely to change your mind. Equally, were you a devotee, nothing Mr. Pollini did on Sunday changed that condition.

title: When a Prince Comes to Town
description: Greenwich, Conn., is filled with masters of the universe. But none of them can trump a prince.

title: China Dips a Toe Into Middle East Peace
description: BEIJING  China took a modest step into Middle East diplomacy this week, hosting back-to-back visits from Mahmoud Abbas, the leader of the Palestinian Authority, and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel.

title: This Is Food Shopping
description: http://vimeo.com/theglossary/thisiswater

title: Ts Newest Columnists Dine in Blue and White
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Scouting Report
description: Mothers Day

title: Eisman Is Gloomy on Canadian Housing
description: The hedge fund manager Steven Eisman rose to prominence in the financial crisis after betting against mortgages in the United States. On Wednesday, he turned his focus to Canada.

title: Red Bulls Roxburgh on Ferguson
description: In the Great Hall of the worlds soccer minds, there is undoubtedly a special wing for the practitioners from Scotland.

title: Keeping His Fans Happy With a Half-Century of Classicism and Virtuosity
description: The popularity of the Russian pianist Evgeny Kissin, who has impressed listeners with his immense gifts since his days as a child prodigy, remains as strong as ever, evident from the capacity audience at his recital on Friday evening at Carnegie Hall. The stage was crowded with extra seating to accommodate listeners, as it occasionally is for a handful of celebrity artists.

title: For First Time on Record, Black Voting Rate Outpaced Rate for Whites in 2012
description: WASHINGTON  The turnout rate of black voters surpassed the rate for whites for the first time on record in 2012, as more black voters went to the polls than in 2008 and fewer whites did, according to a Census Bureau report released Wednesday.

title: Outsmarting Smartphone Thieves
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In the month since two men violently shoved him to the ground and stole his iPhone 5, Dalton Huckaby has almost completely stopped calling his mother. It usually takes him a full day to text his friends back. Nothing personal, but Mr. Huckaby is just too frightened to take his replacement iPhone out in public.

title: The Dwindling Deficit
description: Bad news for Dr. Evil fans: the days of a ONE TRILLION DOLLAR deficit are over. In fact, the deficit is falling fast.

title: A Solitary Soul Whose Pained Voice Heads Into Strange Realms
description: James Blake could easily have been a ballad singer. He showed how with his last encore on Tuesday night at Terminal 5, alone on piano, singing and playing A Case of You by Joni Mitchell in his sustained and tremulous voice, rapt in melancholy and need. But Mr. Blake has other ambitions.

title: Prospect of Irans Election Stirs Little Hope This Time Around
description: TEHRAN  Irans state television broadcast a live program on Tuesday in which passers-by were placed in a chair and asked what they would do if they were president.

title: On Stubborn Bulls, Robinson Is a Standout
description: Cool. Calm. Collected.

title: The Shop That Punk Built
description: To anyone passing by Trash and Vaudeville, the rock-and-roll emporium on St. Marks Place, the sinewy peacock with a bleached shag on the outside steps is a familiar sight.

title: House Hearing Puts Benghazi in Spotlight
description: In a show of partisan politics, a House committee held a hearing on the Sept. 11, 2012, terrorist attack on the American compound in Benghazi, Libya, that killed four Americans.

title: The Season for a Program to Be the Star
description: A simple idea lies behind Spring for Music, the six-day festival at Carnegie Hall that began on Monday with the Baltimore Symphony Orchestra and continued on Tuesday with the Albany Symphony Orchestra. Ensembles from North America are chosen to participate based not on their institutional prestige but for the originality of their proposed programs.

title: Icons Re-imagination of a 65 Dodge Pickup
description: Restoring classic cars and trucks with modern mechanical guts is nothing new. But trying to get inside the heads of the people who designed those vehicles in order to re-create them without the interference of corporate bean counters is quite something else. Thats where Jonathan Wards lively imagination comes into play. He takes a vehicle that has always possessed a charismatic aesthetic and focuses on its details, doing his best to make each one perfect.

title: Teenager Charged With Homicide by Assault in Referees Death
description: The 17-year-old Utah soccer player accused of punching a referee who later died was charged Wednesday with homicide by assault, a charge that could carry a penalty of up to five years in prison if he is convicted.

title: A Quantum Computer Aces Its Test
description: The long-sought quantum computer, a machine potentially far ahead of todays best supercomputers, is almost as hard to define as it is to build. For at least a few particular uses, however, the unusual computer made by D-Wave Systems now seems to be very fast indeed.

title: From Crashes to Exorcism, His Own Cut
description: When William Friedkin was doing research for his controversial film Cruising, he showed up on jockstrap night at the Mine Shaft, the famed gay bar in Manhattan, dressed for the occasion. When he shot the car chase in The French Connection, he took few precautions for the safety of drivers and bystanders. And when he prepped for Rampage, about a bizarre serial killer, he watched a Rorschach test being given to a man convicted of killing his mother. The killer saw angels and butterflies; Mr. Friedkin saw monsters.

title: Verizon Wireless Chief Sees Demand for New BlackBerry Phones
description: BlackBerrys phones havebeen off to a weak start in Canada,the home turf of the struggling handset maker. But the new BlackBerrys are getting a warm welcome from Verizon Wireless, the biggest American carrier.

title: Salinger the Documentary, Craftily Promoted With a Psst
description: LOS ANGELES  J. D. Salinger was good at keeping secrets.

title: Thompson Picks Up Backing of a Fiscal Repairman
description: In recent weeks, William C. Thompson Jr. has been increasingly unfurling mayoral endorsements from African-American and Hispanic leaders, hoping to solidify his base.

title: A Shifting Electorate
description: The overall turnout rate fell by nearly two percentage points from the 2008 to 2012 election, driven in part by a large drop in the youth vote. Black voters turned out at a higher rate than any other group in 2012, passing whites for the first time on record.

title: Chesney Tops Album Chart
description: Kenny Chesney has his seventh No. 1 album on the Billboard 200 chart as Life on a Rock sold 153,000 copies in its first week, according to Nielsen SoundScan. Garth Brooks is the only country act with more No. 1 songs on the chart, with eight. Last weeks No. 1, Michael Bubls To Be Loved, slipped to No. 2 in its second week, with 96,000 in sales. Justin Timberlakes 20/20 Experience holds at No. 3 with 68,000. Fantasias Side Effects of You was No. 4 in its second week, with 36,000, while The Heist, from Macklemore & Ryan Lewis, rose from No. 11 to No. 5, with 35,000.

title: Iron Mans Iron Men
description: A look at the visual effects process for creating Tony Starks suits in Iron Man 3.

title: Manic Duets, Sometimes in a Mist
description: A man and a woman stand in the mist. Sheepish at first, they pull each other into embraces, the woman wrapping her legs around the man or straddling him. As the precipitation increases, the loose, long hair of both partners gradually dampens. Their clothing turns transparent. Except perhaps for when they stick out their tongues to lap the moisture, the scene might be a racy commercial for shampoo. But it is the end of Horizons, by the Greek choreographer Andonis Foniadakis.

title: Its Lunchtime: Lets Dance
description: When lunchtime comes around, Laurie Batista often grabs a salad near the Flatiron ad agency where she works as an executive assistant and eats it at her desk.

title: A Fathers Passage, Set to New Movements
description: In February 2011 the choreographer and dancer Jonah Bokaer was to perform a duet, Replica, in Carthage, Tunisia. The performance, significantly, would have been Mr. Bokaers first visit to his fathers native land.

title: The Public May Now Comment
description: At a little after 7 on a recent evening, the mayor of Bismarck, N.D., banged a gavel to call the citys board of commissioners to order. They were a motley group  mostly young, clad in jeans and sneakers or boots  and seemed ill at ease. They glanced cluelessly at the agendas before them, checked their name plates as though reminding themselves of their names, and waited for an indication of what to do.

title: For Ackman, a Day Without Drama
description: For a hedge fund manager who has had his share of drama in recent months, William A. Ackman was notably subdued in a presentation on Wednesday.

title: Rally Turns Deadly in Southern Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A demonstration that officials said had begun as a peaceful pro-government rally in southern Afghanistan on Wednesday instead turned into a bloody melee, with as many as 10 people killed and 14 wounded as the police fired on demonstrators.

title: Pictures of the Day: Bangladesh and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Bangladesh, Italy, Pakistan and Boston.

title: Sales at Jonathan Adler, Pollack and Others
description: Jonathan Adlers warehouse sale, through Sunday, will include furniture, lighting, pottery and home dcor at up to 70 percent off (the Whitaker sofa, regularly $2,800, is $1,400; the Charade Wave vase, regularly $250, is $75); 513 Irving Avenue (Eldert Street), Brooklyn, jonathanadler.com.

title: The Allure of Simplicity in Leather and Wood
description: Robin Standefer and Stephen Alesch, of the design firm Roman and Williams, have created interiors for such era-defining buildings as the Ace and Standard hotels in New York. But their new furniture collection doesnt stray from tradition. The couple have worked with the SoHo design store Matter in creating a chair, a side table, a coffee table and a series of lights, all in alluring woods like walnut, teak and reclaimed oak. Ms. Standefer described the style as American vernacular. Were embracing simple structures, Mr. Alesch added. This leaves room for laserlike attention to details. The chair, shown, with its custom brass hardware and fine leather ($6,500), makes that point. Information: (212) 343-2600 or mattermatters.com.

title: A Second Roche Bobois for New York
description: Forty years ago, Roche Bobois, the French producer of lush modern furniture, opened its first American showroom on Madison Avenue and 35th Street in New York. Gilles Bonan, the companys chief executive, said that, after the French, Americans are the most avid Roche Bobois customers, drawn by the furnitures comfort, quality and what I call the French flair.

title: Boxes Full of Secrets
description: These days, the jewelry, mirrors and small boxes designed by the French artist Line Vautrin (1913-1997) are much in demand among collectors, commanding thousands. But not so long ago Ms. Vautrin was pass. Like everything in fashion, said Benoist Drut, an owner of the New York gallery Maison Gerard, the trend had changed.

title: She Wont Put Away Her Toys
description: One day last summer, Leah Dumigan noticed an open call on Twitter urging New York designers to submit their American-made products. The Museum of Modern Art Design Store, which in its international Destination: Design series has presented goods from countries including Finland, Mexico and Japan, was finally getting around, in its 11th iteration, to featuring hometown talent. Ms. Dumigan, a graduate of the Fashion Institute of Technologys toy design program, and a new mother, sent in nearly every piece in her line, then added a couple of ideas still percolating but not produced.

title: Life Among the Dolls
description: Four generations of the authors family contributed to a collection of more than 700 dolls.

title: Whos More Vulgar? The Performer or the Crowd?
description: About halfway through Kittys opening set at Irving Plaza on Tuesday night, a pair of young women walked into the room, looked onstage and squealed, turning to each other and talking animatedly about how happy they were to see her.

title: The 700-Doll Question
description: Ten years ago, when my mother was in the throes of dementia, I left New York, bought a home in North Carolina near my brother, and moved her in with me.

title: Face-off Circle Is Focal Point of Leafs-Bruins Series
description: TORONTO  As the Toronto Maple Leafs and the Boston Bruins prepare for Wednesdays Game 4, the gamesmanship between the two veteran coaches is in full swing.

title: Googles Aggregator Gives Way to an Heir
description: Well, if we didnt get it before, we get it now: Google giveth, and Google taketh away.

title: Best Dressed
description: A selection of rooms from the Kips Bay Decorator Show House.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. Theres a large window near my shower thats covered by a temporary blind. Id like to fix it up before showing my home to buyers. Whats the best treatment for such an awkwardly placed window?

title: House of Your (Vivid) Dreams
description: Desire is a reliably unreliable guide to happiness, as Alain de Botton notes in The Architecture of Happiness, the fifth or sixth book from the prolific professional intellectual who has tackled everything from status anxiety to sex. In it, the author observes that bad buildings are like bad relationships, an example expressed through materials of the same tendency which in other domains will lead us to marry the wrong people, choose inappropriate jobs and book unsuccessful holidays: the tendency not to understand who we are and what will satisfy us.

title: Political Handouts Thrive in Pakistan
description: MULTAN, Pakistan  In Multan, a self-described city of saints in central Pakistan, one holy politician is banking on more than prayers to ensure victory in Saturdays national elections.

title: Why Hit a Flower When Its Down?
description: A selection of comments from readers of the Home section, drawn from letters and postings at nytimes.com, about Anne Ravers article on a mysterious strain of downy moldkilling one of the home gardeners favorite annual flowers, Impatiens walleriana.

title: Microsoft Names First Female Finance Chief
description: Microsoft named Amy Hood, an executive at the company, as its chief financial officer, the first woman to hold the top finance job at Microsoft.

title: 2013 Tony Awards: I Told You So
description: The New York Times asked selected Tony Award nominees who they would like to tell, I told you Id get a nomination one day.

title: Shopping for Home Spa Accessories
description: Jamie Ahn, the owner of Acqua Beauty Bar and the Townhouse Spa, goes shopping for home spa accessories.

title: Home Spa Accessories
description: Living in a city like New York can be stressful, and retreating to a spa isnt always an option. Unless its a home spa.

title: Every Fixture Has a Story
description: Inside Gere Kavanaughs Los Angeles home.

title: If It Has a Shape ...
description: LOS ANGELES  Someone once asked Gere Kavanaugh what she liked to design best, and with a typical mix of humor and bluntness, she answered, Anything I can get my hands on.

title: The Legendary Gaetano Pesce on Work and Life
description: At the cavernous entrance to Pier 57 in Chelsea, an ancient loading dock has become a makeshift stage for the work of Gaetano Pesce, the 74-year-old Italian design legend who moved to New York 32 years ago because the city was the capital of the 20th century. He arrived with a splash, one of a whos who of modern Italian designers included in MoMAs groundbreaking 1972 show Italy: The New Domestic Landscape. But Pesce hasnt had a comprehensive solo show in his adopted hometown since a 1999 exhibit tucked away at Columbia Universitys School of Architecture. Hes a legend and a New Yorker, so that tragedy needed to be corrected, said Steven Learner, the creative director of the new Collective.1 Design Fair, where Pesces retrospective opened today.

title: On View | The Designs of Gaetano Pesce
description: The 74-year-old Italian design legend discusses his highly personal career retrospective at the inaugural Collective.1 Design Fair in New York.

title: Now Showing | Saturdays Surf NYC
description: Danny DiMauro and Colin Tunstall talk surf, New York and the release of issue two of their hit magazine.

title: A Defense Play by Jeremy Flint and Jonathan Cansino
description: Mondays column, in which Bjorn Fallenius discarded his high diamond queen to deprive declarer of an entry to his hand, reminded me of the diagramed deal. It was played in 1970 during a match between England and the Netherlands.

title: Raids Yield Stolen Gems and Arrests in Europe
description: PARIS  More than 200 Belgian police officers and authorities in two other countries on Wednesday swept up more than 30 people and recovered some of the $50 million in diamonds stolen in a carefully orchestrated robbery in Brussels in February, investigators said.

title: A Soaking to Talk About
description: Ladies, gentlemen and children, fold your umbrellas for a moment and take a bow. You have just lived through the fifth-rainiest May day in the modern history of New York and the rainiest day since Tropical Storm Irene battered the city two summers ago, according to the weather historian Steve Fybish.

title: Austria Is Pressured to Reveal More About Tax Evaders
description: BRUSSELS  Austria faced renewed pressure on Wednesday to reveal more about tax evaders after senior officials of the European Union called for automatic information sharing to apply more widely and rapidly within the bloc.

title: Europe Inches Closer to Establishing a Banking Union
description: BERLIN  Europe inched closer Wednesday to establishing a European banking union for the Continents largest lenders after the German cabinet approved legislation that would grant to the European Central Bank oversight of such institutions.

title: Turning a Smartphone Into a Workout Buddy
description: Summer is coming at last. Like me, you may be thinking that a few improvements to your fitness and physique might be in order before you hit the beach. Its also possible that, like me, you find it hard to motivate yourself to exercise or to head to the gym, and you dont like the idea of a personal trainer. Time for an app, in other words, and there are many out there to help us get in shape.

title: Versace x Haas
description: A look at the home collection by the Haas Brothers for Versace.

title: Faces in the Crowd, Printed in 3-D
description: Imagine someone collecting a strand of your hair from the subway floor. What would that person do with it? Frame you for a crime? Weave it into a wig?

title: Cable Channels Lift News Corp.s Profit
description: Fueled by the strength of its cable channels and retransmission fees at Fox Broadcasting, News Corporation reported a 4 percent increase in operating income, to $1.36 billion, in the three months that ended March 31.

title: Jabra Revo Lets You Shape Your Sound
description: Jabra, best known for its Bluetooth phone accessories, is making its first foray into Bluetooth premium headphones with the $250 Revo Wireless.

title: Vijay Singh v PGA Tour
description: Vijay Singh filed suit in New Yorks state supreme court, charging the PGA Tour with violating its duty of care and good faith in suspending the golfer for his use of deer antler spray.

title: Senate Panel Postpones Vote on Obamas Labor Nominee
description: Senate Republicans on Wednesday forced Democrats to postpone a committee vote on the nomination of Thomas E. Perez to lead the Labor Department after the chambers top Republican raised doubts about Mr. Perezs ethics.

title: Brad Drewett, President of Mens Tennis Tour, Dies at 54
description: Brad Drewett, a former professional tennis player who became president of the ATP last year and won a greater share of Grand Slam tournament revenue for players, died on Friday at his home in Sydney, Australia. He was 54.

title: Teslas Disappearing Data
description: Tesla Motors regularly gave out a crucial number that gave the public a good idea of how much demand existed for its electric cars.

title: Fergusons Tenure With Manchester United
description: Alex Ferguson, in his 26 years as manager, transformed United into one of the worlds most lucrative, and dominant, soccer clubs.

title: Jeanne Cooper, Young and the Restless Star, Dies at 84
description: Jeanne Cooper, the enduring actress on The Young and the Restless who had much in common with her character, the forthright Katherine Chancellor  apart from everyday occurrences in the soap opera universe like being stranded on a desert island with nothing but her jewelry, having a shopping center fall on her and inadvertently giving one of her grandchildren away  died on Wednesday in Los Angeles. She was 84 and continued to appear on the show until her death.

title: A Chance to Return
description: Senators have proposed an immigration bill that could give a legal second chance to tens of thousands of deportees.

title: State Department Official on Demotion
description: Gregory Hicks, a State Department veteran, explained how raising questions about the Benghazi attack negatively affected his career.

title: Court Upholds Berlusconi Tax Fraud Verdict
description: ROME  An appeals court in Milan upheld a conviction on Wednesday of former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi for tax fraud, sentencing him to four years in prison and imposing a five-year ban on holding public office.

title: Einhorn Is Beaten to the Punch
description: Just days before David Einhorn was to present his latest investment idea, another hedge fund manager stole his thunder.

title: Israel Moves to End Gender Segregation in Public Spaces
description: JERUSALEM  Israels attorney general on Wednesday advised ministers across the government to immediately end gender segregation in public spaces, issuing guidelines that would change many aspects of daily life here  from buses to burials, health care to radio airwaves.

title: Colorado Lawmakers Approve Drivers Licenses for Illegal Immigrants
description: DENVER  In one of their final acts before wrapping up the Colorado legislative session on Wednesday, lawmakers approved a bill allowing immigrants who are in the country illegally to obtain drivers licenses, making the state one of only a handful to have passed such a measure.

title: A Day Later, Everyone Still Talks About Harvey
description: Matt Harveys starts these days always seem to overshadow whatever the Mets do. After Tuesdays nine-inning, one-hit start, Harvey is now overshadowing the team on the days when he does not start. On Wednesday, Harvey was still the topic of conversation.

title: Recent Winners Meet at the Podium
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla.  Adam Scott exited the interview podium Wednesday morning to make way for Billy Horschel. As Scott stepped down and Horschel got ready to step up, they shook hands and exchanged congratulatory greetings. Each won his last start: Scott at the Masters, and Horschel at the Zurich Classic of New Orleans.

title: Paper on Immigrant I.Q. Dogs Critic of Overhaul
description: WASHINGTON  The revelation that a co-author of a Heritage Foundation study critical of the Senates bipartisan immigration proposal had recently argued that Hispanic immigrants are less intelligent than white Americans touched off a furor on Wednesday, undercutting the conservative foundations attempt to become a major force in the immigration debate.

title: Census Report on 2012 Voter Turnout
description: The Census Bureau released a report on voter demographics and turnout rates in the 2012 election.

title: Bryan Forbes, Stepford Wives Director, Is Dead at 86
description: Bryan Forbes, an English film director best known for The Stepford Wives, the 1975 Hollywood thriller about women transformed into docile electronic incarnations of themselves, has died at his home in Surrey, England. He was 86.

title: Hedge Fund Impresario Plays Host in Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS  Just outside the grand ballroom at the Bellagio hotel early Wednesday morning, Anthony Scaramucci, the backslapping host of the countrys largest hedge fund conference, spotted Gregory J. Fleming, president of Morgan Stanley Investment Management and one of Mr. Scaramuccis most important business relationships.

title: 60 Feet 6 Inches From Disaster
description: On Tuesday night, hours after a line drive in St. Petersburg, Fla., crashed off the head of Toronto Blue Jays pitcher J. A. Happ, Brandon McCarthy took the mound in Los Angeles and made his best start of the season for the Arizona Diamondbacks. McCarthy fractured his skull last September at Oakland, a victim of another line drive. He earned a two-year, $15 million contract before pitching his next game.

title: An Effort to Thwart Sale of Papers to the Kochs
description: LOS ANGELES  An effort by two conservative billionaires to take over The Los Angeles Times and seven other newspapers is setting off a firestorm of opposition here. Public employee unions, the leaders of the State Legislature and liberal advocacy groups are moving to block the sale, denouncing it as a threat to public workers and Democratic Party issues.

title: City Council Approves Bill Mandating Sick-Day Pay
description: The New York City Council, after years of impassioned debate, approved a bill on Wednesday that will require many businesses to offer paid time off to sick employees.

title: Former Detainees Appeal Cites Long Wait for a Trial
description: A lawyer for the only terrorist detainee to be held at the military prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, and then tried in the civilian court system asked a federal appeals court on Wednesday to overturn his conviction, on the grounds that his long detention violated his right to a speedy trial.

title: Preparing for Watershed Elections in Pakistan
description: In a country where politicians have competed with military generals for power, patronage is a prominent tool of civilian influence.

title: Predator and Prey, a Delicate Dance
description: IN Lake Superior lies a remote island, Isle Royale National Park, 134,000 acres of boreal and hardwood forests where a life-or-death struggle between wolves and moose has been the subject of the worlds longest study of predators and their prey, now in its 55th year.

title: Weekly Doses of Survival and Competition to Build Viewer Loyalty
description: THE National Geographic Channel will begin a branding campaign on Sunday to introduce its new programming strategy to viewers and advertisers.

title: The Jamie Dimon Witch Hunt
description: THE Jamie Dimon lynch mob is growing. It calls for the separation of the role of chairman and chief executive officer, attacking him for holding both at JPMorgan Chase.

title: Amid Navy Yards Ruins, Space for a Comeback in Manufacturing
description: Across the partition from the roboticist who was making coffee tables with magnetized cubes, an artist was boxing up woodcuts that, when held to the ear, sounded like a forest. Beyond him, just past the software designer on the treadmill, a muscular man in a T-shirt tinkered with his design for a motorcycle.

title: Guess Whos Back!
description: Right now you are undoubtedly asking yourself: What does the return to Congress of the disgraced ex-governor Mark Sanford mean to me?

title: Banks Still Behaving Badly
description: Attorney General Eric Schneiderman of New York announced this week that he plans to sue Bank of America and Wells Fargo for failure to adhere to the terms of a $26 billion settlement that was supposed to provide relief to homeowners and end foreclosure abuses.

title: In China, Power Is Arrogant
description: BEIJING

title: Against High-Scoring Penguins, Isles Defense Leads the Way
description: Stifling the offensive arsenal of the Pittsburgh Penguins is a challenge under optimal conditions. Losing a defenseman midway through a tight playoff game multiplies the stress exponentially.

title: Terms of Art
description: Many on the political right simply cant get this diversity thing right  and I deeply doubt that they want to. Theirs is a bone-deep contempt for otherness, a congenital belief in the superiority-inferiority binary, a circle-the-wagons, zero-sum view of progress, prosperity and power.

title: Mothers Convicted of Felonies May Get Chance to Stay Out of Prison
description: There are few experiences more unsettling for a child than watching a mother being taken away to prison for months or years. For years, womens advocates have worked to establish alternatives for mothers convicted of crimes, saying the lives of their children become so upended they often end up in jail themselves.

title: Allegations of Corruption Swirl Against Sarkozy Ally
description: PARIS  A small tempest of allegations has gathered in recent days over one of the closest allies of former President Nicolas Sarkozy, who is himself under investigation on charges he manipulated Frances richest woman for donations to his 2007 campaign, charges he denies.

title: Silicon Valley Groups Political Effort Causes Uproar
description: Move fast and break things has been the motto at Mark Zuckerbergs Facebook, embodying the Silicon Valley ethos of unapologetically finding new ways to solve old problems. His latest foray into politics in Washington, however, might be characterized as Move fast, play hardball and be prepared for blowback.

title: Diplomatic Stirrings on Syria
description: There are reasons to be skeptical about plans by Russia and the United States to hold an international conference on Syria  diplomats often propose meetings when they dont have solutions. But, at a time when the civil war is worsening in every way, this initiative counts as a hopeful sign.

title: An Industry Man for the F.C.C.
description: President Obama has picked a former telecommunications lobbyist and campaign fund-raiser to serve as chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, raising serious questions about his 2007 pledge that corporate lobbyists would not finance his campaign or run his administration.

title: Iran Hostages See Renewed Focus on Their 17-Year Bid for Compensation
description: WASHINGTON  When the hostages came home from Iran 32 years ago, after 444 days in captivity, they were heroes, and their release was unalloyed good news, a national triumph, observed with ticker-tape parades, speeches, awards and miles of yellow ribbons.

title: Daily News Lays Off 12 Opinion Writers and Reporters
description: The Daily News, which has lost circulation, is laying off roughly a dozen well-known columnists and editorial writers.

title: Boston Bomb Inquiry Looks Closely at Russia Trip
description: MAKHACHKALA, Russia  During a six-month visit to his Russian homeland last year, the parents of the Boston bombing suspect Tamerlan Tsarnaevsaid, he spent his time reading novels and reconnecting with family, not venturing into the shadowy world of the regions militants.

title: Teachers Facebook Post Didnt Warrant Firing, a Panel Upholds
description: The day after a sixth grader from Harlem drowned in the Atlantic Ocean on a class outing, a fifth-grade teacher in Brooklyn posted some rather impolitic comments about her own students on Facebook.

title: On Facebook, Cleveland Kidnapping Suspect Hid Secret Under LOL
description: Ariel Castro, the kidnapping suspect in Cleveland, opened a Facebook account in February, adding 41 friends in the ensuing months. He liked a handful of other Facebook pages, including a tourism page for Virginia Beach, another for the musician Rey Ruiz and a page devoted to Chinese Cresteds, described by the American Kennel Club as a fine-boned, elegant toy dog that craves human companionship.

title: Chelsea and Tottenham Leave Matters Unsettled
description: LONDON  On a day when from dawn until darkness everything in English soccer circled around a manager  Alex Ferguson  Wednesday night finally returned the ball to the players. Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur, each battling for vital points toward Champions League qualification, went at it, and neither could win.

title: Voices From Zaatari
description: Ruqaya Mohammad al-Ahmad, a refugee from Syria, brought her two children, Sindra, 7, and Tariq, 3, to the Zaatari refugee camp in Jordan.

title: In a Letter, State Lawmakers Demand Edits to a Sex-Scandal Report
description: ALBANY  Last August, the Assembly speaker, Sheldon Silver, said he welcomed an investigation into the Assemblys handling of sexual harassment allegations brought by four women against one of its most prominent members, Vito J. Lopez.

title: Senate Bill Would Halt Irans Access to an Estimated $100 Billion in Cash
description: Seeking to escalate pressure on Iran, a bipartisan group of senators introduced legislation on Wednesday that would deny the Iranian government access to its foreign exchange reserves parked in the banks of other countries, estimated to be worth as much as $100 billion, mostly in euros.

description: Ahmad Ojan, 14, sells cups of hot tea for 15 cents apiece to people waiting at the registration camp and in the open-air market.

description: Thierry Henry scored a stunning goal on a bicycle kick in the 88th minute Wednesday night, which proved to be the eventual game-winner.
