title: One Playwrights Ode to Another, His Muse
description: What writers influenced me as a young man? Tennessee Williams said in an interview in The Paris Review. Chekhov! As a dramatist? Chekhov! As a story writer? Chekhov!

title: End of a Count
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  The love fest continues today with a sweet and crunchy (who doesnt love that combination?) puzzle by Patrick Merrell. I loved the MOTHERS DAY wishes, but I loved the secret message even more.

title: Girardi Has Pitcher Batting Eighth
description: DENVER  Maybe it was because he was back in the same National League park he once played in. Maybe it was the circumstances of the game, or maybe it was the effect that Denvers high altitude had on him.

title: Mothers Letter to Sheriff
description: Earlier this month, Marco McMillians mother, Patricia Unger, wrote to the sheriff regarding questions in her sons case.

title: Autopsy Report
description: The report listed as the cause of death asphyxiation of undetermined etiology.

title: Family of Slain Candidate Seeks Federal Inquiry
description: Frustrated by the pace of the investigation into the killing of a Mississippi mayoral candidate  and by the findings in a recently released autopsy report  the family of the candidate, Marco W. McMillian, is demanding that federal authorities step in.

title: Fatal Fire at Bangladeshi Factory
description: NEW DELHI  Another deadly accident struck Bangladeshs export garment industry late on Wednesday night, when a fire swept through a factory, killing at least seven people, including top managers, according to news media reports.

title: James and Heat Get Back to Being Themselves
description: MIAMI  The game was 21 seconds old when Dwyane Wade got wrapped up in the open court by Marco Belinelli, a Chicago Bulls guard who was merely trying to prevent a layup. Wade revealed his irritation by firing the basketball at Belinellis ankles.

title: WTA Championships Find Home in Singapore
description: Once a Manhattan staple at Madison Square Garden, the WTA Championships have traveled the planet since then: from Munich to Los Angeles to Madrid to Doha, Qatar, to their current location in Istanbul.

title: Three Held in Theft of $75,000 Lottery Ticket
description: He was a Guatemalan immigrant who spoke little English and had a fondness for scratch-off lottery tickets; they were two clerks at a Long Island gas station who saw an opportunity.

title: In Switch, City Says It Can Speed Up Replacing School Lights Containing PCBs
description: On Sept. 6, drops of an oily substance leaked from a light fixture on Staten Island and landed on a fifth grader seated for her first day of school. Last Friday, a light in Public School 170 in Brooklyn oozed a similar liquid onto floor tiles, forcing kindergartners to leave the class.

title: Was Alex Ferguson a Better Coach Than the N.B.A.s Phil Jackson?
description: A graphic comparing Manchester Uniteds Alex Ferguson to American coaches and managers.

title: Reports of Cheating at Barnard College Cause a Stir
description: The Barnard College course called Major English Texts II was known by students as an easy A, a low-stress literature survey taught by a popular instructor.

title: Poll Shows Strong Lead for Democrat in Massachusetts Senate Race
description: In the special Senate election in Massachusetts, Representative Edward J. Markey, the Democratic nominee, is starting with a strong lead over Gabriel Gomez, the Republican, according to a new poll from Suffolk University.

title: The Teardrop Shot, Up Over the Giants
description: A sequence revisiting how Chicagos Nate Robinson, one of the best at teardrop shots, scored over the Nets Brook Lopez in a game at the end of the season.

title: Undercover Video Targets Abortion Doctor
description: An anti-abortion group released an undercover video on Wednesday showing what it says were offensive and inhumane remarks about abortions by one of the countrys most prominent abortion doctors.

title: Hefner Struggles in Harveys Shadow
description: Mets starter Jeremy Hefner has one of the most difficult tasks on his team: following Matt Harvey in the rotation. When Hefner takes the mound, often in front of much smaller crowds, the focus is still usually on the younger, more accomplished Harvey.

title: Serious Investigations, or Partisan Ploys?
In Data We Trust
description: The announcement on May 1 by the Republican National Committee that it had awarded a multimillion-dollar contract for data management and collection services to Liberty Works, a firm run by Richard Boyce, an associate of Karl Rove, has driven a new wedge between establishment and conservative forces battling for control of the party.

title: Officer Had Clean Record, Air Force Says
description: WASHINGTON  Air Force officials scouring the personnel records of the officer who ran its sexual assault prevention and response branch and was arrested last weekend on a sexual battery charge have found no sign of trouble, an official familiar with internal discussions said on Wednesday.

title: With Hop and Flick, Little Guys Get Upper Hand
description: MIAMI  The slam dunk has captivated the basketball world for a generation with its combination of raw ferocity and balletic grace, but this year a different shot is sweeping the N.B.A. playoffs.

title: Six Generations in the Lemon Business
description: A familys bid to keep its small business going mirrors Italys debate about the value of local traditions.

title: Her Personal Playwright
description: The first collaboration between Kristine Nielsen and Christopher Durang failed, dismally. In 1989 they appeared together in a famously reviled production of Alfred Jarrys Ubu Roi, which the critic Mel Gussow described as almost relentlessly unfunny in The New York Times. Ms. Nielsen played the queen. Mr. Durang, in a rare outing as an actor, played Ubus conscience.

title: Economists See Deficit Emphasis as Impeding Recovery
description: WASHINGTON  The nations unemployment rate would probably be nearly a point lower, roughly 6.5 percent, and economic growth almost two points higher this year if Washington had not cut spending and raised taxes as it has since 2011, according to private-sector and government economists.

title: Fiscal Policies Take a Toll
description: Recent fiscal tightening through budget cuts and tax increases will slow economic growth for 2013 and prevent the unemployment rate from falling.

title: 17 Officers Removed From Nuclear Watch
description: WASHINGTON  The Air Force removed 17 officers assigned to standing watch over nuclear-tipped Minuteman missiles after finding safety violations, potential violations in protecting codes and basic attitude problems.

title: Russian and Asian Bidders Buoy Christies Art Auction
description: In a season where top Impressionist and modern art has been scarce, Christies managed to cobble together a modest evening sale on Wednesday night, with respectable prices for Soutine and Chagall. It was the second consecutive night of Impressionist and modern art auctions, and while there were few fireworks, and thin bidding, the geography of buyers told an interesting story.

title: Okinawa Piques Chinese Papers
description: HONG KONG  Chinese state-run newspapers began carrying commentaries on Wednesday and Thursday questioning Japans sovereignty over the island of Okinawa, the latest sign of growing nationalism and territorial ambitions among a significant sector of Chinas elite.

title: Lottery Numbers
U.S. Fears Russia May Sell Air-Defense System to Syria
description: WASHINGTON  The United States, which is trying to bring Syrian rebels and the Syrian government to the negotiating table, is now increasingly worried that Russia plans to sell a sophisticated air defense system to Syria, American officials said Wednesday.

title: California: Oakland Police Chief Quits
description: Amid a surge in violent crime, the Oakland police chief, Howard A. Jordan, resigned Wednesday, citing unspecified medical reasons. For years, the citys beleaguered Police Department has suffered from low staffing and management problems. Last year the city narrowly avoided becoming the first in the country to cede control of its police force to federal authorities. Gov. Jerry Brown had to deploy California Highway Patrol officers to help patrol city streets. Chief Jordan, who was appointed in 2011, made his announcement a short time before a police consultant, William Bratton, a former police commissioner for New York City and a former Los Angeles police chief, was to announce his recommendations for fighting crime.

title: Syrian Refugees Cross Into Uncertainty
description: Refugees fleeing fighting in Syria in May 2013 relocated to the Zaatari refugee camp in northern Jordan, where they faced dusty days and cold nights in an uncertain existence with no end in sight.

title: Syrian Refugees Struggle at Zaatari Camp
description: About 120,000 Syrians are calling the tents and trailers of the Zaatari refugee camp in Jordan home, at least for the foreseeable future.

title: New Ranger Injects New Life Into Teams Power Play
description: When the Rangers explored trade possibilities with the Columbus Blue Jackets as the April 3 deadline approached, they insisted that Derick Brassard be included as part of what became a multiplayer deal. Now it is clear why.

title: A Lost Generation: Young Syrian Refugees Struggle to Survive
description: SABHA, Jordan  The parents were petrified the oldest of their seven children would be drafted into the Syrian Army. For their teenage girl, they feared rape and kidnapping. And the next oldest, verging on adolescence, had begun rabble-rousing at school and in the street against the government.

title: Lost in Time
description: Far from Moroccos well-trodden tourist route lies Taroudant, a remote market town where a colorful group of expats have create a most stylish haven.

description: Harnessing the dark side with black bikinis and a leather cover-up.

title: The Scientific 7-Minute Workout
description: Editors note: Heres one of our favorite stories from the archives with a helpful tip for Smarter Living.

title: The Problem With Corporate Governance at JPMorgan Chase
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Arizona: Conviction in Murder
description: Jodi Arias was found guilty of first-degree murder on Wednesday for the killing of her onetime boyfriend, Travis Alexander, in a trial marked by months of salacious evidence and testimony depicting the couples tumultuous relationship. Ms. Arias was accused of stabbing Mr. Alexander almost 30 times, shooting him in the head and slashing his throat from ear to ear during a fit of jealous rage in 2008. Her lawyers argued he had been abusive to her, and that she killed him in self-defense. Jurors, who reached their verdict after roughly three days of deliberations in Phoenix, will next decide whether Ms. Arias, 32, receives the death penalty. There are currently three other women on Arizonas death row.

title: Rangers Knock Down Shots and Push Past the Capitals
description: The Rangers hit every Capital in sight Wednesday night. They fearlessly blocked 33 shots. They won almost twice as many face-offs as Washington. They made Alex Ovechkin irrelevant. And with the outcome in doubt late, again, the defense and goaltending were stout.

title: House Democrats Finally Have Their Dinner
description: WASHINGTON  House Democratic leaders had been feeling left out of President Obamas second-term strategy of outreach to Congress, but on Wednesday night they got their turn, joining him for a longer-than-expected dinner at a hotel near the White House.

description: ruse \rs, rz\ noun

description: 1:37 p.m. | Updated with link to Valleywag, which first reported news of the suit.

title: Wells Has Big Night at Plate, and at Third
description: DENVER  Before Wednesdays game, Joe Girardi made history of sorts by becoming the first Yankee manager since Casey Stengel in 1957 to put a pitcher eighth in the batting order. At the time, it seemed like a radical move, but then during the game he did something even more odd.

title: Game 4: Rangers vs. Capitals
description: The Rangers clawed their way to a 4-3 victory over the Capitals to even the series at 2-2.

title: Whats On Thursday
description: 8:30 P.M. (CBS) TWO AND A HALF MEN The 10th season ends as Walden (Ashton Kutcher) dates a 22-year-old (Hilary Duff, above with Mr. Kutcher) but is more attracted to her sophisticated grandmother (Marilu Henner). Alan (Jon Cryer) and Jake (Angus T. Jones) take a father-and-son bonding trip.

title: In Malaysias Election, a Free Press Was Elusive
description: HONG KONG  American presidents have built-in advantages when running for re-election. Corporations and other interest groups tend to give financially to their cause to stay in the good graces of the leadership. The president enjoys the bully pulpit that comes with being in the White House. Throw a healthy economy into the mix, and its an almost unbeatable combination.

title: News Quiz | May 9, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Game 4: a Victory for the Less-Heralded Rangers
description: The Rangers 4-3 victory Wednesday was not a game dominated by big-scoring stars.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, May 9, 2013
description: When you talk to them about the future, they cant see beyond, frankly, the next day.

title: A Return by Racing Royalty
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Racing royalty visited the Churchill Downs paddock on May 2 as the Kentucky Derby champions Funny Cide (2003) and Mine That Bird (2009) returned for a visit. As they walked quietly across the plaza from the Kentucky Derby Museum, the crowd parted at the unusual sight of two thoroughbreds parading outside the customary tunnel entrance.

title: Sony Posts Annual Profit for First Time in 5 Years
description: TOKYO  Sony said on Thursday that it had eked out an annual profit for the first time in five years, thanks to belt-tightening and the weakening yen. But the companys future continued to hinge on turning around its unprofitable electronics business.

title: Hearst Hires Digital Chief to Oversee Web Brands
description: Hearst Magazines, the publisher of such venerable titles as Esquire and Cosmopolitan, said on Wednesday that it was creating a new position, president of digital media.

description: NEW DELHI  Another deadly incident struck Bangladeshs export garment industry late on Wednesday night, when a fire swept through a factory, killing at least eight people, including top managers, according to news media reports.

title: IHT Quick Read: May 9
description: NEWS China took a modest step into Middle East diplomacy this week, hosting back-to-back visits from Mahmoud Abbas, the leader of the Palestinian Authority, and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel. Edward Wong reports from Beijing, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong.

title: Party of One
description: Why suffer through grumbling vacations with others when its so much more blissful to go it alone?

description: NEW DELHI  A Pakistani prisoner who was attacked in an Indian jail a week ago died of multiple organ failure in a hospital in Chandigarh on Thursday.

description: The question was written by Katherine Schulten. It comes from the article In Pursuit of an Underwater Menagerie.

title: Rap Stars, Product Endorsements and Protests
description: In Rap, Both Good and Bad for Business,  the critic Jon Caramanica writes about problems with recent ad campaigns that featured the rappers Rick Ross, Lil Wayne and Tyler, the Creator.

title: In Color, the Waitresses in a Restaurant for Lonely Men
description: A mural outside a Mexican restaurant reminded Ruth Prieto Arenas of her homeland. The colorful landscape, in stark contrast to the strip of plain brick tenements in Manhattan, stopped her.

title: Tip of the Week: Getting Wireless Network Details
description: Want quick information about your computers wireless connection? Clicking the Wireless Network Connection icon in the Notification area of the Windows desktop taskbar opens a panel that shows the name of the current network. Passing the mouse cursor over the networks name displays a ScreenTip listing the signal strength, type of encryption security and other details. A link at the bottom of the panel opens the Network and Sharing control panel for wireless-network management and settings.

title: What Kind of Little Free Library Would You Create for Your Community?
description: Last weekend, 10 little free libraries popped up in and around Lower Manhattan. As you can see in the slide show above, they are installed in different places and take different forms, but each is a miniature lending library where anyone can take or leave a book under the honor system.

title: The Early Word: Credibility
description: In Todays Times:

title: A Student on the Wait List Asks to Be Removed
description: Some of you may recall that I was waitlisted at Brown and Stanford Universities, and that their final decisions about me have yet to arrive.

title: Soccer Coachs Departure Trumps British News
description: LONDON  In a week that saw the state opening of Parliament and an intensified debate over membership in the European Union, another news item dominated Thursdays headlines in Britain  the retirement of a veteran soccer coach.

title: A Conversation With: Mount Everest Guide Norbu Sherpa
description: NEW DELHI  Norbu Sherpa, 32, has been working as a climbing guide in the high mountains of Nepal, over 6,000 meters (19,685 feet) for more than a decade. He has been a member of seven expeditions to Everest, the highest peak in the world, at 8,848 meters (29,029 feet), and reached the summit five times. Norbu, who was educated in Darjeeling, is currently part of a National Cadet Corps Everest team from India.

title: AT&Ts Ads With Cute Kids Are a Neat Fit for Mothers Day
description: The popular campaign for AT&T featuring commercials with interviews of cute schoolchildren in the style of Kids Say the Darnedest Things is being expanded to help children, of whatever age, celebrate Mothers Day on Sunday.

title: Daily Report: Zuckerbergs Lobbying Group Is Criticized Over Tactics
description: The advocacy group Fwd.Us, created by Facebooks Mark Zuckerberg and others, has shocked some liberals with its tactics in a campaign to support immigration reform, Somini Sengupta and Eric Lipton report in The New York Times.

title: One Social Media Start-Up Rises From the Ashes of Another
description: One of the hardest things for an entrepreneur to do is to admit defeat. But in the case of Apu Gupta and Nick Shiftan, failure was likely the best thing that could have happened to them.

title: 17 Years to Hatch an Invasion
description: From North Carolina to Connecticut, billions of creatures with eyes the color of blood and bodies the color of coal are crawling out of the earth. Periodical cicadas are emerging en masse, clambering into trees and singing a shivering chorus that can be heard for miles.

title: One Scene, 42 Takes and 2 Hours in a Bathroom Stall
description: Scene 63. INT. BATHROOM. NIGHT.

title: Wheelies: The Fewer Ferraris Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Network TV Is Broken. So How Does Shonda Rhimes Keep Making Hits?
description: I love that the gay White House chief of staff is threatening to pretend the first lady is a closeted lesbian, Shonda Rhimes said to a roomful of writers. It is so wrong. In the best way. Ten of the writers  seven men, three women, five plaid button-down shirts and two pairs of outsize hipster glasses frames  were sitting in her bright Hollywood office, pens in hand, scripts in laps, going through notes for the 20th episode of Scandal, Rhimess gonzo political melodrama, which is about to finish its second season on ABC.

title: A Century of Cicadas
description: Periodical cicadas live underground for 17 or 13 years before emerging to sing, mate and die. This years cicadas are Brood II, one of 15 surviving regional broods.

title: Gunmen Abduct Pakistani Ex-Premiers Son as Campaign Nears End
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Unidentified gunmen kidnapped a son of former Prime Minister Yousaf Raza Gilani on Thursday, officials said, throwing an already violence-ridden election campaign into more tumult.

title: Bank of England Leaves Benchmark Interest Rate Unchanged
description: LONDON  With the British economy showing feeble signs of resilience and a new central bank governor waiting in the wings, the Bank of England decided on Thursday to keep its benchmark interest rate and its economic stimulus program unchanged.

title: Cancer Vaccines Get a Price Cut in Poor Nations
description: The two companies that make vaccines against cervical cancer announced Thursday that they would cut their prices to the worlds poorest countries below $5 per dose, eventually making it possible for millions of girls to be protected against a major deadly cancer.

title: Carlyles First-Quarter Profit Barely Budged
description: The private equity giant Carlyle Group reported on Thursday that earnings rose less than 1 percent the first quarter, a gain that came largely thanks to a rise in the value of its investments.

title: Hedge Funds Step Into the Limelight
description: In two separate events in Las Vegas and New York on Wednesday, the hedge fund faithful gathered to hear investment advice and rub elbows with some of the biggest names in the industry. The newer of the two events, the SkyBridge Alternatives Conference, or SALT, is a Wall Street schmooze-fest in Sin City that lets the worlds richest investors mingle with funds peddling their services, DealBooks Peter Lattman reports. Overseeing the star-studded event is Anthony Scaramucci, a hedge fund impresario, or, as Mr. Lattman puts it, a P.T. Barnum in a Ferragamo tie. In a gilded industry that has preferred to stay below the radar, Mr. Scaramucci embraces the white-hot center of it all.

title: Of Post Doctors and Glorious Geniuses
description: PHNOM PENH  Late last month, the prime minister of Cambodia awarded his long-serving finance minister the title Kitti Setah Banditt, which roughly translates to Glorious Economist of Genius and is the supposed equivalent of a doctoral degree. It was a variation on an obscure Glorious Genius honor that seemingly came out of nowhere in 2011, when it was given to two senior leaders of the governing Cambodian Peoples Party as well as the prime ministers wife.

title: Why Am I Dining Out So Often?
description: They were counting us out. They figured it was the millennials who were going to come in and save their bacon. But at the end of the day whos filling up the booths at T.G.I. Fridays? Whos getting the Lumberjack Slam breakfast at Dennys? Whos dialing up for pizza because, really, who feels like cooking tonight?

title: Shimmying Off the Literary Mantle
description: The best way to enjoy Baz Luhrmanns big and noisy new version of The Great Gatsby  and despite what you may have heard, it is an eminently enjoyable movie  is to put aside whatever literary agenda you are tempted to bring with you. I grant that this is not so easily done. F. Scott Fitzgeralds slender, charming third novel has accumulated a heavier burden of cultural significance than it can easily bear. Short and accessible enough to be consumed in a sitting (as in Gatz, Elevator Repair Services full-text staged reading), the book has become, in the 88 years since its publication, a schoolroom staple and a pop-cultural totem. It shapes our increasingly fuzzy image of the jazz age and fuels endless term papers on the American dream and related topics.

title: The Moral Equivalent of Space Aliens
description: To almost everyones surprise, Japan  Japan!  has emerged as the advanced country most willing to break with austerian orthodoxy and try a combination of aggressive monetary and fiscal stimulus. The verdict on Abenomics is, of course, still out, although early indications are good. But how did this happen?

title: Thursday Reading: What to Do With a 700-Doll Inheritance
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and on our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Fresh Analysis of the Pace of Warming and Sea-Level Rise
description: Here are two useful articles assessing the latest thinking on the pace at which Greenland ice loss could raise sea levels and the implications of the recent plateau in global temperatures (one acknowledged by climate scientists including Susan Solomon and James Hansen):

title: Suddenly, a Ring on Her Finger
description: Dear Diary:

title: Chinese Filmmaker Is Investigated by Family Planning Officials
description: BEIJING  Chinas most celebrated film director, Zhang Yimou, is being investigated for a potential violation of family planning laws, an official said Thursday, confirming reports in the state news media.

title: The National Design Award Winners Announced
description: Its no surprise that Paula Schers graphic design work since the 1970s, for cultural, corporate and educational institutions (like a Queens public high school, shown), has won her a 2013 National Design Award for communication design from the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum.

title: Italian Renaissance
description: With her impeccable eye and philanthropic largess, Carla Fendi is aiming to revive the faded glories of the once majestic Spoleto Festival.

title: Officials, Citing Miscarriages, Weigh Death Penalty in Ohio Case
description: CLEVELAND  As more grim details emerged Thursday about the long captivity of the three women rescued from imprisonment in a dilapidated home here, one official compared the victims to survivors of a P.O.W. camp, and prosecutors said they would seek murder charges against the man held in the abductions, accusing him of forcing at least one of the women to miscarry.

title: Barnes & Noble Shares Jump on Sign of Microsoft Interest in Nook
description: 5:29 p.m. | Updated Shares of Barnes & Noble skyrocketed in early trading on Thursday after a report said Microsoft was offering $1 billion for the digital assets of the booksellers e-reader business.

title: ... And a Child Should Lead Them
description: In a season when Broadway often seemed to be losing its mind and its mojo, the wisest advice came from a 5-year-old: If youre stuck in your story and want to get out/You dont have to cry and you dont have to shout!

title: At Brooklyn Librarys New Center, Books Are Secondary
description: The young couple burst through the great bronze doors of the main Brooklyn Public Library 15 minutes before closing time one recent Sunday with an unusual request: Was there somewhere they could recite their vows?

title: Delta Sees New Terminal as Symbol of an Air Travel Makeover
description: As Delta Air Lines executives tell it, the carriers bright and spacious new terminal at Kennedy Airport in New York reflects the industrys new priorities.

title: Hedge Fund Manager and S.E.C. Reach Deal
description: 12:24 a.m. | Updated

title: De Blasios Wife Gives Candid Interview
description: The New York City mayors race has failed to attract much attention in the glossy world of national magazines, save for a handful of soft-focus features about Christine C. Quinn, the City Council speaker, who would be the first woman and first openly gay person to run City Hall.

title: Books to Give Your Mother (and Yourself)
description: Memoirs. Cookbooks. Novels. Memoir-cookbook-novels. (O.K., I havent actually seen one of those. Yet.) Grabby nonfiction for those passionate about everything from eating to Jane Austen. Summer book season is nearly upon us, and that means if youre book-shopping for your mother, your partner or yourself, your problem wont be finding something good, but choosing among the options. Here are a few (a very few) of the books Im sharing with my mom and friends this year.

title: Ottavio Missoni, Who Made Zigzags a Symbol of High Fashion, Dies at 92
description: Ottavio Missoni, the patriarch of an esteemed Italian fashion house whose outr, multicolored knits and zigzag stitches became an insider status symbol for the ultra-wealthy, died on Thursday at the familys home in Sumirago, Italy. He was 92.

title: R.B.S. Names Chief of Citizens Financial
description: LONDON  Bruce Van Saun, Royal Bank of Scotlands finance director, has been appointed chief executive of the Citizens Financial Group, the companys United States unit, two years ahead of its planned initial public offering.

title: Syrian Refugee Crisis Growing
description: Having just returned from a visit to refugee camps in Iraq and Turkey, Marc Hanson, a senior advocate for Refugees International, talks to The Times about what he saw on the ground.

title: Proposals Seek to Curb Bias by Co-op Boards
description: Real estate agents in New York City have long complained that co-op boards mistreat potential buyers they do not like. The boards sit on applications and never make a decision. If they turn down an applicant, they never explain why. And sometimes, the agents suspect, rejections are based on an applicants race or national origin.

title: Neil Patrick Harris to Host Tony Awards for a Fourth Time
description: It doesnt actually say this in the official announcement that the organizers of the Tony Awards sent around on Thursday morning, but you can almost hear them telling it to their industry colleagues at the Oscars: find a host who works, and stick with him. While the choosing of an Academy Awards host is an annual cycle of wondering whos available to do it; wondering if the person or people chosen are up to the task; and then wondering what went wrong the morning after, the Tonys have dispensed with such uncertainty by naming Neil Patrick Harris to host the awards program for a fourth year.

title: No Right to Know Your Rights
description: Theres a big poster in the pantry on the floor where I work about federal laws in the workplace. Theres information on equal opportunity, health and safety, as well as a notice that my employer cant require me to take a lie-detector test. It would be disturbing if the powers that be at the Times wanted to hook me up to a polygraph, and its good to know they would be out of line if they tried.

title: This Year, Off Broadway Dug Deeper
description: The season just concluded was a terrific, even inspiring one for new American playwriting. But if you confined your theatergoing to Broadway, you really wouldnt know it. Actually if you only ventured north of 42nd Street come curtain time, you would be more likely to draw precisely the opposite conclusion: that American playwriting was moribund, consisting primarily of empty vessels that had somehow been floated onto the citys big stages by the presence of name-brand actors.

title: Why Im (Sort of) Ignoring Mothers Day
description: About this time, many spouses and children, including those who are grown, are hurrying to buy or create a gift for Mothers Day.

title: The Gun Report: May 9, 2013
description: Two of todays shootings involve men who allegedly gunned down their wives and other family members. In fact, many shootings covered in our daily report are domestic. This sad fact has apparently not gone unnoticed by Zombie Industries, an N.R.A. convention vendor famous for marketing a target that resembles President Obama. The company is under fire this week for marketing a mannequin shooting target in the likeness of a bleeding woman. Dubbed The Ex, the blond mannequin is clad in a tight white shirt and violet bra and actually bleeds fake blood when shot. After an outcry, Amazon just yesterday stopped selling it.

title: Remember the Vulture
description: Celebrating bad behavior, good pets (and pecs) and other fleeting pleasures of the Broadway season.

title: Pressing Patients to Change Their Minds
description: When my patient Suzy took herself off the active liver transplant list, she was too embarrassed to tell me. I found out from her liver doctors.

title: What Were Reading
description: Modern Farmer: Its Bee Week, folks, and heres a global guide to local honey, from Florida to Yemen, Slovenia and Ethiopia.  Glenn Collins

title: Bombing Suspects Body Interred in Undisclosed Location
description: BOSTON  The body of Tamerlan Tsarnaev, the suspect in the Boston Marathon bombing who died after a shootout with the police last month, has been interred in an undisclosed location, the Worcester Police Department said in a statement on Thursday morning.

title: A Treasure Trove of Documents, Courtesy of the City Council
description: Jessica Reinis of Boerum Hill was only in the fourth grade at the Brooklyn Friends school, but she had plenty of questions for Carol Bellamy, who, from 1977 to 1985, was the City Council president:

title: Celebrating a Wife Who Has Had to Spend Mothers Day Alone
description: Mothers Day has almost arrived, and as I struggle to come up with gift ideas, my thoughts turn toward the many holidays and family events I missed due to training, field operations and deployments. My four years in the Marines Corps included two combat tours in Afghanistan that included trials and tribulations that I will remember for the rest of my days. But I have come to realize that, compared to my wife, I had the easier job.

title: I Am Become Ben, Destroyer of Worlds
description: Joe Wiesenthal reports on Bernanke rage among hedge funders, and sure enough, heres Paul Singer declaring not just that he dislikes Bernankes policies but that BB is destroying the very fabric of society.

title: Poetry Pairing | To Any Reader
description: To honor Mothers Day, celebrated in the United States this Sunday, this weeks Poetry Pairing matches To Any Reader by Robert Louis Stevenson with the article On the Road, With Mothers by Joyce Wadler.

title: Fox Offers an Early Glimpse of Its New Season
description: The Fox network Wednesday night got a jump on next weeks announcements of new fall television shows by releasing the details of the four new dramas and five new comedies it has ordered for the next television season.

title: The Wrath of the Heat
description: Almost everybody got even.

title: Cool Tools: pdf2html
description: A PDF does one thing very well: it presents an accurate image that can be viewed on just about any device. Unfortunately, PDFs also cause grief for anyone who wants to use the data they contain. Governments, in particular, have a habit of releasing PDFs when the information would be more useful and accessible as a spreadsheet. The tools for extracting text from PDFs can be flaky, but Lu Wangs pdf2htmlEX project solves this problem. Pdf2htmlEX takes PDFs and converts them into HTML5 documents while preserving the layout and appearance of the original.

title: Pakistans Pivotal Elections
description: Declan Walsh, The Timess Islamabad bureau chief, previews the upcoming election on May 11, which promises the first democratic transfer of power from one civilian government to another.

title: Storm Leaves Residue of Questions
description: Last fall, after Hurricane Sandy sent water sloshing through her storage container in New Jersey, Ulla Pitha began to worry whether any of her 27 artworks had been damaged. But she worried in particular about one piece: a Mary Cassatt etching.

title: Living With Cancer: Good News Soup
description: People with incurable cancer do sometimes receive good news, as I have. Why is it harder for me to share good news than bad news? During treatment, good news produces elating highs, but also anxious lows.

title: British Tabloids Web Site Makes Foray Into America
description: In recent days, one of the most comprehensive destinations for gossip about the Cleveland kidnapping victims was not an American news outlet. It was Mail Online, the Web site of The Daily Mail, a British tabloid that has taken a distinctly gossipy approach to all news.

title: Senate Bipartisanship on Display, Briefly, as Committee Focuses on Border Security
description: WASHINGTON  As the Senate Judiciary Committee began plowing through more than 300 amendments intended to reshape  and, in some cases, derail  legislation to overhaul the nations immigration laws, signs of bipartisanship emerged Thursday, with the committee accepting at least eight Republican proposals to strengthen border security.

title: Spree of Carjackings Ends With an Arrest Hours Later
description: The mayhem began just after the morning rush on Thursday: carjackings, robberies and a single man with a black gun on the loose in Queens.

title: Transparency, Secrecy and Retaliation Emerge as Major Issues in Benghazi Coverage
description: When Col. Morris Davis, the former chief prosecutor at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, resigned from his post, protesting the torture of prisoners there and political interference that deterred his work, he says he was subjected to a gag order by the Bush administration.

title: Mark Sanfords God
description: Just to follow-up on my last post, I think this riff from Jonah Goldberg nicely distills the attitude a lot of conservatives took to Mark Sanfords campaign for the House of Representatives:

title: Senate Republicans Block Committee Vote on Obamas Nominee to Lead E.P.A.
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans continued a campaign to delay confirmation of President Obamas second-term cabinet nominees on Thursday, blocking a committee vote on Gina McCarthy, the presidents pick to lead the Environmental Protection Agency.

title: In Texas Visit, Obama Points Spotlight on Manufacturing
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  President Obama arrived here Thursday hoping to put a spotlight on this citys embrace of advanced manufacturing and on Republican efforts in Congress to block his economic agenda.

title: Top Editors Abruptly Leave Village Voice Over Staff Cuts
description: The tumult that has characterized The Village Voice in recent years resurfaced on Thursday when the top two editors said they were leaving the weekly newspaper.

title: Whats Michelle Obama Like in Person?
description: The Timess Jodi Kantor, who has covered the Obama family for over six years at the paper an in her recent book, has an essay on Quora about the first lady. Read more at Quora

title: House Vote on Debt Ceiling Gives Priority to Creditors
description: WASHINGTON  The House voted Thursday to allow the Treasury to continue to make payments to foreign and domestic federal creditors and Social Security recipients in the event of a stalemate over the governments statutory borrowing limit, digging in for another debt ceiling standoff, which is looming in the fall.

title: Karzai Says U.S. Bases Can Stay, Raising Some Eyebrows in West
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Afghanistan is ready to let the United States and its allies keep military bases here after the end of the NATO combat mission next year, President Hamid Karzai said on Thursday, offering a concrete public signal that foreign troops would remain welcome in the coming years.

title: House Republicans Call on White House to Release Benghazi E-Mails
description: House Republicans on Thursday called on the Obama administration to release a new batch of e-mails that they believe will shed more light on how the White House and the State Department responded in the days after the attacks on American facilities in Benghazi, Libya.

title: Rangers Remain Quiet on Staals Condition
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Defenseman Marc Staal was not at the Rangers optional practice Thursday after sitting out Wednesdays Game 4 unexpectedly and without explanation from the team. But it seems as if Staal pulled himself from the lineup out of concern that his damaged eyesight might cost the Rangers.

title: Farewell, Taylor Mead
description: Update, May 10 | Read Taylor Meads obituary.

title: Bottled Water? Its Not Free
description: For airline passengers who wonder what carriers will think to charge for next, Frontier Airlines has an answer that is threefold: nonalcoholic drinks, carry-ons and using Expedia. Soda, coffee, tea and juice will soon cost $1.99 for basic- and economy-fare ticket holders. Water in a glass will be free, but not bottled water. Some members of Frontiers frequent-flier program are exempt from the fee, which was announced in conjunction with a $25 to $100 fee to stow carry-ons for basic passengers who booked their ticket through a third-party site. The fees are expected to take effect this summer.

title: Everton Coach Is Selected as Fergusons Replacement
description: The breach left by Alex Fergusons retirement did not linger, as Manchester United announced Thursday that it had agreed to terms on a contract with Everton Manager David Moyes, who will take charge of one of the worlds most famous soccer clubs beginning July 1.

title: Hes No Longer the Loudest Guy in the Room
description: This interview with David Steinberg, chief executive of XL Marketing, a digital marketing company in New York, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: A Generation Far Removed Gets a Glimpse of the Holocaust
description: They came to see the tattoo on Pearl Browns left arm.

title: F.B.I. Did Not Tell Police in Boston of Russian Tip
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. did not tell the Boston police about the 2011 warning from Russia about Tamerlan Tsarnaev, one of the two brothers accused in the Boston Marathon bombings, the citys police chief said Thursday during the first public Congressional hearing on the terrorist attack.

title: For Islanders, a Long Island Presence Is Still a Possibility
description: The Islanders are heading to Brooklyn in two years, but they will keep one skate on Long Island if Bruce C. Ratner is chosen to redevelop Nassau Coliseum, the teams current and soon-to-be former home.

title: In Hours, Thieves Took $45 Million in A.T.M. Scheme
description: It was a brazen bank heist, but a 21st-century version in which the criminals never wore ski masks, threatened a teller or set foot in a vault.

title: Decoded: HLN's Strategic Salaciousness
description: HLN, the sister network of CNN, poured resources into the trial of Jodi Arias, hoping to recapture ratings it had in another case involving a young woman and an alleged homicide: Casey Anthony.

title: The Sleeve Settles In
description: Quirks of the Game is a regular feature on The Timess sports blogs.

title: Politico to Charge Some Readers for Access to Online Content
description: Politico, the news media organization that covers Washington in minute detail, said on Thursday that it would start experimenting with charging for access to its Web site.

title: Image of the Day: May 9
Lawmakers, at White House, Discuss Sex Abuse in Military
description: WASHINGTON  In a sign that the White House is increasing its focus on the problem of sexual assault in the military, one of President Obamas closest advisers met with a group of Congressional lawmakers on Thursday morning to discuss their legislative strategy for addressing the issue.

title: Accessories Market Is Expanding for Samsung Phones
description: Heres a sign that Samsung Electronics continues to rise as a challenger to Apple in the handset market: the proliferation of third-party accessories supporting its Galaxy phones.

title: Seeing the Light
description: For his fervent private collectors, James Turrells celestial skyspaces are an exercise in blind faith. The temperamental artist regards them as test runs for his lifes work in the Arizona desert. Somehow, everyones happy.

title: After Sandy, the Wine That Endured
description: If you told me six months ago that I could find 40 lunatics to buy that wine, I would have told you you were crazy, said St. John Frizell, owner of Fort Defiance, a restaurant-bar in Red Hook, Brooklyn.

title: With Wall Street Support, a Charity Grows Up
description: It was a real wake-up call, recalled the billionaire financier Leon D. Black, when his wife, Debra, received a diagnosis of melanoma in 2007.

title: Unsealed Indictment Regarding $45 Million Cybercrime Campaign
description: Read the full unsealed indictment regarding $45 million cybercrime campaign.

title: Audi, Architects and the New Museum Discuss Tomorrows Transportation
description: Gas-engined cars may be yesterdays technology, but some carmakers are thinking about the future, too. Last week, Audi held the latest meeting of its Audi Urban Future Initiative, a multiyear program bringing together architects and planners to survey future urban planning concepts.

title: A Call to Refinance Private Student Loans
description: The federal Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is urging the creation of a market for the refinancing of private student loans, though how that happens remains to be seen.

title: Challenge to Dogma on Owning a Home
description: Homeownership is a good thing, for the individual and for society. Or so American governments, whether Republican or Democrat, have long believed. The benefits have been cited repeatedly in justifying the existence and expansion of the tax breaks given to home buyers.

title: From the U.S. Attorneys Office: Putting a Face on $30,000 in A.T.M. Withdrawals in 6 Hours
description: A map and surveillance photos provided by federal prosecutors show one thief withdrawing some of the $2.4 million stolen from 2,904 automatic teller machines in New York City in about 10 hours starting on Feb. 19.

title: Reading Club | Digital Distraction
description: How many times will you check Facebook, Twitter, your e-mail, or another tab on your Internet browser as you read this post, and what does that do to your ability to absorb what you read?

title: The E-Book Piracy Debate, Revisited
description: The other day, I saw an interesting announcement from Tor Books UK, a publisher of science fiction and fantasy.

title: A Cheese Shop in a Slim Crown Heights Space
description: The new cheese shop in Crown Heights may be called Wedge, but Sliver would be more like it. The owners of the narrow but well-equipped storefront, Kate Blumm and Michael de Zayas, have done their homework. And with the expertise of Lilith Spencer, who had been at Bklyn Larder, the cheese and provisions shop, they are stocking their bright little place with some real finds. Among them are a goats milk ricotta from Edgwick Farm in Cornwall, N.Y.; a couple of tommes from the Kokoborrego Cheese Company in Mount Gilead, Ohio; and an organic Parmigiano-Reggiano from Italy. They also carry pistachios and almonds from Sicily, a mead vinegar from Italy, breads from Bien Cuit in Brooklyn, and a sweet white miso made in Conway, Mass. Charcuterie is sliced on what Ms. Spencer says is the Rolls-Royce of slicing machines; Wedge, 728 Franklin Avenue (Sterling Place), Crown Heights, Brooklyn, wedgeonfranklin@gmail.com, facebook.com/wedgeonfranklin.

title: Convulsions - First Aid
description: A slide show depicting the first aid procedure for convulsions.

title: Minor Burn - First Aid
description: A slide show explaining proper first aid to treat a minor burn.

title: Delayed Bike-Share Program Is to Start on Memorial Day
description: New York Citys bike-share program has a starting date: May 27.

title: Fall for Dance Festival Celebrates 10th Anniversary With Performances at the Delacorte Theater
description: New York City Centers Fall for Dance Festival will celebrate its 10th anniversary with performances by 24 companies at the center, as well two evenings of free performances, hosted for the first time in the festivals history by the Public Theater at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park.

title: Getty Museum Acquires Paintings by Rembrandt and Canaletto
description: Two paintings  a Rembrandt self-portrait that was rediscovered in 2007 and one of Canalettos dazzling views of Venice  are the latest acquisitions made by the J. Paul Getty Museum in Los Angeles, officials there announced on Thursday.

title: YouTube Offers Sesame Street and Martial Arts, for a Fee
description: YouTube on Thursday detailed its plan to let producers sell paid subscriptions to their videos, creating a prominent new marketplace for programming on the Internet.

title: U.S. Man Is Stabbed at Embassy in Cairo
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian man stabbed an American man outside the United States Embassy in Cairo on Thursday. It was not clear why.

title: To Raze or Not? MoMA Rethinks Plan
description: AFTER impassioned protests from prominent architects, preservationists and design critics, the Museum of Modern Art said on Thursday that it would reconsider its decision to demolish its next-door neighbor, the former home of the American Folk Art Museum, to make room for an expansion.

title: Young Girls, Real Fire
description: For Matthew Warchus, the director of the $16 million Matilda, the preview period was less about perfecting the script and choreography  that work was done last year in the London production  than honing the performances of the four girls rotating in the title role and the children playing Matildas classmates.

title: Overfed on a Mothers Affection
description: My mother held out a Tupperware container of chicken thighs and drumsticks, roasted with kimchi, bell peppers, onions and scallions. Its a great dish, one of my favorites.

title: Harvey Fierstein on 'Kinky Boots'
description: The Tony-nominated writer of Broadways Kinky Boots describes changes to a big argument between the shoe factory heir Charlie and his business partner, the drag queen Lola.

title: Douglas Carter Beane on 'Cinderella'
description: The Tony-nominated writer of Rodgers & Hammersteins Cinderella describes going undercover into the audience to gauge reactions to the show.

title: Pro-Inflation Policies Show Signs of Helping the Japanese Economy
description: TOKYO  For almost two decades Japans economic fortunes have deteriorated, and little seemed to be done about it.

title: Dishs Results Hint at Trouble for Sprint Bid
description: Dish Networks pay-TV pain signals trouble for its $25.5 billion bid for Sprint Nextel. Weak quarterly results announced on Thursday show why the company covets Sprint. But the poor earnings  net income dropped 40 percent  also show why Sprint shareholders should be skeptical of Dishs offer.

title: What Gives, Mom?
description: Six years ago, my mother-in-law gave me a large stainless steel roasting pan at my bridal shower. I thanked her in person and wrote her a note. I like having it. Its much nicer than my other kitchenware, but Ive hardly used it because I rarely cook for a crowd. Over the years, she has asked about it frequently: Am I using it? How often? Last year, she asked for it back. I told her she could borrow it. Now shes sent me a text message asking if she can buy it back. But it was a gift. What should I do? Should I stop accepting gifts from her?

title: Up Front
description: Sir Harold Evans (otherwise known as Harry) has spent his life around words  reporting, editing and writing books. Born in Manchester, England, in 1928, he began his career as a journalist when he was only 16, rising rapidly through the years and accumulating honors as he went. He was the editor of The Sunday Times of London from 1967 to 1981, moved to the United States in 1984 and became  to mention only a few of his positions  editorial director of U.S. News and World Report, president of Random House and founding editor of Cond Nast Traveler. In 2001, British journalists voted him the all-time greatest British newspaper editor. He was knighted in 2004.

title: Imran Khan Gives Speech From Hospital as Pakistan Vote Nears
description: Imran Khan, who was rushed to the hospital this week after falling from a forklift during an election event, addressed supporters of his party at a rally on Thursday via video link from his hospital bed, taking advantage of a final opportunity to campaign before Pakistans general elections on Saturday.

title: On the Brink
description: Nobody at the time called the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Sarajevo on June 28, 1914, a shot heard round the world. The phrase, filched from Ralph Waldo Emersons Concord Hymn, epitomizes a judgment that crystallized only as the horrendous sequels played out. Some parts of the international community werent listening at all. America was serene in its isolation and prosperity. To the world, or to a nation, The Grand Forks Herald in North Dakota declared, an archduke more or less makes little difference. President Wilson, pacing the lonely corridors of the White House, was distraught over the first ladys failing struggle for life. Paris was engrossed in a murder trial brimming with sex and political scandal. London was too obsessed with Irish home rule to sustain attention until closer to midnight.

title: Market Report | Things Mom Wants But Doesnt Know It Yet
description: Still in search of a memorable Mothers Day gift? Keep it personal with customized and indulgent presents that are just for her. From a bespoke jewelry box to monthly floral deliveries, these thoughtful treasures will have Mom patting herself on the back for raising you so well.

title: Ottavio Missonis Legacy
description: Ottavio Missoni, an Italian track star, and his young bride, Rosita, created the Missoni label in the 1950s. Here are some archival runway looks throughout the years.

title: Orb Stays Loose in Mud as Preakness Field Comes Together
description: The field for the 138th running of the Preakness Stakes is starting to take shape. Eight Kentucky Derby starters are being considered for the middle jewel of the Triple Crown, and they will be joined by three or four horses who did not race in the Derby. It remains possible one or two more horses may come under consideration.

title: Cakes for Celebrities, Coveted by Collectors
description: Baked goods do not hold up well in storage. Yet collectors still vie for slices of wedding and birthday cakes made for celebrities decades ago and packaged as party favors.

title: Focus Turns to 3 Suspects in Belgian Diamond Robbery

description: Horton Gallery

description: QCC Art Gallery

description: MADRID  A group of investors plans to file an unusual lawsuit against the Bank of Spain, accusing the central bank of failing to warn investors of the problems at Bankia, a giant mortgage lender whose downfall helped set off a banking crisis that obliged Spain to seek a bailout from Europe.

title: Pasta That Comes With a Back Story
description: The basket, made entirely of aged Parmigiano-Reggiano, was pocked and porous like a growth of coral, flaring outward at the rim. Heaped within were snips of asparagus and translucent asparagus-ricotta ravioli, their milky green interiors showing through.

title: The Obligations of Obamacare Opponents
description: While following the continuing debate over the Oregon Medicaid study, I was struck by this passage fromAaron Carroll and Austrin Frakts rejoinderto skeptics of Medicaid expansion:

title: Made for Ugh, Appropriated for Oooh
description: Punk didnt play nice. Whether in music or attire, it wanted to provoke and offend, disrupt and incite. Good manners, good taste and marketable skills were considered the kiss of death.

title: Punk Gone Couture at the Met
description: This show traces the evolution of punk from the streets of London to fashion runways.

title: As Latinos Make Gains in Education, Gaps Remain
description: After lagging behind other Americans in education for generations, Latinos have significantly narrowed the gap, and last year they passed a milestone, with new Hispanic high school graduates more likely than their white counterparts to go directly to college, according to a new study.

title: Conga Irreversible | Los Carpinteros
description: Scenes from the film originally produced for the 2012 Havana Biennial, by the Cuban-born, Madrid-based Los Carpinteros. Directed by Pavel Giroud.

title: AZ and Altidore Win Dutch Cup
description: Jozy Altidore may be mulling his next move and he may not be too happy about the possibility of not being able to join the United States national team as soon as he might like this month, but for one day at least Altidore and his AZ teammates are kings of the Netherlands. And thats not bad.

title: What Happens in Vegas for Hedge Funds
description: LAS VEGAS  The SALT hedge fund conference, held over four days at the Bellagio resort, is a lot of things  its an ideas conference, a Wall Street bacchanal, a power-networking event.

title: Triple Play: Make Your Picks for Week 7
description: The Bats blog again tests our readers predictive skills with three questions about the coming week. Feel free to lean on research, your gut instinct or maybe just dumb luck.

title: Comfortable Out of Their Own Skin
description: A man and woman, stripped of skin, are balanced in a balletic embrace, but their skulls and thoracic and abdominal cavities are open from behind and their spines are pulled backward, with organs and muscles attached.

title: Creations, Both Cutting-Edge and Double-Edged
description: Leave it to The New York Post to get to the heart of the matter. Print and Shoot blared Mondays front-page headline over the subheading, Gun from 3-D copier sparks terror fears.
