Some of this material can be seen and heard in Mr. Gaffigans Grammy-nominated, downloadable comedy special, Mr. Universe, and on his national tour. It also fills the pages of his new book, Dad Is Fat, which was released last week.

title: A Return Poses a Risk to the Knicks
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, May 11, 2o13
description: "We are with you. We will not move out from this place without rescuing you.

title: The Man at the Piano
description: This Monday evening, a small, vibrant arts organization, The New York Festival of Song, which Ive long treasured, will be celebrating its 25th anniversary with a gala concert.

title: After Malaysia Election, Political Attacks Continue as Opposition Calls for Protests
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  If there was a moment after the nail-biting national election on Sunday when Malaysians could envision a respite from five years of political turmoil, it did not last long.

title: Protecting Cinnabon and the Gap, and Still Getting No Respect
description: Earlier this year, somebody noticed a black suitcase on the ground floor of the Manhattan Mall in Herald Square. The response was immediate.

title: China Officials Seek Career Shortcut With Feng Shui
description: ZOUMAJIE, China  Outraged peasants protesting land grabs. Jilted mistresses plotting revenge. Provincial investigators seeking out graft.

title: In A.T.M. Robbery Case, a Splashy Trail of Big Spending
description: Three worked as bus drivers for special-needs children, two worked at Kmart and another delivered pizza for Dominos.

title: From the Archives: Letter From Malcolm Shabazz, 2003
description: An excerpt from a letter Malcolm Shabazz sent to Michael Wilson, a reporter for The New York Times, in 2003.

title: Giants Rookies Find Familiarity in Camp
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  It was a crowded Giants rookie minicamp Friday, with more than 60 players  most of them undrafted free agents  swarming multiple practice fields. There was a lot of young, energetic football muscle parading back and forth, a throng that often ran the wrong way or looked lost in the middle of an assignment.

title: Lottery Numbers
Corrections: May 11, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Taking Things Into Account
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  I know. It will be O.K., I promise. Here comes the explanation.

title: Music for Violin, With Faustian Strings Attached
description: Everyone knows that the Devil has the best tunes. And we also know what he plays them on: a fiddle. From Tartinis Devils Trill Violin Sonata of 1713 to the Charlie Daniels Bands 1979 country music ballad The Devil Went Down to Georgia, the instrument most readily associated with the Crafty One is a violin.

title: Before You Can Plant, Dance Through the End of the World
description: There is a vigorous dance component in Last Days/First Field, but its choreographer, Jill Sigman, has even bigger ambitions in mind. The two-hour work, as she explains in program notes, is a movement ritual for our time. In the first half, Last Days, the focus is on dancing: theres an apocalyptic feel as performers move frantically in packs or alone, gesticulating wildly as their feet slap soundly onto the floor. The ritual part comes to light in the second half, First Field. Ms. Sigman attempts to alter the landscape, both physically and spiritually, by bringing nature inside.

title: Expelled by Pakistan
description: Pakistan is facing daunting challenges, including a violent insurgency that threatens the state and a critically important general election on Saturday. Yet its Interior Ministry this week had nothing better to do than to expel Declan Walsh, The Timess bureau chief in Pakistan. The move was unjustified and should be reversed.

title: Racism in a Texas Death Case
description: In the annals of racism in the Texas criminal justice system, seven death penalty cases are in a class by themselves. In 2000, after the Supreme Court ordered a new sentencing hearing in one of them, Senator John Cornyn, who was then the state attorney general, called for new sentencing hearings in the other cases for the same reason: because race was improperly and explicitly considered as a factor in determining the sentence.

title: Beyond Basketball and Bigotry
description: The overwhelmingly supportive response to Jason Collins, who came out last week as the first openly gay male athlete playing in a major American team sport, is an encouraging measure of the nations civil rights progress. But his barrier-breaking announcement a dozen years into his N.B.A. career also carries a reminder of a reality millions of gay people live with every day: being open about their sexual orientation could put their job and career at risk.

title: Ceaseless Pressure on Whales
description: Since 1986, when the International Whaling Commission imposed a moratorium on whaling, there has been a steady resurgence in whale populations. The recovery of several species pushed to the brink of extinction by commercial whaling is a reminder of the resilience of nature. Even so, there is a nearly constant push to ease the restrictions that have protected the whales and, in some cases, to resume hunting. There are two cases in point: fin whales near Iceland, a nation that has never accepted the I.W.C. moratorium, and humpback whales near Hawaii.

title: France: Concern Over New Virus
description: French officials said Friday that they are examining three people who came into contact with a man hospitalized with a new respiratory coronavirus related to SARS, to see if they have also contracted the disease. The man, 65, hospitalized in late April, got the disease on a package tour to Dubai. Officials are now examining a nurse at the hospital, a doctor and a former roommate of the man, all of whom are being monitored by doctors. The concern is how easily the new virus might spread from one person to another. Since the virus emerged last year, 18 people have died worldwide, but the man is so far the only confirmed case in France. He is in serious but stable condition.

title: Rivera Is Able to Laugh It Off
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  About two hours before the first pitch of the Yankees game against the Kansas City Royals, and nearly 53 weeks after Mariano Rivera suffered the worst injury of his career, two men carried a 12-foot sign out to the spot where Rivera went down.

title: Europes Careless Dithering
description: EUROPES economic problems are growing steadily worse, with unemployment in parts of the Continent now above the level reached in the United States during the Great Depression.

title: Benghazi E-Mails Put White House on the Defensive
description: WASHINGTON  A long-simmering dispute over the White Houses account of the deadly assault on the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, flared up on Friday, with a disclosure of e-mails that show the White House was more deeply involved in revising talking points about the attack than officials have previously acknowledged.

title: Britain: Cleric May Head to Jordan
description: After years of battling in Britains courts to avoid deportation to Jordan and a retrial there on terrorist bombing charges, a militant Islamist preacher of Palestinian descent known as Abu Qatada told an immigration court through his lawyer on Friday that he will fly home voluntarily if Britain and Jordan ratify a treaty concluded last month that will ensure that no evidence obtained by torture will be used in the case. The two countries have said they expect the ratification process to be completed within months. The 52-year-old cleric, whose real name is Omar Mahmoud Mohammed Othman was sentenced in absentia to life imprisonment on the bombing charges by a Jordanian court in 1990. In Britain, where he sought refugee status, he has become a symbol for many in Britain of the exploitation of the countrys immigration, welfare and justice systems by migrants seeking to use Britain as a haven for terrorist activities. Mr. Othmans new pledge was met with widespread skepticism, with some legal experts saying he might be seeking to pre-empt a move favored by some in the government who have urged that Mr. Othman, currently held in prison for breaking bail conditions forbidding his use of cellphones and computers, be flown back to Jordan peremptorily, in defiance of British and European court rulings in his favor.

title: Baxters Attentiveness Helps in the Pinch
description: In trying to figure out why Mike Baxter has been such a good pinch-hitter for the Mets, Manager Terry Collins pointed to his attention to detail.

title: Year Later, Rivera Is Back on His Feet and Stingy as Ever on the Mound
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  About two hours before the first pitch of the Yankees game against the Kansas City Royals, and nearly 53 weeks after Mariano Rivera sustained the worst injury of his career, two men carried a 12-foot sign out to the spot where Rivera went down.

title: An Eyeglass Store Moves Across the Street
description: Moscot, which has been selling glasses at the corner of Delancey and Orchard Streets since 1936, will have a new, nearby, location.

title: Head of Teachers Union Tests Candidates Views
description: When Michael Mulgrew, the president of the citys teachers union, looks out on a ballroom at the New York Hilton Midtown on Saturday, he will deliver a stinging speech about mayoral dictatorship and call for an investigation into 11 years of Department of Education data.

title: Alan Abelson, Who at Barrons Was a Thorn in Wall Streets Side, Dies at 87
description: Alan Abelson, a former top editor of Barrons magazine who made waves  sometimes tsunamis  by writing a pugnacious, sagacious stock market column that denounced Wall Street hucksterism and routinely rocked share prices, died on Thursday in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: Trying to Be Hip and Edgy, Ads Become Offensive
description: Madison Avenue is learning a painful lesson: cutting edge advertising can slice both ways.

title: F.D.A. Rejects Request to Block Sales of Generic Painkiller
description: The Food and Drug Administration announced Friday that generic versions of the painkiller Opana ER can remain on the market, dealing a blow to the brand-name manufacturer, Endo Health Solutions, which had asked the agency to declare the generic versions unsafe.

title: Environmental Review to Delay Two Engineered Crops
description: Genetically engineered crops that could sharply increase the use of two powerful herbicides are now unlikely to reach the market until at least 2015 because the Department of Agriculture has decided to subject the crops to more stringent environmental reviews than it had originally intended.

title: Saying Zei Gezunt to an Eyeglass Store
description: Abe Schneider has been buying eyeglasses at the same store on the Lower East Side for more than 20 years, so when he needed new lenses, where did he go? Where else?

title: Fortuneteller Pleads Guilty to Grand Larceny Charge
description: It began with a simple offer from a stranger on a Manhattan sidewalk, a promise to introduce a woman who appeared to be carrying a heavy emotional load to someone with spiritual powers.

title: Dissatisfied Supporters of Manchester United Built Their Own U
description: MANCHESTER, England  The e-mails and phone calls flow in regularly from all over the world, as soccer players, parents and fans want to get in touch with the club here known as United. The clubs staff members understand the interest in the team that famously wears red and black, so they do their best to reply to each request, whether it comes from Africa or Asia or America.

title: Fourth No Confidence Vote for the President of N.Y.U.
description: Two recent overwhelming votes of no confidence against the president of New York University have brought to four the number of N.Y.U. schools or campuses whose faculties have rejected his leadership.

title: Father Held for Letting His Children Fire BB Guns
description: The park in Queens was filled with parents and small children enjoying the spring morning on Tuesday when Zbigniew Pawlowski, 54, arrived to join the crowd of families with two children of his own  and, according to prosecutors, two illegally owned BB guns.

title: Rutgers Coach Never Completed Degree
description: Eddie Jordan stepped into a mess when he took over as the Rutgers mens basketball coach last month. Now, within three weeks of arriving, he finds himself in an embarrassing situation of his own.

title: A Strip of Cloth That Makes Dry Cleaners Shudder
description: After Hurricane Sandy made Tanya Aeya evacuate her apartment in the West Village, she returned to discover that her clothes had been sitting in water for three weeks.

title: A Cleaning Conundrum
description: Fancy saris are covered with intricate embroidery and beading, which make them hard to dry clean.

title: Struggles Continue for Mets and Marcum
description: The final bit of intrigue on a dreadful night at Citi Field for the home team, which neither pitched nor hit well, came in the fifth inning, when the umpires gathered to make a decision.

title: A World of Sugar Frosting and Sculptured Roses
description: For generations, Valencia Bakery has produced cakes for Latinos in the Bronx to celebrate family milestones.

title: Sugary, but Real
description: If you give a photographer coffee, shes going to want cake. And if she wants cake, shes going to Valencia. And if she goes to Valencia, shes going to stay and shoot. A lot.

title: Panel Recommends Building New School at Site of Sandy Hook Elementary
description: NEWTOWN, Conn  Confronting imperfect options, but in a spirit more hopeful than resigned, a task force of local leaders on Friday unanimously recommended tearing down Sandy Hook Elementary School and building a new one on the site where a gunman massacred 26 children and educators on Dec. 14.

title: Al Fritz, Who Put Youngsters on Stylish, Colorful Bikes, Dies at 88
description: Al Fritz created stylish roadsters that were yearned for by young hot-rodders in the 1960s and 70s. But his rolled on two wheels, not four.

title: In Rout of Royals, Girardi Wins His 500th Game as Yankee Manager
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  During their recent three-game series in Colorado, Joe Girardi had a lot of managing to do. Without a designated hitter, with his bench shortened by injury, and without the usual heavy hitters in his lineup, he had to improvise. A lot.

title: Mean to Bees
description: The pink ladys slipper orchid, or moccasin flower (Cypripedium acaule), is the queen of springtime wildflowers. It is also one of natures most beautiful liars.

title: James Rises From Floor to Power the Heat to Victory
description: CHICAGO  The best player in the N.B.A. brought the ball across halfcourt. He was fouled. And then he was shoved  not lightly, but with two-handed force from a 6-foot-10-inch, 275-pound opponent.

title: Days of Despair in Bangladesh, and Then a Rescue Miracle
description: Photographs since the collapse of the Rana Plaza building in Bangladesh illustrate the grief of the last 17 days, and then a rescue on Friday.

title: An Open Letter to The Elders
description: Excellencies,

title: Study Finds an Increase in Arsenic Levels in Chicken
description: Researchers at Johns Hopkins University said they found levels of arsenic in chicken that exceeded amounts that occur naturally, and warned that they could lead to a small increase in the risk of cancer for consumers over a lifetime.

title: Twice-Deflected Overtime Shot Puts Rangers on Brink of Elimination
description: WASHINGTON  One goal, scored 53 seconds into the game, was hardly enough for the Rangers on Friday night. They lost control of another close playoff game against the Washington Capitals at Verizon Center and fell in overtime, again. Now they face elimination Sunday at Madison Square Garden.

title: 'If These Knishes Could Talk'
description: Clips from a documentary about the history of the New York accent, by Heather Quinlan.

title: Scoreless Again, Nash Admits Frustration
description: WASHINGTON  Rick Nash was the leading goal scorer for the Rangers in the regular season, with 21 in 44 games.

title: Do They Really Tawk Like That? Not Now
description: Years ago, a friend who had moved to New York from Minneapolis to go to college marveled that the people she met who had been raised on the Upper East Side spoke with no accent. Although she hadnt expected them to sound like Buddy Hackett, she was intrigued by the notion that members of the citys upper classes didnt particularly sound as if they were from anywhere. As someone who had grown up in a well-to-do Midwestern family, she hardly sounded like Marge Gunderson in Fargo, but there were certain subtle pronunciations and inflections, she argued, that still marked a wealthy Midwesterner as a Midwesterner, signifiers absent in an analogous population here.

title: ABC Introduces 12 New Series for Next Season
description: The broadcast networks have ordered what is surely a record number of new series for the next television season, including ABCs announcement on Friday of a long list of programs.

title: Game 5: Rangers vs. Capitals
description: Mike Ribeiro scored off a carom 9 minutes 24 seconds into overtime, giving Washington a 2-1 win and putting the Rangers on the brink of elimination.

title: NBC Saves Community, but Drops Two Other Series
description: Against all expectations, NBC renewed its quirky comedy Community on Friday night, at the same time that it quietly pulled the plug on the eventually ill-named Smash.

title: Whats on Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) MADAGASCAR 3: EUROPES MOST WANTED (2012) Those escapees from the Central Park Zoo  Alex the lion (Ben Stiller), Marty the zebra (Chris Rock), Gloria the gorilla (Jada Pinkett Smith) and Melman the giraffe (David Schwimmer)  depart Africa to join a European circus, the better to evade a French animal-control officer (Frances McDormand) literally after Alexs head, in this franchises latest installment. They also try to play nice with their new friends Vitaly (Bryan Cranston), a tiger; Gia (Jessica Chastain), a jaguar; and Stefano (Martin Short), a sea lion. Life lessons in the script (partly by Noah Baumbach, Mr. Stillers Greenberg director) are desultory, but a late twist is surprising, Andy Webster wrote in The New York Times about this film directed by Eric Darnell, Tom McGrath and Conrad Vernon, and styled after Miroslav Saseks illustrations. Where Madagascar 3 soars is in its visuals: A Monte Carlo chase is vertiginously madcap; a Cirque du Soleil-style spectacle dazzles with rich pastels; the 3-D effects have wit and invention, Mr. Webster added. Kids will be stimulated. And, parents, youll enjoy the sights.

title: IHT Quick Read: May 11
description: NEWS Day after day, the grim drudgery of digging for bodies had progressed at Rana Plaza. Talk of rescuing survivors had faded. This was the recovery phase, and what was being recovered were corpses, the numbers spinning remorselessly forward: 700 dead became 800, then 900, with no end in sight. By Friday morning, the number had pushed above 1,000. And then, late in the afternoon, a soldier from the Bangladeshi Army, standing atop the rubble of the wrecked building, noticed an iron rod that seemed to be moving. There was a noise, a voice. Rescuers hurriedly carved a hole through a concrete pillar. Television stations in Bangladesh cut to the scene: a woman, gasping, was alive in the wreckage, nearly 17 full days after Rana Plaza had collapsed. A new number was announced: One. A female garment worker named Reshma. A survivor. A miracle. Save me! rescuers heard her shout, before they pulled her into the afternoon light, her face powdered in dust as she was placed on a stretcher. Julfikar Ali Manik reports from Dhaka, Bangladesh and Jim Yardley reports from New Delhi.

title: Why Putin Cant Solve Syria
description: MOSCOW  After marathon meetings with Secretary of State John Kerry here this week, the Russian foreign minister, Sergey Lavrov, hinted that Moscow might finally pressure President Bashir al-Assad of Syria to leave office.

title: South Korean Ex-Aide Denies Improper Conduct on Trip
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A spokesman for President Park Geun-hye who was fired while on a recent state visit to the United States denied Saturday that he had groped a young woman in a Washington hotel.

title: Ex-Premier Is Set to Regain Power in Pakistan Vote
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  Former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, once a political exile deposed by the military, returned to the cusp of power on Saturday, taking a commanding lead in a parliamentary election in which Pakistanis braved Taliban intimidation to cast ballots with historic prospects for the countrys democracy.

title: Tropical Cyclone Could Threaten Refugees in Myanmar
description: BANGKOK  A tropical cyclone in the Andaman Sea is headed close to an area in Myanmar where tens of thousands of victims of ethnic and religious violence are living in makeshift camps, adding urgency to fears of what the United Nations has termed a looming humanitarian catastrophe.

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Himachal Pradesh: At least 38 people died and 23 others were injured after a crowded bus fell into the Beas River near Kullu, a hill resort in Himachal Pradesh, on Wednesday, according to an Associated Press report in Live Mint.

title: The Weekend Word: Revelations
description: Todays Times

title: Canada Exports Mafia War to Sicily
description: LONDON  When Americans hear there is trouble across the border, they do not immediately think of Canada.

title: This Week in the Global Arts Guide
description: The notoriety of the French-American artist Niki de Saint Phalle (1930-2002) came when she left her family to devote herself to art, starting with her shooting paintings for which she fired at pockets of paint affixed to canvases. They earned her a place in the New Realism movement with Arman, Klein, Christo and others. The Girl, the Monster and the Goddess at the Moderna Museet in Stockholm assembles works that evoke her traumas and reflect the creative way she coped with them. Her Freudian film Daddy, 1973 about her relationship with her father in a mlange of autobiography and fantasy, is also in the show.

title: Mille Miglia Reignites Italys Racing Passions
description: BRESCIA, Italy  It is very certain the accomplishment of Stirling Moss with the new Mercedes 300 SLR sports car in the 22nd Mille Miglia will stand as one of the finest of this or any racing season, wrote the noted motoring journalist Bernard Cahier in the immediate aftermath of the 1955 race.

title: Pakistanis Explain What the Election Means to Them
description: Pakistanis go to the polls on Saturday in a general election, marking the first time in the countrys history that one elected civilian government will complete its term and hand over power to another elected government.

title: Whos Afraid of Gin?
description: If I had a dollar for every time someone told me Tequila makes me crazy, I would have a pretty hefty wad of cash. And just yesterday a man told me he doesnt drink whiskey because it makes him angry. (Ive heard that one before, too. Plenty.) Still, I believe gin has the most fearsome reputation of all liquors, and it just doesnt seem deserved. In my Drink column this week, I admit that for many years I forswore gin because I thought it made me sad. But the gin was not to blame; normal life circumstances were  and so were the lingering effects of having seen William Hogarths Gin Lane.

title: In Praise of Econowonkery
description: Mike Konczal has an interesting piece on the general question of whether wonk-blogging  the practice of putting up fairly analytical data-heavy posts bearing on policy issues directly on the web, rather than going through more traditional publication channels  is a good thing. He puts it in the context of liberal politics, which it mostly (though not entirely) is; but Id like to think about it more generally as a way in which data and analysis can be brought quickly to bear on policy discussion.

title: Pakistanis Vote as Violence Breaks Out
description: Voters turned out for a historic election as threats of attacks were borne out, with violence across the country leaving at least 21 people dead.

title: Harpooning Ben Bernanke
description: Brad DeLong has the best piece Ive seen on Bernanke rage among the hedge funders. His point is that the hedgies keep thinking of the Fed as if it were a rogue trader driving prices away from their natural value, like JP Morgans London Whale, rather than as a central bank trying to achieve full employment and target inflation. Hence their rage at the failure of bond prices to collapse the way they should.

title: Red Bulls Drive for Five
description: The Red Bulls on Saturday will try to win their fifth straight game in a building  Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Mass.  where they have not won in more than a decade.

title: This Weeks Business News in Pictures
description: Cuba challenges Australias tobacco rules, American apparel retailers apply some fair trade practices and China shows more signs of a slowdown.

title: A Year Later, Remembering a Champion
description: NASHVILLE  The last time I was here, I watched a horse die.

title: In the Name of a Legacy
description: NASHVILLE  The left-field wall at Vanderbilts redbrick ballpark is 310 feet from home plate, just as it is at Fenway Park in Boston. It is 35 feet high and green, and if you stand beside it you can see the dents of a thousand doubles.

title: Ejection Shows Bulls Have Fight and Spirit, but Little Margin for Error
description: CHICAGO  Nazr Mohammed said he reacted instinctively.

title: Variety: Puns & Anagrams
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Remember stereograms?

title: The Hidden World Under Our Feet
description: HELENA, Mont.

title: Astronauts Take Unplanned Spacewalk to Repair Leak
description: Two astronauts aboard the International Space Station conducted a hastily arranged spacewalk on Saturday to look for the source of a worrisome leak that had forced the shutdown of one of the eight power systems that provide electricity to the orbiting laboratory.

title: The Commencement Controversy
description: THE actor James Franco at U.C.L.A. John M. McHugh, the former Army secretary, at the State University of New York at Oswego. The commentator Ben Stein at the University of Vermont. All are notable figures who were invited to participate in college graduations in recent years, only to withdraw or be disinvited in the face of campus protests.

title: Car Bombings Kill Dozens in Center of Turkish Town Near the Syrian Border
description: REYHANLI, Turkey  Two powerful car bombs killed at least 43 people in this town near Turkeys border with Syria on Saturday, transforming downtown office blocks into smoldering husks in one of the deadliest attacks on Turkish soil in at least a decade.

title: This Opening Round Isnt for the Squeamish
description: To be a fan of a major contact sport is to be implicated when the violence becomes too real. So I felt hypocritical about looking away from the television when Ottawas Eric Gryba slammed into Montreals Lars Eller in Game 1 of their first-round N.H.L. playoff series.

title: Two Candidates Shake Up Irans Presidential Race as Last-Minute Entries
description: TEHRAN  Irans presidential race entered a new, unpredictable phase on Saturday when two game-changing politicians, both out of favor with the countrys leaders, signed up as candidates in the final minutes of a five-day registration period.

title: A People Without a Story
description: FOUR years ago this week, the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam announced that their struggle for an independent homeland in northern Sri Lanka had reached its bitter end. The group had been fighting on behalf of the Tamil people for more than a quarter-century, and its defeat was absolute.

title: Inflation Madness
description: One thing I gather from various economic discussions as well as some of the trolls on this blog is that theres a widespread view that the kind of monetary policy I advocate  which includes a higher inflation target  isnt just wrong; its madness. It is, I am told in no uncertain terms, proof that I am no longer a real economist, if I ever was.

title: Why the Fuss Over the D.S.M.-5?
description: LATER this month, the American Psychiatric Association will unveil the fifth edition of its handbook of diagnoses, the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders. Fourteen years in the making, the D.S.M.-5 has been the subject of seemingly endless discussion.

title: Global Financial Leaders Avoid Public Rift With Japan
description: Finance ministers from leading global economies on Saturday avoided a public rift with Japan over policies driving down the value of its currency, while keeping up pressure on Germany to help lift growth in Europe.

title: Sri Lanka Ends 26 Years of Civil War
description: Major events in Sri Lankas quarter-century-long conflict with Tamil separatists.

title: Barbara Natterson-Horowitz
description: Barbara Natterson-Horowitz is a cardiologist and professor at U.C.L.A.s David Geffen School of Medicine. Her best-selling book, Zoobiquity, co-written with Kathryn Bowers, explores the physiological and psychological similarities between humans and animals and the implications for the diagnosis and treatment of disease.

title: Real Moms Dont Cook
description: MY mother is a great believer in takeout. She has her reasons.

title: Anglers Follow the Bugs to the Trout
description: WARM SPRINGS, Ore.  The sky was not exactly dark in a blotting-out-the-sun sense, but the salmon flies were certainly thick above central Oregons Lower Deschutes River. Thousands of female specimens circled 30 feet above the waters surface, preparing to descend and drop their eggs. Occasionally, a bug would spiral slowly down to the river, flutter awkwardly on the surface, then disappear in a sudden splash.

title: After the Children Have Grown
description: LATELY, Ive been having some trouble figuring out exactly who I am. Or, more precisely, who I will be going forward. Parts of me have changed over the years. But my core identity has not budged in three decades. Im a mother.

title: P.S. 244: The Zagat Review
Overcoming Addiction, Professor Tackles Perils American Indians Face
description: LAWRENCE, Kan.  The visitor to Haskell Indian Nations University detailed his roaring 20s: drug addict, garbage collector, suicidal burnout once told by a doctor that he was mentally retarded. It was a curious way to inspire a group of young American Indian students long surrounded by these types of problems. Until he got to the good part.

title: What Makes a Mother? Suffering
description: BELGRADE LAKES, Me.

title: Baby Face
description: Eight mothers who are artists drew their babies, and shared a little bit about the joy and fear of parenting.

title: Sunday Dialogue: How Goods Are Produced
description: Unsafe factory conditions overseas: who is culpable?

title: Filling Void After a Cy Young Winner Leaves
description: R. A. Dickey is the seventh reigning Cy Young Award winner who changed teams through a trade or free agency before the next season, and doom and gloom was predicted for the Mets after they sent him to the Toronto Blue Jays.

title: America the Clueless
description: THE problems with our countrys political discourse are many and grave, but an insufficient attention to Obamacare isnt among them. We have talked Obamacare to death, or at least into home hospice care. The Obamacare shorthand itself reflects our need to come up with less of a mouthful than Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, given how regularly the topic recurs. Obamacare is like J. Lo or KFC. It saves syllables and speeds things along.

title: Were Family, Yes, but Were Still Accountable
description: This interview with  Brooke Denihan Barrett, co-chief executive of Denihan Hospitality Group, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Amending the Immigration Bill
description: Highlighting some of the amendments the Senate Judiciary Committee is considering.

title: First Steps to a Better Immigration Bill
description: After the Senate Judiciary Committee ended its first day of marking up an867-page immigration bill on Thursday, plunging into the details of what could be the most ambitious overhaul of the system in a quarter-century, one thing was clear: it is a lot better to be deep in the weeds of a complicated bill than trapped in the desert of a stalemate, which is where immigration reform has been since the last big bipartisan bill collapsed in 2007.

title: Is Yours More Corrupt Than Mine?
description: LETS talk about what makes a delinquent state legislature. I know its been on your mind.

title: Movie Review: Venus and Serena
description: The Times critic A. O. Scott reviews "Venus and Serena."

title: Movie Review: Stories We Tell
description: The Times critic Manohla Dargis reviews "Stories We Tell."

title: Chinas Evolving Core Interests
description: Whenever China wants to identify the issues considered important enough to go to war over, it uses the term core interests. The phrase was once restricted to Taiwan, the island nation that China has threatened to forcibly unify with the mainland. About five years ago, Chinese leaders expanded the term to include Tibet and Xinjiang, two provinces with indigenous autonomy movements that Beijing has worked feverishly to control.

title: Shortcomings of a Psychiatric Bible
description: Patients and parents concerned about mental illness have every right to be confused. The head of the federal agency that finances mental health research has just declared that the most important diagnostic manual for psychiatric diseases lacks scientific validity and needs to be bolstered by a new classification system based on biology, not just psychiatric opinion. The hitch is that such a biology-based system will not be available for a decade or more.

title: The Zombie Next Door May Be the Scariest of All
description: The term zombie has traditionally referred to a corpse that has been reanimated through supernatural means and rendered into an automaton that does its masters will. Look it up in a dictionary and you will find the traditional definition firmly in place. But pop culture, of course, has its own definition.

title: Tasty, and Subversive, Too
description: DEL AIRE, Calif.  Fruit looms large in the California psyche. Since the 1800s, dewy images of oranges, lemons and other fruits have been a lure for seekers of the states postcard essence, symbols of fertile land, felicitous climate and the possibilities of pleasure.

title: Updates on Pakistans Election
description: The Lede followed developments in Pakistan on Saturday, where voters cast ballots in a parliamentary election marred by deadly violence. Former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, once a political exile, had a commanding lead.

title: Obama Honors Top Cops in White House Ceremony
description: Three weeks after praising Massachusetts law enforcement officials for their handling of the manhunt tied to the Boston Marathon bombings, President Obama honored 43 officers from across the country named by their peers as this years Top Cops.

title: Directors Disappoint by What They Dont Do
description: DIRECTORS of some high-profile public companies are coming under scrutiny this proxy season. Shareholder advocates say its about time.

title: Movie Review: The Great Gatsby
description: The Times critic A. O. Scott reviews "The Great Gatsby."

title: Brothers, Stars, Rivals
description: When Joe DiMaggio announced his retirement in December 1951, a standing-room-only news conference featured the Yankees co-owner Dan Topping, who wept and tried to persuade him to continue playing. When DiMaggios youngest brother, Dom, retired from the Boston Red Sox on May 12, 1953, he told a handful of reporters , I believe I could have played one more year of good baseball.

title: The Cardinals Spend Wisely and Keep On Winning
description: The St. Louis Cardinals played 13 postseason games last October, falling one win short of returning to the World Series. Seven of those games were started by Kyle Lohse or Chris Carpenter, and another by Jaime Garcia, who hurt his shoulder in the third inning.

title: Social Media in China Fuel Citizen Response to Quake
description: LUSHAN, China  Wang Xiaochang sprang into action minutes after a deadly earthquake jolted this lush region of Sichuan Province last month. Logging on to Chinas most popular social media sites, he posted requests for people to join him in aiding the survivors. By that evening, he had fielded 480 calls.

title: Spinning the Ball, Then Living the Game
description: INDIANAPOLIS  On Friday afternoon, Indiana Pacers Coach Frank Vogel stood alongside the court at Bankers Life Fieldhouse with a group of reporters who playfully tried baiting him into giving an impromptu performance of the basketball trick he invented more than 25 years ago, the one he had once performed on Late Night With David Letterman.

title: Alice E. Kober, 43; Lost to History No More
description: I RESCUE lost souls.

title: Love Thy Stranger as Thyself
description: IMMIGRATION reform is not a liberal idea. It is good, old-fashioned conservative policy  at least thats what its supporters want the Republican faithful to believe.

title: Marc Gasol Left Memphis as Enigma and Returned as Star
description: MEMPHIS  Jason Peters was the boys basketball coach at Lausanne Collegiate School in August 2001 when he received some important news. A new student was enrolling at Lausanne, a private school here on the citys east side. And that new student happened to be Pau Gasols younger brother.

title: Big Recall for Jeeps Announced by Chrysler
description: Chrysler is recalling about 469,000 Jeeps worldwide, including about 295,000 in the United States, because the transmission could shift by itself from park into neutral, according to a report posted on the Web site of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration.

title: When Myths Collide in the Capital
description: WASHINGTON

title: Egyptian Activist Is Released After Questioning
description: CAIRO  The Egyptian authorities on Saturday released a prominent activist who had been critical of the countrys Islamist president.

title: The Yemeni Way
description: SANA, Yemen

title: An Old-School Touch and a Dash of Superstition
description: I joined my father, Claude McGaughey; my brother, Reeve; my stepmother, Alison; and a few family friends in watching the 139th Kentucky Derby on a small television in an office at Churchill Downs in Louisville, Ky.

title: The Taxman vs. the Tea Party
description: AS a taxpayer and a conservative who hopes to remain on good terms with the Internal Revenue Service for many April 15ths to come, I dont want to speculate too freely about the motives of the low level I.R.S. employees who decided to single out Tea Party groups for an inappropriate level of attention during the heat of the 2012 campaign.

title: The Long Shadow of Bad Credit in a Job Search
description: THE first couple of times Alfred J. Carpenter was turned down for a job, he didnt know what to think.

title: Four U.S. Standouts Become Fast Friends
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Young swimmers packed a small room at Mecklenburg County Aquatic Center on Thursday to hear the sage words of a 16-year-old high school sophomore.

title: Grants Anabasis (More Civil War Obsession)
description: Still indulging myself with personal addenda to the Times Disunion blog, and feeding my U.S. Grant obsession. So, at this point in the Vicksburg campaign were at the amazing stage where Grant cuts loose from the Mississippi, defeats Confederate forces trying to reinforce the city, then turns toward Vicksburg, defeats another army, and pens it up for the siege to come. The campaign looks like this:

title: In Syria and Beyond, the Tyrant as Target
description: There can be slainNo sacrifice to God more acceptableThan an unjust and wicked King Seneca, Hercules Furens

title: J.R. Smith May Miss Game 3
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The Knicks are unsure if guard J.R. Smith will be able to play in Game 3 of the Eastern Conference semifinals against the Indiana Pacers on Saturday night after Smith missed a shootaround with an undisclosed illness.

title: The Posture Guru of Silicon Valley
description: MATT DRUDGE recently noted an anniversary of his aggregator news site with a Twitter post: 18 years of DRUDGE REPORT in February! And STILL sitting ;).

title: Rangers Go-to Guys Have Gone Into a Hole
description: WASHINGTON  As the Rangers prepare for their must-win Game 6 against the Washington Capitals on Sunday afternoon, their predicament could be a mystery titled The Wrong Man  as in, did the Rangers deal away the wrong high-salaried scorer at the trade deadline last month?

title: Seeking Teachers Support, Mayoral Candidates Pledge Education Reform
description: They cooed about the importance of paying teachers fairly. They took turns skewering charter schools. One candidate went out of his way to say the president of the teachers union would go down in history as a great leader.

title: How Can They Charge That? (And Other Questions)
description: WHY do tickets to popular Broadway shows command premium prices, while movie theaters charge the same price for popular films as for clunkers? Things in high demand generally command higher prices, so why not blockbuster films?

title: Forecast for a 20,000 Dow Still Holds
description: LAST July, when the Dow Jones industrial average was still stuck below 12,900 and investors were seeking safety in bonds, Seth J. Masters made a startling argument.

title: A Voucher Deal That Wasnt So Sweet
description: LETS start with a final Whirlpool update. Last we heard from Shira London  the woman who was told by a third-party warranty company that her refrigerator had a pre-existing condition and therefore was not covered for repairs  shed been sent a new fridge. Unfortunately, it was damaged, so her husband declined delivery.

title: A Life of Science Was in the Cards
description: I AM a proud member of a small, emerging class of minority women with careers in science, technology, engineering and mathematics  the STEM fields for short. As a professor at Yale University and a scientist in the field of tissue engineering, or regenerative medicine, Im often asked how I got to where I am. I usually respond with stories of my early interest in problem-solving and puzzles.

title: Neither Teacher Nor Nurse
description: I GREW up in Grosse Pointe Woods and Bloomfield Hills, Mich. My father, who immigrated from Germany in 1925, worked in the automotive industry for 35 years, retiring from Chrysler. He was a brilliant inventor and businessman who occasionally took me with him when he visited engineering companies on Saturdays.

title: For Penguins, a Timely, or Long Overdue, Change in Goal
description: How much loyalty does a team owe its star goaltender after his game goes south?

title: On Camera to Get Off the Waiting List
description: As waiting lists grow and become more and more competitive, students across the country are finding new ways to gain an edge and get their names in front of admissions officers, even going as far as recording YouTube videos pleading their case through song, dance and more.

title: On a College Waiting List? Sending Cookies Isnt Going to Help
description: When Amanda Wolfbauer, a high school senior, received the admissions verdict from Hamilton College, in Clinton, N.Y., she posted on Twitter, What does one do once theyre on a college waitlist? #frustrated #worsethanrejection.

title: The Waiting Game
description: The Timess Ariel Kaminer on how far high school seniors (and their parents) will go to get themselves off a college waiting list and into the school of their dreams.

title: Honoring Greats of College Football Takes Much Time and Several Steps
description: Tommie Frazier was the electrifying option quarterback who led Nebraska to consecutive national championships without a loss in 1994 and 1995. He also pulled off one of the greatest runs in college football history, breaking free from seven Florida Gators en route to a 75-yard touchdown run in the 1996 Fiesta Bowl to cement the second title.

title: Dean Jeffries, Car Customizer and Painter, Dies at 80
description: Dean Jeffries, a car customizer, designer and painter who was considered one of the pre-eminent artists of American racecar and hot-rod culture, died on May 5 at his home in North Hollywood, Calif. He was 80.

title: Review of 50 Brooklyn Murder Cases Ordered
description: The Brooklyn district attorneys office has ordered a review of some 50 murder cases assigned to an acclaimed homicide detective, an acknowledgment of mounting questions about the officers tactics and the legitimacy of the convictions.

title: The Mellowing of Maxine Waters
description: LOS ANGELES

title: Timeline: Maxine Waters, the Firebrand Overseeing Finance
description: Representative Maxine Waters of California has softened her tone since becoming the top Democrat on the House Financial Services Committee in January.

title: Simply Put
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  I wont lie to you: I didnt enjoy this one. And I wanted to, really I did.

title: Niese Stays Consistent, Just Not in the Way the Mets Had Hoped
description: Before the season, the Mets pitching staff was loaded with question marks, with Matt Harvey entering his first full season, Dillon Gee and Shaun Marcum working back from injuries and the unproven Jeremy Hefner at the back of the rotation.

title: More Science Fiction for Economists (Seriously Time-Wasting)
description: Noah Smith has a list; all good stuff, although not all to my taste. (I just cant read Cory Doctorow, and dont know why). Definitely definitely The Dispossessed, which never seems to lose its relevance.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, May 12
description: As scrutiny of the September attacks on the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi,Libya, intensifies,Representative Darrell Issa of California, chairman of the House oversight committee, and Senator Dianne Feinstein of California, chairwoman of the Intelligence Committee, will join NBCs Meet the Press on Sunday.

title: Hidden Threats to Young Athletes
description: In February, hundreds of youth sports safety advocates convened at a Washington hotel. They were determined to talk about something other than concussions, a counterintuitive ambition considering the rampant worry about the effects of head trauma in young athletes.

title: Man Takes Hostages in Trenton
description: A standoff between an armed man and dozens of police officers at a house in Trenton continued into a second day, the police said on Saturday, amid reports that the man had killed at least one person inside the home and was holding children hostage.

title: Netanyahu and Putin to Discuss Syria
description: JERUSALEM  Amid growing concern in Israel and the West that Russia may soon deliver a sophisticated air defense system to Syria, Israeli and Russian officials confirmed on Saturday that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu would meet with President Vladimir V. Putin as early as this week.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: 3 Arrested in Plot to Bomb Egyptian Cities and Embassy
description: CAIRO  Egyptian security forces have arrested three militants with ties to Al Qaeda who were planning terrorist attacks in Egyptian cities and against a foreign embassy, the interior minister said Saturday.

title: Berlusconi Rallies Supporters, With Defiant Words for Judges and Prosecutors
description: BRESCIA, Italy  A rally in this northern Italian city on Saturday to protest two court rulings against former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi  and organized by Mr. Berlusconis party, one of the partners in Italys uneasy new government  became a fresh test of the coalition since it was formed under pressure two weeks ago.

title: Foreign Nations Push for Special Immigration Treatment
description: A closer look South Koreas lobbying effort to secure beneficial provisions in the immigration bill.

title: Some Countries Lobby for More in Race for Visas
description: WASHINGTON  The government of South Korea hired a former C.I.A. analyst, two White House veterans and a team of ex-Congressional staff members to help secure a few paragraphs in the giant immigration bill.

title: Championship Drama, Months Early
description: The World Chess Federation has decided that the World Championship match in November will be held in Chennai, India, the hometown of the titleholder, Viswanathan Anand, and that the prizes will total $2.55 million.

title: Stars Are Feeling Down With Rangers on Verge Of Being Knocked Out
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  After practice Saturday afternoon, Rick Nash and a glum Brad Richards talked about their scoring slumps. Coach John Tortorella declined to talk about his struggling stars.

title: Paramedic Denies Role in Deadly Texas Blast
description: WEST, Texas  A volunteer paramedic who became a public face of mourning after last months deadly blast at a fertilizer plant in this Central Texas town denied having any involvement in the explosion, his lawyer said on Saturday.

title: For Gritty Grizzlies, Their Kind of Win
description: MEMPHIS  Zach Randolph screamed at Lionel Hollins. Marc Gasol screamed at the officials. Tony Allen screamed at himself. No one will ever accuse the Grizzlies of being a quiet, understated team. They like to share their feelings. Hollins, the teams coach, prefers it that way.

title: Garca Loses Concentration and the Lead at the Players Championship
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla.  Nineteen other times Sergio Garca had been paired with Tiger Woods, and on most of those occasions Garca staggered off the course at the end of the round with the look of someone who had seen a ghost. Only three times in those meetings had Garca finished with the better score.

title: Texas Advocacy Group Wields Charter-Policy Power
description: As his legislation expanding the states virtual school network reached the floor of the Texas House in early May, Representative Ken King was focused on what it was not.

title: Yankees Consider Putting Nunez on Disabled List
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  The Yankees are getting closer to placing Eduardo Nunez on the 15-day disabled list with a strained left rib cage muscle. Manager Joe Girardi said he spoke to General Manager Brian Cashman on Saturday and a decision will most likely be made before Mondays doubleheader in Cleveland. But, as Girardi noted, the Yankees cannot afford to go into that day short-handed.

title: Just Before Summer Tours, a Burst of New CDs
description: As the midpoint of 2013 approaches, an impressive array of high-profile releases from Texas artists has already emerged, highlighted by an octogenarian legend (Willie Nelson), a cult favorite (Iron and Wine), an embattled Dixie Chick (Natalie Maines) and a promising country starlet (Kacey Musgraves). Whos next? A Beyonc album, still unscheduled, is somewhere on the horizon. But more immediately there is a robust selection of Texans releasing new music  from hip-hop to country and indie rock to Top 40  in advance of the summer touring season.

title: A Bill to Bolster the Fight on Wrongful Convictions
description: Clinton Bamberger lost the most important case of his career, but most legal experts consider that 1963 United States Supreme Court decision a crucial victory for criminal justice.

title: Out of Egypts Chaos, Musical Rebellion
description: CAIRO  One washed towels in a barbershop. The other sold fast food. Some nights, they would grab the microphones at outdoor weddings and try out raps they had written, only to earn a hail of stones.

title: Egypts Music Revolution
description: A youth-driven and socially conscious music genre called mahraganat reflects social shifts spurred by the revolution that toppled President Hosni Mubarak in 2011.

title: Texas Bill Would Let Doctors Get Data From Drivers Licenses
description: Health care providers in Texas could soon collect or verify patient information by swiping that patients drivers license.

title: G.O.P. Delays on Nominees Raise Tension
description: WASHINGTON  President Obamas latest cabinet-level nominees are running into deep resistance in the Senate, pitching Democrats and Republicans into another tense standoff over White House appointments.

title: Trailing Early, Late and in Between
description: INDIANAPOLIS  From the moment they took the court last fall, the refashioned Knicks held certain truths to be self-evident, that they were endowed with the inalienable right to shoot and score at will, the farther from the basket the better.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, May 12
description: This could turn into a stealth immigration policy. Every country is going to try to negotiate its own carve-out.

title: Islanders Put On a Show, but Then the Penguins Drop the Curtain
description: UNIONDALE, N.Y.  The Islanders needed until the final week of the regular season to claw their way into the playoffs and secure their first postseason berth since 2007.

title: Pettitte Gets on Track and Keeps Team in Groove
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Andy Pettitte was closely following his sons high school baseball team in its playoff series through various hand-held devices. Pettittes son Josh had thrown a no-hitter for his team in Deer Park, Tex., on Friday night. On Saturday, hours before Pettitte took the mound, he learned that his sons team had staged a late-inning comeback, with Josh providing two key hits, to win the series.

title: Knicks-Pacers: Game 3
description: Images from Indianas 82-71 victory, which gave it a 2-1 lead in the series.

title: Dazed by an Illness, Knicks Smith Is Unable to Give Much Help
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Numbers have not been good for J. R. Smith lately, on the court or off.

title: Yankees Chamberlain Gives Rivera a Dugout Rebuke
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Mariano Rivera has been the focus of adoring affection everywhere he has gone in baseball since announcing that this would be his final season. As part of his farewell tour, he has been meeting with fans and team employees in each city he visits.

title: Corrections: May 12, 2013
description: NATIONAL

title: Louisa Brown, Daniel Revitte
description: Louisa Kathryn Brown and Daniel Murphy Revitte were married Saturday at the Park Avenue Christian Church in New York. The Rev. Diana W. Phillips, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony.

title: Lao Shes Art Collection Auctioned Amid Enthusiasm
description: BEIJING  For Chinas newly rich and hungry art collectors, the combination of Lao She, one of the countrys most beloved 20th-century writers, and Qi Baishi, one of its most famous 20th-century painters, was irresistible: on Saturday evening, the second day of the China Guardian 2013 Spring Auctions in Beijing, 16 paintings from the private collection of the writer who killed himself during the Cultural Revolution sold for 167.6 million yuan, or $27 million, the auction house said.

title: Danijela Gazibara, Jeremy Kimball
description: Danijela Gazibara, a daughter of Ljiljana and Milorad Gazibara of Portage, Ind., was married Monday to Jeremy Martin Kimball, a son of Virginia L. Kimball and Dudley B. Kimball of Ridgewood, N.J. James Mitchell, an assistant administrator in the City Clerks office, officiated at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau.

title: Allison Martin, Robert Wussler Jr.
description: Allison Lynn Martin and Robert Joseph Wussler Jr. were married Saturday at the Highlands Country Club in Garrison, N.Y. The Rev. David Bach, a minister of the Reformed Church in America, officiated.

title: Margot Golden and Benjamin Tishler
description: Margot Goodrich Golden and Benjamin William Tishler were married Saturday evening at the weekend home of the brides parents in Chatham, N.Y. Rabbi Kenneth A. Kanter officiated.

title: A Kiss That Could Shake a Chandelier
description: Patricia Leslie Elam and Charles Edward Walker were married Saturday evening at the Museum of the National Center of Afro-American Artists in Boston. The Rev. Dr. Robert M. Franklin, a Church of God in Christ minister, officiated, with assistance from Marionette Fennell-Patterson, who is affiliated with Soka Gakkai International U.S.A., a Buddhist lay organization.

title: Kathleen Nokes and Dorothy Hickey
description: Kathleen Mary Nokes and Dorothy Elizabeth Hickey were married Saturday at the Inn at Stone Ridge in Stone Ridge, N.Y. The Rev. Theodore W. Hayes, a retired Baptist minister, officiated.

title: Meghan McCarthy, Gregory Vadala
description: Meghan Kathleen McCarthy and Gregory Anthony Vadala were married Saturday in Princeton, N.J. Msgr. Walter E. Nolan performed the ceremony at St. Pauls Church, with the Rev. Elizabeth R. Wright, a United Methodist minister, taking part.

title: Julia Buckman, Owen Kenney
description: Julia Walsh Buckman and Owen Davol Kenney were married Saturday by the Rev. Kirk J. Ullery, a Roman Catholic priest and an uncle of the bride, at St. Mary, Our Lady of the Isle Catholic Church on Nantucket in Massachusetts.

title: Michel Fox, Brandon Blum
description: Michel Lauren Fox, a daughter of Barbara J. Fox and William J. Fox of Englewood Cliffs, N.J., was married Saturday to Brandon Corey Blum, a son of Harriet M. Blum and Howard Blum of New City, N.Y. Rabbi Bruce S. Block officiated at the Pierre hotel in Manhattan.

title: Emily Kuo and Michael Chu
description: Emily Tru Kuo and Michael Chu were married Saturday in Houston. The Rev. P. Clay Holland performed the ceremony at Christ the King Presbyterian Church.

title: Nicole Dugan, David Pogue
description: Nicole Vosshall Dugan and David Welch Pogue were married Saturday evening at Beltane Ranch in Glen Ellen, Calif. The Rev. Jonathan Leavy, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated.

title: Caroline Lampen and Bret Miller
description: Caroline Matson Lampen, a daughter of Susan and Richard Lampen of Coral Gables, Fla., was married Saturday in Miami to Bret Alec Miller, the son of Minda and Henry Miller of Columbia, S.C. Rabbi Terry A. Bookman officiated at the Four Seasons hotel.

title: Vanessa Calderon, Justin Barra
description: Dr. Vanessa Yasmin Calderon and Justin Barra were married Saturday at Villa Verano, a private estate in Santa Barbara, Calif. Osmin Calderon, the brides father, officiated after receiving temporary designation as a deputy civil marriage commissioner for Santa Barbara County.

title: Patricia Jackson, Samuel Greenfield
Jacqueline Minneman, Raphael Schweiger
description: Jacqueline Marie Minneman was married Saturday to Raphael Schweiger at the University of Virginia Chapel in Charlottesville, Va. The Rev. Gerald P. Fogarty, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Shoshana Parker, Ari Fridman
description: Shoshana Abigail Parker and Adam Judah Fridman are to be married Sunday afternoon at the Loews Philadelphia Hotel. Rabbi Avraham J. Shmidman is to perform the ceremony.

title: Ashley Rotenstreich, Peter Carl
description: Ashley Wallace Rotenstreich and Peter Michael Carl were married on Saturday in Manhattan. Rabbi Ronald B. Sobel performed the ceremony at Temple Emanu-El, where he is the senior rabbi emeritus.

title: Monica Iyer, Robert Becker Jr.
description: Monica Visalam Iyer and Robert Becker Jr. were married Saturday evening at Studio 450, an event space in New York. Ronald L. Ellis, a United States magistrate judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, officiated.

title: Theresa Kennelly, Michael Mooney
description: Theresa Anne Kennelly, the daughter of Leigh Kremer Kennelly and Judge Matthew F. Kennelly of Evanston, Ill., was married Saturday to Michael Anthony Mooney, the son of Laurie Totin Mooney and Michael P. Mooney of West Bloomfield, Mich. Nan R. Nolan, a retired federal magistrate judge in Chicago for the United States District Court for the Northern District of Illinois, officiated at the Garfield Park Conservatory in Chicago.

title: Catherine Newman, Philip Gerwin
description: Dr. Catherine Ann Newman and Dr. Philip Marshall Gerwin were married Saturday evening at Wentworth by the Sea, a hotel in New Castle, N.H. Steven M. Dembow, a justice of the peace for the town of Merrimack, N.H., officiated.

title: A Move in the Right Direction
description: Maria Consetta Taft and Todd Quentin Swanson were married Saturday at Barndiva, a restaurant in Healdsburg, Calif. Suzanne H. Woolsey, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: His Post-Surgical Care: French Custards
description: Gretchen Dow Simpson and James Clyde Baird were married Saturday at the Manning Chapel on the campus of Brown University in Providence, R.I. The Rev. Geralyn Wolf, a retired Episcopal bishop of the Diocese of Rhode Island, performed the ceremony.

title: Kristina Rohall, Andrew Haag
description: Kristina Leigh Rohall and William Andrew Haag were married Friday at the Reefs Resort in Southampton, Bermuda. The Rev. G. Dean Smith, a minister ordained by the New Testament Church of God, performed a nondenominational ceremony.

title: Kristen Wright, Bryan Smith
description: Kristen Wright and Bryan Robert Smith were married Saturday in Georgetown, S.C. The Rev. Dr. Dora R. Gafford performed the ceremony at Duncan Memorial United Methodist Church, where she is pastor.

title: Sarah Dailey, David Galst
description: Sarah Victoria Dailey and David Paley Galst were married Saturday at Battery Gardens in Manhattan. Rabbi Darren Levine officiated, with the Rev. Ann Duncan, a United Methodist minister, taking part in the ceremony.

title: Lisa Frank, Max Schwartz
description: Lisa Carrie Frank, a daughter of Lois A. Frank and Glen M. Frank of Prescott Valley, Ariz., was married Saturday evening to Max Raphael Schwartz, the son of Dr. Nella I. Shapiro and Jack D. Schwartz of Chappaqua, N.Y. Rabbi Marc C. C. Katz officiated at the Liberty Warehouse, an event space in Brooklyn.

title: Alan Koenigsberg, John Dotto
description: Alan Scott Koenigsberg and John Alexander Dotto were married Saturday at the Central Park Boathouse in New York. The Rev. David Didio, an interfaith minister, officiated.

title: Juliette Wallack, David Metz
description: Juliette Anne Wallack and David Benjamin Metz were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Ramie Arian at the Yale Club of New York.

title: Jennifer Lewis, Christopher Buell
description: Jennifer Lauren Lewis and Christopher William Buell were married Saturday evening at the National Museum of Women in the Arts in Washington. The Rev. James Thomas Lenhart, a Congregational minister, officiated.

title: Leigh Van Ostrand, Patrick McKegney
description: Leigh Anne Van Ostrand and Patrick Donovan McKegney were married Saturday evening at Infant Jesus Roman Catholic Church in Port Jefferson, N.Y. The Rev. Patrick M. Riegger performed the ceremony.

title: Jaclyn Hatala, Erich Matthes
description: Jaclyn Anne Hatala and Erich Henry Matthes were married Saturday at the Mountain Lakes House, an event site in Princeton, N.J. Kathryn Grzenczyk Mantoan, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Susan Chapman, Christopher Hughes
description: Susan Evelyn Chapman and Christopher Allan Hughes were married Saturday evening at the Ritz-Carlton in Key Biscayne, Fla. The Rev. Charline E. Manuel, a Unity minister, officiated.

title: Cho Basden, Daniel Mazur
description: Cho Virginia Basden, the daughter of Jill Richards Basden and the Rev. Michael P. Basden of Naples, Fla., was married there Saturday to Dr. Daniel John Mazur, a son of Lillian Ekaczyk Mazur and Glen A. Mazur of New Lenox, Ill., at Trinity-by-the-Cove Episcopal Church, where the brides father is the rector. The Right Rev. Jeffrey D. Lee, the godfather of the bride and the bishop of the Episcopal diocese of Chicago, performed the ceremony with the Rev. Stephen Gerth, an Episcopal priest, assisting.

title: South Korea Seeks Journalists Arrest in Defamation Case
description: SEOUL, South Korea  State prosecutors are seeking to arrest a South Korean journalist on charges of violating election laws for reporting an unconfirmed suspicion ahead of Decembers presidential vote that the brother of the leading candidate might have been involved in the killing of a relative, the journalists lawyers said Sunday.

title: After a Journalists Prodding, China Investigates a Top Official
description: HONG KONG  Chinas top anticorruption agency said Sunday that it was investigating Liu Tienan, a senior economic policy maker, in an abrupt turn in a case that openly pitted him against a campaigning investigative journalist.

title: Two Killings Preceded 37-Hour Trenton Standoff
description: Just before she disappeared two weeks ago, Carmenlita Stevens went to a cousins house not far from her own in Trenton, and complained that her boyfriend, Gerald Tyrone Murphy, had become volatile. She feared that she and her five children were in danger, and by the time she left, at 3 a.m., she had resolved to leave him.

title: After Fair Trade Coffee, Fair Trade Shea
description: A few of the estimated 16 million African women who pick shea nuts for a living are going to be making their case for fair trade to the giant corporations who buy their nuts in New York City on Monday.

title: Malaysias Close Elections
description: Malaysias elections end in controversy.

title: From Isabella Rossellini,  Creature Moms
description: Isabella Rossellini does nothing by half measures. She didnt hesitate to shed her glamour, and her clothes, exposing a battered body in Blue Velvet, or to play a withered matron in Two Lovers. Now the actress-director and model has cast herself as, of all things, a spider with a multitude of eyes and teats; a scruffy hamster that devours her babes; and a cuckoo that deposits her eggs in a rivals nest.

title: Arrests and Calls for Calm in Turkey
description: REYHANLI, Turkey  Turkish officials said Sunday that they had arrested nine people accused of carrying out twin bombings in this town near the Syrian border the day before, as the investigation moved at a clip that underscored the intense pressure on the government to contain the fallout from the attacks.

title: How We Do It: Time Diaries of Family Life
description: I dont know how you do it.

title: How Debbie Wasserman Schultz Does It
description: Friday, April 19, 2013, Weston, Fla.

title: Few Vote in Bulgaria as Apathy Prevails
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria  Bulgarians turned out in record low numbers on Sunday to choose a government to replace the one that resigned after angry and unfocused demonstrations and a bloody crackdown here in the capital this year.

title: Disruptions: Even the Tech Elites Leave Gadgets Behind
description: If you were to meet 32-year-old Robin Sloan of San Francisco, you might think him a Luddite unable to get his head around new technologies. He owns an old Nokia phone with one main application: making phone calls. He takes notes using a pen and paper notepad. And he reads books printed on paper.

title: Little Pigs, Little Pigs, Let Us In on Your Mysterious Past
description: Joe Diaz remembers the call on his two-way radio. About eight years ago, he was beckoned down to the crawl space under the auditorium at the Stern School of Business at New York University. His team of facilities workers had found something he needed to see: a box full of little ceramic pigs.

title: Jacqueline Brookes, Actress and Teacher, Dies at 82
description: Jacqueline Brookes, an actress who appeared in films and on television but who won her widest acclaim on the stage in New York and around the country, performing the work of Shakespeare, Molire, Pirandello, Edward Albee and other dramatists over a 60-year career, died on April 26 in Manhattan. She was 82.

title: Whats on Sunday
description: 10:30 P.M. (HBO) FAMILY TREE In this new, largely improvised series from Christopher Guest and Jim Piddock, Chris ODowd plays the down-on-his-luck Tom Chadwick, a 30-year-old Briton grappling with his identity since losing his girlfriend and his job. But when his Great-Aunt Victoria bequeaths him a chest of curios, he starts investigating his lineage to understand better who he and his unconventional family actually are. The ventriloquist Nina Conti plays his sister, Bea, who speaks through a monkey hand puppet; Michael McKean, above right, with Mr. ODowd, is their father. In this premiere episode, Tom finds a black-and-white portrait thought to be of his great-grandfather Harry and tracks down Neville St. Aubrey (Christopher Fairbank), an oddball antique photography expert. Toms best friend, Pete (Tom Bennett), meanwhile, fixes him up with a model. But what kind, exactly, no one is sure. There is a familiarity to the series, Mike Hale wrote in The New York Times. As in Mr. Guests films, its story is less important than the presentation of a gallery of eccentrics, ranging from mildly odd to completely loony. One result, Mr. Hale said, is that the series can feel a little loose and inconsequential as Tom unearths one dotty, inglorious relative after another. But that also means that we get to spend more time with Mr. Guests crack cast of improvisers, he added, and there are moments in each half-hour that pay off.

title: Nevillenomics
description: Nicholas Crafts has a really interesting piece about UK economic policy in the 1930s. The gist is that monetary policy drove recovery through the expectations channel; the Bank of England managed to credibly promise to be irresponsible, that is, to generate inflation.

title: Chairman of Benghazi Board Defends Its Decision Not to Question Clinton
description: WASHINGTON  The State Department board that reviewed last years attack on a diplomatic outpost in Libya never questioned Hillary Rodham Clinton, the secretary of state at the time, because it had already decided responsibility lay below her level, the boards chairman said Sunday.

title: Maintaining an SNL Link, Meyers to Succeed Fallon on NBCs Late Night
description: Seth Meyers will be the next host of NBCs Late Night, the network announced on Sunday.

title: Seeking College Edge, Chinese Pupils Arrive in New York Earlier
description: Weiling Zhang, a sophomore at the Lman Manhattan Preparatory School, yearned to communicate with more conviction and verve than her peers back home  the American way, she said.

title: I.R.S. Focus on Conservatives Gives G.O.P. an Issue to Seize On
description: WASHINGTON  The Internal Revenue Services special scrutiny of small-government groups applying for tax-exempt status went beyond keyword hunts for organizations with Tea Party or Patriot in their names, to a more overtly ideological search for applicants seeking to make America a better place to live or criticize how the country is being run, according to part of a draft audit by the inspector general that has been given to Capitol Hill.

title: Building a $325,000 Burger
description: MAASTRICHT, the Netherlands  As a gastronomic delicacy, the five-ounce hamburger that Mark Post has painstakingly created here surely will not turn any heads. But Dr. Post is hoping that it will change some minds.

title: A Strong Gatsby and Stronger Iron Man 3
description: Moviegoers ignored naysaying critics and swarmed to Baz Luhrmanns stylized 3-D adaptation of The Great Gatsby over the weekend. But Iron Man 3 (Walt Disney Studios) repeated as the No. 1 box office draw in North America, taking in $72.5 million, for a two-week total of $284.9 million. Gatsby, adapted from F. Scott Fitzgeralds classic novel and starring Leonardo DiCaprio in the title role, sold about $51.1 million in tickets in second place  an astounding result for a period drama.

title: A Fitting Farewell at Old Trafford, Right Down to the Ending
description: The Manchester rain fell relentlessly on the end of Alex Fergusons extraordinary reign at Old Trafford.

title: Nadal and Williams Dominate in Madrid Open Finals
description: MADRID  In front of an adoring crowd and on his cherished clay surface, Rafael Nadal defeated Stanislas Wawrinka to win the Madrid Open on Sunday, securing his fifth title since returning in February from a knee injury.

title: Yankees Play Down Chamberlain-Rivera Exchange as Family Squabble
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo.  Yankees closer Mariano Rivera tried Sunday to defuse any fallout from a testy exchange the night before in which his fellow reliever Joba Chamberlain rebuked him in front of fans and reporters.

title: In Taiwan, Lamenting a Lost Lead
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan  Jonney Shih, the chairman of Asustek Computer, has epitomized the Taiwanese electronics engineer for a generation: a slender figure in rumpled, baggy trousers, he once helped Intel solve heat problems in its Pentium 4 microprocessors.

title: For Witness to Nagasaki, a Life Focused on Science
description: LOS ALAMOS, N.M.  Sixty-eight years ago, Osamu Shimomura was a 16-year-old high school student working in a factory seven and a half miles from Nagasaki, Japan. Sitting down to work, a light flashed, briefly blinding him, and the pressure wave from an explosion came rolling through.

title: Pop, American Songbook and Young Charm
description: If the young women who packed 54 Below at 11 p.m. on Friday didnt emit the piercing screams you would hear at a Justin Bieber concert, it was because Aaron Tveit, the handsome 29-year-old star they came to adore, is a decade older, and these fans were in their late teens and 20s. But the atmosphere suggested a more restrained version of the fervor exhibited by Beliebers.

title: 2 Presidential Candidates in Iran Draw Resentment
description: TEHRAN  A day after two game-changing politicians signed up at the last minute as candidates for Irans presidential elections in June, the countrys governing establishment reacted angrily, predicting that they would not be allowed to participate or that they would definitely lose.

title: Orbs Exercise Rider Shares Insight Before Preakness
description: Jenn Patterson, an exercise rider for Shug McGaughey, has a morning set list that reads like a whos who of elite equine athletes. It includes the multiple Grade I winner Point of Entry, the Virginia Derby winner Air Support, and Imaging, who is scheduled to contest the Dixie Stakes on the undercard of the Preakness Stakes next Saturday.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Defending a Scrap of Soul Against MoMA
description: Last week was a good one for common sense and manning the barricades in New York. The City Planning Commission recommended limiting the special permit that allows Madison Square Garden to operate at its current site, which opens the door to fixing Penn Station, trapped below it.

title: Economic Reports for the Week Ahead
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Information to be released includes retail sales for April, business inventories for March, and China industrial production and retail sales for April (Monday); the import price index and euro area industrial production (Tuesday); the Producer Price Index and industrial production for April; capital flows for March, and the euro area gross domestic product for the first quarter (Wednesday); the Consumer Price Index for April, initial jobless claims, and housing starts for April (Thursday); the University of Michigans preliminary consumer sentiment index for May, and leading indicators for April (Friday).

title: A Card Game at Lunchtime
description: It was raining cats and dogs last Thursday at noon when audience members filed into the Kaufmann Concert Hall at the 92nd Street Y, spreading the odor of wet coats and umbrellas. It was the lunchtime performance of the final run of chamber-music concerts presented and, in part, performed by the violinist Jaime Laredo with a program encompassing works by Dvorak, Brahms and Franck. The auditorium was divided into two camps. In the front half, the musically literate, as evidenced by the significant number of musical scores spread out on laps. In the back, 150 high school students. For the former, chamber music was a necessity on par with a well-brewed cup of coffee; for the latter, a novelty.

title: D.J. Crews Strut Through Four Rounds of Battle
description: The sound clash is a 60-year-old Jamaican tradition in which D.J. crews work the same crowd in the same space. Its a completely sturdy carnival-culture, art-as-battle ritual: the audience declares the winner, deciding through body reflex and intellectual surprise, voting with hands and lungs.

title: News From the Advertising Industry
description: Accounts

title: Burying Victims and Hunting for Suspects After a Bombing in Turkey
description: The Turkish authorities said Sunday that nine people had been detained in twin car bombings the day before in Reyhanli, near the Syrian border.

title: On a Scavenger Hunt to Save Most Humans
description: One of the first characters to appear in Inferno is a spike-haired, malevolent biker chick dressed in black leather. She looks like trouble in more ways than one. What is the girl with the dragon tattoo doing in Dan Browns new book?

title: Imperfect Harvey Gets Little Help From Offense
description: The margin of error for the Mets, in the midst of an offensive slumber, is minuscule. The slightest misstep  an uncharacteristic inning from their ace, Matt Harvey, or a badly placed pitch by the usually reliable closer Bobby Parnell, or an unlucky bounce to a Pirates infielder  can spell disaster.

title: Yeh Brothers Cup in Japan
description: At the Yeh Brothers Cup in Japan last month, teams eliminated from the main event dropped into two subsidiary events, a Swiss teams and a pairs.

title: A Lament for the Wrath of a Storm and the Losses It Wrought
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  The idea of a collaboration between the idiosyncratic New York multimedia artist Laurie Anderson and the Kronos Quartet, a musically omnivorous San Francisco ensemble, seems so obvious that you wonder why it never happened before now. Landfall, a new 70-minute piece Ms. Anderson designed to perform alongside Kronos, came to Montclair State University here on Friday night, as part of that institutions reliably invigorating Peak Performances series.

title: Martin Short to Write Memoir for Harper
description: Although Ive never read a book all the way through, Im sure excited to write one. This is how Martin Short, in a statement from his publisher, announced Sunday that he had struck a deal to write his first book, a memoir of his life and enduring career in show business. Harper, the imprint of HarperCollins that published an autobiography of Amanda Knox last month, will release the book in fall 2014. Mr. Short, a comedian and actor who created some of his most famous characters on SCTV and Saturday Night Live, will write about those years, as well as his time working on films like The Three Amigos. He will also cover his 30-year marriage to Nancy, who died in 2010, and his longtime friendships with fellow Hollywood stars. A title is forthcoming, Mr. Short added: I havent named my book yet, but Im toying with the title If Id Saved, I Wouldnt Be Writing This.
