description: Q.

title: Morgan Stanley Sells Indian Wealth Unit
description: LONDON  Morgan Stanley agreed on Monday to sell its Indian wealth management unit to the British bank Standard Chartered for an undisclosed amount.

title: Tumblr Community Responds to Yahoo Bid
description: Stop me if youve heard this one before. A social media Web site sells to a large company that then plans to make money by placing ads against users content. The people on the social Web site revolt.

title: Yahoos Social Media Play
description: The board of Yahoo agreed on Sunday to buy the popular blogging service Tumblr for about $1.1 billion in cash, a signal of how Yahoo plans to reposition itself in the age of social media, The New York Times reports, citing people with direct knowledge of the matter. The deal, expected to be announced as soon as Monday, would surpass Facebooks $1 billion purchase of Instagram last year.

title: India and China Vow to Cooperate on Border
description: NEW DELHI  The leaders of India and China papered over their recent border spat on Monday with a friendly joint statement and an array of promises for economic and military cooperation, but they resolved none of their most vexing problems.

title: German Wages and Portuguese Competitiveness (A Bit Wonkish)
description: Theres a three-cornered debate among Ryan Avent, Tyler Cowen, and Karl Smith  over the extent to which a more expansionary ECB policy would help the European periphery.

title: Editors Note
description: Editors Note | Wednesday, May 22, 2013:

title: Monday Reading: Smoke Can Permeate Nonsmoking Hotel Rooms
Actavis to Buy Warner Chilcott in All-Stock Deal
description: The generic drug maker Actavis agreed on Monday to buy Warner Chilcott, a smaller rival, for about $5 billion in stock, in the latest flurry of deal-making in the specialty drug industry.

title: Hezbollahs Role in Syria War Shakes the Lebanese
description: NABI CHIT, Lebanon  At the entrance to this village in Hezbollahs Bekaa Valley heartland, under a sign welcoming visitors to The Citadel of Resistance, workers on Monday hoisted a freshly printed banner honoring a young man described as one of Hezbollahs latest martyrs  killed in battle not with Israel, the foe the groups guerrillas train to fight, but with Syrian rebels.

title: India and China Sign Deals on Economic and Cultural Cooperation
description: The prime ministers of India and China on Monday emphasized the need for economic cooperation between the two fast-growing developing nations, saying that a recent dispute over a border region would not disrupt relations.

title: Cannes Film Festival: A Bling Ring Stars Head-Spinning Trip
description: CANNES, France  When word broke that thieves had stolen $1 million worth of gaudy jewelry in Cannes, right after the premiere of Sofia Coppolas Bling Ring, the news was so timely it practically seemed like creative guerrilla marketing. Ms. Coppolas film is based on the true story of five Los Angeles kids who raid the homes of their most OMG-ed celebrities so they can dress, as all the ads and magazines implore, just like Paris Hilton, Lindsay Lohan, Audrina Patridge, Megan Fox and Miranda Kerr.

title: Altidore: Team Success a Sweet Ending to Season
description: As a professional soccer player, Ive been called many names. Some have been good, while others I choose not to repeat since they would be clipped out by the Goal blogs editors.

title: Chianti by Bike
description: Each spring, the ex-pro cyclist Joo Correia heads to Italys Chianti region to lead small groups of amateur riders on weeklong bike trips that feature arduous climbs, technical descents and plenty of time to sample the areas main attractions: food and wine. Post-ride, Correia arranges lunch at a local bar and dinner at places like the winemaking complex of Castello di Ama, where works by such artists as Anish Kapoor can be enjoyed over a bottle of Chianti classico. The last trip of Correias season culminates with LEroica, a one-day festival of classic European vloisme, in which riders take on unpaved roads with pre-1987 gear, like steel frames and wool jerseys. Its a celebration of everything beautiful about cycling, Correia says. Trips from $5,950; ingamba.pro.

title: Red Bulls Rewind: Monster in the Middle
description: HARRISON, N.J.  His play is not fancy and there is no need for flowery words.

title: Ryanair Annual Profit Rises 13%
description: PARIS  The budget airline Ryanair reported a 13 percent increase in annual profit on Monday, as Europes protracted economic downturn continued to send air travelers in search of the lowest fares.

title: Are Totalitarianisms Like Snowflakes?
description: MOSCOW  Just saying that a Jew should have been made into a lampshade does not make you an anti-Semite, or so a prominent columnist asserted recently. And just because both Nazism and Soviet Communism were totalitarian regimes does not mean they are comparable. Such arguments, counterarguments and variations of them have dominated Russian blogs, social networks and some of the traditional media for the last week.

title: Full Metro-North Rail Service Expected Wednesday
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority said on Monday that it expected full commuter rail service to return by Wednesday morning, less than a week after a collision near Fairfield, Conn., involving two Metro-North Railroad trains injured more than 70 people and jammed a crucial transit corridor for much of the Northeast.

title: Star Wars Animated Series Set for 2014 Debut
description: This will be a day long remembered for fans of the animated Star Wars television series and the continuing saga of that long-ago, faraway galaxy. On Monday, Lucasfilm and Disney said they had started production on a new Star Wars show  one that will explore the period between the prequel and classic Star Wars trilogies and that will have its debut on the Disney Channel in fall 2014 before moving to its regular home on Disney XD.

title: Justices Take Case on Prayer at Town Board Meetings, and a Patent Dispute
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to decide cases concerning prayers at the start of town meetings and a patent dispute over heart monitors. It also issued an important administrative law decision that said the Federal Communications Commission was entitled to deference in determining the scope of its own jurisdiction.

title: How Tracy Mack-Askew, Chevrolet Vehicle Line Manager, Does It
description: Thursday, March 14, 2013, Detroit

title: Macroeconomic Machismo
description: Atrios, weighing in on the Kinsley Kontroversy, suggests that the evident urge to make Someone Suffer  Someone Else, of course  reflects sadism. But I dont think thats right. Lack of compassion, sure; an inability to imagine what it must be like for someone less fortunate than oneself and ones friends, definitely. But I think that the linked Scott Lemieux post, which equates the austerian fixation on stagflation with the neocon fixation on Munich, is much closer to the mark.

title: The Case for Not Cooperating With Prosecutors
description: It is something rarely heard from a firm that is the focus of a government investigation: Our cooperation is no longer unconditional. With that cryptic phrase in a letter to its investors, SAC Capital Advisors signaled that it had entered a new phase in the insider trading investigation involving the firm and might be willing to fight efforts to gather evidence of violations.

title: What Were Reading
description: The Wall Street Journal: Barbecue is such a sacred cow of American cuisine that compelling new approaches have been slow in coming. Josh Ozersky touches base with a few pit masters who have decided that its time to innovate.  Jeff Gordinier

title: Weekend Gun Report: May 17-19, 2013
description: Benton, Ill. Greenwich Village, N.Y. Prattville, Ala. Statesville, N.C. Houston, Tex. Beech Island, S.C. Saginaw, Mich. Phoenix, Ariz. North Philadelphia, Pa. Rochester, N.Y. West Palm Beach, Fla. New Haven, Conn. Banning, Calif. Albuquerque, N.M.

title: Whats So Big About Big B?
description: In Murabba, the director Anurag Kashyaps contribution to the new movie Bombay Talkies, our hero, one Vijay from Allahabad, who has been waiting for days outside the tall gates of Amitabh Bachchans mythologized house in Mumbai, finally hears his name being called by the guards. Standing in a small crowd of men waiting for a glimpse of the star, Vijay raises his hand to distinguish himself, only to realize that so does everyone around him, for each of them is also Vijay from Allahabad.

title: May 20 Updates on Tornado That Left Dozens Dead Near Oklahoma City
description: Last Updated, 11:37 p.m. Video and images in the aftermath of a tornado that tore through Moore, Okla., on Monday afternoon show a wide swath of destruction in this suburb south of Oklahoma City.

title: Challenge What You Think You Know
description: Carl Richards is a certified financial planner in Park City, Utah, and is the director of investor education at The BAM Alliance. His book, The Behavior Gap, was published this year. His sketches are archivedon the Bucks blog.

description: The Timess Jenna Wortham on the reaction to Yahoos acquisition of Tumblr and what it means for users.

description: At the most recent meeting of the She Owns It business group, we discussed pricing a new product or service, the dangers of giving something for nothing, and the reasons customers may prefer that you raise your prices.

title: Former Senator to Run Wall St. Lobby Group
description: At Wall Streets lobbying outfit, a revolving door continues to spin.

title: Gulliver Seeks Rental: The Newfound Fascination With Tiny Dwellings
description: In Luke Clark Tylers last New York City apartment, his shoes had some unusual companions in the closet. The shoes sat, in neat pairs, on a rack, directly below his dishes and right next to the microwave. A few inches away, a hip-high refrigerator lived beneath his desk. And the apartment was so narrow that Mr. Tyler could sit on a sofa pushed against one wall with his feet propped up on the opposite wall.

title: Former Bank Executive in China Faces Bribe Accusations
description: HONG KONG  Chinas top anticorruption agency said on Monday that a former state bank executive faced accusations of pocketing huge bribes, making him the latest senior official to face charges during the new leaderships drive to show that it is attacking corruption.

title: Whos Escaping Climate Change Mire and Muck?
description: On This American Life this weekend, Ira Glass tried to jog the climate conversation out of the mire and muck with an hourlong discussion of impacts and options related to human-driven global warming. Below you can offer examples of people or institutions you see avoiding the pitfalls and paralysis surrounding this super wicked issue.

title: Goldman Sachs to Exit Chinese Bank With $1.1 Billion Stake Sale
description: Goldman Sachs plans to raise about $1.1 billion by selling its remaining stake in the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, ending its lucrative seven-year investment it what has grown to become the worlds biggest lender by market value.

title: A Long Night After a Short-Handed Goal
description: Its not like the N.H.L. needed to ratchet up the suspense in its playoffs, what with 17 overtime games stretching its first-round playoff games into the wee hours and several in the second round. But perhaps the hockey gods felt the need to liven up Sunday after the afternoons Bruins-Rangers snoozer and the N.B.A. playoff game between the Spurs and the Grizzlies, which was officially classified as a sleep aid. The gods also probably felt the need to remind everyone the Penguins and the Senators are playing a second-round series. (The Sens are from Ottawa, by the way. Canadas capital. Google maps can be helpful in this situation. And this being Canada, it is required to have a hockey team.) So, to get your attention, what better than two overtimes?

title: Image of the Day: May 20
Matilda Wins Big at Drama Desk Awards
description: The Broadway musical Matilda received five Drama Desk Awards on Sunday night, the most of any nominated show, winning for outstanding musical, featured actor (Bertie Carvel as Miss Trunchbull), lyrics, book and set design.

description: Dreaming Again Boeings embattled 787 Dreamliner, no longer grounded for safety concerns, returned to Americas airways today. (CNN)

title: The Coins in the Dark Puzzle
description: There are twenty-six coins lying on a table in a totally dark room. Ten are heads and sixteen are tails. In the dark you cannot feel or see if a coin is heads up or tails up but you may move them or turn any of them over. Separate the coins into two groups so that each group has the same number of coins heads up as the other group. (No tricks are involved.)

title: A Boutique Airline Hopes to Join the Jet Age
description: TORONTO  Travelers actually like flying on Porter Airlines. It could be the Canadian airlines formula of offering free premium beer and sandwiches, served by flight attendants in trim 1960s-era uniforms and, of course, the discounted tickets.

title: Segal Awards From Lincoln Center Go to Pianist and Actress
description: They are the first Martin E. Segal Awards without Martin E. Segal. Mr. Segal, Lincoln Centers former chairman, died in August at age 96. Yet the awards live on, and this years two winners are being honored Monday at a luncheon at the Stanley H. Kaplan Penthouse at Lincoln Center.

title: Tumblr Deal Was a Private Party, With Few Bankers Invited
description: How does a company put together the biggest social media deal in some time? In the case of Yahoo and its $1.1 billion takeover of Tumblr, it was not with an army of bankers.

title: Billboard Awards Red Carpet
description: On the red carpet at the Billboard Awards on Sunday night in Las Vegas, Taylor Swift arrived in a cut-out metallic dress, Madonna sported a garter belt and Kesha showed some side thigh.

title: Senate Panel, Getting Punchy on Immigration, Quits for the Night
description: 8:42 p.m. | Updated After a break for dinner and votes, the Senate Judiciary Committee moved onto Title II of the immigration overhaul bill, which deals with the path to citizenship for the 11 million undocumented immigrants already in the country.

title: Triple Play: Week 7 Results
description: The Giants built a 4-0 lead against the Rockies over the first two innings of their game last Friday, but Colorado responded with a run in the second, three in the third and five in the fifth and eventually hung on for a 10-9 victory.

description: OTTAWA  Jason Spezza made his much-anticipated return to the Ottawa lineup Sunday night in the Senators 2-1 double-overtime victory over Pittsburgh.

title: All the Rage | Toys for Boys at ICFF
description: The 25th installment of the International Contemporary Furniture Fair, the massive design trade show that runs through tomorrow at the Javits Convention Center in Manhattan, is a playground for bachelors (or would-be bachelors) with big pocketbooks. Its booths are awash in upscale, masculine, nostalgic furniture and accessories  less Sharper Image, more Lord Granthams study in Downton Abbey  with provenances ranging from Pennsylvania to Paris, Los Angeles to London, northern Italy to the Brooklyn Navy Yard. Scattered everywhere are accoutrements for esoteric gentlemanly pursuits like falconry, backgammon, whittling and spinning tops in leather, horsehair, Donegal tweed and hand-turned bronze. Theres a monolithic pool table made of concrete, gramophone-style speakers in steel-cast aluminum and white Baltic birch, even hand tools mounted and displayed like artwork in a frame. Low-slung, campaign-style chairs look perfect for poker night, leather-swathed folding chairs would be ideal for watching a rugby match from the sidelines, and the wingback chair seems made for kicking back with P.G. Wodehouse and a Scotch before bedtime. Even the vitrine  the traditional glass case for displaying specimens  is making a comeback, rendered in all shapes and finishes and with everything from cathode-ray tubes to shirt collars inside.

title: Maserati to Recall 7,400 Cars for Suspension Problem
description: Maserati will recall about 7,400 vehicles because a rear suspension failure can cause the driver to lose control, the automaker has informed the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration in a report posted over the weekend on the agencys Web site.

title: In China, Weighing Economic and Political Freedoms
description: As discussed in last weeks column, Chinas leadership is said to be making plans to unveil reforms at the next meeting of all members of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, likely to be held in October. Yet any policy changes may satisfy calls for deeper economic reforms but disappoint hopes for broader political reforms.

title: 4 Germs Cause Most of Infants Severe Diarrhea
description: Just four germs are responsible for most of the severe and fatal diarrhea among the worlds infants, according to a large new study.

title: Bulking Up Smoothies With Chia Seeds
description: Years ago, before the term super foods was a part of our lexicon, I would always add a handful of chia seeds to my whole-grain bread dough. I knew the seeds were high in protein (chia, like quinoa, has all of the essential amino acids), and in those days vegetarians were obsessed with proving that we could get enough protein from plant sources. I didnt use chia seeds in other recipes, and eventually I forgot about them, as did many others  except for the people who sprouted them in little terra cotta growers to create Chia Pets, a craze I happily missed.

title: NBC News Picks Leader to Steer Turnaround
description: Deborah Turness was the first person interviewed for the prestigious job at the top of NBC News earlier this year. It was a telephone interview, because Ms. Turness was in London, where she oversaw ITV News. The person on the other end, Patricia Fili-Krushel, was so impressed that she flew Ms. Turness to New York for a follow-up.

title: Video: Bill Cunninghams On the Street, Full Bloom
description: A focus of fashion is the length of the leg, seen in tights or just bare. In the Brooklyn Botanic Garden, the Japanese wisteria is natures version: more than three feet long at the height of its blossoming. And while there, dont forget the lilacs and azaleas.

title: Dining Calendar
description: Stags Leap Wine Cellars is teaming up with David Burke Kitchen, 23 Grand Street in SoHo, for a wine pairing dinner on Tuesday at 7 p.m. that will feature wines from Stags Napa Valley winery like the cabernet sauvignons that won the 1976 Paris Tasting. The four-course meal, at $150 per person, will feature several wines, hors doeuvres and dishes like sea scallops benedict. Steven Spadarotto, the vice president and general manager of Stags Leap, will be at the dinner to talk about the wine. Call (212) 201-9119 for reservations.

title: Camping Out for Five Days, in Hopes of a Union Job
description: The men began arriving last Wednesday, first a trickle, then dozens. By Friday there were hundreds of them, along with a few women.

title: Twin Bombings Kill 3 in Dagestan
description: MOSCOW  Twin car bombings in the capital of Russias volatile Dagestan republic on Monday killed three people and injured at least 44 more, most of them police officers, officials said.

title: Cisco: Big Data Is the Network, Too
description: John Chambers says the profits from Cisco Systems new strategy are still one to three years away. The strategy, however, is already becoming more clear: Big Data will only work if its delivered through the network, and that could go hand-in-hand with consolidation among companies that specialize in data analysis and networking or traditional computing.

title: The Battles of Vicksburg
description: The fall of Vicksburg, Miss., to forces under Gen. Ulysses S. Grant is remembered for the long, intensive siege that led up to it. But before the Union Army put a stranglehold on Vicksburg, Grant made two disastrous assaults on the city, on May 19 and 22.

title: The Book Stops Here
description: There wont be many book parties when the latest version of the American Psychiatric Associations official manual of mental disorders, known as the D.S.M.-5, rolls off the presses this week. Instead, the long-awaited guide has touched off a heated debate among psychiatrists about its scientific value and clinical usefulness.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: The Association of Music Producers, New York, presented its first AMP Awards for Music and Sound. The Best of Show award was won by Metamorphosis, an animated short for Good Books, an online bookseller, with music by Antfood, New York. Metamorphosis also shared the award for best use of music/sound for Web or interactive branding with Yessian, for Compilation, for Dream Bigger Dreams by Nick Cave. The association also announced the inaugural inductions into the Association of Music Producers Hall of Fame, the Coca-Cola Company and the McDonalds Corporation.

title: Group Says Deaths Show Problems Remain at Foxconn
description: SHANGHAI  Three Chinese employees at Foxconn, one of the worlds biggest contract electronics manufacturers, died in what were believed to be suicides in recent weeks, which a group that monitors labor conditions in China says is the latest indication that the company continues to be plagued by labor problems.

title: Senate Panel Asks I.R.S. Chief to Detail Communications With White House
description: If the Internal Revenue Service and the Obama administration thought the Senate Finance Committee and its Democratic leaders would offer something of a respite from the battering they have been taking from Congressional Republicans, they learned otherwise on Monday.

title: U.S. Takes Steps to Add Security at Embassies
description: WASHINGTON  By late this summer, the State Department plans to send dozens of additional diplomatic security agents to high-threat embassies, install millions of dollars of advanced fire-survival gear and surveillance cameras in those diplomatic posts, and improve training for employees headed to the riskiest missions.

title: Hobbes and Locke on the 6:13
description: The older I get, the more I am moved by civility. It can be commuters standing stoically and silently shoulder to shoulder on a rush hour subway. Or an Up escalator in Penn Station on a Monday morning full of tired, cranky people holding themselves at attention so as not to brush against the person rising in front of them. Or the woman at the cash register whom the salesman is just about to help, when she points at me and says, I think he was next.

title: Banana Wild Blueberry Smoothie With Chia Seeds
description: Because I use frozen organic wild blueberries for this, I dont need to add any ice cubes. Youll need to soak the chia seeds for several hours or overnight.

description: SAN FRANCISCO  Both Marissa Mayer, Yahoos chief executive, and David Karp, Tumblrs 26-year-old founder, reassured worried users on Monday that Yahoos deal to acquire Tumblr for $1.1 billion would allow the social networking site to operate as it is.

title: U.S. and Europe Prepare to Settle Chinese Solar Panel Cases
description: HONG KONG  The Obama administration and the European Union have each decided to negotiate settlements with China in the worlds largest antidumping and antisubsidy trade cases involving Chinas roughly $30 billion a year in solar panel shipments to the West, officials and trade advisers in Beijing, Brussels and Washington said.

title: Blackberry Lime Smoothie With Chia Seeds and Cashews
description: I love the flavor and color of blackberries in a smoothie, but I dont care for the seeds, which wont really blend, so I always strain my blackberry smoothies. Make more of the limeade than you need for the smoothie and keep in the refrigerator.

description: Leobardo Espinoza Jr., a high school senior in Kansas whose parents did not graduate from high school, expects to work harder and longer to compete with his Ivy League classmates this fall.

description: A nutritional energy bar is introducing a campaign that is intended to help give the brand more energy as well as those who consume it.

description: I love pineapple smoothies. In this one I use carrot juice for the liquid and it works beautifully, as its neither too sweet nor too acidic.

description: Arrested Development is returning, and people are going a little nuts.

title: Behind the Video Camera, an Avid Cook
description: Ze Frank has been known for years as a master at using videos to share stories and generate laughs on the Web, which is why BuzzFeed recently brought him in as an executive. Among his friends, though, he is known as an avid and ambitious home cook. Mr. Frank, 41, spoke by phone from Los Angeles, where he lives, about starting young in the kitchen and turning to a (mostly) vegan diet after a doctor told him his cholesterol was way too high.

title: Check In | Escape to Provence
description: Just in time to live out your South of France summer fantasies, the Domaine de la Baume, a luxurious 15-room hotel, opens in the Haut-Var region of Provence. The 18th-century manor was the home of the famed painter Bernard Buffet  who also happened to be Pierre Bergs lover before Berg met Yves Saint Laurent  until he died in 1999. Individually decorated rooms are furnished with a mix of antiques and painted wooden furniture; the propertys olive groves, apiary and fruit orchards supply the hotels gourmet restaurant; and theres an open-air spa, red-clay tennis courts and the same reliably stunning Provenal views that inspired the artist for years. Rooms from $570; domaine-delabaume.com.

title: A Plan to Bring Sun-Powered Irrigation to Poor Farmers
description: One of the finest applications of solar photovoltaic panels is in powering drip irrigation systems for farmers in hot, sunny, poor parts of the world. You dont even need to store the electricity. The pumping is mainly needed when the sun is shining.

title: Semi-Invisible Sources of Strength
description: My mother was a nurse, the old-fashioned kind without a college degree, first in the class of 1935 at the Lenox Hill Hospital School of Nursing in New York City. Her graduation was announced in The New York Times, and her name was listed in the commencement program  Estelle S. Murov, in gold letters on ivory vellum as the valedictory speaker, to be followed by the Florence Nightingale Pledge, presentation of prizes and diplomas, benediction, recessional and a reception and dance at the Hotel Astor.

title: Its His Job: Aaron Staton Dances Up a Storm on Mad Men
description: Is there anything Ken Cosgrove cant do? Since the earliest seasons of Mad Men, weve known that this executive, played by Aaron Staton, is a rising star in the advertising industry and an accomplished author of fiction whos had work published in The Atlantic Monthly. But Sundays episode of the AMC period drama revealed that Cosgrove, when filled up with something nice by a mysterious doctor who visits his office, is a pretty impressive dancer, too, and capable of performing an elaborate and angry tap dance for his colleague Don Draper (Jon Hamm) while repeating his now popular credo, Its my job.

title: Chesapeake Energy Names Successor to Ex-Chief
description: HOUSTON  Chesapeake Energy, the nations second-largest producer of natural gas, announced on Monday that a senior Anadarko Petroleum executive would become its chief executive next month.

title: Power and Protection in One Case

description: Ed Carpenter, whose family owns the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, qualified for the pole position for the Indianapolis 500 on May 26. The top qualifying position was worth a $100,000 prize, but Carpenter says the boost for his team, which he owns, was worth more.

description: Jos Mourinho, the petulant but prosperous Portuguese soccer coach who labeled himself the Special One, will leave Real Madrid at the end of the season and is widely expected to return to the West London powerhouse Chelsea for a second term.

title: After Flopping as a Ranger, Redden Is Back as a Bruin
description: BOSTON  He was a Ranger for only two disappointing seasons, and that was three years and three teams ago. One of those teams was in the American Hockey League. Wade Redden, an injured Boston Bruins defenseman, has yet to play against the Rangers in the teams Eastern Conference semifinal series, but he will be at Madison Square Garden for Game 3 Tuesday night.

title: Best Tool to Fight Childhood Obesity? Your Kitchen
description: In describing the many fronts in the war against obesity, Jane E. Brody, Wells Personal Health columnist, is drawn inexorably to one conclusion: the road to a slimmer waistline starts in the home kitchen (Many Fronts in Fighting Obesity).

title: Gunman Kills Four in a Bank in Southern Israel
description: An unemployed former security guard shot and killed four people in a bank in the southern Israeli city of Beersheba on Monday hours after the bank had refused his request for financial assistance, the police said. The gunman committed suicide after holing up in the bathroom of the bank with a female hostage for about an hour. The hostage escaped unharmed. The gunman, who lived nearby, had visited the bank in the morning and, according to the Israeli news media, found that his account had been blocked because of a debt. He returned later and killed the bank manager, his deputy and two clients. Random shootings of this kind are rare in Israel. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu described the event as a terrible tragedy, adding, I cannot remember such an incident, certainly not in recent years.

title: The Perfect Summer Beer May Be the Saison
description: For years, the American beer world has been in love with saisons: dry, fruity ales traditionally made by Belgian farmers in winter, then set aside for quenching thirst during hot summer days in the fields. But while most craft breweries have a saison beer in their rotation, and some even specialize in the style, it has yet to catch on with the general, I.P.A.-swilling public.

title: Still Charting Memorys Depths
description: MONTREAL  In many ways, the Obama administrations new plan to map the human brain has its origins in the work of Brenda Milner, the neuropsychologist whose detailed observations of an amnesia patient in the 1950s showed how memory is rooted in specific regions of the brain.

title: Dead Ingot Bounce
description: A couple of weeks ago I mentioned that I had been getting some grief from goldbugs, who were reveling in the fact that gold went up some after I wrote about its fading appeal. I expressed skepticism  as you always should after any short-term price movement, especially in an asset with as much emotional freight as gold  and suggested that it might be a dead ingot bounce. Hmmm:

title: Tornadoes Hit Four States in Midwest

description: David Wallis, contributor to Science Times, shares his wifes personal experience (broken nose by way of head butt) and advice so that other parents can avoid such injuries.

description: Marissa Mayer has made her mark on Yahoo in less than a year. Her $1.1 billion deal to buy blogging site Tumblr on Monday goes a long way to restoring the faded and vainglorious exclamation point to the companys name.

description: It was the stuff of cheap excitement and of headaches, of travel posters of beaches and bullfights, and of simpler times when Greenwich Village was a folk paradise and when Spanish food meant garlic and shrimp rather than laboratory gastronomy.

description: ALBANY  For other politicians, the past week would have been fatal. But not for the New York State Assembly speaker, Sheldon Silver.

title: A Moderated Mojito
description: I tend to prefer cocktails that follow classic recipes. But on a recent trip to southern Utah, I happily sipped a moderated mojito at Red Mountain Resort, which does not serve spirits, only beer and wine. The rum in this rendition had been swapped for sauvignon blanc. The general manager, Tracey Welsh, explained: Our inspiration was to offer a lower alcohol content in cocktail favorites our guests love, allowing them to wake up feeling refreshed the next day, and ready to go for early morning hikes. Thats providing you can drink just one.

title: An Amaro Cocktail as Fresh as a Breeze
description: Dont you just love amari, those bittersweet Italian liqueurs like Cynar and Aperol that are so popular now?

title: Chilled Espresso, Shaken to a Froth
description: There isnt much to the shakerato: a shot of espresso poured over ice cubes and simple syrup, then shaken. But when those three elements are rattled around in a cocktail shaker for what seems like an eternity (it actually clocks in at 15 seconds), they undergo an alchemical transformation: the dense espresso, now frothy, sweet and flecked with ice, is as refreshing as it is flavorful.

title: The King of Sherry Cocktails
description: There is a renewed interest these days in sherry, not least among bartenders, who are creating cocktails at a breakneck pace using various expressions of the fortified wine. This has produced some liquid gems, particularly those drinks that capitalize on sherrys reliable affinity with the agave spirits tequila and mezcal.

title: Say Yes to the Bellini
description: Lets say youre hosting a summer fiesta. You want your guests to waltz into the backyard and find something more than chilled Sancerre and a tub full of beer bottles and ice.

title: Give the Margarita a Rest
description: A few years ago, a friend returned from a trip to Mexico imploring anyone who would listen to give the margarita a rest and drink a Paloma instead. In its most elemental form, the Paloma is tequila and grapefruit soda (preferably Squirt), maybe with a splash of lime juice. Thats a good drink. But for all his evangelical zeal, my friend had a hard time finding Squirt in his Brooklyn neighborhood. He was willing to let go of authenticity, and let me make him a Paloma with fresh grapefruit juice, a little simple syrup and soda water instead.

title: There Just Has to Be a Scandal  Somewhere
description: The American public, Greg Sargent pointed out this morning, does not find a presidential scandal in either the Benghazi talking points or the Internal Revenue Services targeting of right-wing groups seeking a tax-exempt and disclosure-free status.

title: For a Warm Day, a Young Whiskey
description: For many people, whiskey and warm weather dont mix: peat, sherry, smoke and caramel arent exactly thirst-quenching flavors. But not all whiskeys are created equal, and some are sufficiently light and refreshing to stand alongside gin or vodka in a summertime bar.

title: The Negronis Lighter, Saner Progenitor
description: The Negroni is enjoying a moment now. For bartenders and barflies, this deliciously complex mix of Campari, gin and sweet vermouth has become an easy way to fly ones flag as a knowing cocktail classicist. But the drinks rising profile has cast a shadow over its once-popular progenitor, the Americano. Without this refreshing Italian-born highball  Campari, sweet vermouth and club soda  there would have been no blueprint for the gin-loving Count Camillo Negroni to experiment with a century ago. (The drinks family line actually goes back even farther; the Americano grew out of a simpler aperitif that omitted the soda, called the Milano-Torino  Milano in honor of the birthplace of Campari, Torino for the vermouth.)

title: A Link to Ears of Early Humans
description: Our very early ancestors possessed bones in the middle ear very similar to those of modern humans, researchers are reporting. The finding suggests that hearing sensitivity is one of the oldest features of human evolution.

title: Wine and Cola? It Works
description: Some might consider the kalimotxo (pronounced cal-ee-MO-cho) a guilty pleasure; Ive received more than a few skeptical glances when Ive ordered it at bars in New York. But I dont feel an iota of contrition when I drink this Basque-country classic. It couldnt be easier: equal parts red wine (some say the cheaper the better, but thats up to you) and cola. I like a squeeze of lemon juice for a little brightness, and maybe a slice of lemon or orange to dress it up. But purists might consider even those modest additions a little fussy. The overall effect is surprisingly sangria-esque, minus all that fruit-chopping and waiting, and wonderfully refreshing.

title: Waiter, Theres a Cocktail in My Soup
description: A while ago, struck by how similar a tomato-based gazpacho was to a Bloody Mary mix, I added vodka to the soup. Voil: a chilled cocktail and summery first course in one.

title: Americano: An Italian-Born Highball
description: Made with Campari, sweet vermouth and soda, the Americano is a light summertime drink.

title: Tips on Avoiding Phishing Frauds
description: I consider myself fairly cautious about Internet security, but I was still nearly caught off guard by a phishing effort aimed at me a couple of years ago.

title: When Place Is Not Enough
description: My Sunday columninvoked Rod Drehers new book, The Little Way of Ruthie Leming, while trying to tease out some issues surrounding loneliness and community in America, and particularly the possible link between Americans weakening social ties and our slowly rising suicide rate. Readers interested in these questions should also check outDamon Linkers recent column on Little Way, which puts Drehers book in the context of a broader intellectual tendency on the post-Bush, post-Great Recession right:

title: Bringing a Couple of Senses Into Sync
description: Look and Listen is the title of a festival of new music performed in art galleries that kicked off its 12th season with a concert at the Pratt Manhattan Gallery on Friday evening. But during a performance of Lewis Nielsons piece Le Journal du Corps by the intrepid JACK quartet, I found myself compulsively engaged in a third activity: labeling.

title: Apple Stores Are Bringing In More Money Per Visitor Than Ever
description: Apples stock has takena brutal beating since last year, but the companys retail stores are bringing in more money per visitor than ever. It is just another example of how challenging it has become for the most successful company in the technology industry to impress Wall Street.

title: The Military That Was Only for Show
description: World War II has provided an endless number of true stories in recent years, as greatest-generation appreciation has come into vogue, and we have perhaps grown to expect a certain rhythm in these accounts. A mission accomplished amid much bravery and loss. Memories of horror and heroism carried silently for decades.

title: Obama to Visit Sub-Saharan Africa in June
description: President Obama will make a weeklong trip to Africa this summer, the longest journey of his presidency so far to the continent of his fathers family, the White House announced on Monday.

title: Oyster Shells Are an Antacid to the Oceans
description: How does the Chesapeake Bay spell relief? O-Y-S-T-E-R-S, a new study finds.

title: A Genre, Old and Irish, Is Renewed
description: Early vocal music like Gregorian chant often uses a melismatic style, in which a single syllable of text is sung between successive notes. Arabic, fado, flamenco and Balkan genres are also rooted in melisma, as is sean-nos, which translates as old style. A highly ornamented, unaccompanied Irish idiom, it has been passed down orally through generations.

title: Senate Panel Is Expected to Castigate Apple on Tax Tactics
description: Members of the United States Senate are expected to sharply criticize Apples global tax tactics while questioning the companys chief executive, Timothy D. Cook, at a Congressional hearing on Tuesday.

title: From Dean Martins Crooning to Techno Sprockets in Four Steps
description: Finding a balance between individual and group expression is important for any dance troupe. But for repertory companies, which lack the cohesive vision of a single choreographer, the challenge is especially acute. In the first of two programs that Hubbard Street Dance Chicago is performing at the Joyce Theater, four works by different choreographers explore this tension in ways both distinct and dispiritingly similar.

title: Pictures of the Day: Iraq and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Iraq, Lebanon, Afghanistan and Virginia.

title: Bloggers Just Wanna Have Fun
description: The announcement today that Yahoo would acquire Tumblr, the blogging tool and social network, for $1.1 billion, raises once again a familiar Internet-era question of how something that generates no profits can be worth so much. And the specific question of how Tumblr might translate page views into cash was central to Rob Walkers profile of David Karp, Tumblrs founder, for the magazine last year.

title: The Theory of Interstellar Finance
description: The theory of interstellar trade is a well-understood topic, with an extensive literature consisting of one paper (pdf) I wrote in 1978. Interstellar finance, however, is less well covered.

title: That Corner Spot? Its Perfect for a Concert
description: Hardings, a cozy Flatiron district restaurant handsomely appointed in Americana and offering an inventive menu to match, was abuzz on Sunday evening, its dining room filled with the lively sound of customers mingling over glasses of wine. At 20 minutes after 8, a hostess tapped a glass for attention as a pianist, a violinist and a cellist settled into a corner niche to perform.

title: Apples Web of Tax Shelters Saved It Billions, Panel Finds
description: WASHINGTON  Even as Apple became the nations most profitable technology company, it avoided billions in taxes in the United States and around the world through a web of subsidiaries so complex it spanned continents and went beyond anything most experts had ever seen, Congressional investigators disclosed on Monday.

title: Younger Children Seek an Acne Cure
description: If your 10-year-old has acne, rest assured he or she is not alone. According to treatment guidelines published this month in the journal Pediatrics, acne is common in children ages 7 to 12.

title: Financial Firms Said to Seek Alternative to Bloomberg Chat
description: Nine Wall Street firms have been actively involved in creating an alternative to one of Bloomberg L.P.s most widely used programs, its chat messaging network, people briefed on the effort said.

title: Pain Can Make Them Feel Alive
description: There are so many meant-to-shock moments in White Hot  a pregnant woman punching herself in the face, repeatedly, and a description of agonizing, bloody sex are just two  that tedium soon replaces repulsion. Thats probably what the playwright, Tommy Smith, was after. But some of that energy would certainly have been better used to create an absorbing scene or the semblance of a plot.

title: Punched and Poked by Their Pride and Joy
description: When Carter Roberts was 2, he gripped a Matchbox car and, mimicking the Kung Fu Panda, whacked his mother, Sarah Rosengarten, across the face. Ms. Rosengarten, 27, wound up at the local emergency room, where doctors diagnosed a hairline fracture of the jaw.

title: To Be a Nurse, Injury by Child, Acne Before Age 10
description: A review of a new book, written by nurses on nursing; the sometime dangers of having small children; pimples arent just for middle school anymore.

title: Yahoo Getting Space at Old Home of The Times
description: New media is replacing old in Times Square.

title: Kepler Telescopes Troubles, a Maya Pyramid in Ruins and More
description: The Kepler Space Telescope is 40 million miles from Earth, which makes sending a repairman difficult. Unlike the Hubble telescope, which was designed to be serviced by astronauts, Kepler was meant to live far from Earth, well beyond a wrenchs reach. And its Pauline-like peril and uncertain future lent some drama to this weeks scientific doings.

title: R.O.T.C. Returns to New Yorks City College More Than Four Decades After Removal
description: When I attended City College a few years ago and spoke with college officials about bringing back the Reserve Officer Training Corps, or R.O.T.C., they dismissed the idea as impossible. The wounds from those wild days during the Vietnam War were still too raw. But in an afternoon ceremony on Tuesday that Colin Powell  the former secretary of state and retired four-star general who happens to be a City College graduate  is expected to attend, Army R.O.T.C. will be welcomed back to the City University of New York, with its headquarters at City College.

title: White House Says It Didnt Loop Obama In on I.R.S. Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  White House officials were first notified on April 16 about an investigation into Internal Revenue Service scrutiny of conservative groups and discussed its potential findings with the Treasury Department but never told President Obama, the White House said Monday.

title: Vast Oklahoma Tornado Kills Dozens
description: MOORE, Okla.  A giant tornado, a mile wide or more, killed at least 91 people, 20 of them children, as it tore across parts of Oklahoma City and its suburbs Monday afternoon, flattening homes, flinging cars through the air and crushing at least two schools.

title: Whats a Bloomberg?
description: A short primer on what these number-crunching machines do, and why they have been at the center of controversy.

title: Flywheel
description: Reaction wheels like the ones that NASA officials say have failed aboard the Kepler spacecraft, effectively ending its mission to detect potentially habitable planets outside the solar system, are simple devices, at least in concept. But making ones that can survive the rigors of a rocket launching and then spin for a long time to keep a spacecraft properly oriented  in Keplers case, to keep its telescope precisely pointed at the same field of stars  is difficult.

title: Photo Replay: May 20
description: A view of the day in sports, including the final of the Swiss Cup, the World Table Tennis Championships and major league baseball.

title: Met Opera Dismantles Its Ballet in Buyouts
description: The Metropolitan Opera has decided to disband its resident ballet company, whose roots date back to the operas founding in 1883. The 8 remaining dancers of the Metropolitan Opera Ballet, down from 16 in 2011, have accepted buyout packages and left the company, their union confirmed on Monday.

title: Solving a Riddle of Primes
description: Three and five are prime numbers  that is, they are divisible only by 1 and by themselves. So are 5 and 7. And 11 and 13. And for each of these pairs of prime numbers, the difference is 2.

title: Somber Tunes, Off-Kilter Beats
description: Serenity isnt all that serene for the National on the bands sixth album, Trouble Will Find Me (4AD). Its the plushest, most burnished album from a New York City band that has increasingly leaned toward the measured and stately. This time, the National utterly refuses to buttonhole listeners; the music calmly awaits attention, but amply repays it.

title: No Easy Choices on Breast Reconstruction
description: By almost any measure, Roseann Vallettis reconstructive breast surgery was a success. Although it was a protracted process, involving some pain and a nightmarish nipple replacement, she is pleased with how she looks.

title: A Ruling Could Support F.C.C.s Net Neutrality Defense
description: The Federal Communications Commissions high-profile attempt to defend its net neutrality rules against a court challenge got major support on Monday from the Supreme Court, which ruled in a separate case that regulatory agencies should usually be granted deference in interpreting their own jurisdictions.

title: In Performance: Audra McDonald
description: The singer Audra McDonald accompanies herself on piano to Adam Guettels Migratory V, a song from her new album, Go Back Home.

title: Ray Manzarek, Doors Keyboardist, Dies at 74
description: Ray Manzarek, the keyboardist and a founding member of the Doors whose sinuous and melodic organ riffs defined the bands sound, died on Monday afternoon at a clinic in Rosenheim, Germany, after a bout with cancer. He was 74.

title: In Performance: At Home With Audra McDonald
description: 5:59 p.m. | Updated  Its a busy month for Audra McDonald. On May 9 she performed at Avery Fisher Hall for Lincoln Centers spring gala. On Tuesday her first solo album in seven years  Go Back Home, with songs by John Kander and Fred Ebb, Stephen Sondheim, Adam Gwon and other composers  is being released. On Friday she hosts Audra McDonald in Concert: Go Back Home, a broadcast of her Avery Fisher performance, for Live From Lincoln Center.

title: Bronx Tour Company Drops Pitch to See a Real Ghetto
description: A company called Real Bronx Tours is no longer offering adventurous visitors to New York a ride through a real New York City GHETTO  at least on its Web site.

title: So Powerful, It Stands in for Sound and Light
description: They could almost be dancing for one another, these kids, on the street, in a club. Except that their circle is open at the front and they face outward, performing for spectators. Each gets a turn in the middle, and at first what they do isnt that impressive. But it builds, and soon enough the dancers are balancing on their heads with legs like angular sculptures, swinging their arms like nunchucks, creating strobe-light effects without strobe lights  inspiring awe.

title: Business Trip Becomes an Obstacle Course, and an Object Lesson
description: I HAVE really good travel karma, Carol Margolis said. Well, almost all the time.

title: The Dark Side of Liberation
description: The soldiers who landed in Normandy on D-Day were greeted as liberators, but by the time American G.I.s were headed back home in late 1945, many French citizens viewed them in a very different light.

title: Apples Tax Avoidance Strategies
description: The Timess Charles Duhigg on the financial practices of Apple and a corporate culture that pushed for great innovation, in both products and tax strategies.

title: Japans New Optimism Has Name: Abenomics
description: TOKYO  After years of grinding malaise, Japan suddenly has some of its bling back.

title: Siblings Haunted by the Past, and by Afghanistans Cycle of Misery
description: Khaled Hosseinis new novel, And the Mountains Echoed, may have the most awkward title in his body of work, but its his most assured and emotionally gripping story yet, more fluent and ambitious than The Kite Runner (2003), more narratively complex than A Thousand Splendid Suns (2007).

title: Italys Petri Dish for New Path
description: PARMA, Italy  The Five Star Movement of Beppe Grillo, the comedian turned political insurrectionist, won municipal elections a year ago in this small northern city by campaigning on a platform of change, transparency and popular participation in decision-making, much as it had elsewhere in Italy.

title: White House Sets U.S.-China Summit for California in June
description: President Obama plans to meet President Xi Jinping of China next month for the first time since Mr. Xis installation as the leader of the worlds most populous nation, as the two leaders try to establish a working relationship on critical issues like North Korea, the global economy and allegations of state-sponsored cyber attacks, the White House announced on Monday.

title: New Research Tools Kick Up Dust in Archives
description: Seated recently in the special collections room at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology library, Anders Fernstedt raced through an imposing set of yellowing articles and correspondence.

title: In 1949, He Imagined an Age of Robots
description: It was a vision that never saw the light of day.

title: The Passengers Arent Smoking. Its a Camp Stove.
description: IT seems that Ive been flying forever. Most of my business trips are to establish new relationships for Elevation Burger and to make sure the franchises we have are going well.

title: Boruch Spiegel, Fighter in Warsaw Ghetto Uprising, Dies at 93
description: Boruch Spiegel, one of the last surviving fighters of the Warsaw ghetto uprising of 1943, in which a vastly outgunned band of 750 young Jews held off German soldiers for more than a month with crude arms and firebombs, died on May 9 in Montreal. He was 93.

title: Bruce Weber and Kathleen Turner on Becoming Mentors
description: Interview Excerpts: Bruce Weber and Kathleen Turner

title: Barbara Brenner, Breast Cancer Iconoclast, Dies at 61
description: Barbara Brenner, who led the group Breast Cancer Action and shaped it in her own combative image, pillorying the medical establishment, industrial polluters and even other cancer research advocates, died on May 10 at her home in San Francisco. She was 61.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,206 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Lothar Schmid, Chess Referee of the Match of the Century, Dies at 85
description: Lothar Schmid, a German chess grandmaster who was the referee for three of the most contentious World Chess Championship matches ever played, including the volatile 1972 contest between Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky, which he may have saved by negotiating a truce just as it seemed they were both about to quit,  died on Saturday in Bamberg, Germany. He was 85.

title: Assessing the Damage Along the Tornados Path in Oklahoma
description: Map of the buildings that were severely damaged or destroyed.

title: Hughes Does Best to Look Ahead After Disastrous Start
description: BALTIMORE  In the immediate aftermath of his most recent outing for the Yankees, Phil Hughes anticipated that he would have a tough time sleeping for a couple of nights. Sure enough, after he gave up seven runs in two-thirds of an inning against the Seattle Mariners last Wednesday, Hughes tossed and turned.

title: Businessman Linked by U.S. to Hezbollah Is Arrested in Brazil in a Fraud Scheme
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The Brazilian police have arrested a businessman listed by the United States as a member of Hezbollah, the powerful Lebanese militant group, under suspicion of operating a fraudulent scheme in the clothing industry  a far cry from the arms, drugs, explosives and counterfeit bills that American officials have suspected him of trafficking in during the past.

title: Common Gnomes Pop Up at Rarefied Flower Show, to Horror of Many
description: LONDON  To people in the world of British gardening, the announcement was as startling as if the authorities at Wimbledon had suddenly decreed that players could compete in cutoffs and sequined tank tops.

title: Live Video Coverage From KFOR-TV in Oklahoma City
description: KFOR-TV in Oklahoma City is streaming live coverage online in the aftermath of the deadly tornado that struck Monday afternoon in Moore, Okla.

title: SAC Capital Aims to Stem Withdrawal Requests
description: The embattled hedge fund SAC Capital Advisors is bracing itself for another round of withdrawal requests from investors after disclosing that it would no longer fully cooperate with the governments scrutiny of its trading practices.

title: Brooklyn Academy of Music Announces Next Wave Lineup
description: The 2013 lineup for the 31st Next Wave Festival, with 34 productions in dance, music, theater and opera running Sept. 17-Dec. 22 at the Brooklyn Academy of Music, is to be announced Tuesday. The highlights in theater this season include The Blue Dragon, by Marie Michaud and Robert Lepage and running Sept. 18-21 at the Harvey Theater. Directed by Mr. Lepage, who also stars in the production, it is the sequel to The Dragons Trilogy, about the life of an art dealer.

title: The Tax Costs for Tumblrs Owners
description: Yahoos acquisition of Tumblr will be structured with substantially all of the $1.1 billion deal consideration offered in cash.

title: E.R.s Account for Half of Hospital Admissions, Study Says
description: Emergency rooms account for about half of the nations hospital admissions and accounted for virtually all of the rise in admissions between 2003 and 2009, according to a study released on Monday.

title: Complete Text of Israels Report on the Muhammad al-Dura Video
description: As my colleague Isabel Kershner reported, an Israeli government review panel asserted on Sunday that a French television report broadcast in 2000, which appeared to show the death of a 12-year-old Palestinian boy named Muhammad al-Dura during clashes in Gaza, was so deeply flawed that it was possible that the boy had been neither shot nor killed during the incident.

title: Knicks Offer a Blunt Assessment of What Went Wrong
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The youngest player on the N.B.A.s oldest team offered the bluntest assessment of a season that ended too soon.

title: Aiming Autism Ads at Hispanic and African-American Parents
description: AUTISM Speaks, the autism and science advocacy organization, this week is introducing a new public service advertising campaign aimed at Hispanic and African-American parents.

title: Egypt Sends Show of Force to Sinai After Kidnappings
description: CAIRO  President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt sent dozens of tanks and hundreds of soldiers to Sinai on Monday as a show of force in the largely lawless area after unknown gunmen kidnapped seven Egyptian security officers there last week.

title: U.S. Attorney in Phone Leaks Has Seen Both Sides
description: Last weeks disclosure by Ronald C. Machen Jr., the United States attorney for the District of Columbia, that his office had secretly seized telephone records of Associated Press reporters as part of a leak investigation surprised and shocked many people.

title: Polling Group in Russia Says It May Close
description: MOSCOW  In recent years, when public opinion turned against the Kremlin, there was one main way to find out about it  the Levada Center, a respected group of sociologists who broke off their relationship with Vladimir V. Putins administration and set up the countrys only independent polling agency.

title: Church Whistle-Blowers Join Forces on Abuse
description: They call themselves Catholic Whistleblowers, a newly formed cadre of priests and nuns who say the Roman Catholic Church is still protecting sexual predators.

title: Obama Couples Praise for Burmese Leader With Warning Against Violence
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama encouraged the wave of reform that has transformed the onetime pariah state of Myanmar into an emerging touchstone of change in Asia, but pointedly warned the countrys visiting leader on Monday that violence against minority Muslims needs to stop.

title: A Premier League Travel Primer
description: A view of what to expect, and prepare for, if you attend a English Premier League game.

title: United Joins in Grounded Dreamliners Return to the Skies
description: After being grounded by battery problems since mid-January, Boeings 787 Dreamliner returned to service in the United States on Monday with a nearly full flight of passengers from Houston to Chicago.

title: But Wait. Didnt Yahoo Try a Deal Like This Before?
description: When Yahoo announced its headline-grabbing acquisition, it boasted that the deal gave it access to an unduplicated audience of users and that its target was a popular personal publishing platform.

title: Applying Early Lessons to Build Afghan Security
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  As a young Army Green Beret major in December 2001, Don Bolduc fought shoulder to shoulder in an offensive against Kandahar, the Talibans spiritual capital, with a little-known Pashtun resistance commander named Hamid Karzai.

title: Immigration Officials Say Safeguards Were Added
description: Department of Homeland Security officials, responding to sharp criticism on Monday from a union representing 12,000 of its employees, said they had added many safeguards in recent years to protect against fraud and security violations by foreigners seeking to live in the United States.

title: Cul-de-Sac Poverty
description: WASHINGTON  LONG before Robert F. Kennedy toured Appalachia and the Mississippi Delta in 1964, before Jimmy Carter walked through the South Bronx in 1977, Americans thought of poverty as synonymous with inner cities and rural hinterlands.

title: The Outrageous Cost of a Gene Test
description: LOS ANGELES  ANGELINA JOLIES revelation that she had had a preventive double mastectomy was eloquent and brave. She had learned that she inherited a faulty copy of a gene, BRCA1, that put her at high risk for invasive breast cancer as well as ovarian cancer. Now women everywhere are asking: Should I get the same test? What will it cost?

title: Stop the Leaks
description: WASHINGTON  FOLLOWING the disclosure that the Justice Department obtained the telephone records of Associated Press journalists, The A.P. and other news organizations have sharply criticized the action as investigative overreaching and unwarranted interference with the ability of journalists to report on government operations.

title: What Our Words Tell Us
description: About two years ago, the folks at Google released a database of 5.2 million books published between 1500 and 2008. You can type a search word into the database and find out how frequently different words were used at different epochs.

title: One Schools Catholic Teaching
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  No one at the Catholic high school that fired Carla Hale in March claimed that she was anything less than a terrific physical education teacher and coach, devoted to the kids and adored by many of them.

title: A Guide for Game Hunting in Englands Premier League
description: NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE, England  The Newcastle versus Liverpool match was about to start, and the police officer at the gate was providing advice for those sitting in the away section, amid several thousand tanked-up Liverpool fans.

title: State Dept. Report Says Countries Have Repressed Religious Freedom With Laws
description: WASHINGTON  Countries around the world, including allies of the United States, have used laws on blasphemy and apostasy to suppress political opponents, the State Department said on Monday in an annual report chronicling a grim decline in religious freedom that has resulted in rising bigotry and sectarian violence.

title: Ex-U.S. Attorney in Arizona Is Criticized for Leak to Fox
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Departments independent inspector general on Monday criticized a former top federal prosecutor in Arizona, Dennis K. Burke, for leaking to Fox News a document in June 2011 about a federal agent who was raising alarms about the gun trafficking investigation known as Operation Fast and Furious. He called the prosecutors actions particularly egregious misconduct that was wholly unbefitting a U.S. attorney.

title: Bin Ladens Son-in-Law Seeks a New Lawyer, but Theres a Snag
description: When a high-profile defendant in a terrorism case appeared last week before a federal judge in Manhattan, it seemed as if the entire bar association was there to represent him.

title: There Was a Time When Ending Hunger Was a National Goal for Republicans and Democrats
description: That hunger and malnutrition should persist in a land such as ours is embarrassing and intolerable. So declared Richard Nixon in May 1969 in his now widely forgotten Special Message to the Congress Recommending a Program to End Hunger in America. In that document, he summoned the country to a new level of generosity and concern and laid out a series of strong legislative steps and executive actions, including a significant expansion of the food-stamps program.

title: Tornado Leaves a Trail of Destruction in Oklahoma
description: A monstrous tornado, a mile wide or more, tore through towns near Oklahoma City on Monday.

title: No Public Office for Vito Lopez
description: Vito Lopez, formally accused last week of groping and abusing young women on his staff, resigned from his Assembly seat early Monday morning. That is a relief. But Mr. Lopez is still threatening to run for City Council in Brooklyn and has raised almost $40,000 in contributions to begin a campaign. Brooklyns residents and the citys taxpayers deserve far better and should demand his immediate withdrawal.

title: A Flashy Bet for Yahoo on a Shift in Social Media
description: Yahoos $1.1 billion proposed acquisition of Tumblr is a huge coup for the young founder of the even younger start-up and a splashy move by Marissa Mayer to shake up her company.

title: Before Tumblr, Founder Made Mom Proud. He Quit School.
description: When David Karp was 14, he was clearly a bright teenager. Quiet, somewhat reclusive, bored with his classes at the Bronx High School of Science. He spent most of his free time in his bedroom, glued to his computer.

title: Why Is Russia Still Arming Syria?
description: The slim hope generated two weeks ago when the United States and Russia announced plans for an international conference aimed at ending Syrias increasingly virulent civil war is fast fading  and Russia is a big reason. Instead of using its leverage as Syrias enabler and defender to move President Bashar al-Assad toward a negotiated solution, Russia recently sent him advanced antiship cruise missiles, and there is fresh talk now of advanced A-300 air defense weapons. The Russians have also augmented their naval presence in the region.

title: Where the Mets Can Start Rebuilding
description: The Mets spent much of last winter insisting, in the words of General Manager Sandy Alderson, that they were not punting on the 2013 season. He had to say it, because admitting the obvious would have been demoralizing for fans and players. But actions told the truth.

title: Veteran Senator Emerges as Player on Immigration Overhaul
description: WASHINGTON  As proponents of a new immigration overhaul cast about for a Republican ally to help give their bill an extra boost, they have focused on a 79-year-old lawmaker with new hipster glasses (from Costco), black Nike sneakers (for his bad arches) and, perhaps most important, a deep and complicated relationship with immigration policy: Senator Orrin G. Hatch of Utah.

title: New Efforts to Undercut Health Reforms
description: Congressional Republicans are trying to exploit two controversies bedeviling the Obama administration to undermine the health care reform law. They are using an uproar over misguided tactics by Internal Revenue Service employees to target conservative political groups seeking tax-exempt status as an excuse to prohibit the agency from playing a pivotal role in carrying out the Affordable Care Act. And they want to use a controversy over efforts by the secretary of health and human services, Kathleen Sebelius, to encourage private donations to help enroll people in new health care exchanges as a cudgel to disrupt such efforts.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, May 21, 2013
description: There is a technical term economists like to use for behavior like this. Unbelievable chutzpah.

title: Overruns Forcing Lower Payments to Some Providers in Stopgap Health Program
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said Monday that it was cutting payments to doctors and hospitals after finding that cost overruns are threatening to use up the money available in a health insurance program for people with cancer, heart disease and other serious illnesses.

title: Ray Manzarek, 74, Keyboardist and a Founder of the Doors, Is Dead
description: Ray Manzarek, who as the keyboardist and a songwriter for the Doors helped shape one of the indelible bands of the psychedelic era, died on Monday at a clinic in Rosenheim, Germany. He was 74.

title: In England, Police Tactics Aim to Stop Trouble Before It Starts
description: LONDON  Changes in fans attitudes and the way stadiums are configured and managed have all contributed to the decrease in violence and mayhem around English soccer in the last 20 years. But perhaps the biggest change has come in the way the sport is policed.

title: A Race of Firsts for Los Angeles Voters, but Many Seem to Take It in Stride
description: LOS ANGELES  Voters in the nations second-largest city will go to the polls Tuesday to elect a new mayor in an election that will inevitably result in a milestone: either the first woman or first Jew elected to the top city post.

title: Rangers Hope Game 3 Is Again a Turning Point
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The Rangers will attempt what no N.H.L. team has ever done: rally from a second straight 2-0 series deficit to advance in the Stanley Cup playoffs. Nevertheless, Coach John Tortorella seems encouraged.

title: Corrections: May 21, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Raising Towers and Wrestling Demons
description: Halvard Solness, the driven title character in Ibsens 1892 drama, The Master Builder, might well approve of the forests of glittering towers sprouting all over Manhattan these days, those skinny glass boxes housing luxury condos by the hundreds. The man devoted much of his life to building homes for families, after all, although hedge fund managers were obviously not among his clients in 19th-century Norway. And he was obsessed with adorning his own home with a sky-stabbing spire, an accusatory finger calling God to account for his failings.

title: Whats On Tuesday
description: 7 P.M. (HBO) MOONRISE KINGDOM (2012) In this storybook tale from Wes Anderson, the 12-year-old Suzy (Kara Hayward) and her soul mate, Sam (Jared Gilman), fall in love and run off, while still on an island, sending the adults in charge  Suzys parents (the Bishops, played by Bill Murray and Frances McDormand); Scout Master Ward (Edward Norton, above center); and Captain Sharp (Bruce Willis)  into a panic as a violent storm approaches. Written by Mr. Anderson and Roman Coppola (they worked together several times before), Moonrise Kingdom breezes along with a beautifully coordinated admixture of droll humor, deadpan and slapstick, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times. But, she added, as in all of Mr. Andersons films, theres a deep, pervasive melancholia here too, a sense of regret evident in Mr. Bishops slouch (with his plaid pants, he is a walking John Cheever tragedy) and in the way Captain Sharp and Mrs. Bishop look, and dont look, at each other. Adulthood can seem so desperately painful, so maybe Sam and Suzy shouldnt be quite as eager to grow up. Still, Ms. Dargis said: Sam and Suzy, while their story has the charms of a fairy tale and some of its terrors, arent playing at love. They are in love, and that is the most real thing in the world. Mr. Anderson and Mr. Coppola earned an Oscar nomination for best original screenplay.

title: Why Rational People Buy Into Conspiracy Theories
description: In the days following the bombings at the Boston Marathon, speculation online regarding the identity and motive of the unknown perpetrator or perpetrators was rampant. And once the Tsarnaev brothers were identified and the manhunt came to a close, the speculation didnt cease. It took a new form. A sampling: Maybe the brothers Tsarnaev were just patsies, fall guys set up to take the heat for a mysterious Saudi with high-level connections; or maybe they were innocent, but instead of the Saudis, the actual bomber had acted on behalf of a rogue branch of our own government; or what if the Tsarnaevs were behind the attacks, but were secretly working for a larger organization?

Should it also be legal for recreational use for consumers who are 21 and over, as Washington and Colorado have allowed? Mr. Obamas Rasmussen Reports approval rating was 48 percent, not much changed from an average of 50 percent in April. Mr. Obamas approval rating in a CNN poll published on Sunday was 53 percent, little different from 51 percent in their April survey. And in a Washington Post-ABC News poll, Mr. Obamas approval rating was 51 percent, essentially unchanged from 50 percent in April.

But Jonathan Greene, a data miner at a company called Acme Informatics, recently wrote to tell us that he took a selection of Gun Report entries and created a word cloud. This is a text graphic in which words that appear more frequently are given greater prominence. Mr. Greene designed his cloud by hand, extracting different parts of speech and determining frequencies for each adjective. In his version, dead and early appear most prominently.

Because no matter how well it will scale down on TV, this exploration of sex, lies and bigger-than-life celebrity deserves to be seen on a bigger-than-life screen, which is how the first press audience saw it Tuesday morning at the Cannes Film Festival, where its in the main competition. As the final piano notes tinkled over the end credits, the audience clapped when Mr. Soderberghs name appeared, only to applaud louder when Michael Douglass did.

title: The Richness of Soft-Shell Crabs Calls for Chardonnay
description: Its hard to be analytical when youre salivating with anticipation. Luckily, these soft-shell crabs dont require much thinking. The richness of the crab, combined with the butter, lemon and the nuts (mmmm), screams out for chardonnay, the kind with body, richness, lively acidity and minimal oak. More and more California chardonnays from Santa Barbara and the Sonoma Coast are expressing this sort of energy. A Meursault or a good premier cru Chablis would be lovely.

title: The Civil Wars Oratorical Wunderkind
description: Early in 1863, faced with a series of state elections that threatened to undermine support for the war, Republican party leaders unleashed an unexpected political weapon: a 20-year-old Quaker named Anna Dickinson. For eight weeks, Dickinson barnstormed across New England, speaking nearly every night on behalf of Republican candidates. The young woman who couldnt legally cast a ballot anywhere in the United States quickly proved herself adept at swaying elections.

title: Pain Relievers Do Not Cause Asthma, Study Finds
description: Some parents have been worried about giving their children pain relievers like ibuprofen and acetaminophen, based on reports that children who take the drugs are more likely to develop asthma. Researchers have even speculated that the rising prevalence of asthma was a result of wider use of acetaminophen, sold under the brand name Tylenol, in treating childhood fevers.

title: When Stealing Glances Last Too Long

title: Jeffrey Tambor on the Return of Arrested Development

title: I.R.S. Official Will Decline to Testify Before House Panel
