description: Some of the brokerage firms that helped pique Americans interest in stocks are now luring them into something much riskier: stock options.

title: Can a Tree Grow in the Bronx?
description: LAST week the Central Park Conservancy, the nonprofit group that manages Central Park, announced a $40 million fund-raising campaign to improve the parks playgrounds, an initiative that will surely benefit thousands of children who play in the park.

title: Abscesses Reported After Steroid Injections
description: At least seven people have reported complications after being injected with a potentially contaminated medication made in a pharmacy in Tennessee, federal and state health officials said. The Food and Drug Administration said that it had not yet determined the nature of the illnesses, but that at least one person seemed to have a fungal infection. Last fall, fungal contamination of the same type of medication, an injectable steroid produced by a compounding pharmacy in Massachusetts, caused the deaths of more than 50 people. Officials in North Carolina, where two of the new cases were found, said that the symptoms were skin abscesses and that there had been no reports of meningitis, stroke or other life-threatening conditions. Illinois said it was investigating five cases of patients who developed abscesses after receiving the medication, which is used to treat back pain and swelling in joints, among other conditions.

title: Events in Westchester
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Off the Charts: Under Obama, Stocks Do Better
description: President Obama this month became the fifth president to have the Standard & Poors 500-stock index double from the level when he took office.

title: On the Front Lines of Food Safety
description: MOSS LANDING, Calif.  With piles of fresh strawberries beckoning consumers at markets and stores this season, an alliance of a major retailer, fruit growers and farm workers has begun a program to promote healthy produce and improve working conditions.

title: Lessons in Emoting From an Oblivious Teacher
description: There is a funny thing about fame. It shows. It is written all over Sarah when she bursts through the door in Charles Evereds Class, an alluring if sentimental one-act drama having its New York premiere at the Penguin Rep Theater.

title: To Rescue Survivors, He Pursued the Storm
description: MOORE, Okla.  Phillip Wise on Monday chased one of the most ferocious tornadoes to touch down in Oklahoma in years. Through his windshield from a half-mile out, the Category 5 twister was not so much a funnel but a shapeless, swirling wall of mud, pieces of homes, and airborne cars and horses.

title: Measured by S.&P. Returns, Obama Is on a Short List
description: IN the 84 years that the Standard & Poors 500-stock index has been calculated, it doubled during the terms of only four presidents before Barack Obamas election in 2008. This month that number rose to five as the index climbed to more than twice what it was when he took office.

title: Raiding the Keokuk
description: Late on an April night in 1863 a flotilla of small boats circled a partially sunken ship off the coast of Morris Island, S.C., not far from Fort Sumter in Charleston Harbor. Soon two iron towers studded with bolts rose like islands from the dark waters. Onboard the ship, a Union ironclad called the Keokuk  sunk a few days before in the failed Union attempt to bombard Fort Sumter into submission  stood several men, silently waiting, their eyes on Adolphus W. LaCoste, the civilian in charge of the Confederate salvage operation. His hand raised, they held their breath as a Union picket boat rowed past, towards the lights of the blockading fleet. As the voices of the rowers faded, LaCoste gave the signal to resume. In water up to their waists, with hands and wrenches tugging and turning, they strained at the armored decks over the guns of the sunken ironclad. They had one thing in mind: the guns.

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Friday Night Music: Arcade Fire Does the Clash
description: No particular reason, but found this running through my head at the end of a crazy day. Some love it, some hate it; but the dedication and respect are something to watch.

title: The Women Versus the Ted
description: Lets discuss how much better Congress would work if most of the members were women.

title: Messy Fight Over Mandela Trust Goes Public
description: JOHANNESBURG  Nelson Mandela was livid. He believed that two of his daughters, working with a lawyer he had recently fired, were trying to meddle in his financial affairs. So he summoned the daughters, Makaziwe Mandela and Zenani Dlamini, to his home here for a family meeting in April 2005. According to two people present, he gave them a withering talking-to.

title: Hometown Driver Now a Local Hero
description: INDIANAPOLIS  After Ed Carpenter won the pole for Sundays Indianapolis 500 last weekend with a blistering speed of 228.762 miles per hour, he celebrated by taking a police escort from the Indianapolis Motor Speedway to Bankers Life Fieldhouse. There he watched his favorite basketball team, the Pacers, dispatch the Knicks in Game 6 of the teams Eastern Conference semifinal.

title: For Obamas Global Vision, Daunting Problems
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, in one of his most significant speeches since taking office, did not simply declare an end to the post-9/11 era on Thursday. He also offered a vision of Americas role in the world that he hopes could be one of his lasting legacies.

title: Ailing Bridges, Budget Woes
description: The bridge that collapsed near Seattle is part of a nationwide infrastructure that some say is crumbling beneath us.

title: Press Sees Chilling Effect in Justice Dept. Inquiries
description: President Obamas conciliatory gesture toward the press this week  a review of Justice Department investigations involving journalists  struck some national security reporters as closing the door after the sources have already bolted.

title: Fox Overseer of Idol and Its Kin Will Depart
description: Not only is American Idol expected to lose all four of its judges, it is also bidding adieu to Mike Darnell, the Fox executive who judged correctly at the very beginning that the show would be a hit.

title: Recalling a Girl, 14, Laughing, Before She Was Shot on a Bus
description: Standing before hundreds of mourners at a church in Jamaica, Queens, on Friday, Shaquanna Almonds told the family and friends of 14-year-old Daja Robinson about her last moments.

title: A Lot of Elephants in the Room
description: Some people have been waiting to see the house in Clybourne Park for 50 years. And there it is, on Long Wharf Theaters Mainstage  not at its best, because the owners are leaving and the living room is strewn with moving boxes. But look at all that space and the handsome wooden staircase and the door that leads to a real backyard. No wonder Lena Younger, the heroine of Lorraine Hansberrys seminal 1959 drama A Raisin in the Sun, was so proud to be able to move her five-member family there, after living in a cramped two-bedroom apartment on the South Side of Chicago. To hell with the fact that everybody else in the neighborhood was white.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Simple or Impossible
description: My last contribution to The Times was on a dead man. I now try to write about a living art.

title: Good News for Teixeira, Not as Good for Nova
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Shortly before Joe Girardi announced that Ivan Nova had been demoted from the starting rotation, Nova spoke at his locker in the visitors clubhouse at Tropicana Field. Two lockers away, the rookie Vidal Nuno, who will start Saturday, sat and watched.

title: Battle for Syrian Town Spurs Sectarian Fighting in Northern Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The all-out battle for the Syrian town of Qusayr, pitting the Lebanese Shiite Muslim militant group Hezbollah and Syrian armed forces against Sunni Muslim rebels, has spurred the worst sectarian fighting in years in the north of Lebanon.

title: Russia: Earthquake Hits Eastern Coast
description: An 8.3-magnitude earthquake struck Russias Far East on Friday, sending tremors that prompted evacuations as far away as Moscow, more than 4,000 miles to the west of the epicenter. The United States Geological Survey recorded the earthquake at 5:44 p.m. local time at a depth of approximately 373 miles below the Sea of Okhotsk, off the coast of the Kamchatka Peninsula. Officials initially told residents on Sakhalin and the Kurile Islands to head for higher ground in case of a tsunami. Russias Emergency Ministry later lifted the tsunami warning and said in a statement that no injuries had been reported. Tremors were felt in more than a dozen regions spanning Russia; in Moscow, local law enforcement officers evacuated 850 people from two apartment buildings after residents said the buildings were shaking.

title: Impressionists of the Coast
description: The Jersey Shore attracted Impressionist painters starting in the late 19th century, along with other areas in the Northeast like Cos Cob, Conn., and New Hope, Pa. But while the artists communities of Cos Cob and New Hope were rediscovered in the late 1970s and the 1980s, those of the Jersey Shore were generally overlooked by art scholars, according to Richard Boyle, a historian and former director of the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts in Philadelphia.

title: France: Investigators Tie I.M.F. Chief to Fraud Inquiry Involving Sarkozy
description: Christine Lagarde, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, was made an assisted witness on Friday in an investigation by French judges into allegations of possible fraud and misuse of public funds that date from her time as finance minister. As an assisted witness, Ms. Lagarde has not been placed under formal investigation but is considered to have been closely implicated in the case, which involves a half-billion-dollar state payout to Bernard Tapie, a businessman and politician who once served time in prison for his involvement in the fixing of soccer matches. Ms. Lagarde oversaw that payout in 2007 and 2008, while serving as finance minister under President Nicolas Sarkozy, whose candidacy Mr. Tapie had supported. The board of the International Monetary Fund has expressed its confidence in Ms. Lagarde. In a statement Friday, she said she had always acted in the best public interest and in accordance with the law.

title: Goalie Loses His Balance but Keeps Sense of Humor
description: BOSTON  He has seen the replay more times than he would care to remember. He has gone over the play countless times in his mind. And every time, the reaction is the same.

title: Little Debate on Big Issues in Race to Fill Kerrys Seat
description: BOSTON  For an election that was supposed to be about the big issues of the day, the special election in Massachusetts to fill the Senate seat vacated by John Kerry seems to be about everything but.

title: Canada: Mayor Denies Drug Allegations
description: After a week of avoiding journalists, Mayor Rob Ford of Toronto on Friday denied accusations that he smoked crack cocaine. I do not use crack cocaine, nor am I an addict of crack cocaine, Mr. Ford, left, said as he read a statement during a brief news conference. He did not take questions. Last week Mr. Ford dismissed as ridiculous reports by The Toronto Star and the Web site Gawker that their reporters had viewed a video recording of Mr. Ford that appeared to show him smoking crack cocaine. The two organizations said they were shown the recording by drug dealers who hoped to sell it. The mayors statement followed the release of an open letter from six of Mr. Fords allies on the City Council asking him to address the reports. Some other members of the council told reporters on Friday that they found the mayors statement inadequate, given his history of initially denying embarrassing episodes only to later acknowledge the accusations as true.

title: Events on Long Island
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Judge Finds Violations of Rights by Sheriff
description: PHOENIX  A federal judge ruled on Friday that Sheriff Joe Arpaio and his deputies had violated the constitutional rights of Latinos by targeting them during raids and traffic stops here and throughout Maricopa County.

title: Strategic Ignorance
description: In an age when knowledge is power, restricting knowledge is a power grab, creating the conditions of ignorance that allow bias, ideology and propaganda to flourish, unchallenged and unchecked.

title: Get Churches Out of Public Schools
description: New York City prohibits the use of public school facilities for regular religious services. That policy makes sense for buildings that are used and maintained by taxpayers. But the City Council wants to eliminate that policy through a new state law. It voted 38 to 11 on Wednesday to pass a resolution asking the Legislature and Gov. Andrew Cuomo to approve legislation to permit religious services on public school properties when they are not in use.

title: Deception on Gun Background Checks
description: A strange thing happened after 45 senators killed a bill to expand background checks for gun buyers five weeks ago: many of those same senators suddenly discovered a profound affection for background checks. They had been for them all along, it turns out, and wanted nothing more than to keep guns out of the hands of felons.

title: Exercise and Academic Performance
description: As schools everywhere strive to improve the academic performance of their students, many have cut physical education and recess periods to leave more time for sedentary classroom instruction. A sensible new report from the Institute of Medicine, a unit of the National Academy of Sciences, shows how shortsighted this trend can be. It found that exercise can significantly improve childrens cognitive abilities and their academic performance, as well as their health.

title: Rangers Ask a Do-It-All Defenseman to Do a Little More
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  A potential solution to the Rangers power-play woes surfaced in Game 4 against the Boston Bruins, and Coach John Tortorella only wished he had thought of it earlier. After all, it seemed so obvious.

title: As Tourists Come and Go, Harlem Churches Lose a 10% Lifeblood
description: The tourists started lining up two hours before morning worship service on West 116th Street in Harlem. Most were dressed in everyday clothes, contrasting with the dark suits and prim dresses of the largely African-American congregation in the historic sanctuary of Canaan Baptist Church of Christ.

title: Lottery Numbers
Vows: Emmania and Henry
description: Teenagers from separate worlds fell in love playing Dance, Dance Revolution. Henry Blum proposed to Emmania Rodriguez by installing an arcade version of the game in his grandmothers basement.

title: Creating Order From Chaos
description: As Syrians flee their homes, many end up in the sprawling refugee camp in Zaatari, Jordan. Kilian Kleinschmidt is tasked with settling thousands of families facing an uncertain future.

title: Subway Doors Slammed Shut Just in Time to Save Her
description: Off the platform at the first station on the downtown No. 4 line is an office for subway employees, with cubbies for their bags, bulletin boards, video monitors and a break room. The conductor arrived for her late shift at 1:20 a.m. and signed in. Fifteen minutes later, her work began. She greeted the train operator  they are no longer known as motormen  in the first car before taking her place in the booth in the sixth, in the middle of the train. It left the terminal to begin its long journey through the Bronx and Manhattan to Brooklyn.

title: This Is Not 2009
description: With the scent of scandal encircling the White House, some Republicans are already licking their chops over the 2014 midterm elections, while some Democrats are pre-emptively licking their wounds.

title: Calm Boss Overseeing a Syrian Refugee Camps Chaos
description: ZAATARI, Jordan  Kilian Kleinschmidt had a problem. The afternoon before Kuwaits ambassador to Jordan was scheduled to visit the overcrowded Syrian refugee camp here, children vandalized mobile homes that Kuwait had donated, stealing windows, doors and floor mats.

title: Where a Tribes History Comes to Life
description: On a recent afternoon, Jason Johnson, clad in buckskin leggings, a breechcloth and a headdress of turkey feathers, was tending a fire and stripping the bark from tupelo logs in a wooded, two-acre plot behind the Shinnecock Nation Cultural Center and Museum in Southampton.

title: Dispute Over Budget Deepens a Rift Within the G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans are locked in a widening internal dispute over future budget negotiations, splitting along generational and ideological lines on the partys approach to the central issue that drove the conservative surge in the Obama era: how to deal with the federal debt.

title: Corrections: May 25, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Theyre Tan and Toned, but Theyre Not Very Nice
description: Mick is sick of the city. He misses lightning bugs and children on lawns and driving. And the New Yorkers in Joshua Conkels comedy I Wanna Destroy You are so hideous that you almost have to agree with him.

title: Irreverent Sermonettes
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  I dont believe Ive had an easier and more fun entry into a Saturday puzzle in, well, ever. PURPLE HAZE is all in my brain, and even if you were never a fan of Jimi Hendrix, Im sure you know this classic rock song. It was enough to get me rocking and laughing at one of my favorite clue/entry pairings in a long time: a labor leaders cry might be PUSH! and if youre like me, the response is likely to be to grab the labor leader by the collar and shriek Shut up!  More ice chips!

title: New Alliance Emerges to Tighten Chemical Rules
description: WASHINGTON  The first credible effort in years to revamp the nations outmoded chemical safety law grew in part from the Senates failure in April to enact a gun buyer background check bill.

title: The Power Behind Manchester City Is Content to Stay Out of Sight in New York
description: The setting was modest, the mood jovial, the dignitaries on hand pretty impressive. In the school cafeteria of P.S. 72 in East Harlem on Wednesday morning, professional soccer was nudged forward in New York City, with talk of a new team with prestigious owners and a new stadium designed specifically for the sport.

title: Obamas Gitmo Problem
description: Late Wednesday afternoon, less than 24 hours before President Obama made his big national security speech  in which he said, for the umpteenth time, that the prison in Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, should be closed  a group of American lawyers representing Guantnamo detainees filed an emergency motion with the Federal District Court in the District of Columbia. The motion asked the court to order the removal of unjustified burdens that the military command at Guantnamo has placed on the detainees, making it nearly impossible for them to meet with their lawyers.

title: Mexican Official Defends Accuracy of Data on Organized Crime
description: MEXICO CITY  Rejecting concerns that the governments statistics were foggier than ever, Mexicos top security official argued Friday that real progress was being made in reducing organized crime killings and that the number of people previously reported missing was inflated.

title: All of Citys Public Swimming Beaches to Reopen by Memorial Day
description: Under leaden skies, officials on Friday fulfilled a pledge made after Hurricane Sandy wreaked havoc on 14 miles of New York City beaches, announcing that all eight public swimming beaches would reopen in time for Memorial Day.

title: Burgers and the Big Talk
description: The doors were thrown open onto Lenox Avenues broad sidewalk, Michael Jackson boomed from the sound system  sometimes life in the big city isnt so hard. Harlem Shake, which opened at 124th Street and Lenox Avenue earlier this month, already has lines out the door and unreasonable waits for its burgers and shakes. But on a summery evening last week, no one seemed to mind. The dcor is retro diner, the restroom an homage to Jet magazine covers past. Its what youd expect a Harlem-themed restaurant in Tokyo to look like transported to Harlem. The principal owner Jelena Pasic, 38, said that the neighborhood reminds her of the small island in Croatia where she grew up. People are much more personal than in the rest of New York, she said. Proof that the restaurant isnt located somewhere out of town: kale salad on the menu.

title: New Computer Attacks Traced to Iran, Officials Say
description: SAN FRANCISCO  American officials and corporate security experts examining a new wave of potentially destructive computer attacks striking American corporations, especially energy firms, say they have tracked the attacks back to Iran.

title: For Now, Daviss Struggles Stay in the Major Leagues
description: After a day off for the Mets, Manager Terry Collins returned to Citi Field on Friday afternoon and picked up where he left off, answering questions about the job security of Ike Davis, the teams struggling first baseman.

title: States Policies on Health Care Exclude Some of the Poorest
description: WASHINGTON  The refusal by about half the states to expand Medicaid will leave millions of poor people ineligible for government-subsidized health insurance under President Obamas health care law even as many others with higher incomes receive federal subsidies to buy insurance.

title: Running a League, From Behind the Plate
description: Rich Ritchie is the commissioner of the Queens Lighted Softball Association, a nighttime league of which he is also the chief umpire.

title: Softballs Iron Fist
description: Rich Ritchie, 61, has been organizing ballgames since he was a kid.

title: Doctor Gets Eight Years in L.I.R.R. Fraud Scheme
description: A Long Island doctor was sentenced Friday to eight years in prison for his role in a fraud scheme that allowed hundreds of retired Long Island Rail Road workers to collect disability benefits to which they were not entitled.

title: Kentucky Operator to Cease Enrichment of Uranium
description: WASHINGTON  The only American-owned plant for enriching uranium, a cold war relic near Paducah, Ky., will be shut down next month, its operator said on Friday. The closing could pose a problem for the American nuclear weapons arsenal over time but is not likely to affect civilian nuclear electric plants.

title: Oklahomans Dont Stop Fighting
description: Several Moore, Okla., residents, whose lives were somehow connected by Mondays tornado and its aftermath, shared their experiences of enduring the storm.

title: Bill on College Financial Aid for Undocumented Students Seems Stalled in Albany
description: As immigration legislation moves forward on Capitol Hill, generating widespread debate and providing glimpses of an emerging bipartisan consensus, a less ambitious effort in Albany is playing out differently.

title: Some of His Best Customers Are Canine
description: Pete Van Leeuwen started Van Leeuwen Artisan Ice Cream in 2008 with his brother Ben, their partner, Laura ONeill, and two classic yellow trucks. Now in their sixth year of business, they have six trucks and three stores in Brooklyn and Manhattan, as well as a Balinese restaurant (Selamat Pagi) in the front of their production facility. The first summer Mr. Van Leeuwen drove around, scooping ice cream. These days, with the food truck boom in New York City and their growing business  just this week they introduced vegan ice cream  Mr. Van Leeuwen, 36, spends his time organizing and troubleshooting, with occasional breaks for a pistachio cone, his favorite flavor.

title: Rangers Game and Wedding Form a Blissful Union
description: For the longtime Rangers season-ticket holders Phil and Joan Boening and their two sons, Justin and James, tensions were agonizingly high Thursday evening.

title: Militant Says He Is Behind Attack in Niger
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Mokhtar Belmokhtar, the mastermind of the January seizure of an Algerian gas plant that left dozens of foreign hostages dead, has claimed responsibility for another terrorist attack: the suicide bombings on Thursday in Niger that killed about 30 people, including 24 soldiers and at least six jihadists.

title: Come 5:30, Shes on the Bus
description: Some people go to great lengths to avoid getting stuck in Long Island beach traffic. Marianna Scandole does it for a living. Ms. Scandole, 26, is a host on the Hampton Jitney and the Hampton Ambassador, which carry lower- and higher-paying passengers through some of the regions most illustrious clogged arteries. For Ms. Scandole, who previously worked as a nanny, the job is something of a career trial balloon. I want to become a flight attendant, so I thought that would be an excellent way to get some practice in, she said. She lives with her mother and younger sister in Hampton Bays.

title: As Lacrosse Grows, the Diversity of Players Remains Largely Unchanged
description: On a team in Southern California, more than 2,500 miles from the center of lacrosses universe on the Eastern Seaboard, Kyle Harrison no longer feels unsettled.

title: Ex-Guatemalan President Extradited to U.S. in Corruption Case
description: MEXICO CITY  Guatemalan officials rousted an imprisoned former president on Friday, loaded him onto a jet and whisked him to New York to face long-pending corruption charges.

title: Carousel Horses Return Home to Brooklyn
description: This weekend, the B&B Carousell horses will once again spin in the salubrious breezes on Coney Island.

title: Time Lapse: The Making of a Carousel
description: As a part of Coney Islands makeover, the B&B Carousell was dismantled and restored at a facility in Ohio. Workers reassembled the antique wooden carousel over several days in May.

title: Summers Steeds, Back Home
description: One at a time, they loaded the horses into the truck. The dapple grays and the chestnut mares were maneuvered onto a tractor-trailer where they nestled snugly together, wrapped in moving blankets.

title: Rio Struggles With Sex Crimes
description: Sexual assaults in Rio de Janeiro have cast a light on class differences in the city and have raised fears for womens safety ahead of the 2014 World Cup and 2016 Summer Olympics.

title: Public Rapes Outrage Brazil, Testing Ideas of Image and Class
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  The attacks have stunned this city. In one, an assailant held a gun to the head of a 30-year-old woman while raping her in front of passengers on a bus as the driver proceeded down a main avenue. In another, a 14-year-old girl from a hillside slum was raped on one of Rios most famous stretches of beach.

title: Yankees End Two-Game Skid but Lose Granderson to Injury
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  In a season characterized by a staggering run of injuries, the Yankees misfortune reached an almost absurd level Friday when Curtis Granderson sustained another broken bone in only his eighth game of the season.

title: Haynes Johnson, Journalist and Author, Is Dead at 81
description: Haynes Johnson, a Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist, television commentator and author known in particular for his long association with The Washington Post, died on Friday in Bethesda, Md. He was 81.

title: Now Thats a Souvenir
description: Theyve been standing on the Flushing Bay Promenade, just north of the Mets stadium and across the water from La Guardia Airport, for nearly 50 years: two identical fiberglass shells. Not quite buildings, not quite sculptures, the twin structures look simultaneously retro and modern  a past vision of futurism.

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, May 25, 2013
description: We like to believe in Brazil that we live in a peaceful, happy place, when the truth of our existence is far more complicated. Its like were Narcissus gazing into a pool of sewage.

title: Application and Affidavit for Rosen Search Warrant
description: An affidavit details what information the United States government gathered from conversations between Stephen Jin-Woo Kim, a government employee, and an unnamed journalist believed to be James Rosen, the chief Washington correspondent for Fox News.

title: Joyful Noise in Silent Barn, an Alt-Arts Mecca
description: The D.I.Y. arts scene  that illicit and usually itinerant cultural milieu  may have found a legal, if not a permanent, home for this summer in New York. It is called the Silent Barn, and it could be thought of as Brooklyns First Church of the Perpetual House Party.

title: Georges Moustaki, Poetic French Singer, Dies at 79
description: PARIS  Georges Moustaki, a singer and songwriter who wrote dith Piafs hit song Milord and won wide popularity in France for his poetic lyrics and melancholy ballads, died on Thursday in Nice, France. He was 79.

title: Rogers Returning to M.L.S. With Galaxy
description: Robbie Rogers is expected to join the Los Angeles Galaxy on Saturday, becoming the first openly gay player on a major mens professional team in North America.

title: Flynn Robinson, Scorer on Dominant N.B.A. Club, Dies at 72
description: Flynn Robinson, a sharpshooting guard who came off the bench to add scoring punch for one of the greatest teams in N.B.A. history, the 1971-72 Los Angeles Lakers, died on Thursday in Los Angeles. He was 72.

title: A Painter Amid Friends
description: In the summer of 1949, John Ashbery, unleashed to the world from Harvard, arrived in New York to begin his long and productive creative life in a small loft building on Third Avenue near 16th Street. Mr. Ashbery was to spend the season in the apartment of his college friend Kenneth Koch, who was visiting his parents in Cincinnati, and he was to pick up the key from a woman, Jane Freilicher, who lived one floor up. The consequence of this quotidian exchange was a deeply connected friendship now in its sixth decade, nourished by the bohemian reverie that characterized Greenwich Village for so much of the 20th century and migrated to the east end of Long Island with the arrival of Memorial Day.

title: Rogers Set to Join Los Angeles Galaxy
description: Robbie Rogers is expected to join the Los Angeles Galaxy and become the first openly gay player on a major mens professional team in North America.

title: Across U.S. Companies, Tax Rates Vary Greatly
description: Last week, in a Congressional hearing, Apple got grilled for its low-tax strategy. But not every business can copy that approach. Here is a look at what S.&P. 500 companies paid in corporate income taxes  federal, state, local and foreign  from 2007 to 2012, according to S&P Capital IQ.

title: Jamess Miscues Help Pacers Stop Heat to Tie Series
description: Give LeBron James an inch or two, a second or two, a half-step or a slight gap, and he will turn you into a historical footnote, a foil for his Hall of Fame highlight reel. This much, the Indiana Pacers had already learned, painfully, deeply, in the opener of the Eastern Conference finals.

title: James L. Tolbert, 86, an Early Lawyer to Black Hollywood, Dies
description: James L. Tolbert was in love. Marie Ross was too. But she had little interest in marrying a man who pieced together his income by hosting parties and concerts in empty buildings. One of his gimmicks: selling food and drink out of an old hearse.

title: Stuck in the City? Theres Lots to Do
description: New York City cannot bear to be anything but the best. Even its notorious summer heat and humidity have to compete on the world stage, giving the tropics an annual run for their money. But while the less intrepid (and more affluent) flee to beach towns and other breezier climes, the city offers a wealth of summer diversions to those who stay put and embrace the swelter. The following is a sampling of worthy seasonal pursuits, across all five boroughs, that will make the months from Memorial Day to Labor Day much more bearable.

title: Alton T. Lemon, Who Challenged State Aid to Religious Schools, Dies at 84
description: Alton T. Lemon, a civil rights activist whose objection to state aid to religious schools gave rise to a watershed 1971 Supreme Court decision, died on May 4 in Jenkintown, Pa. He was 84.

title: Whats On Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (HBO) MAGIC MIKE (2012) In a role loosely inspired by his stint as a stripper in Florida, Channing Tatum (above left, with Matthew McConaughey) stars as the gyrating main attraction at the Xquisite dance club, in what Manohla Dargis, writing in The New York Times, called Steven Soderberghs funny, enjoyable romp about male strippers and the American dream. Alex Pettyfer plays Adam, a college dropout who is pushed onstage at Xquisite. At first Adam is resistant. Then Madonnas Like a Virgin begins to throb. What happens will be familiar if youve ever seen one of those variations on the fallen-woman movie, Ms. Dargis wrote. In the past the movies were very much preoccupied with the moral regulation of women, but here the stress is on Mikes struggle to succeed as he juggles his part-time gigs (dancing, auto detailing and construction) with his desire to build custom furniture. She added: The collaboration between Mr. Soderbergh and the relatively untested Mr. Tatum is itself a gamble, one that has brought out the best in each. What could have been an embarrassing misfire hinted at by the movies misleading trailers is instead a smoothly distilled collaboration that balances Mr. Tatums heat and charm  and ambitions that are as transparent as Mikes  with Mr. Soderberghs cool, cinematic intelligence and ongoing preoccupations.

title: Failing to Convince Assad
description: AMMAN, Jordan  As Secretary of State John Kerry and 10 European and Arab foreign ministers gathered here this week to discuss grand strategy, President Bashar al-Assad was taking decisive action. With the help of thousands of fighters from Hezbollah, Iran and Iraq, he was close to achieving some of his largest military gains in two years.

title: Daviss Woes Suspended, With Game, After the 8th
description: The number of strikeouts collected by Ike Davis during the Mets 45th game, which began Friday night, will not be officially determined until Saturday. The series opener between the Mets and the Braves at Citi Field was suspended before the start of the ninth inning with the score tied at 5-5, and the game will resume at 6:10 p.m.

title: IHT Quick Read: May 25
description: NEWS For more than a century, the Museum of Medical History in Berlin has exhibited assorted limbs, bones, tubercular lungs and fetuses, all in the name of science and enlightenment. Yet lately the curators are re-evaluating the principles that govern their displays as they confront a growing debate over what cultural organizations should be doing to preserve the dignity of the dead. Many of the worlds grand museums are hearing increasing demands for the return of human remains from former colonies or conquered peoples. Some are giving back bones and skulls that were once viewed as exotic trinkets and were traded by native peoples for calico or plundered in the late 1800s by scientists exploring racial differences. Doreen Carvajal reports from Berlin.

title: Liberty Look to Laimbeer, Off Court as Well
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Bill Laimbeer turned 56 on Sunday, but his identity in basketball has not changed.

title: School Van Fire in Pakistan Kills 15 Children
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Fifteen schoolchildren and a teacher were killed Saturday when their school van caught fire in eastern Punjab Province, rescue and government officials said. Seven other children were injured, two of them critically.

title: A Rising French Star, Complete With Fast Food
description: When the French Open begins Sunday, the locals will have a new matinee idol to root for.

title: North Korea Glosses Over Tensions After Its Special Envoy Visits China
description: BEIJING  North Korea put a positive spin Saturday on the visit of its special envoy to China, but made no mention of Chinas push for the North to resume negotiations aimed at ridding the country of its nuclear weapons program.

title: The Weekend Word: Remembrance
description: In Todays Times:

title: Century-Old Racing Columns Still Quicken the Pulse
description: You can read old editions of The Brooklyn Daily Eagle online if you are interested in issues that appeared from 1841 to 1902, but thanks to Old Fulton NY Postcards, a quirky site featuring scanned-in articles from many New York papers, I have read many of W. C. Vreelands racing pieces, which appear in later issues. Vreelands writing rang with the nerve, excitement and depth of racing. Part gossip, part handicapping, part pure racing fandom, Vreelands columns made horses into celebrities and readers into racing insiders.

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Jammu and Kashmir: A woman from Pakistan was caught by the Border Security Forces in the Samba District of Jammu and Kashmir along the Indian-Pakistani border Thursday, according to a Press Trust of India report in Hindustan Times. The initial investigation revealed that she had accidentally crossed into India and nothing incriminating was recovered from her, an officer told the wire service.

title: Up, Up and Away
description: THE values of gold and silver have dropped like a stone in international trading markets. Coffee futures are hovering near a three-year low. But the price of one commodity has been rising as if it were lighter than air  and in this case, well, it is.

title: Kerry, in Africa, Presses Nigeria on Human Rights
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia  Making his first visit to sub-Saharan Africa as secretary of state, John Kerry urged Nigeria on Saturday to uphold human rights as it steps up its fight against Islamic extremists.

title: Players to Watch at Roland Garros
description: MEN

title: Players Not to Watch at Roland Garros
description: It is easy to spot the players coming into a Grand Slam tournament with a head of steam, arriving in Paris with an impressive roster of victories that make them ones to watch at the tournament. For this years French Open, players like Benoit Paire, Grigor Dimitrov, Simona Halep and Bethanie Mattek-Sands would easily fit into that category, among others.

title: Vintage Apple-1 Sells for Record $671,400
description: Apples stock price may be well down from its peaks last year, but the market for the companys oldest computers continues to set records.

title: Europes Keynesian Problem
description: Brad DeLong tries to find nice things to say about Ken Rogoffs latest. But he tries too hard.

title: The Oil Extremists
description: The federal Energy Information Administration reported in March that at some point this year  maybe in the fall, maybe next month, maybe tomorrow  United States crude oil production will surpass imports for the first time since 1995. This is an important milestone. It does not mean that America has reached energy independence, not by a long shot. That is and will remain an elusive dream for a country that uses one-fifth of the worlds oil while possessing little more than one-fiftieth of its reserves.

title: Rape Behind Bars
description: A new federal report shows that the nations prisons and jails have a long way to go before they comply with the Prison Rape Elimination Act. That 2003 law requires institutions receiving federal money to adopt a zero-tolerance policy on rape and to embrace rigorous prevention measures like those outlined last year by the Justice Department.

title: A Is for Avoidance
description: Even before last weeks Senate hearing on Apple, it was clear that the aggressive use of tax havens and other tax avoidance tactics had become standard operating procedure for global American companies.

title: Preventing a U.S.-China Cyberwar
description: When President Obama and President Xi Jinping of China have their first meeting next month in California, addressing the issue of Chinas cyberattacks on American institutions will be an important priority. Both nations need to take steps to avoid drifting into an all-out cyberwar.

title: The Deer on the Wall
description: A little more than 60 years ago, when he was still a young man, my dad shot a mule deer while hunting in northwestern Colorado. Like so may things in his early life, this was a fact, not a story.

title: Postscript in Pink: Rule Kept Bats in Rack
description: A little over two weeks ago, a bat was dropped off in the visitors clubhouse at Target Field in Minneapolis. It was intended for Baltimore Orioles outfielder Nick Markakis, and it was stained his standard black  except for Markakiss signature and the bats name and model number, all of which were in pink. Nearby, in the Minnesota Twins clubhouse, third baseman Trevor Plouffe had just received a similarly marked bat.

title: The Closing of the Conservative Mind
description: Jonathan Chait has an interesting portrait of Josh Barro; Mike Konczal, citing this and also a longer discussion of reformish conservatives by Ryan Cooper, argues that there really isnt much to see here. I agree, and have been trying to pin down what I mean by that.

title: From Franchisee to C.E.O.
description: MY parents moved from San Luis Obispo to the Mojave Desert, about four hours to the east, after my dad, a physicist, got a job at what is now the Naval Air Weapons Station, China Lake. My younger brother Chris and I grew up catching lizards and snakes and riding motorcycles. We were also on the local swim team.

title: A Final Inspection for Prospects Hoping to Hear Their Names in the Second Round
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Several rows of long tables were arranged around the basketball court, each covered by a black cloth with a white sheet of paper bearing one word, Reserved. Decision makers for the 30 N.B.A. teams chose their seats.

title: Hone the Job You Have Into One You Love
description: OVER the past few months, American workers have been suffering from a major case of spring fever. Many of them, for the first time in years, are thinking about testing the waters of the slowly improving economy. They are looking for better jobs than those theyve been clinging to throughout the recession. Maybe, they think, they can even find a job they love.

title: A Shortage of Child Support, but a Surplus of Blame
description: LETS start, as we often do, with a tangent.

title: The C.E.O. Triumphant (at Least at Apple and Chase)
description: NO taxpayer is obliged to pay the government a penny more than the law requires, the Supreme Court said in 1935. But the court also said no corporation was permitted to use elaborate and devious means  known nowadays as gimmicks  for the express purpose of evading taxes.

title: A Baseball Academy in a Talent-Poor Part of Mexico
description: SAN BARTOLO COYOTEPEC, Mexico  In this tiny town just south of Oaxacas state capital, some of Mexicos most talented young baseball players are taking their first real steps toward the big leagues.

title: Misplaced Honor
description: IN the complex and not entirely complete process of reconciliation after the Civil War, honoring the dead with markers, tributes and ceremonies has played a crucial role. Some of these gestures, like Memorial Day, have been very successful. The practice of decorating the graves arose in many towns, north and south, some even before the war had ended. This humble idea quickly spread throughout the country, and the recognition of common loss helped reconcile North and South.

title: On the Horizon, Five Reasons to Smile
description: THE state of the economy is far from ideal, but some very definite positives are brewing. Its not just that we are continuing to recover from a deep recession; we are also seeing signs that Americas long-term future may be looking up, too.

title: Bequeathing the Keys to Your Digital Afterlife
description: ITS tough enough to write an ordinary will, deciding how to pass along worldly goods like your savings, your real estate and that treasured rocking chair from Aunt Martha in the living room.

title: Late Start in the Sport, Brilliant Start to a Career
description: Kevin Towers was scouting for the Yankees in 2010 when a trade got his attention. The Arizona Diamondbacks, spiraling toward a last-place finish in the National League West, dealt pitcher Dan Haren, a three-time All-Star, to the Los Angeles Angels for a package that included two promising left-handers in Class A.

title: A Student of Indy History, Hoping to Make Some
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The lights from a photo shoot had dimmed, but the gleam in Dario Franchittis eyes remained. The five-foot sterling silver Borg-Warner trophy stood before him, the history of the Indianapolis 500 told through the miniature busts of each years winner carved into its side. Franchitti, a Scot, traced the years with his fingers and found his countryman Jim Clark, the 1965 winner. He scanned for Ray Harroun, the 1911 winner. Then, near the bottom of the trophy, he settled on his own face  or, rather, the three of them.

title: If My Data Is an Open Book, Why Cant I Read It?
description: OUR mobile carriers know our locations: where our phones travel during working hours and leisure time, where they reside overnight when we sleep. Verizon Wireless even sells demographic profiles of customer groups  including ZIP codes for where they live, work, shop and more  to marketers. But when I called my wireless providers, Verizon and T-Mobile, last week in search of data on my comings and goings, call-center agents told me that their companies didnt share customers own location logs with them without a subpoena.

title: Nascars Vocal Leader, Even if Few Follow Him
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Fresh off winning the 2012 Sprint Cup championship, Brad Keselowski stood at the lectern during the annual awards dinner in Las Vegas last November and declared to the Nascar gathering before him, As a champion, I want to be your leader.

title: Jump to Pros Is Quite a Leap
description: Shortly after Memorial Day, the Colorado Avalanche will introduce Patrick Roy as their coach, a hiring the team announced Thursday. He will also be vice president for hockey operations, sharing roster decisions with Joe Sakic, his former Avalanche teammate, who was named an executive vice president earlier this month.

title: Joe Thornton Doesnt Let Sharks Lose Their Edge
description: LOS ANGELES  The jovial San Jose Sharks captain, Joe Thornton, has managed to laugh off plenty of criticism in his career, once joking that he would much sooner spend his time perusing Playboy than reading anything in the hockey press.

title: With Orb, Its Still Wait and See
description: Shug McGaughey has been guided by the condition of his horse throughout his Hall of Fame career. He is not about to change now as he debates whether Orb, his first Kentucky Derby champion who finished a disappointing fourth in the Preakness, should compete in the Belmont Stakes on June 8.

title: Ten Years Later, a Growing Appreciation for Sorenstams Breakthrough
description: Annika Sorenstams participation in the PGA Tour event at Colonial Country Club 10 years ago did not change peoples thinking overnight the way Billie Jean Kings exhibition tennis match against Bobby Riggs in another part of Texas had 30 years before.

title: Two Who Did Not Return
description: More than 500 major league baseball players served in the military during World War II, including stars like Ted Williams, Stan Musial and Joe DiMaggio. But little attention has been paid to the two who died, Elmer Gedeon and Harry ONeill, because their playing days were brief.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: What Eisenhower Taught Me About Decision-Making
description: This interview with  J.W. Marriott Jr., known as Bill, executive chairman and former C.E.O. of Marriott International, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Variety: Split Decisions
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  This is Fred Piscops first solo byline as a Split Decisions constructor, and even though Mr. Piscop has had a plethora of solo bylines both as editor and constructor, I still had a moment of nostalgia remembering the late George Bredehorn and his Split Decisions puzzles.

title: Hagel Calls Sex Assaults in Military a Scourge
description: Defense Secretary Chuck Hagel on Saturday called the increasing reports of sexual assault a scourge on the military and urged the Armys newest officers to help build a culture of respect and dignity in the armed forces.

title: Those Caffeine Rituals at the Office
description: Those Caffeine Rituals

title: Newark Monsignor Loses Job for Failing to Stop Priests Work With Children
description: One of the top officials in the Archdiocese of Newark has been forced out for failing to properly monitor the activities of a priest who had been forbidden from having contact with children, the archdiocese announced on Saturday.

title: Improbably, Missionary Trains Stars in Kenya
description: The worlds most unlikely track coach had never attended a meet in the United States. The map said New York, but the cold, rainy, windy weather stirred memories of a distant home.

title: As Boozy Invaders Hit Beach, Hamptons Sound a Snooki Alert
description: AMAGANSETT, N.Y.  For generations, few beaches in the Hamptons were more coveted and jealously protected than Indian Wells.

title: Sally Jewell
description: Sally Jewell had a varied career as a petroleum engineer, banker and the chief executive of the outdoor retailer REI before the Senate confirmed her last month as  secretary of the interior.

title: Shareholders Are Speaking Up, but Whos Listening?
description: WE are nearing the end of proxy season, that once-a-year moment when shareholders can speak their minds, sort of, to the officers and directors overseeing their companies. But that doesnt mean corporate boards always listen.

title: Call for Calm After 3 New Arrests in British Soldiers Death
description: LONDON  The police made three new arrests on Saturday in the killing of an off-duty soldier on a London street, while British politicians and religious leaders called for calm in response to a rise in threats and invective against Muslims across the country.

title: In Surprise, Pacers Are Driven by Their Offense
description: For a brief moment, LeBron James had an angle to the rim. With the clock ticking down, James drove hard to his right and tried to wedge his shoulder between Indiana Pacers wing Paul George and the hoop. Instead, James ran into Georges chest, turned away from the basket and fired a pass that was tipped, then collected, by the Pacers.

title:
Hezbollah Commits to an
All-Out Fight to
Save Assad
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The leader of the powerful Lebanese militant group Hezbollah decisively committed his followers on Saturday to an all-out battle in Syria to defeat the rebellion against President Bashar al-Assad. He said the organization, founded to defend Lebanon and fight Israel, was entering a completely new phase, sending troops abroad to protect its interests.

title: Sunday Dialogue: Treating Mental Illness
description: Readers discuss the benefits of talk therapy versus medication.

title: Showdown at the Airport Body Scanner
description: I have never walked through an airport body scanner  or, as I think of it, the cancer machine. In the years since these radiation chambers began appearing in airports across the United States, I have developed a variety of tricks to avoid submitting myself to them.

title: Highlights and Analysis: Champions League Final, Bayern Munich 2, Dortmund 1
description: The Goal blog provided live analysis and commentary of Saturdays Champions League final  Bayern Munichs thrilling 2-1 win over Dortmund at Wembley Stadium in London. Read on to follow the game as it happened.

title: Who Will Crack the Code?
description: WASHINGTON  IRELAND and Singapore have no natural resources that make them obvious places to manufacture the concentrate used in soda, nor have they developed innovative new soda-making techniques. Yet they have nonetheless become global capitals for making soft-drink concentrate.

title: When Numbers Mislead
description: ITS always seductive to know where one stands in relation to the average. As an overly confident college freshman, the first time I received a below-average score on an exam was a needed wake-up call. Today, I find it encouraging to read that I exercise more than the average woman my age.

title: Can 44 Subtract 43 From the Equation?
description: DALLAS  DO we dare to hope that the Bush administration is finally at an end?

title: Rich Tourist, Poor Tourist
description: As the travel season kicks into full swing this Memorial Day weekend, many of us are anticipating the rites of the modern vacation with a quiver of dread  crawling along the Long Island Expressway; stalling in endless security lines; gnawing on pretzels while squeezed into ever-smaller airplane seats. Its hard not to envy todays ber-rich, whose getaways, on private jets to Caribbean villas, take place far above the sweaty fray of mortal tourists.

title: Obamas Artful Anguish
description: PRESIDENT OBAMAS speech on national security last week was a dense thicket of self-justifying argument, but its central message was perfectly clear: Please dont worry, liberals. Im not George W. Bush.

title: Untangling What Companies Pay in Taxes
description: The tax filings of companies, like those of individuals, are confidential. When individual companies want to make the case that they pay large amounts of tax  as many do  they often point to complex calculations from their financial statements that portray the companies in the best light. For an outsider, it can be hard to know how many accounting assumptions go into these calculations and how accurately they reflect the companys actual tax payments.

title: Gesture Writing
description: Five years ago, I walked into a third-floor art studio on the campus of the University of California, Berkeley, climbed atop a wooden stage covered in stained padding and dropped my ratty yellow bathrobe. A panel of strangers asked me to pose, and then to freeze. I had never modeled for artists, and had no idea how I would feel standing naked as people I had just met stared at me. The idea held some bohemian appeal, but more urgently, I needed to supplement my income as a freelance writer while I worked on a novel.

title: Obamacares Other Surprise
description: LISTENING to the debate about President Obamas health care plan, some critics argue that Obamacare is going to need Obamacare  because its going to be a train wreck. Obama officials insist theyre wrong. Well just have to wait and see whether the Affordable Care Act, as the health care law is officially known, surprises us on the downside. But there is one area where the law already appears to be surprising on the upside. And that is the number of health care information start-ups its spurring. This is a big deal.

title: Intricate Rituals for Fallen American Troops
description: At the Dover Port Mortuary, where the bodies of service members are brought to be prepared for funeral, no detail is too small.

title: Leak Inquiries Show How Wide a Net U.S. Cast
description: WASHINGTON  Even before the F.B.I. conducted 550 interviews of officials and seized the phone records of Associated Press reporters in a leak investigation connected to a 2012 article about a Yemen bomb plot, agents had sought the same reporters sources for two other articles about terrorism.

title: The Gift of Siblings
description: GIVEN what a mouthy thing I grew up to be, its shocking to me that I began talking later than most children do. But I didnt need words. I had my older brother, Mark.

title: More Guns in the Sky
description: Confidential. For N.R.A. internal. Now that the Senate has voted down new gun control laws and we have the president on the defensive  never thought Id say it, but God bless the I.R.S.!  we have a real opportunity to guide Congress along a common-sense path that will further ensure the freedoms of peaceful, law-abiding citizens. Herewith, talking points on the next crucial phase of our work. Please distribute to all concerned elected officials who share our love of liberty and public safety.

title: Foreign Projects Give Afghans Fashion, Skate Park and Now 10,000 Balloons
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Braving jeers and provoking smiles, volunteers spread through Kabul on Saturday, giving away 10,000 pink balloons as part of a performance art project called We Believe in Balloons.

title: Francis Humility and Emphasis on the Poor Strike a New Tone at the Vatican
description: VATICAN CITY  He has criticized the cult of money and greed he sees driving the world financial system, reflecting his affinity for liberation theology. He has left Vatican officials struggling to keep up with his off-the-cuff remarks and impromptu forays into the crowds of tens of thousands that fill St. Peters Square during his audiences. He has delighted souvenir vendors near the Vatican by increasing tourist traffic.

title: Turbine Plans Unnerve Fans of Condors in California
description: The California condors slow 20-year climb back from the brink of extinction has long been a fragile not-quite-success story in the conservation world. So when the news came on Friday that developers of a wind-energy project near the Mojave Desert would not face criminal charges if the blades killed a single condor, environmental groups expressed grave concern.

title: Arizonas Illegal Sheriff
description: How do we know that Joe Arpaio, sheriff of Maricopa County, Ariz., is a racial profiler, an abuser of power who has subjected Latinos for years to unconstitutional arrests, detention and harassment?

title: Seeking Serenity in a Patch of California Land
description: FRESNO, Calif.  Like Scotch broom and dandelions, despair can be invasive. This is why, every Monday, Lee Lee, a Hmong refugee, puts on her sun hat and flip-flops, grabs the hoe handmade by her father and brother in Laos and heads to the Hmong Village Community Garden here, where she tends rows of purple lemon grass, bitter melon and medicinal herbs along with other Hmong women.

title: In California, Gardening for Mental Health
description: Community gardens for immigrant groups can provide more than just familiar foods hard to find in the grocery store; they can be a balm for alienation.

title: What Mideast Crisis? Israelis Have Moved On
description: FOR years, conventional wisdom has held that as long as Israel faces the external challenge of Arab  especially Palestinian  hostility it will never come to terms with its internal divisions. The left has sometimes used it as an argument: we must make peace with the Palestinians so that we can set our house in order  write a constitution, figure out the public role of religion. Others have viewed the threat as almost a silver lining keeping the place together: differences among Israeli Jews (religious or secular, Ashkenazic or Sephardic) are so profound, the argument goes, that if the society ever manages to turn its attention inward, it might tear itself apart.

title: Verdicts Expected Soon for 2 Milosevic Agents
description: THE HAGUE  He was the presidents man for all seasons, prosecutors said, ready to organize hit squads, permit the killing of prisoners, sign off on covert weapon shipments or mediate the release of peacekeepers. Jovica Stanisic, the onetime chief of the secret police, was widely thought to be the second most powerful man in Serbia during Slobodan Milosevics presidency.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, May 26
description: Still echoing through Washington, President Obamas speech Thursday on shifting the nations approach to counterterrorism will be up for debate on the Sunday shows.

title: Ammas Multifaceted Empire, Built on Hugs
description: THERE are entourages  and then there is the retinue of Mata Amritanandamayi, a 59-year-old Indian guru known simply as Amma, or mother. On Friday, she began a two-month North American tour during which she will be accompanied by 275 volunteers. They plan to ride in four buses across the continent from Bellevue, Wash., to Marlborough, Mass., visiting 11 cities, including New York. And at each stop along the way, Amma will sit on stage for 15 hours at a stretch, greeting her thousands of devotees.

title: Breeding the Nutrition Out of Our Food
description: WE like the idea that food can be the answer to our ills, that if we eat nutritious foods we wont need medicine or supplements. We have valued this notion for a long, long time. The Greek physician Hippocrates proclaimed nearly 2,500 years ago: Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food. Today, medical experts concur. If we heap our plates with fresh fruits and vegetables, they tell us, we will come closer to optimum health.

title: Nutritional Weaklings in the Supermarket
description:
Heirloom varieties and wild species of produce
have been found to outshine their cultivated cousins.

title: Made-for-TV Movies
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  There was a time after I had my kids when I thought I would never get out to the theaters to see a movie again, at least not one that didnt involve Pokemon. The Boy was not big on sitting for long periods of time, even with his small lap loaded with candy, so very often The Girl was left to watch a large portion of the movie by herself while I chased The Boy up the aisle and out into the lobby. Now that theyre older, of course, things are different and they are much more likely to chase me up the aisle as I stomp out (What?! Bruce Willis was dead all along?? What the heck is that?! I want my money back!)

title: Indians Grow Impatient With Taciturn Premier Amid Troubles
description: NEW DELHI  He speaks so softly that even his public comments are sometimes nearly inaudible. He has not held a formal news conference in India since 2011. And a pack of reporters were driven to hold a protest recently when he refused to participate in the routine political act of being photographed while filing for re-election in Assam State.

title: Maoist Attack Kills at Least 16 in India
description: NEW DELHI  At least 16 people, including a prominent politician, were killed Saturday when Maoist guerrillas ambushed a convoy of political leaders in Chhattisgarh State, the authorities said. Among the dead were five police officers.

title: Bayern Munich, Champion of Germany, Adds European Title
description: LONDON  Some saw this as the opening to an age of German soccer dominance, and maybe it will be. Maybe years from now Saturdays Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Borussia Dortmund will be viewed as the start of the Bundesligas rise to the pinnacle of European sports.

title: At the Bottom of the Top 10, but No. 1 at a Norway Event
description: The Norway Chess 2013 tournament was among one competitors greatest triumphs, and the results offered hope to two others but were a disappointment  again  for the world champion.

title: A Long Way From Church Street but Still in Sync
description: On a 1988 live recording of The Front Porch Song, which he wrote with Lyle Lovett when they were students at Texas A&M in the late 70s, Robert Earl Keen pauses midway to describe the songs inspiration. We used to sit on this old porch on Church Street, right across from the Presbyterian church, and play bluegrass and folk music, and talk about girls and where we were going to move to when our parents got our grades, he says. Talk about someday becoming big songwriters.

title: Texas Lawmakers Put Down Their Swords
description: If Texas less-than-theatrical 83rd legislative session is remembered at all, it will be known for accords, not discord.

title: Morris Renek, a Novelist of Gift and Determination, Dies at 88
description: Morris Renek, a critically admired New York novelist who wrote comic tales about historical criminals and modern urban life but never achieved the commercial success many thought he deserved, died on May 10 in Manhattan. He was 88.

title: Wayne Miller, Photographer of War and Peace, Dies at 94
description: Wayne Miller, a photographer whose intimate images from the front lines of war, the streets of Chicagos South Side and his own family life captured a world in transition in the middle of the 20th century, died on Wednesday at his home in Orinda, Calif. He was 94.

title: Teixeira Teary-Eyed Over Grandersons Latest Setback
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Somehow, Mark Teixeira was far more emotional about Curtis Grandersons broken left pinkie than Granderson appeared to be Friday night. Teixeira was at Tropicana Field when Granderson learned he would miss at least a month after he was hit by a pitch and broke the fifth metacarpal.

title: Wayne Miller, Magnum Photographer, Dies at 94
description: Mr. Miller once said that what he wanted to do was to photograph mankind and explain man to man.

title: A Clash Over Who Is Allowed to Give You a Brighter Smile
description: GUNTERSVILLE, Ala.  In the middle of the enduring conflict between liberty and public welfare stands Joyce Osborn Wilson and her teeth-whitening business.

title: Giffords Urges Graduates at Bard to Be Courageous
description: ANNANDALE-ON-HUDSON, N.Y.  Speaking uncertainly but smiling broadly, Gabrielle Giffords, the former Arizona congresswoman who became a public face of the gun control movement after she was shot in 2011, delivered a kind of blessing in her commencement address to Bard College graduates here on Saturday afternoon, urging them to be bold, be courageous, be your best.

title: Interpol Rebuffs Russia in Its Hunt for a Kremlin Critic
description: MOSCOW  Interpol has rejected a Russian request for a worldwide police hunt for William F. Browder, a British investment banker and a Kremlin nemesis who has made no secret of his whereabouts or of his battle against the government of President Vladimir V. Putin over accusations of human rights abuses.

title: Last Inspection: Precise Ritual of Dressing Nations War Dead
description: DOVER AIR FORCE BASE, Del.  The soldier bent to his work, careful as a diamond cutter. He carried no weapon or rucksack, just a small plastic ruler, which he used to align a name plate, just so, atop the breast pocket of an Army dress blue jacket, size 39R.

title: A Day Later, Play Resumes, and So Do the Mets Woes
description: There was one encouraging thing that could be said for the Mets at the end of a dismal Saturday during which they rang up two more losses in what is shaping up as a long season. Ike Davis, the monumentally struggling first baseman teetering on the verge of a demotion to the minor leagues, got a single.

title: Yemen Making Strides in Transition to Democracy After Arab Spring
description: For more than two months, 565 people representing a cross section of Yemens population have gathered in a luxury hotel on the outskirts of Sana, the capital, trying to hammer out the shape a future government will take.

title: California Faces a New Quandary, Too Much Money
description: LOS ANGELES  After years of grueling battles over state budget deficits and spending cuts, California has a new challenge on its hands: too much money. An unexpected surplus is fueling an argument over how the state should respond to its turn of good fortune.

title: What to Watch on Sunday at the French Open
description: Six recommended matches to catch on Day 1 of the French Open.

title: U.S. Shift Poses Risk to Pakistan
description: From multibillion-dollar military aid to stealthy and secretive drone strikes, Pakistan, perhaps even more than Afghanistan, has been the central focus of Americas 12-year war on Islamist militancy.

title: Rogers Says Hes Ready for a Role as a Pioneer
description: CARSON, Calif.  Robbie Rogers thought he had stepped away from his career as a professional soccer player the moment he pressed the button publishing a blog post announcing that he was gay. At the time, in February, he said, he could not imagine that he could be himself on and off the field.

title: Offense Vanishes; Rangers Follow
description: BOSTON  The Rangers trailed by a goal, nine minutes from elimination, when the puck found Ryan Callahan alone outside the blue line. The crowd at TD Garden fell silent. The Rangers stood on their bench and leaned over the boards as Callahan churned in on Boston goalie Tuukka Rask, their season on his stick blade.

title: Japanese Lab Workers Exposed to Low Levels of Radiation
description: TOKYO  As many as 55 workers at a national laboratory may have been exposed to low levels of radiation after an experiment overheated, releasing radioactive particles into the air, the agency operating the lab said Saturday.

title: Overbays Homer in the 11th Caps a Stirring Comeback Against the Rays
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Joe Girardi was being debriefed by reporters in his office after one of the Yankees most remarkable games in this remarkable season, going through the list of contributions made by various players after the eighth inning.

title: Syracuse Engineers a Comeback Win; Duke Holds One Off
description: PHILADELPHIA  Duke was 15 minutes from a cakewalk to the national title game, sailing through its semifinal against Cornell with Saturdays blustery wind at its back, looking undaunted and largely unobstructed, all of its diversified offensive machinations firing in full.

title: A Supporting Role
description: In a recent mission, the Americans adjusted to a new role, biting their tongues even as they followed Afghans into what they saw as dubious missions.

title: In Afghan Transition, U.S. Forces Take a Step Back
description: CHAMKANI, Afghanistan  The American soldiers were climbing the steep ridgeline, fractured shale cracking underfoot and sweat pouring off their faces, when their Afghan allies up ahead took off without warning.

title: Fourth Line Gives Bruins an Advantage Once Again
description: BOSTON  The victory was secured. The Bruins were moving on to the Eastern Conference finals after their series-clinching 3-1 victory over the Rangers, and all Boston forward Shawn Thornton could think of was the one that got away.

title: Yankee Stadium Hosts an Exhibition That Has the Feel of a Rehearsal
description: It was a preliminary rendering for curious observers, a rough sketch of one possible future for soccer in New York City.

title: Quotation of the Day for Sunday, May 26
description: If I knew the story of every individual who went through here, I would probably be in a padded cell.

title: Corrections: May 26, 2013
description: NATIONAL

title: Whats On Sunday
description: 9 P.M. (HBO) BEHIND THE CANDELABRA (2013) Michael Douglas, above, stars as the piano showman Liberace, and Matt Damon is Scott Thorson, his chauffeur, lover and adopted son, in this film biography from the director Steven Soderbergh and the screenwriter Richard LaGravenese. Set in Las Vegas, Los Angeles and Palm Springs, the film chronicles the mens relationship as Liberace picks up and possesses Mr. Thorson, has him cosmetically altered in his image and legally adopts him before discarding him for a younger model. Theres something uncanny, even brilliant, about Mr. Douglass impersonation of Liberace, Mike Hale wrote in The New York Times. Sashaying across Las Vegas stages and epic suburban living rooms with a drum majors puffed-up grandeur and a lounge lizards predatory smile, Mr. Douglas gives a performance so assured, so free of camp or cringe, that you quickly surrender any doubts you might have had about his playing a famously flamboyant, closeted-in-plain-sight gay entertainer. At the same time, he said, theres something limited, and limiting, about Mr. Douglass portrayal. Its brilliance feels as if it were all on the surface, a matter of expertise and professionalism. And the same could be said of Mr. Soderberghs film, he added. A cerebral gloss on, and satire of, a big old Hollywood biopic, its full of smart, funny details  perfectly sewn in place, like the rhinestones on one of Mr. Douglass blinding costumes  but its short on heart, or heat.

description: As the Bruins move on to play Pittsburgh in the conference finals, the Rangers face an off-season of self-reflection and of change.

title: Trying to Revive Mideast Talks, Kerry Pushes Investment Plan for West Bank
description: DEAD SEA, Jordan  In an effort to revive the moribund peace talks between Israel and the Palestinians, Secretary of State John Kerry announced a plan on Sunday to invest as much as $4 billion to develop the economy of the West Bank.

title: The Last Sweet Year of High School Slips Away
description: It began with the last PTA Back-to-School Coffee. This season of lasts, when every ritual, every event, seems freighted with extra meaning. Its my only childs senior year of high school, a year in which we are preparing to transition to the next phase of our lives. Perched on metal bleachers with the other team parents, my husband and I watched the sun go down behind the scoreboard of what would be Annas last high school water polo game. We trundled through her schedule of classes during the last back-to-school night. I had Anna pick the tulips we would plant for her last spring at home (for now, anyway), and they bloomed in a riot of lovely, bulbous pastels.

title: Errani Outplays Rus in Early Match
description: PARIS  The last time Sara Errani of Italy played a match at the French Open, the stands were filled with more than 15,000 spectators. It was the womens final last year, when she lost to Maria Sharapova of Russia.

title: Nadals Knee
description: Rafael Nadals style of play and his two-handed backhand put a lot of stress on his injured left knee.

description: THE HAGUE  Hops, malt, yeast, water and  proprietary fracking chemicals?

description: Update: Brad DeLong makes my point with graphs.

title: Macroeconomic Hippie-Punching
description: Brad DeLong interprets the Keynes-bashing opening of Ken Rogoffs latest as strategic hippie-punching (see definition 2.2), designed to soften up his readers for the easy-money, debt-forgiveness message that follows.

description: MOORE, Okla.  President Obama walked among 10-foot-tall piles of tornado debris littered with childrens schoolbooks on Sunday as he offered the condolences of a nation to a town nearly wiped off the map by a storm.

description: Its hard for first-grade fingers, Camilla Hammer explained. We tell them its like putting sprinkles on a cupcake.

title: Safety Agency to Investigate Ford Pickup Engine Trouble
description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Sunday that it was investigating consumer complaints about sharp reductions in acceleration on 2011 to 2013 Ford F-150 pickups that are equipped with the 3.5-liter EcoBoost V-6 engine.

description: The New York City Planning Commission last week took a significant but fatally flawed step toward improving the lives of millions of New Yorkers and others who use Pennsylvania Station, the nations busiest transit hub.

title: Burdette Defeats Vekic to Move to Second Round
description: PARIS  Mallory Burdette, among the corps of talented young American women at the French Open, rolled past Donna Vekic of Croatia, 6-3, 6-4, in just 72 minutes on Sunday.

title: Hezbollah Areas in Beirut Are Hit
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Two rockets crashed into southern Beirut suburbs controlled by the militant Shiite group Hezbollah on Sunday, wounding four people. The attack, the first on the groups Beirut stronghold since the hostilities in Syria broke out two years ago, raised anxieties here that the fighting next door was beginning to revive Lebanons own sectarian conflicts.

title: Wind Down the War on Terrorism? Republicans Say No
description: Republican lawmakers on Sunday criticized President Obamas vision for winding down the war on terrorism, using talk show appearances to accuse him of misunderstanding the threat in a way that will embolden unfriendly nations.

title: Quelling Anxiety Across the Chesapeake
description: STEVENSVILLE, Md.  On stormy days, it is difficult to see the shore from the halfway point. The bridge, arcing high into the air, has tall ships passing beneath. Its guardrails look like split-rail farm fences, revealing a dizzying drop to choppy waters.

title: As His Father Did, Rosberg Wins Monaco Grand Prix
description: MONACO  With his father, Keke, watching by the side of the track, the German driver Nico Rosberg won Formula Ones most prestigious race, the Monaco Grand Prix, on Sunday, 30 years after Keke Rosberg won it. It is the first time a father and son have won the race.

title: Mayoral Races of 70s Offer Similarities, if Little Insight, to the Current Field
description: In 1973, the early front-runners campaign for New York City mayor stalled after revelations that he had refused to answer questions from a grand jury. A former mayor flirted with running again to derail would-be successors. A runoff was imposed to guard against a weak candidate winning the Democratic primary, as had happened four years earlier, and, not incidentally, to hamper a black or Hispanic candidacy.

title: Boston Marathon Winner Will Donate His Medal
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia  In a somber ceremony at the American Embassy in Ethiopia on Sunday, Lelisa Desisa, the mens winner of this years Boston Marathon, said he intended to donate his medal to the people of Boston.

title: Playing as if Hes in His Prime, Duncan Lifts the Revitalized Spurs
description: It is not true that Tim Duncan has only two facial expressions, but you could forgive anyone who arrived at that conclusion after watching him play basketball.

title: The Essayification of Everything
description: Lately, you may have noticed the spate of articles and books that take interest in the essay as a flexible and very human literary form. These include The Wayward Essay and Phillip Lopates reflections on the relationship between essay and doubt, and books such as How to Live, Sarah Bakewells elegant portrait of Montaigne, the 16th-century patriarch of the genre, and an edited volume by Carl H. Klaus and Ned Stuckey-French called Essayists on the Essay: Montaigne to Our Time.

title: Europeans Press China Over Trade in Telecom
description: Last month in Paris, Ken Hu, the acting chief executive of Huawei, told a group of journalists that the fast-growing Chinese maker of telecommunications network equipment had not come to France to supplant Alcatel-Lucent in its home market.
