title: In Sales, Fast & Furious 6 Wins Fast and Furiously
description: LOS ANGELES  Hollywood expected a box-office drag race to end them all for the Memorial Day weekend, with two huge-scale sequels, both in categories most popular with younger men, opening in rare direct competition. But it turned out to be no contest at all.

title: Temple Art Come to Life: The Odissi Classical Style in Full Flower
description: How marvelous, amid the furor of the ballet spring season at Lincoln Center, to spend an evening watching top-level Indian dance  and to recall that its Odissi genre is not only far older than ballet but just as beautiful, classical and compelling. Pure dance and speaking mime alternate and overlap; every part of the body is involved, not the least fingers and eyes; the tilt of the shoulder line from one diagonal to another becomes a richly harmonic effect, like a change from one full chord to another; long-held poses sing out with powerfully sculptural effect amid rapid rhythms.

title: Al Jazeera America Shifts Focus to U.S. News
description: While it has a foreign name, the forthcoming Al Jazeera cable channel in the United States wants to be American through and through.

title: Kanaan Darts to Long-Sought Win at Indy
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Nine years ago, during a visit to Indianapolis, Tony Kanaan went to see a young girl in a hospital. She was comatose after a stroke and was scheduled to have an operation the next day. Kanaan gave her mother a necklace, a gift from his mother, for good luck.

title: Examining Nadals Knee Injury
description: Rafael Nadal missed seven months last year with a knee injury. That knee will face its toughest test when he plays in the French Open, his first Grand Slam event since his return.

title: A Killer Turns Time Into a Getaway Vehicle
description: The year is 1974. A precocious little girl is playing outdoors with a toy circus shes built when a spooky gent with a limp approaches her. She shows him the bumblebee that, in her imagination, is a lion. He pulls its wings off. He would hurt her too, but little girls bore him.

title: Real First-Round Foe for Womens No. 1: Microphone
description: PARIS  It was a day for staring down first-round demons in Paris, the city of blight when it comes to Serena Williamss record in Grand Slam tournaments.

title: Israeli Venture Meant to Serve Electric Cars Is Ending Its Run
description: JERUSALEM  The vision was ambitious. Better Place, an electric vehicle infrastructure company, unveiled plans more than five years ago to pioneer a system of quick-service battery swapping stations across Israel to enable unlimited travel.

title: For Bloomberg and Bike-Sharing Program, the Big Moment Arrives
description: He festooned New York City with hundreds of miles of bike lanes and dispatched chairs and picnic tables to Broadway, where cars once roamed.

title: Love Triangles Multiplied
description: Alessandro Scarlatti, described by the New Grove Dictionary of Opera as the most important opera composer of his generation in Italy, wrote more than 60 operas, working mostly in the convention-bound medium of opera seria. Who could blame him for wanting to break loose, late in his career, with a lone, irreverent comedy?

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: In observance of Memorial Day, the stock and bond markets will be closed on Monday. The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes the regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills on Tuesday and an auction of four-week bills on Wednesday.

title: Higher, Faster, Longer: 2 Former Bolshoi Superstars Are a Sensation
description: Although the first and firmest rule for audiences should always be to refrain from comment during a performance, its often funny to spot who needs to break the rule and why. On Saturday night at American Ballet Theater, Natalia Osipova and Ivan Vasiliev danced the lead roles in Don Quixote. The two ladies seated behind me, in tizzies of excitement, could seldom shut up.

title: Sabathia Pinpoints Problem: Its Him
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  About 15 minutes after C. C. Sabathia and the Yankees were pounded by the Tampa Bay Rays, the pitching coach Larry Rothschild sat next to Sabathia in front of his locker, and they had a brief conversation in hushed tones.

title: Consoles Moving Into Next Generation
description: REDMOND, Wash.  On a gray day here last week, Microsoft officials welcomed a few hundred people into a tent pitched on a soccer field at the companys headquarters. Microsoft was unveiling an appliance, the Xbox One, which takes up about as much room as a lazy house cat and is designed to be plugged into a television.

title: Economic Reports for the Week Ahead
description: ECONOMIC REPORTS Data to be released include the S.& P./Case-Shiller Index, the Richmond Federal Reserve manufacturing index and the Dallas Federal Reserve manufacturing index (Tuesday); the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development economic outlook, and the European Union Consumer Price Index (Wednesday); first-quarter gross domestic product, weekly initial jobless claims, pending home sales, euro zone consumer confidence and Japanese inflation (Thursday); and the Chicago purchasing managers index for May, the University of Michigan consumer sentiment index for May and personal income and spending (Friday).

title: Story of Young Womans Awakening Is Top Winner
description: CANNES, France  Blue Is the Warmest Color  an emotionally raw and sexually explicit contemporary French drama and critical favorite about a young womans awakening  won the Palme dOr on Sunday evening at the 66th Cannes Film Festival here.

title: The Rite of Passage at Cannes
description: CANNES, France  As he stood here after the premiere of his new movie, The Immigrant, James Gray smiled widely. It had been five years since he had been to the Cannes Film Festival with Two Lovers, which was also the last time he had directed a movie. Flanked by Marion Cotillard and Jeremy Renner, two of the stars from his latest, Mr. Gray, 44, looked content for a man who earlier that day had compared facing the journalist hordes to having a colonoscopy without anesthesia. But the hordes had been dispatched and now he could bask in an audiences love. So he smiled, hugged Ms. Cotillard and then, abruptly, buried his face in his blue bespoke tuxedo jacket.

title: A Family Streamed Back to Life
description: Chalk one up for the Internet: It has killed Arrested Development.

title: Its All Hands on Deck at a Childrens Concert
description: About an hour before the New York Philharmonics Young Peoples Concert on Saturday afternoon, the lobby spaces of Avery Fisher Hall were transformed into Kidzone. Children and their parents roamed around outside the auditorium; the mood buzzed pleasantly.

title: Seeking Period Precision In Channeling the Masters
description: The long battle to have early and Baroque music played on accurate instruments and in accurate style has been largely won.

title: Its The Policy, Stupid
description: Source.

title: Joke Starter
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  I tumbled to Doug Petersons DOUBLE DOWN theme fairly quickly, but it wasnt until I got to 29 Down that I flashed back to an interesting moment in my childrens development where they became obsessed with KNOCK KNOCK jokes.

title: Dioramas of a Nightmare
description: A look at Ai Weiweis work being shown in Venice.

title: The Longest Day and Young Chelsea Bridge Club
description: Bridge marathons are few and far between. Four students played in London for 170 hours in 1969. Three years later four students in Edinburgh broke that record by 10 hours. The Young Chelsea Bridge Club in London has organized several marathons that last exactly 24 hours, but teams of three may enter.

title: An Artist Depicts His Demons
description: BEIJING  For a year and a half the artist Ai Weiwei and a sculptor friend oversaw a team of 20 to 30 people toiling away here in secret on one of his most political and personal projects.

title: 4,300 Singers Gather in Russia
description: A choir of more than 4,335 people assembled on Sunday near St. Isaacs Cathedral in St. Petersburg, Russia, to perform an hourlong concert of 14 songs in an effort to set the record for the worlds largest choir, The Associated Press reported. The event was one of many to observe the 310th anniversary of St. Petersburg and included singers of all ages, including professional and amateur choirs from the area. The effort to receive a distinction from Guinness World Records has a big challenge: According to the Guinness Web site, the largest choir performed on Jan. 30, 2011, in Chennai, India, where 121,440 people sang in unison for more than five minutes.

title: Watford to Face Crystal Palace in English Promotion Final
description: LONDON  It is being called the richest single match in the history of soccer.

title: Gay Marriage Is Protested in France
description: PARIS  Thousands of French marched on Sunday, Frances Mothers Day, to protest the recent legalization of gay marriage. Despite initial worries, the demonstration was largely peaceful, with the police estimating that about 150,000 people took part.

title: Questions and Answers on Citi Bike
description: Beginning on Monday, roughly 6,000 bicycles will be available for public use at more than 300 stations in Manhattan below Central Park, and parts of Brooklyn. Anyone who is at least 16 can check out a bike from any station and return it to any other station in the city. Here are some answers to questions about the program, which is called Citi Bike.

title: PBS Demands, and Gets, More Reporting in a Film
description: The independent short film Outlawed in Pakistan had its United States premiere in January at the Sundance Film Festival, where The Los Angeles Times called it among the standouts.

title: Oregon Youth Is Accused of Plotting School Attack
description: Law enforcement officials in Oregon say they have disrupted a plot by a student to set off explosives at his high school in what one official described on Sunday as a video-game style of killing people reminiscent of the Columbine High School massacre.

title: An Ad Campaign at WNET Uses Reality TV as a Punchline
description: After years of viewers complaining about reality television, a television station is chiming in.

title: Computer Network Piecing Together a Jigsaw of Jewish Lore
description: TEL AVIV  One scholar likened it to finding the orphaned socks for generations of a family. Another compared it to law-enforcements use of DNA databases and face-recognition software.

title: Preparing 9 Months for the Fruits of a Storm
description: Late last October, Hurricane Sandy pumped six feet of water into the lobby of a residential building in downtown Jersey City, trapping Meaghan B Murphy and her husband, Patrick, in their apartment and leaving them without electricity for days.

title: From Brooklyn to the Pacers, a Story of Torment and Triumph
description: Two years ago, the filmmaker Ted Green began working on a segment about the early days of the Indiana Pacers. During his research, Green repeatedly came across the name Roger Brown. Browns imprint was all over the Pacers history and record books.

title: For New Breed of Rustlers, Nothing Is Sacred
description: NEW DELHI  When night falls in this gritty capital, gangs troll the darkened streets looking for easy prey among a portion of the citys vast homeless population; thousands have been rounded up and carried off in trucks in recent years.

title: A Rare Improvement After a Triple Crown
description: It is beginning to look as if winning baseballs first triple crown since 1967 was just a warm-up act for the Detroit Tigers Miguel Cabrera.

title: Ed Shaughnessy, Tonight Drummer, Is Dead at 84
description: Ed Shaughnessy, whose deft drumming anchored the Tonight Show orchestra for 29 years, died on Friday at his home in Calabasas, Calif. He was 84.

title: Concert Industry Struggles With Bots That Siphon Off Tickets
description: As the summer concert season approaches, music fans and the concert industry that serves them have a common enemy in New York. And in Russia. And in India.

title: Guards in India Were Outgunned, Attack Survivor Says
description: NEW DELHI  A survivor of one of the worst guerrilla attacks in Indias long-running Maoist insurgency said Sunday that the security force guarding the ambushed convoy of top state political leaders in the state of Chhattisgarh was outnumbered and outgunned during an hourlong firefight.

title: Her Body Betraying Her, Venus Williams Makes Quick Exit
description: PARIS  On another day, in a different time, Venus Williams would have dispatched Urszula Radwanska the way big sisters send little sisters away. But Williams, now nearing the end of her career, has not been the dominant sister even in her own sibling match for years and Radwanska, with many more years to go, happens to be the younger sister of Agnieszka Radwanska, the fourth seed here.

title: News Corp. Says It Was Not Told of Subpoena for Reporters Phone Records
description: News Corporation said on Sunday that it had no record of being notified by the Justice Department nearly three years ago of a subpoena for the telephone records of a reporter at its Fox News cable channel.

title: Archdiocese Pays for Health Plan That Covers Birth Control
description: As the nations leading Roman Catholic bishop, Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan of New York has been spearheading the fight against a provision of the new health care law that requires employers, including some that are religiously affiliated, to cover birth control in employee health plans.

title: Early Glimpse of Greatness for Rangers Yields to a Pile of Contract Issues
description: One beautiful play, made long ago and never repeated, epitomized the high hopes and dashed promise of the Rangers season. It happened Jan. 23 at Madison Square Garden, in the third game of the schedule, against the same Boston Bruins team that would eliminate them four months later.

title: A Legacy Feud in Tech
description: SAN FRANCISCO  If the Hatfields and McCoys lived in Silicon Valley, theyd be fighting with piles of cash and lines of software code instead of knives and shotguns. And the fight would be over who wins the most customers in the computer industrys growing cloud of software services.

title: Lacrosse Final Gets New A.C.C. Rivalry Off to a Fast Start
description: PHILADELPHIA  Syracuse had already said just about all its goodbyes to the Big East before Saturdays N.C.A.A. semifinal lacrosse game against Denver, but Derek Maltzs winning goal with 19.2 seconds left may have served as one last tug on the conference cord.

title: Teams in Familiar Spots as Subway Series Returns
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Like many of the current Yankees, Vernon Wells has never played in a Subway Series against the Mets. But he has still paid attention to those games from afar and can reel off big moments with as much knowledge as any New York baseball fan.

title: Bad Time to Face Yanks for the Mets
description: Although the Yankees are the team that has been battered by injuries this season, the Mets are the ones who are hurting heading into this years revamped Subway Series, which starts Monday.

title: How the Military Talks About Sexual Assault
description: Does the Pentagon know what zero tolerance means?

title: So Bake Sales Are Taboo? Try Selling Hand Sanitizer
description: Lynn Carlson, who teaches law and history at a Queens public school, could once count on bake sales and candy drives to raise thousands of dollars for her annual trip with students to Washington or Boston.

title: Americans and Their Military, Drifting Apart
description: STANFORD, Calif.  AFTER fighting two wars in nearly 12 years, the United States military is at a turning point. So are the American people. The armed forces must rethink their mission. Though the nation has entered an era of fiscal constraint, and though President Obama last week effectively declared an end to the global war on terror that began on Sept. 11, 2001, the military remains determined to increase the gap between its war-fighting capabilities and those of any potential enemies. But the greatest challenge to our military is not from a foreign enemy  its the widening gap between the American people and their armed forces.

title: CapeFlyer Makes Its Debut
description: The last direct train from Boston to Hyannis, Mass., stopped a half-century ago, and on Friday passengers boarded the CapeFlyer for its inaugural run.

title: Train Service to Cape Cod, an Alternative to Road Rage
description: HYANNIS, Mass.  On Friday night, as the CapeFlyer rumbled over the canal that separates Cape Cod from the rest of Massachusetts, some of the officials aboard were not regarding the scenic waters or the marvels of the silver lift bridge that carried the train.

title: The Fight Over Recess Appointments
description: When the Senate is not available to confirm presidential nominees, the Constitution gives the president the power to temporarily fill government positions. Senate Republicans have gone out of their way to make themselves effectively unavailable, refusing to confirm nominees to agencies whose missions they oppose. That is why President Obama has had to make many recess appointments, including five to the National Labor Relations Board.

title: Geoengineering: Our Last Hope, or a False Promise?
description: CANBERRA, Australia  THE concentration of carbon dioxide in the earths atmosphere recently surpassed 400 parts per million for the first time in three million years. If you are not frightened by this fact, then you are ignoring or denying science.

title: The Obamacare Shock
description: The Affordable Care Act, a k a Obamacare, goes fully into effect at the beginning of next year, and predictions of disaster are being heard far and wide. There will be an administrative train wreck, were told; consumers will face a terrible shock. Republicans, one hears, are already counting on the laws troubles to give them a big electoral advantage.

title: Public Records on the Newtown Shootings
description: It would be hard to compound the tragedy of the Newtown school massacre, in which 20 children and six school employees died, but a misbegotten proposal aimed for the Connecticut Legislature would do just that.

title: Groups Targeted by I.R.S. Tested Rules on Politics
description: When CVFC, a conservative veterans group in California, applied for tax-exempt status with the Internal Revenue Service, its biggest expenditure that year was several thousand dollars in radio ads backing a Republican candidate for Congress.

title: Silence on This Day
description: If you listen carefully, you can almost hear the silence at the heart of Memorial Day  the inward turn that thoughts take on a day set aside to honor the men and women who have died in the service of this country.

title: Throwing Money at Nukes
description: The United States has about 180 B61 gravity nuclear bombs based in Europe. They are the detritus of the cold war, tactical weapons deployed in Belgium, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands and Turkey to protect NATO allies from the once-feared Soviet advantage in conventional arms. But the cold war is long over, and no American military commander can conceive of their ever being used. Even so, President Obama has put $537 million in his 2014 budget proposal to upgrade these bombs. When all is said and done, experts say, the cost of the rebuilding program is expected to total around $10 billion  $4 billion more than an earlier projection  and yield an estimated 400 weapons, fitted with new guided tail kits so that they are more reliable and accurate than the current ones.

title: The Union Dead
description: The best-known national cemeteries  Arlington in Virginia, Golden Gate in California  mingle veterans of different wars. But in the burial grounds where space for graves ran out sooner, Civil War soldiers dominate. Fredericksburg, Glendale, Antietam, City Point: these smaller cemeteries have a sleepier air than the seemingly infinite green fields of Arlington.

title: Partisan Gridlock Thwarts Effort to Alter Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  When he talks to Republicans in Congress, Scott DeFife, a restaurant industry lobbyist, speaks their language: President Obamas health care law is a train wreck well down the track. There will be collateral damage if changes are not made. Friends of the industry cannot sit back and let that happen.

title: Who Owns This Land? In Greece, Who Knows?
description: ATHENS  Not long ago Leonidas Hamodrakas, a lawyer in Athens, decided to pay closer attention to his familys land holdings  some fields, a scattering of buildings and a massive stone tower  in Mani, a rural region in southern Greece.

title: Founder of Military Museum Is Killed by Police in Connecticut
description: A Connecticut man who was shot and killed by the local police at the start of the Memorial Day weekend was identified Sunday by state authorities as a 75-year-old Army veteran and founder of a military museum in Danbury.

title: One-Day Deals Making E-Books Brief Best Sellers
description: One Sunday this month, the crime thriller Gone, Baby, Gone, by Dennis Lehane, sold 23 e-book copies, a typically tiny number for a book that was originally published in 1998 but has faded into obscurity.

A Rising Tide of Suicides, and Access to Guns

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: The Uses and Abuses of Plastic Bags
Dirty and Dated, but Irreplaceable
description: It is one of our enduring family photos from youth baseball: my sister dutifully in attendance, my father in a tie, my mother with a confectionary meringue of a bouffant. She looks like Peggy from Mad Men, and she is holding neither peanuts nor Cracker Jack but a can of bug spray.

title: British Officials Knew Suspect in Soldiers Death Had Ties to Al Qaeda
description: LONDON  Britains security agencies appeared headed for a period of deeply uncomfortable scrutiny after the government said Sunday that it had been aware for more than two years that one of the two men suspected of hacking an off-duty British soldier to death on a London street had ties to Al Qaeda.

title: Seeking Food Ingredients That Arent Gene-Altered
description: Food companies big and small are struggling to replace genetically modified ingredients with conventional ones.

title: What to Watch on Day 2 at the French Open
description: Rafael Nadal vs. Daniel Brands Daniel Brands has improved his ranking by nearly 100 spots already in the first five months of the 2013 season, moving from No. 153 to his current spot at No. 59. If conditions are cold and damp, the 6-foot-5 German Brandss hard, flat hitting could prove uncomfortable for Nadal, despite Nadals near invincibility on Parisian clay. This will be Nadals first Grand Slam match since his shocking loss to Lukas Rosol at Wimbledon in 2012, but there should be little reason to doubt his readiness for returning to best-of-five.

title: Deal Reached to Reduce Inequality in Colombia
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Peace negotiators for the Colombian government and the countrys largest rebel group said Sunday that they had reached an agreement on a plan to reduce inequality in rural areas.

title: A Team to Tackle Hoarding
description: Members of the Orange County Task Force on Hoarding speak about how they deal with the multidimensional aspects of hoarding behavior.

title: Understanding Hoarding
description: Hoarding was once considered a type of obsessive compulsive disorder, but studies have shown that only 20 percent of people who hoard also have O.C.D. Some 50 percent of hoarders, however, suffer from major depression. In the new Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, hoarding is now defined as distinct disorder.

title: Task Forces Offer Hoarders a Way to Dig Out
description: YORBA LINDA, Calif.  Wet rag in hand, the older woman was trying to clean her filthy, packed garage to comply with a warning that she was violating city codes. As two officials approached to check on her progress, she proudly pointed to an open box in which she had placed two dead rats.

title: In Sweden, Riots Put an Identity in Question
description: STOCKHOLM  Eva Bromster, an elementary school principal, was jolted awake by a telephone call late Thursday night. Your school is burning, her boss, the director of the local education department, told her.

title: Bettering His Age, Now 84, Routinely
description: BOYNTON BEACH, Fla.  Most golfers can only dream of shooting their age.

title: Lazio Beats Roma in Italian Cup Final
description: Citizens of Rome went to the polls this weekend to elect their next mayor. But the current one, Gianni Alemanno, was not referring to his re-election campaign Sunday morning when he announced, This is a huge party for our city today, and we should not disturb or ruin it.

title: Flagrant Foul Called on Wade, 2 Days Later
description: INDIANAPOLIS  It is tempting to view the Eastern Conference finals as an upstart, unafraid Indiana Pacers team versus the greatest player of this era, LeBron James. But Dwyane Wade, another Miami Heat superstar, is doing what he can to elbow his way onto Jamess stage.

title: Kudla Falls to Czech Veteran
description: PARIS  Denis Kudla, 20, of Arlington, Va., a promising American who qualified for the French Open on Friday, fell in the first round on Sunday, but not without a battle.

title: Quotation of the Day for Monday, May 27
description: If you calculated the total deeds that are registered, the country would be twice as big as it is.

title: Davis Changes His Luck, as Well as the Mets
description: After a four-strikeout game against the Atlanta Braves on Friday, as bad a night as he has had during a horrid season-long slump, Mets first baseman Ike Davis went into the batting cage and hit for almost two hours.

title: Power of One | Miuccia Pradas Circle of Influence
description: Miuccia Prada is a fashion designer by profession, but shes also an art curator, film producer, fledgling architect, conflicted feminist, avid consumer and unreconstructed socialist. Meet the modern woman.

title: Let Them Make Their Own Jobs
description: Nancy Folbre is an economics professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst.

title: Battling Cancer Together
description: Three days after her double mastectomy for recurrent breast cancer, Elissa Bantug, then 25, needed to feel whole again. But when she expressed a desire for intimacy, her fianc (now her husband) walked away, leaving her feeling hurt and angry and worried about their future together.

title: Corrections: May 27, 2013
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Untested Pacers Act Their Age; James Merely Acts Like Himself
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The Indiana Pacers Paul George got to shake LeBron Jamess hand again Sunday night, but this time he was not basking in a show of respect from James, the N.B.A.s most valuable player.

title: Whats on Monday
description: 9 P.M. (Lifetime) RING OF FIRE (2013) Jewel, the Grammy-nominated singer, stars in this adaptation of Anchored in Love: An Intimate Portrait of June Carter Cash, John Carter Cashs narrative about his mothers life. The story traces her childhood in the mountains of Virginia and her rise to fame with the Carter Family to her solo career and turbulent but enduring marriage to Johnny Cash (Matt Ross, above, with Jewel). Frances Conroy rounds out the cast as Junes mother, Maybelle Carter; John Doe portrays her uncle A. P. Carter, and the Peasall Sisters stand in for the Carter Sisters. At 6 on Oxygen, Reese Witherspoon, in an Oscar-winning role, and Joaquin Phoenix, in an Oscar-nominated performance, portray Johnny and June Carter Cash in James Mangolds Walk the Line (2005).

title: At Coca-Cola 600, Three Red Flags and Finally a Checkered One
description: CONCORD, N.C.  On a day meant for racing, beginning with the Formula One Monaco Grand Prix and followed by the Indianapolis 500, Nascar earned some headlines of its own in its showcase Coca-Cola 600 at Charlotte Motor Speedway on Sunday night.

title: Farewell, Sammy the Deli Man
description: Dear Diary:

title: IHT Quick Read: May 27
description: NEWS Two rockets crashed into southern Beirut suburbs controlled by the militant Shiite group Hezbollah on Sunday, wounding four people. The attack, the first on the groups Beirut stronghold since the hostilities in Syria broke out two years ago, raised anxieties here that the fighting next door was beginning to revive Lebanons own sectarian conflicts. Anne Barnard reports from Beirut.

title: Nikkei Sinks Again Amid Mixed Signals From Central Bank
description: HONG KONG  The Japanese central bank on Monday released minutes of a recent meeting that showed some board members skeptical of the banks own strategy of lifting Japan from deflation, while another big fall in the countrys stock market stoked fears of further volatility in the weeks and months ahead.

title: Memorable Moments at the Astrodome
description: The Astrodome, nicknamed the Eighth Wonder of the World, has hosted many notable events, from college basketballs Game of the Century, to tenniss Battle of the Sexes.

title: Milestone for Gay Athletes as Rogers Plays for Galaxy
description: CARSON, Calif.  When Robbie Rogers stepped on the field late Sunday night as a substitute for the Los Angeles Galaxy, it was familiar turf. He trained on the field as a youth when it opened more than a decade ago. It is where he helped the Columbus Crew win an M.L.S. Cup title.

title: Buyout Offer Brings China Into the Orbit of Club Med
description: 7:52 p.m. | Updated

title: European Nations End Weapons Embargo, Creating Path to Arming Syrian Rebels
description: BRUSSELS  Divisions among European Union foreign ministers on Monday prevented the renewal of the arms embargo on Syria, raising the possibility of a new flow of weapons to rebels fighting to bring down the government of President Bashar al-Assad.

title: South Korea Urges North to Be Serious Before Talks
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea opposes engaging the North in another round of talks for talks sake, its foreign minister said Monday, after a special North Korean envoy reportedly told Beijing that the North was ready to return to the negotiating table.

title: Security Forces Fatalities on the Rise in Kashmir
description: NEW DELHI In two separate gun battles between security forces and militants last week, four soldiers and two militants were killed in the Kashmir Valley.

title: Daily Report: Roots of a Rivalry in Cloud Computing
description: If the Hatfields and McCoys lived in Silicon Valley, they would be fighting with piles of cash and lines of software code instead of knives and shotguns. And the fight would be over who wins the most customers in the computer industrys growing cloud of software services, Quentin Hardy writes in The New York Times.

title: U.N. Rights Chief Says Governments Fail to Protect Victims of Syria Conflict
description: GENEVA  The international community is failing to meet its obligations to victims of Syrias conflict, the United Nations top human rights official said Monday, invoking the responsibility of governments to protect civilians of another country from war crimes, crimes against humanity and genocide.

title: Y2K: Much Ado About Nothing?
description: Retro Report: The Y2K bug threatened to wipe out computers and disrupt modern society at the end of the 20th century.  We all remember the doomsday hype, but what really happened?

title: Revisiting Y2K: Much Ado About Nothing?
description: There have always been a few people around who think the world as we know it is about to end. But in the late 1990s there arose fears of a computer bug named Y2K, which was so worrisome that President Clinton actually appointed a Y2K czar to prepare the country for the worst.

title: Q&A: Rescuing Lost Videos From YouTube
description: Q.

title: Moscows Gay-Bashing Ritual
description: MOSCOW  I arrived at the edge of Gorky Park as one arrives on a red carpet: A score of photographers surrounded me and started clicking away. I was the first person to show up for an L.G.B.T. rally scheduled for 5 p.m. Saturday, one of three pride events held in the city that day.

title: Japans wartime brothels
description: The statement earlier this month by Toru Hashimoto, mayor of Osaka, that brothels established by the Japanese Army in occupied territories during World War II were necessary to relieve war-crazed soldiers is either ignorant, naive or deliberately misleading. It is a fact that across Asia, Japans soldiers and officers relieved themselves by systematic rape of the civilian population.

title: Braving the Indian Heat
Japanese Politician Reframes Comments on Sex Slavery
description: TOKYO  Seeking to quell an uproar over his recent comments suggesting that sexual slavery was a necessary evil in Japans imperial past, a populist party leader said Monday that he had not meant to justify wartime brothels or deny the womens suffering at the hands of Japanese soldiers.

description: LONDON  So much for a quiet weekend.

description: They say it is always better to be overdressed than underdressed. And this, it seems, is the only fashion rule Delhi women take seriously.

title: Nightmare in Portugal
description: The FT has a long, deeply depressing portrait of conditions in Portugal, focusing on the plight of family-owned businesses  once the core of the nations economy and society, now going under in droves.

title: Dog Bites Can Raise Your Insurance Premiums
description: Dog bites continue to represent one-third of the payout dollars for homeowner liability claims, according to the latest data from the Insurance Information Institute and State Farm Insurance.

title: Portuguese Memories (Trivial and Personal)
description: I didnt want to mix this in with my substantive Portugal post, but a few readers might be interested in some maudlin memories from my youth.

title: The Affectionate Burden Left by a Fallen Friend
description: On May 18, 2010, I awoke to the all-too-familiar sound of an improvised explosive device detonating. But this one was different from others we had encountered in Marja, Afghanistan, that spring. This explosion shook our entire patrol, and the barking of orders that followed proved the reality of what had happened. I knew that my platoon had been hit. As I donned my gear, I began to pray for whoever might have been wounded, and that we could evacuate them as quickly as possible.

title: Fair Ticketing: Fans Before Scalpers
description: Live Nation, Ticketmaster's parent company, is launching new technology to thwart the scalpers who use bots to sweep up the best concert seats and resell them at high prices.

title: For Young Drivers, Drinking Is More Dangerous
description: Fatal accidents involving drivers who have been drinking vary sharply depending on a drivers age and the time of day.

title: Blake Is Reflective After First-Round Loss
description: PARIS  After winning only eight games in 88 minutes on Sunday, the unseeded James Blake peered into the past and pondered the future as he absorbed his loss in the first round of the French Open.

title: Remembering a Childs Grief
description: Each time I catch a glimpse of chilling footage from the recent tragedies in this country (the Newtown shootings, the Boston bombings and, now, the Oklahoma tornado), I find myself looking at the children in the images  terrified, shocked, changed. I see their faces when I close my eyes to sleep at night.

title: An Amazon Platform for Fan Fiction
description: Fan fiction, a labor of love for die-hard fans of popular characters and intellectual properties, previously relegated to the back alleys of the Internet, has now been legitimized.

title: Young Drivers and Alcohol: A Deadly Mix
description: WASHINGTON  It is well known that young drivers are more likely than older ones to have accidents. But a visual analysis of national data on drunken driving puts the disparity into stark relief  and suggests whose lives might be saved by a proposal to lower the legal blood-alcohol limit.

title: Excerpt: 'The Trip to Bountiful'
description: The audience joins in as Cicely Tyson sings the hymn Blessed Assurance in a scene from the Broadway revival of Horton Footes play.

title: Image of the Day: May 27
When It Starts to Rain  Do You Run?
description: Say youre out for a stroll and it starts to rain. It begins to pour. Youre without an umbrella. What do you do?

title: Its a Steal: Madoff Home Up for Sale
description: A tour of the former home of Peter B. Madoff, brother and co-conspirator of Bernard L. Madoff. Both men are in jail for a Ponzi scheme, and the home is being sold to repay victims.

title: Angelina Jolies Aunt Dies of Breast Cancer
description: Less than two weeks after Angelina Jolie described her decision to have a double mastectomy to avoid breast cancer in an Op-Ed article in The New York Times, her aunt, Debbie Martin, has died of the disease in Escondido, Calif., The Associated Press reported. She was 61 and died on Sunday.

title: For Sale: A Madoff Home With a Pool, and Shadows
description: The lush white mansion for sale at 34 Pheasant Run in Old Westbury on Long Island makes a grand first impression. It has a long, winding driveway; a tennis court; a two-bedroom pool house surrounded by lavish gardens; a parade of antiques in its hallways; and marble in hues of lapis and gold throughout the ground floor.

title: Very Late Motherhood
description: Q. Could a postmenopausal woman bear her own child from stored eggs and semen?

title: Ted Spagnas Sleep Studies
description: For sleep evangelists and connoisseurs, and even for sleep strivers, the publication this fall from Rizzoli of Sleep by Ted Spagna is a watershed event. Beginning in 1975, Spagna mounted time-lapse cameras in his subjects bedrooms, producing portraits from a Gods-eye view and cataloging, in full color, the rich language of sleep: tosses, turns, expressions, positions, intimacy, solitude. It was curiosity alone that led the photographer, who died in 1989, to his first sleeping subject: himself. I was surprised to see another self that existed in sleep that I didnt know about, he has said. Looking at these photos, Im reminded of John Steinbeck, who wrote, It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it. Spagna, more than anyone else, took us inside the committee room.

title: Pops Song, a sample track from the Martian Chronicles.
Note the Moment, Not the Man
description: The blessing and curse of progress is that you cannot choose your heroes, no matter how long you wait for them to emerge.

title: Justices Agree to Agree, at Least for the Moment
description: WASHINGTON  There has been a remarkable outbreak of harmony at the Supreme Court. Of the seven decisions issued in the last two weeks, six were unanimous.

title: Bizarre Ruling Mars End of Lis First-Round Victory
description: Li Na won her first-round match Monday over Anabel Medina Garrigues, 6-3, 6-4, but not without a messy end to the penultimate game.

title: In Performance: Larry Pine
description: Larry Pine in a scene from A Public Reading of an Unproduced Screenplay About the Death of Walt Disney, Lucas Hnaths play at Soho Rep.

title: Fat Talk Compels but Carries a Cost
description: Over winter break, Carolyn Bates, a college senior, and a friend each picked out five pairs of jeans at a Gap store in Indianapolis and eagerly tried them on. But the growing silence in their separate fitting rooms was telling. At last, one friend called out, Dang it, these fit everywhere but my thighs! I wish my legs werent so huge. The response: My pair is way too long. I need to be taller or skinnier!

title: Out for a First Spin: Citys Bike Share Program Begins
description: By midafternoon, the passing flickers of blue were already ubiquitous  negotiating light taxi traffic in the West Village, hurtling through the protected lanes of Midtown, drifting toward the Brooklyn waterfront.

title: Tasting Words; DNA Art; Neuroscience on the Small Screen
description: Exhibits, events and more at the intersection of art and science.

title: Ralph Laurens Bugatti Is Best of Show at Villa dEste
description: CERNOBBIO, Italy  A black, teardrop-shaped 1938 Bugatti, owned by the fashion designer Ralph Lauren, was awarded the prestigious Coppa dOro on Saturday here at the Concorso dEleganza.

title: New Tools to Hunt New Viruses
description: A new flu, H7N9, has killed 36 people since it was first found in China two months ago. A new virus from the SARS family has killed 22 people since it was found on the Arabian Peninsula last summer.

title: A Nation Still at War Honors Its Dead
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Monday paid homage to the nations military, especially troops serving in Afghanistan, using his traditional Memorial Day address at Arlington National Cemetery to exhort Americans to honor their sacred obligation to veterans and to remind the country that our nation is still at war.

title: Tunisia Congratulates Blue Director for Cannes Honor
description: The culture minister in Tunisias Islamist-led government congratulated the French-Tunisian director Abdellatif Kechiche in a statement on Monday for winning the Palme dOr at the 66th Cannes Film Festival for his new film, Blue Is the Warmest Color, while making no reference to its sexually explicit content, The Associated Press reported.

title: The Germs You Live With, Serenade for Clarinet and Cicada, New York as Science City
description: Its a jungle in there  and by in there we mean your house; David Rothenberg plays a duet with the 17-year cicadas; the World Science Festival returns to the city.

title: Really? The Claim: Fresh Produce Has More Nutrients Than Canned
description: THE FACTS

title: Dining Calendar
description: The Spirits of Mexico Festival makes its first stop on a national tour in New York at Astor Center, 399 Lafayette Street in NoHo, on Wednesday at 7 p.m. Agave-based spirits  think tequila and mezcal  will be featured among dozens of tastings. Seminars and a competition for the best cocktail will also be part of the event, which is $65 per person for general admission and $85 for V.I.P. entrance at 6 p.m. Buy tickets online.

title: Smash Finale Is Not Quite a Magnet for Viewers
description: Only a few viewers stuck around to sing along with the last musical number of NBCs Smash on Sunday, when the series ended with back-to-back episodes that featured guest appearances by real Broadway actors like Ron Rifkin, Lillias White and Marin Mazzie as presenters during a fake Tony Awards ceremony.

title: Bruins Excel Without Any of Hockeys Biggest Names
description: For a league that has built its recent growth with superstar players, the N.H.L. has an interesting conundrum on its hands in the Boston Bruins.

title: Polio Reappears in the Horn of Africa
description: Polio is again circulating in the Horn of Africa, the World Health Organization said.

title: Monday Motorsports: Kanaan, Rosberg and Harvick Collect Big Wins
description: Tony Kanaan scored a popular victory on Sunday in the 97th Indianapolis 500, leading a parade of frustrated rivals across the finish line under a yellow caution flag.

title: High-End Health Plans Scale Back to Avoid Cadillac Tax
description: Say goodbye to that $500 deductible insurance plan and the $20 co-payment for a doctors office visit. They are likely to become luxuries of the past.

title: Beaten on the Job, an Afghan Police Officer Goes on TV and Hits Back
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  When the son of the most powerful military commander was stopped here by a police officer with the temerity to search his vehicle, he responded with a typically privileged attitude: he had his men beat the policeman.

title: After Nadal Dodges Upset, a Wild Card Delivers One
description: PARIS  Like any conscientious, would-be giant slayer on red clay, Daniel Brands did his due diligence.

title: Ants Are Not Just Food to Pitcher Plant
description: The carnivorous pitcher plant Nepenthes bicalcarata, found in Borneo, has a perplexing double life: Although it eats ants, it also serves as home to one ant species.

title: Allosaurus Muscles Hint at Good Table Manners
description: Allosaurus, a smaller cousin of Tyrannosaurus rex, was a dexterous hunter that tugged at prey like a modern-day falcon, showing far more sophisticated table manners than T. rex, researchers are reporting.

title: The New Rules for Sunscreen
description: There is no question most skin cancers are related to sun exposure, yet even with sunscreen sales approaching $1 billion a year, skin cancer rates continue to climb. Melanoma diagnoses have risen nearly 2 percent a year since 2000 and are increasing even more among young white women.

title: Racial Diversity Efforts Ebb for Elite Careers, Analysis Finds
description: HOUSTON  As a partner and chief diversity officer at Thompson & Knight, Pauline Higgins was not afraid to press the issue of hiring minorities at the 126-year-old Texas law firm. But when she left in 2008, she was replaced by an associate with less influence.

title: McCain Travels to Syria to Meet With Rebel Forces
description: WASHINGTON  Senator John McCain, the Arizona Republican who has called for the United States to intervene militarily in Syria, traveled to Syria on Monday to meet with rebel forces fighting the regime of President Bashar al-Assad, according to a spokesman for Mr. McCain. It was the first time that a United States senator had gone to Syria to meet with the rebels since the conflict there began two years ago.

title: Lundqvist Calls Rangers Season a Step Back
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Henrik Lundqvist has heard this song before: the inevitable dissections of what went awry on breakup day for the Rangers.

title: A New Generation of American Talent Announces Arrival
description: PARIS  Madison Keys came to Paris for the first time last week with a few simple goals. Like all visitors, she and her friends wanted to hit at least one tourist destination, maybe the Eiffel Tower or the Louvre. And because Keys is no normal teenager on a gap-year trip, she wanted to get through the French Open without falling and getting the famous red clay on the muted colors of her clothes.

title: Where Twisters Dug In, So Did They
description: Even before the horrific events in Oklahoma last week, Lee Sandlins Storm Kings banished any notion I may have had that it would be a lot of fun to see a tornado up close.

title: At Least 53 Are Killed in Bombings in Baghdad
description: BAGHDAD  More than 50 people were killed in a wave of car bombings on Monday that struck Shiite neighborhoods in Baghdad despite tightened security measures, officials and security forces said.

title: Stephens Overcomes Opponent and Shouting Man
description: PARIS  Sloane Stephens of the United States scrambled into the second round of the French Open with a 6-2, 7-5 victory over Karin Knapp of Italy in a match repeatedly disrupted by a shouting spectator who favored Knapp.

title: After Chronicling History, SoHo Artist Is Losing a Vantage Point
description: In 1990, James Wentzy  a 38-year-old struggling artist, darkroom wizard and self-described SoHo homesteader  learned he had H.I.V. Faced with his own mortality, he decided reluctantly to do something he hated. Work.

title: Second Title for Duke and Delayed Triumph for a Soldier
description: PHILADELPHIA  Off to the side of the pandemonium, Casey Carroll quietly watched his Duke teammates mob one another on the sun-drenched field, soaking in the first national championship he managed to witness in person.

title: 3-D Help for Breathing, Vanishing Amphibians and More
description: The road to Mars is long and fraught with danger. What it doesnt have is restaurants. So a mechanical engineer, Anjan Contractor, has won a $125,000 grant from NASA to build a 3-D printer that can take the basic building blocks of food  oil, water, protein and tomato powders  and turn them into edible items like chocolate and pizza, the online magazine Quartz reported last week.

title: Science in the City Streets
description: The founders of the World Science Festival, which opens this week with events scheduled throughout New York City, talk about what's in store for attendants.

title: Pakistan Faces Struggle to Keep Its Lights On
description: LONDON  A week before he is to be sworn in as Pakistans prime minister for the third time, Nawaz Sharif has secured one form of power, yet now faces a fierce battle to find another.

title: U.S. Open Cup: 1988-2012
description: The fourth and final installment in the history of the U.S. Open Cup.

title: For a Boomer,  Sunscreens Came Late and Cancer Too Soon
description: In retrospect, I should have taken a last look at the nose I was born with. This was on the first Wednesday of November in 2011, the day of a scheduled appointment with a dermatological surgeon for Mohs micrographic surgery, the purpose of which was to carefully remove some previously discovered skin cancer from the lower left side of my nose. But it was also the fourth day after a surprise autumn snowstorm that had left our home in north central Connecticut without heat or electricity and the surrounding landscape devastated by thousands of fallen trees. On the morning of my procedure I washed my hair and sponged my body with a few quarts of water heated in a stockpot on a gas barbecue grill outside the house, threw on some clothes and rushed out the door. The entire exercise felt like an inconvenience. Looking back, taking proper care of my freckled, reddish skin, descended from somewhere on the moors of Ireland, had always felt like an inconvenience.

title: Bird and Postman Meet, and a Fairy-Tale Heroine Is Born
description: LONDON  Fairy tales and myth are central to ballet. A woman turned into a swan by an evil magician; a sylph who falls in love with a human and finds the consequence is death; a girl who dies of a broken heart but is transformed into a ghostly spirit.

title: Castle in the Making
description: The Ozark Medieval Fortress, an attraction founded in 2010 but built with 13th-century methods for tourists, is now a ruin  at least financially.

title: Fixer-Upper. Ozark Views. Vassals Welcome.
description: LEAD HILL, Ark.  It was supposed to be a fairy tale come to life, but the hard truth can be read on the signs along Highway 14. One trumpets, A castle in the making and Theyre building it. Come see it! The other sign, more recent, is a lament: Closed for the season.

title: Mapping the Great Indoors
description: BOULDER, Colo.  On a sunny Wednesday, with a faint haze hanging over the Rockies, Noah Fierer eyed the field site from the back of his colleagues Ford Explorer. Two blocks east of a strip mall in Longmont, one of the worlds last underexplored ecosystems had come into view: a sandstone-colored ranch house, code-named Q. A pair of dogs barked in the backyard.

title: The Jungle Indoors
description: Researchers are just beginning to understand the sheer number and type of organisms that live inside the home with us.

title: Next to You on the Subway
description: Norman R. Pace, a microbiologist at the University of Colorado Boulder, pioneered the use of DNA to study microbes. He has searched for extremophiles (organisms that can exist in extreme environments) in the hot springs of Yellowstone National Park and once descended in the submersible Alvin to examine microbial life on hydrothermal vents. He greets visitors, like any microbiologist who has seen too much, with a fist bump.

title: A Go-To Actor Who Is a Niche Unto Himself
description: There are actors more handsome than John Malkovich, more alluring, more dissolute. But if a director needs someone to play a legendary libertine  or even a Lothario-esque version of Mr. Malkovich himself, as in Being John Malkovich  guess who gets the call?

title: Where Better to Play a Theremin Than on a Boat?
description: Toward the end of his recital at Bargemusic in Brooklyn on Friday evening Rob Schwimmer performed Kurt Weills Lost in the Stars with a warm, smooth baritone that had great polish and sweetness in the upper range.

title: 12 Minutes to Board, and a Security Line of 500
description: I STARTED my company, the Buzz Marketing Group, when I was about 16 years old. I answered an ad to review products aimed at teenagers. I got a lot of samples to review, so I recruited friends to help, and by 1996, I was on my way.

title: Tales Told From a Bar Stool, Each One More Shivery Than the Other
description: Youd think Id have learned how to harden my heart.

title: Now Resurfacing, the Myth of the Serpent Scorned
description: For all the differences infusing Eastern and Western artistic traditions, one can count on certain universal realities. For example: If youre a young, female innocent in a canonical love story, chances are that things wont go so swimmingly for you.

title: A Mystery Buried Deep in a Canvas
description: A restoration reveals that a Jackson Pollock work was altered.

title: Joe Mantello on Broadway
description: No one told Joe Mantello that being a leading actor and a Tony Award-winning director was like shooting for the moon. And so, he did it his way.

title: At High Speed, on the Road to a Driverless Future
description: JERUSALEM  Last month, on a freeway from Jerusalem to the Dead Sea, I sat in the drivers seat of an Audi A7 while software connected to a video camera on the windshield drove the car at speeds up to 65 miles an hour  making a singular statement about the rapid progress in the development of self-driving cars.

title: Powerhouse of the Uranium Enrichment Industry Seeks an Exit
description: CAPENHURST, England  The first thing you notice when entering Building E23 on a tightly guarded site here in northwest England is the loud tick-tock. The sound resonates throughout the long, low-slung building where, behind secured doors, sit row upon row of tall thin tubes.

title: A Pollock Restored, a Mystery Revealed
description: Jackson Pollocks unconventional working methods  spreading a piece of unstretched, unprimed canvas on the floor of his Long Island studio and then pouring, splattering and literally flinging industrial paints across its surface  have long been part of his myth, performance art executed without an audience.

title: What to Watch on Day 3 at the French Open
description: If the suspect skies allow for a full day of play, here are six matches to earmark Tuesday at the French Open.

title: The Music Behind Liberaces Capes, Jewels and Candelabra
description: The director Steven Soderbergh and just about everyone associated with Behind the Candelabra, the new biographical film about Liberace, emphasized from the start that the movie was going to be about a love affair. A strange love affair, for sure  more a sordid co-dependency between Scott Thorson, a rootless young man, and Mr. Entertainment himself, Liberace, who was 40 years older.

title: Never a Crime-Free Moment
description: You cant blame Abe George for crying foul over Brooklyn DA.

title: Rough-Edged Atomic Pioneer
description: Ray Monk had begun work on his J. Robert Oppenheimer biography in 2005, when Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwins American Prometheus was published. That book, billed as the first full-scale biography of Oppenheimer, the theoretical physicist, gave Mr. Monk good reason to worry. It covers scientific, historical, moral, political and personal aspects of Oppenheimers life, conveying his arrogance, brilliance, self-destructiveness and lady-killing charisma. What gaps remained for Mr. Monk to fill?

title: New Albums by Laura Marling, Terence Blanchard, Frankie J and Cecile McLorin Salvant
description: I will not be a victim of romance, Laura Marling declares near the start of her magnificent new album, Once I Was an Eagle (Ribbon Music). That doesnt stop her from plunging into it. In her new songs, love is combative, tempting, cruel, inscrutable, predatory and yet, occasionally, a comfort, with music to match every change of heart and mind. Once I Was an Eagle is the fourth album by this 23-year-old British songwriter, and her ambitions continue to grow.

title: 20 Questions on Soap, Cereal and Related Oddities
description: IT is time again to ask 20 questions about advertising, the media and popular culture.

title: Checking In After Checkout
description: Hotels want to hear your opinion of your stay.

title: Same-Sex Couple Say, I Do, as Italy Sticks to I Dont
description: ROME  The nuptials were traditional in almost every sense. The music was romantic. Teary vows were exchanged, along with shimmering rings, and a passionate first kiss was greeted with boisterous cheers, and more tears, by both families.

title: Harvey Eager to Face Yankees, His Childhood Team
description: Interleague games between the Mets and Yankees have lost their luster and novelty since the earliest editions of the Subway Series. But Tuesday nights matchup between Hiroki Kuroda and Matt Harvey was a major source of buzz before the start of the series Monday night at Citi Field.

title: A Gay Marriage, in Spirit
description: Two men made a political statement by going through the ritual in Rome, though gay couples have no legal standing in Italy.

title: At School Papers, the Ink Is Drying Up
description: The Clinton News used to be the source for everything that mattered to its readers in the northwest Bronx. It published 10,000 copies every other week in the 1930s and even circulated overseas among Bronx residents fighting in World War II.

title: Improving Dimitrov Knows Expectations Are Higher at French Open
description: PARIS  Grigor Dimitrov whistles as he recalls a particularly tough session of training last December. Having spent his teenage years at the Mouratoglou Academy in Paris, Dimitrov, a stylish Bulgarian, made the decision to break out of his comfort zone at the end of 2012, uprooting to the rather more chilly environment of Bromma, a suburb in western Stockholm. His goal? To join forces with the former world No. 2 Magnus Norman, the man he felt could help him make the transition from promising youngster to genuine world beater.

title: King Gives Up Royal Yacht, but Donors Want It Back
description: MADRID  In hard times like these, everyone has to make sacrifices. And King Juan Carlos of Spain wanted it known that he was doing his part, too.

title: What Gives? The Pacers Defense Looks to Reassert Itself
description: INDIANAPOLIS  The Pacers like to call themselves a defensive-minded team, and the numbers bear them out. The Pacers led the N.B.A. during the regular season in opponents field-goal percentage (.420) and 3-point field-goal percentage (.327), and were second to Memphis in points allowed (90.7).

title: Kim Merker, Hand-Press Printer of Poets, Is Dead at 81
description: Kim Merker was a chain-smoking New Yorker with literary ambitions when he went to Iowa in the mid-1950s to study poetry. He became a wordsmith of another kind.

title: By Inserting Itself Into Syrian War, Hezbollah Makes Dramatic Gamble
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Fighting a pre-emptive war against foreign jihadists is not the usual mission for Hezbollah, the Lebanese militant group best known for confronting Israel. So when its leader, Hassan Nasrallah, explained why he was sending fighters into Syria, he took care to remind his followers that they were not living in Djibouti but on the border of a country whose two-year uprising Hezbollah sees as a threat to its existence.

title: Getting Ahead by Having Answers Instead of Questions
description: This interview with  Brent Saunders, chief executive of Bausch & Lomb, was conducted by  Adam Bryant. Mr. Saunders  spoke before the announcement thatValeant Pharmaceuticals International of Canada plans to buyBausch & Lomb.

title: Entrepreneurs Help Build Start-Ups by the Batch
description: Just two years after its conception, Prism Skylabs has made enormous strides.

title: Brazil: Mayor Punches Resident in Face
description: The mayor of Rio de Janeiro, Eduardo Paes, punched a constituent in the face after being called the Portuguese equivalent of excrement in a dispute before stunned diners at a Japanese restaurant. Mr. Paes issued a written apology to the city after the episode, which unfolded Sunday night when he went outside to smoke a cigarette during a meal with his wife and several others. But he qualified the apology by stating that it was unacceptable to face such insults during private moments with his wife. The constituent, Bernardo Botkay, a writer and a singer in a rock band, said he had directed his scorn at Mr. Paes because he believed that the mayors policies were benefiting a select group of real estate speculators and contributing to gentrification ahead of the 2014 World Cup and 2016 Summer Olympics, both of which will be held in Rio. I think it is noteworthy to be physically attacked by the mayor, Mr. Botkay said. It clearly shows that he does not have what it takes to run the city.

title: Immigrant Measure Still Backed by Gays
description: WASHINGTON  Lawmakers supporting a bipartisan bill in the Senate to overhaul the immigration system faced a surge of outrage last week from gay rights advocates after a provision those groups supported was left off the legislation in committee at the last minute.

title: Europe and China Trade Talks End Bitterly
description: HONG KONG  Trade negotiations between the European Union and China ended on Monday with mutual recriminations. China called on the European Union to refrain from imposing tariffs on solar panels, and the European trade commissioner complained that China was pressuring individual countries to prevent Europe from reaching a consensus.

title: The Underachievers of Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES  The baseball teams that met here on Monday, both with losing records and far from first place, are not alone among Southern California underachievers. The premier team in town, the Lakers, exited the N.B.A. playoffs without a victory despite a roster of stars.

title: Sonys Bread and Butter? Its Not Electronics
description: TOKYO  Sony is best known as a consumer electronics company, making PlayStation game consoles and televisions. And it loses money on almost every gadget it sells.

title: The Forgotten Amerasians
description: NEW HAVEN  THE Senate Judiciary Committee approved an immigration reform bill last week that would gradually make citizenship possible for as many as 11 million undocumented immigrants. The bill is widely described as sweeping in scope. In fact, it is not quite sweeping enough, as it leaves the plight of another group of would-be Americans unaddressed.

title: In Syria, Go Big or Stay Home
description: WASHINGTON  FROM liberal internationalists to hawkish conservatives, a chorus of influential voices in Washington is suggesting that American intervention in Syria would also do serious damage to Bashar al-Assads close ally, Iran.

title: An Addiction to Zealotry
description: Virginia Republicans delivered a rousing surprise at their gubernatorial nominating convention this month. They chose E. W. Jackson, an African-American minister and lawyer, as their candidate for lieutenant governor after he delivered a thunderously right-wing speech.

title: Moving On
description: I have sold my books. Not all of them, but most of them. I held on to the books I might need while putting the finishing touches on a manuscript that is now with my publisher. I also kept the books I will likely need when I begin my next project in the fall. But the books that sustained my professional life for 50 years  books by and about Milton, Spenser, Shakespeare, Skelton, Sidney, Herbert, Marvell, Herrick, Donne, Jonson, Burton, Browne, Bacon, Dryden, Hobbes  are gone (I watched them being literally wheeled out the door), and now I look around and see acres of empty white bookshelves.

title: Thanks for the Memories, Even the Ones to Forget
description: For the past 27 seasons as a Mets season-ticket holder, 76-year-old Gloria Feit has watched her team routinely overshadowed by the hated Yankees. It has not always been for Feit to be a Mets fan, especially because her husband is a Yankees fan.

title: Silencing the Whistle-Blowers
description: LAST week Pfc. Bradley Manning returned to court for his final pretrial hearing in the WikiLeaks case, an appearance that has renewed debate about how to balance the imperatives of national security against the rights of whistle-blowers.

title: Mexico: Dramatic Final Anoints a Hero
description: In a stirring final in Mexicos Azteca Stadium, Club Amrica goalkeeper Moiss Muoz was his teams offensive catalyst, sending the Clausura finals to extra time. Then, after a scoreless 30 minutes, he was the star of the penalty-kick shootout as Cruz Azuls 15-year title drought continued in painful fashion.

title: Heroes of Uncertainty
description: Were living in an empirical age. The most impressive intellectual feats have been achieved by physicists and biologists, and these fields have established a distinctive model of credibility.

title: Even With Yanks Hurting, Theres Usually Pain to Spare for Mets
description: Whatever the Mets original sin is  and, really, we dont have time to delve into all that right now  they and their dogged fans pay for it pretty much all the time.

title: Rutgers Backs Athletic Director After Charge of Abuse
description: Earlier this month, Rutgers named Julie Hermann, a longtime official in Louisvilles athletic department, as its athletic director, hailing her as the right person to help repair the universitys image after a scandal involving the abusive behavior of its former mens basketball coach.

title: With Everyone a Critic, Hoteliers Struggle to Cope
description: SINCE people began traveling, everyone has shared opinions about hotels, but until fairly recently the evaluations were spread by word of mouth or through the august evaluations of recognized guidebook authors.

title: Keep the Clunkers Away From the Polls
description: New York Citys Board of Elections has complained for weeks that the electronic voting machines first used in 2010 cannot handle the citys tight primary elections schedule. But one solution, endorsed by the board and under consideration in Albany, seems absurd. The board and the State Legislature are talking about scrapping the new machines and replacing them with the old metal clunkers, with their creaky levers, that went out of production more than 30 years ago.

title: Caution and the Common Core
description: The rigorous Common Core learning standards that have been adopted by 45 states represent a once-in-a-generation opportunity for the United States to improve public schools nationally, bringing math, science and literacy education up to levels achieved by high-performing nations abroad.

title: Border Injustice
description: Those who view fixing immigration as simply a matter of getting tougher on lawbreakers tend to overlook how tough the system already is, an ever-growing web of agents, cops, courts and prisons whose cruelty and deficiencies are appalling. Much attention has focused on the excesses of local law enforcement, exemplified by self-appointed immigration enforcers like Sheriff Joe Arpaio of Maricopa County, Ariz., whose department was found guilty in federal court on Friday of violating the constitutional rights of Latinos for years through racially biased crime sweeps, arrests, detention and harassment.

title: In Terror Shift, Obama Took a Long Path
description: WASHINGTON  The pivot in counterterrorism policy that President Obama announced last week was nearly two years in the making, but perhaps the most critical moment came last spring during a White House meeting as he talked about the future of the nations long-running terrorism war. Underlying the discussion was a simple fact: It was an election year. And Mr. Obama might lose.

title: Gun Makers Saw No Role in Curbing Improper Sales
description: The Glock executive testified that he would keep doing business with a gun dealer who had been indicted on a charge of violating firearms laws because This is still America and Youre still innocent until proven guilty.

title: Build Bridges, Not Fences
description: To the Editor:

title: Women in Computing
description: To the Editor:

title: Latinos and Gay Culture
description: To the Editor:

title: How Much Salt?
description: To the Editor:

title: Antidote to TV Blues
description: To the Editor:

title: Scrubbing Our Troubles Away
Pay Kids to Take Tests
description: To the Editor:

title: A Time When Marijuana Is Legal
description: To the Editor:

title: Subdued Richards Braces Himself for Possible Exit
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Brad Richards walked reluctantly into the ring of microphones for what was probably his last public appearance as a New York Ranger, ready to face an inquisition about his rapid, humiliating fall from stardom.

title: Corrections: May 28, 2013
Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, May 28, 2013
description: When you train as an ecologist, you imagine yourself tromping around in the forest. You dont imagine yourself swabbing a toilet seat.

title: The Peace Bridge (What Else?) Sets Off a Cuomo-Canada War
description: FORT ERIE, Ontario  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos administration is known for its combative stance toward lawmakers, bureaucrats and reporters alike.

title: Upset at a Call, Stakhovsky Goes the Social Media Route
description: When 101st-ranked Sergiy Stakhovskys racquet proved insufficent to gain an edge on the No. 7 seed Richard Gasquet through the first two games on Court Suzanne Lenglen Monday, Stakhovsky found a more modern piece of equipment to try to swing the match his way: his iPhone.

title: Reducing Some City Parks to the Status of Beggars
description: Steve Hindy, the Brooklyn Brewery baron and a fellow whose love of this city is manifest, serves as board member of the Prospect Park Alliance. He noticed the city was steadily edging away from its financial commitment.

title: Johnson Falls to Montanes in See-Saw Battle
description: PARIS  Steve Johnson of the United States stroked 56 shots beyond the reach of Albert Montanes of Spain, but he came up short in a three-and-a-half hour duel that see-sawed to a 6-4, 4-6, 6-3, 3-6, 6-1 victory for Montanes.

title: Something Happened on the Way to Bountiful: Everyone Sang Along
description: Not long after the curtain rises on the second act of The Trip to Bountiful, the Broadway revival of the Horton Foote play at the Stephen Sondheim Theater, something unusual happens. Cicely Tyson, as Mrs. Carrie Watts, sits on a bus station bench in a small Texas town. She is on the run from her abusive daughter-in-law and henpecked son in Houston, desperate to see the family farm in Bountiful once more before she dies.

title: Citing Danger, Schumer Calls for Scrapping New Screening Plan for Statue of Liberty
description: Senator Charles E. Schumer called on the National Park Service on Monday to scrap what he called a dangerous new security plan for the Statue of Liberty, saying that it could leave visitors to the tourist attraction vulnerable to a terrorist attack.

title: Fit to Be Tied
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  Dan Feyer is a solving machine, but once in a while he gets in the constructing mood and offers us a puzzle of his own making to solve. I loved this puzzle of his from 2011 (Across Lite, Solution, blog) and today marks his third time out. Kick back and solve this one with a nice, cold BREWSKI.

title: Obama Plans 3 Nominations for Key Court
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama will soon accelerate his efforts to put a lasting imprint on the countrys judiciary by simultaneously nominating three judges to an important federal court, a move that is certain to unleash fierce Republican opposition and could rekindle a broader partisan struggle over Senate rules.

title: Lottery Numbers
Mets Win an Opener Light on Fans and Runs
description: Though much of the sheen has disappeared from their interborough rivalry, the Yankees and the Mets still found ways to generate bursts of electricity Monday night during their 91st regular-season meeting.

title: A Day for Remembering
description: The nations capital paid homage to those who died while serving in the military on Memorial Day.

title: Photo Replay: May 27
description: A look at the day in sports, including the W.N.B.A. debuts for a pair of rookies and first-round play at the French Open.

title: From Out of the Blue, a Call to Represent the U.S.
description: When the United States under-20 national team headed to France over the weekend for its final preparations for the World Cup in Turkey, which begins next month, it had a new member: Alonso Hernandez, who is looking forward to making his international debut after recently breaking into the first team at the Mexican club Monterrey.

title: The Bike Share Derby
description: New York Citys bike share program has opened to subscribers. Our reporters tested the system against more familiar modes of transportation in five races.

title: Hernandez Error on Memorial Day
description: Keith Hernandez pickedthe wrong day  Memorial Day  to use dead soldier as a descriptive termfor a sawed-off bat.

title: New Summer for Shore Residents, but Not as Before
description: ORTLEY BEACH, N.J.  In any other year, Uncle Mike said, it is the Kickoff Classic, the first weekend of the summer when seasonal and year-round residents roam Fourth Avenue like amiable vagrants who have just emerged from hibernation, stopping in to say hi, hanging out on one anothers porches, strolling the Boardwalk, checking out the beach.

title: Gardner Turns a Misplay Into a Highlight Catch
description: For almost five innings, Brett Gardner stewed over what he thought was his misplay on a ball hit by David Wright in the first inning of the Mets 2-1 win over the Yankees on Monday. Wright had hit a towering fly ball to right-center field. Gardner gave chase and then crashed into the wall. The ball bounced around, allowing Wright to reach third base.

title: Japan: U.S. Pilot Rescued Off Okinawa
description: Japanese rescuers saved an American fighter pilot from the waters off southern Japan after his F-15 fighter crashed into the ocean early Tuesday, Japanese officials said. The F-15, which flew out of Kadena Air Base on Okinawa, crashed in the Pacific about 70 miles east of the island at 9 a.m. Tuesday, American military officials said. The Japanese authorities immediately sent boats and aircraft to the scene and spotted the pilot clinging to a raft, said Toru Michizaki of the Japanese Coast Guard in Okinawa. The pilot, whose name was not released, was rescued by members of the Japan Air Self-Defense Force, he said. American officials said the cause of the crash was under investigation.

title: A Missed Opportunity Against Monfils, and a Loss for Berdych
description: Gael Monfils summoned the magic of Court Phillipe Chatrier to will himself past fifth-seeded Tomas Berdych in a gripping five setter.

title: Honoring Those Who Served
description: See more Memorial Day coverage from National.

title: The Joylessness of Sex on TV
description: Sex on TV is more risque, more graphic and more raunchy than ever. So why is it so incredibly unsexy?

title: Evening Song
description: The National Book Award finalist James Richardsons meditation on the small hours inspires the street artist KAWS to call it a night.

title: Getting to Tax Reform
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Word of the Day | estranged
description: estranged \i-stranjd\ adjective

title: Whats on Tuesday
description: 8 P.M. (13); 9:30 P.M. (49) CAROLE KING: THE LIBRARY OF CONGRESS GERSHWIN PRIZE With a career as a singer and songwriter spanning more than 50 years, Ms. King, left  whose hits include Youve Got a Friend, So Far Away, (You Make Me Feel Like) A Natural Woman, I Feel the Earth Move and Will You Love Me Tomorrow?, which she wrote as a teenager with Gerry Goffin, her husband at the time  is the first woman to receive this award, bestowed by President Obama on May 22 in the East Room of the White House. That celebration, presented here by In Performance at the White House, features James Taylor, Gloria Estefan, Billy Joel, Jesse McCartney, Emeli Sand and Trisha Yearwood, as well as Ms. King.

title: Final Words From Rangers
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Here are some bite-sized highlights from Mondays Rangers breakup day.

title: IHT Quick Read: May 28
description: NEWS Divisions among European Union foreign ministers on Monday prevented the renewal of the arms embargo on Syria, raising the possibility of a new flow of weapons to rebels fighting to bring down the government of President Bashar al-Assad. James Kanter reports from Brussels.

title: South Korea Shuts 2 Reactors Over Faked Certificates
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea said on Tuesday that it was turning off two nuclear power reactors and delaying the scheduled start of operations at another two after its inspectors discovered that the reactors used components whose safety certificates had been fabricated.

title: Tech Boom Turns Bangalore Weddings Into Worldly Feasts
description: Ravi Sinha, an entrepreneur in Bangalore, innovates constantly, tracking all the latest trends and occasionally outsourcing to outside specialists. Research and development are critical to his profits, and globalization has helped shape his business.

title: Test Yourself | English, May 28, 2013
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article All of Citys Public Swimming Beaches to Reopen by Memorial Day.

title: South Korea Rejects North Koreas Invitation to Talks on Industrial Complex
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea invited South Korean factory owners to a shuttered industrial complex on Tuesday to discuss its reopening, a gesture the South Korean government swiftly rejected.

title: What Old Television Shows Would You Bring Back?
description: Do you like any television shows that have completed their runs? Do you wish those shows could come back with new episodes?

title: Leaving Tehran and Restraints Behind
description: Kiana Hayeri has fond memories of her teenage years in Tehran  even if she had to dodge the morality police whenever she decided to wear a little more makeup or uncover her hair.

title: Obama Honors Fallen Troops and Those Still Fighting
description: In the article A Reminder That the Afghan Fight Persists, Sheryl Gay Stolberg writes about President Obamas Memorial Day speech.

title: Racings Public Persona and Quiet Ambassador
description: For 20 years in the 1980s through 2000, D. Wayne Lukas was a ubiquitous presence in the winners circle at Triple Crown races, amassing 13 wins in the spring classics  at one point racking up six victories in a row with four different horses from 1994 to 1996. But he hadnt set foot inside the celebratory enclosure at one of these three classic races in 13 years, since Commendable won the Belmont Stakes in 2000.

title: Where Is Home for a Third-Culture Kid?
